story:
Hello everyone.

As we all know, Monty Oum was a very passionate, creative individual, as well as an inspiration to all of us. He was a role model to many people out there, inspired so many people with his creation and was no doubt, an amazing person. The news of his death was a shock for all of his fans and family, and he will be missed greatly by them all...

Nevertheless, Monty would want his fan to use their imagination and creativity to make the world a better, more colorful place.

The world of Remnant, is an obvious example of this. He had ambitious plans to make things technologically advanced and yet still connected to nature and not completely rejecting the notions of the outdoors. It's undeniable as to how he envisioned a world with so much color, and so much mood. One could say it would also lead into making said world for the fans to also diverge and create on- a stage for the people. And on this stage, we create our Characters to do as they were made to do, and act out the lives of Remnant. To fill in the seemingly blank and void people in the background with a vivid array of ideas, inspirations, and even emotion. This artbook is for such an vision.

Warriors of Remnant

Warriors of Remnant - an original artbook inspired by Monty Oum, featuring 10 artists. Each artists will have four pages to submit an 8''x10'' illustration featuring their original creations, characters bio's and anything they wish to show about their characters!

Each artbook will have at least 40 pages for at least 10 illustrations along with character's bio, tutorials, art cards, ect. There will also be a chance for other artists and fans to featured their creation in the book!

The fund raised for this project will be applied to the publishing fund, and a copy of this book will be mailed to RoosterTeeth. The artbook will be printed using PrintNinja service.

For more information about the artbook, please visit this site: http://warriors-of-remnant.deviantart.com/


Production Breakdown

This is the breakdown of the artbooks, along with the production cost to print them. I will be using PrintNinja to print the artbooks. Note, this is the standard version of the artbook if the goal is met!

-Binding: Soft cover

-Size: 8.5x11

-Cover's paper weight: 105lb

-Cover's paper finish style: Gloss

-Inside page's weight: 105lb

-Inside page's coating: Matte

-Inside page count: ~80

-Quantity: 250 (More will be printed if a lot of people are interested in getting a copy)

Total cost: ~$2547 (Shipping not included)

Stretch Goal

$3500 - Hard Cover Binding

If this goal is met, the books will be printed with hard cover binding, allowing more pages to be included!

$4000 - Extra pages!

If this goal is met, each artists will receive two extra pages. These pages can be used for anything the artists desired, such as art tutorial, short stories, artist's bio, etc

$4500 - Art Card

If this goal is met, each artists will have the chance to design their own, unique art card. They will be included with the books, and can be used as bookmarks!

$5000 - Leather Bound Cover

If this goal is met, the book will have a leather bound cover, with the title stamped in gold foil, giving you the feeling that you're reading a classic fairy tale!

Risk and Challenges

While planning this project, I've noticed that I will inevitably face many obstacles to make this project come true. However, I strongly believe that the love for RWBY, as well as the legacy Monty Oum left will unite fans and friends from around the world together, and hopefully they will support this project and make this a reality

story:
Hello everyone! I've decided to open an Indiegogo campaign for the chance to make my jewelry designing dreams a reality. Simply put, I love to design jewelry. I've been interested in jewelry since I was a little girl. While I was in high school, I took a mixed media art class where I learned how to melt down metal to make pendants, how to cut sheets of metal to create jewelry, and many other craft skills. That class inspired me to take my creativity and apply it to jewelry making and I've been designing and hand making jewelry ever since. My interest and love for jewelry was also shared by my aunt. We would go to bead expos, seeing new designs, checking out the latest trends and would talk for hours about jewelry when we were together. Unfortunately, she passed unexpectedly before I got the chance to learn everything I could from her and I never got the chance to fully thank her for helping me grow my passion.

     Currently, I have been trying my best to save the funds I need by myself, but I have encountered a few obstacles along the way. I spent some time unemployed and had some unexpected and unwanted doctors visits which depleted a lot of my savings. The part time job I have now doesn’t provide me with the hours I need to make enough money, so I've decided to use my free time in a much more practical and constructive way. I am at the point now where I want to take my jewelry making to the next level. I want to expand my creative knowledge and enhance the products I'm already making. I have a book filled with designs that I would love to make into a reality. My designs are unique, fun, and will be fantastic quality. I hand make all of my pieces, so each piece is uniquely different even if it is one of the same design. All of the money raised in this Indiegogo campaign will go directly towards buying all of the supplies and the tools that I'll need to make my designs and passion reality. If you can donate, you will receive the item(s) from whatever tier you decide to donate to. If you can't donate, but you like my designs, please show your friends and family. Tag, post, tweet etc. Any support would mean the world to me. Thank you so much for taking the time to read my story and learn about my passion.

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Dameun Strange and I am a Minnesota Sound Artist/composer who grew up in Washington, DC where I started on my journey with music and sound at a very young age. I was fortunate to have grown up exposed to many different styles of music influenced by the vibrant culture represented in the Mid Atlantic Area. Recently, I have returning to my art music roots, composing Railing Forward: The John Henry Suite for sax quintet, string quartet and percussion ensemble for collaboration with choreographer Erinn Liebhard. I have also been a featured composer for Joanna Lees and Kristin Howe and Alternative Motion Project in Twin Cities and am currently composing music for a series of orchestral fantasies based on stories surrounding the Yoruba Pantheon. My  production of Mahogany Hall: Sounds from the Black Chamber on February, 27, 2015 at the Baroque Room in Lowertown, Saint Paul, MN is a follow up to my 2014 debut recital. New Constellations, and will feature a full program of my compositions. These compositions were a part of a three year process of experimenting with chamber music and what it could look and sound like for the 21st Century. There are crowd favorites like, The Hughes Song Cycle: Dream Variations that features spoken word and beat boxing. As well as pieces that feature a chamber choir.  The program will also feature performances by local poets, J. Otis Powell, Tish Jones and Venessa Fuentes and visual art by designer Alida Carlson that was inspired by the music. 

  • I started this campaign to raise funds for the talented performers contributing their gifts to making the dream of a recital featuring music that I composed come true. In order to create an accessible program, I kept the ticket prices low, hoping that you, the members of the community who have the means would help supplement paying the artist. Usually this is done through a granting process but I believe in grassroots organizing and building strength and power through community. And because of that, I thought I would try crowd-sourcing the funds.
  • By contributing to this campaign you will help one of my long time dreams come true and prove that chamber music is still alive and can be community supported. You also will be supporting accessibility and diversity in the arts.

What We Need & What You Get

  • My aim with this show is to continue make modern chamber music accessible, to continue to explore contemporary themes and use of the chamber. To do this, I  kept the ticket prices low. BUT I would love to pay my musicians well for their time and commitment and this is where you can help.
  • I have a couple of unique perks for you. A have spent the past 3 years experimenting with the music influence I felt from the four generations of women who raised me. I have done this using both the electronic and live mediums. The music from the electronic experiments have been compiled in a recording exclusively available to supporters of Mahogany Hall at the $10-$99 level. And if you donate at the $100 plus level, you will receive that recording plus an invitation to attend the Strange New Music Experiment Season 2 Celebration BBQ in June.
  • Even if I do not receive all of the money for my goal, all of the money goes to the performers.

The Impact

  • I believe that art music can be accessible and fun. And as a composer I am really excited to be able to share my creations with my community with a community of artist that I love and trust. This program features a variety of sounds, artists and arts. 
  • After a successful revamping of the Strange New Music Experiment, I felt the need to continue to build a space to explore contemporary chamber music and push the boundaries of what this type of performance could look like on stage and what those audience members look like, as well.  It's a chance for me to showcase my work as a Black composer of classical music. I would love for you to be a part of in anyway you can. 


Other Ways You Can Help

  • I understand that not everyone has the extra money to contribute. I would ask that you spread the word about the recital and this campaign to help out.
  • Use the Indigogo share tools!

story:
Hello, my name is Chantel Cohen, I have recently opened my candle business in December of last year. I have been making candles for about 3 years now. I only started making them just for fun an the love I have for candles. Upon people seeing them an smelling them, gave me the idea to make this a business. I came from California to South Carolina with my Husband an Son. I was not sure of the demographic in this area, so I actually began surveying the people in this area about how much they enjoy candles. I was able to purchase a few supplies to make some candles as a test of the popularity of them, an the test was a success. I have also researched the area for anyone who is making candles the same as I do. I can not find anyone who does. Great news for me, my company is called Unique Candles an that is what I make. Gel candles are a great way to show your expression. 

I am in need of some start up money to purchase enough supplies, an a huge wax melter, to make a decent amout of candles to start selling at the flea markets here. Charleston is a huge tourist spot, that I feel the type of candles that I make will be a added plus to show off the beautiful state I live in. I currently have customers who purchased the first set of candles that I made, requested more for Valentine's Day. There is also a customer of mine who makes gift baskets herself an would like to purchase more candles from me to implement inside of her baskets. 

I am a small business owner who would love to be able to open a store one day. I also have plans to sell my products to some of the big retails stores. I would like to sell online as well, needing a website built to do that.I have already contacted the retail stores previously an they stated they like to buy from small business owners. My candles are unique an they can be used to burn or as decor. I am confident that this business can take off an become a household name. Please support my business an help it grow. Maybe one day, my candles will end up in each an every persons home who has given me, my business, a greater gift of life and success. I am very Thankful to all who help support this project. My family thanks you. God bless you all.

story:
Hi! Thanks for checking out The Gilded Lily IndieGogo campaign. We are so excited to have this opportunity, and are looking forward to sharing our craft with the world!

Who we are:

My mother, Julie has been designing and planning weddings for over twenty years, but has been creative her whole life. At one wedding, she hemmed the bride's gown moments before making an extra boutonniere for the officiant - who read the ceremony she wrote! Julie has been drawing, sewing, designing and crafting things for as long as I can remember, and it was her creative lead I was following when I, Kimberly, decided to become an Arizona Certified Master Florist. We've been designing weddings, tributes and every-day floral arrangements together for years.

What we're doing:

Together, my mom and I have a goal: To be able to take people's sentiments, hopes, wishes and memories and make them both beautiful and tangible in the form of uniquely designed floral arrangements. To make these arrangements available to you, we would like to open a flower shop, which we will call The Gilded Lily.

Why we're doing it:

We are blessed in that our artistic medium is one that is naturally beautiful: flowers. What nature does not provide is the sentiment. We want your mom to be thrilled that you remembered her birthday with her favorite shade of yellow roses. We want your grandfather to bring your grandmother a corsage of pink carnations, because that's what he did on their first date, and he's loved her ever since. We know we can bring these feelings to life for you.

On a personal note, I want this for my mom. In business, we are partners, but in life, she's the one who made my prom dress, nursed me when I was sick, changed my son's first stinky diaper (so glad it wasn't me - thanks mom!), and has been there for me my whole life. Now, it's time to make her dream happen, and I'm so lucky to share it with her.

Where it's going to happen:

We have a space in historic downtown Kingman, Arizona. It's a great brick building with a tin ceiling and fantastic windows, built in the 1920s. However, it needs some work. We need to update the electrical wiring, and install a flower cooler. And we need to paint over the magenta walls in the bathroom. Yikes.

When it's going down:

We're hoping to open the first week of February, with our "official" grand opening scheduled for March! That doesn't give us a lot of time, but we want to be able to serve the community for Valentine's Day! If you're thanking your partner for 50 great years, or saying, "Hey baby, you're looking fly!" to the cute girl in your office, we want to be a part of YOUR message.

How to help:

This is a partial rundown of what we need:

  • Refrigeration unit and insulated panels - to give you the freshest possible product
  • Electrical contractor - To install the cooler, and bring our wiring up to code
  • Permits - for construction of the cooler, and to open the business
  • building renovation - paint (lots of paint!), drywall, a door to our cooler, a counter top...
  • delivery system - to keep the flowers from rolling around in the back of our van as we're delivering them to you
  • order processing stuff - a receipt printer, customer management software

And some of what you'll get in return:

  • Flowers on your birthday

Fall Flowers!


  • hand beaded rose

Brooch Boquet featuring three hand beaded roses!

  • a custom designed gift basket

Our "Bro-quet", a manly take on gift baskets!

  • hand-painted initial art

Samples of the Painted Initials! (Marlee is one of our favorite people in the WORLD!)


We have worked really hard to come up with creative and worthwhile perks . Please know these perks are offered with the sincerest thanks for helping make our dream a reality.

My mom and I have many reason for wanting to bring this project to life, but a couple really stand out. First, we know that in our area, our talents to make each customers' floral vision a reality is unique. Anyone can throw some flowers in a vase, but we can show you more. Secondly, and most importantly, we're doing this for and with our families. I want my sons to be provided for, and feel comfortable expressing themselves, and I want my mother to truly be fulfilled in sharing her gifts with the world.

So thanks IndieGogo and people of the internet! Can't wait to start sharing our progress with you!

story:
Help Pikii's Future

Good day, my name is Débora Martins, but as an artist I'm known as Pikii Dylluan, a 21 years old illustrator and comic artist that is working her best to complete college. 

I always had problems with money and being a freelancer doesn't always help since commissions are hard to get, so my mom has helped me till now with the college fees, rent and everything you can imagine. She's a single parent with minimal wage, and as you can imagine the odds aren't that good for her as well.

We were capable to manage somehow till now, until my computer and my tablet started to break down due to old age and over-use. I need them to keep drawing my comics and illustrations, not forgetting about my college projects. My whole life is dependent on those two devices and I have no money whatsoever to replace them.

For That I Would Need 1500$

In Details:

1000 to 1100$ would go to a new computer

A portable computer that would be capable enough to remain stable while using the heavy softwares that are used for illustration.

I won't be able to buy a desktop since it is far more expensive and due to my moving around from dorm to college, I would need a computer to be constantly with me and ready to work.

100 to 400$ would go to a new wacom tablet 

If I am to receive the total of 1500$, I am going to buy the Intuos Pro Pen & Touch Medium which is currently 349,99$ and use the remaining money to buy an external disk to help me transfer all the work and data that there is on the computer I currently have to the new one.

But depending on how much is raised, the second best option will be Intuos Pen Small (79,99$).
Even If I were to prefer the first option, I do believe that the second one would do a great job as well since I think that wacom has the best tablets in the market and just having a new one would mean the world to me.

Perks and Funds

I have stepped back a great amount of times from drawing due to the state of my computer and my tablet, both have been hard to work with since my computer overheats a lot and won't let me have at least 2 applications open without blocking the window or giving me "the blue screen of doom", and my table has various problems with connection, not only with the cable but most of times my computer doesn't recognize the tablet as a tablet unless I reset the definitions. 
With a new pc and tablet I would be more motivated to draw, my comics will have more constant updates and with more pages, I will do more illustrations to which will be for expositions, commissions, college projects, prints, giveaways, etc. 


And If I am not to raise the total of 1500$, and depending on the amount, the funds will be used to fix my current computer and buy a new external fan for it as well so it won't overheat while I am working (which is one of the major problems). It won't be an everlasting resolution but it would help me until I save enough money to either buy a new tablet or a new pc, even tho it won't happen any time soon.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some times you can't always donate because maybe you also have problems with money and I understand you, I have been and am in the same situation. But don't worry, there's always other ways to which you can contribute!
Such as:

  • Get the word out! Signal boost my campaign in any way you can, sharing the word between your friends and family is always an option.
  • If you have a Tumblr or Facebook page, I will be making a post about my campaign there and you will be able to reblog or share as many times you want.
  • And do not forget to use the Indiegogo share tools! They are always a nice touch  from the staff.


Thank you so much for you attention and have a wonderful day!
story_txt:

I always had problems with money and being a freelancer doesn't always help since commissions are hard to get, so my mom has helped me till now with the college fees, rent and everything you can imagine. She's a single parent with minimal wage, and as you can imagine the odds aren't that good for her as well.

story:
CRNI is on the front lines of free speech.  Ali Farzat's hands were broken by agents of the Syrian government -- for drawing cartoons critical of President Bashar al-Assad.  Majda Shaheen's life and safety were threatened -- for drawing cartoons critical of Palestinian politics.  In many parts of the world, editorial cartoons are the most widely read and remembered opinion pieces in the popular press. As a result, editorial cartoonists like Farzat are frequently the first journalists targeted by extremists, thugs, and tyrants.

For 25 years CRNI has been working with a global network of over 600 cartoonists. CRNI diligently monitors threats and abuses against editorial cartoonists ranging from censorship, fines and penalties, and physical intimidation (including of family members), to assault, imprisonment, disappearance, and execution.

We stand by those at risk, bringing international pressure on their persecutors by mounting campaigns for their just treatment, among the public at large and within the diplomatic community; as well as reaching out to heads of state and ministries, and coordinating joint actions with other organizations that promote free expression.

Nous sommes tous Charlie,  Nous sommes tous Kanika,  Nous sommes tous Rayma,  Nous Sommes tous Mohammad .  To date, our efforts have directly impacted the freedom and well-being of editorial cartoonists in close to 50 countries -- like Kanika Mishra who took on the issue of India’s cultural challenges with rape and violence against women, and herself became a target of threats,  Rayma Suprani in Venezuela who was censored out of a job, Musa Kart in Turkey who faced a decade in prison for a cartoon about his country's president, Mohammad Saba'aneh in Palestine who was imprisoned by Israel and who now faces a government inquiry in his own country because of his cartoons.


CRNI is seeking to raise $40,000 to enhance operations. Since its inception CRNI has operated with a single paid staff and dedicated volunteers. As the needs have grown to assist cartoonists at risk, CRNI must grow with those needs. The funds will be used to expand our work and better utilize social networks and more quickly and effectively respond to cartoonists who are threatened. With that, we can move to increase our support systems and our financial position and establish dedicated efforts to helping those cartoonists most vulnerable and at-risk. 

Please take a look at some of what is offered as our appreciated for your generous contributions.

  • A unique set of cartoon postcards,
  • A new CRNI t-shirt
  • Signed prints  offered by many of the best cartoonists working today.
  • One of a kind original cartoons. Each week we will reveal new originals that can be yours for a contribution of $400 or more. Each original will be signed and personalized by the artist.

Contributing Cartoonists:

Aislin (Montreal Gazette), Nick Anderson (Houston Chronicle), Pat Bagley (SLC Tribune), Barry Blitt (The New Yorker), Matt Bors (The Nib), Steve Brodner (The Nation), Michael de Adder (Artizans),Jeff Danziger (New York Times Syndicate), Matt Davies (New York Newsday), Susan Dewar (Toronto Sun), KAL (The Economist), Bruce Mackinnon (Halifax Chronicle Herald), Dan Murphy (Artizans),, Jack Ohman (Sacramento Bee), Joel Pett (Lexington Herald Leader), Michael Ramirez (Investor's Business Daily), Rob Rogers (Pittsburgh Post Gazette), Jen Sorensen, Ann Telnaes (Washington Post), Tom Tomorrow, Tom Toles (Washington Post),  Signe Wilkinson ( Philadelphia Daily News), Matt Wuerker (Politico), Adam Zyglis (Buffalo News)  

SEE GALLERY FOR IMAGES


CRNI is a nonpartisan organization. We do not take a position on the political opinions of cartoonists.  We advocate for the free exchange of ideas, for the rights of each individual to have and to express opinions, and for the public’s right to access the work of these courageous, committed, and gifted journalists and artists.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Project #1. The Work Space of an artist, Kim Yong Kwan.

Based on his interest on the pattern, he created a unique one for the well-made coffee set. By supporting this project, you will have a chance to enjoy his unique pattern which also matches perfectly with your space as well. Here are his previous works.

To see more on his work:                                        http://brand.hyundai.com/ko/art/projects/brilliant-30-yongkwan-kim.do

1) Making stage for fashion brand, 'Rouge & Lounge' 

2) Space designing for the cosmetic brand, 'Amore Pacific'

His work space and awesome 'Art Coffee Set'

How do we produce ceramics?

As well known, Korea is famous for producing ceramics of supreme quality. Especially, 'Icheon', a city nearby Seoul, has been a representative town for producing world best quality of ceramics for the last 50 years. All of our ceramic products are produced in Icheon completeing the whole process of making fine ceramics. So, You don't need to worry about the quality of the product.

What You Get.

By supporting our project, you will get delivered the whole coffee set package. And your backing will bring a life to our project~!  

  • Kettle+ Cup+ Dripper, plus free gift box and a card for giving presents for your family or friends. It will be a perfect choice for preparing X-mas gift!    

    

* Please choose your color among below. (Black/ Blue)

 

Safe delivery for you!

Your products will be safely double wrapped with the sponge and two boxes, and will be delivered via EMS. It will take 2-3 weeks depending on the region. Please be aware that shipping charge is not included in the backing. It will cost 25~45 USD, also depending on the country.

For more information

When you have anything to ask about our project, or product, please email us at jeanykr00@gmail.com . Or you can use comment section on this platform.

story:
Le délai de cette page ayant expiré, rendez-vous sur la nouvelle version pour participer à la deuxième vague de financement : https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/exposition-d...

Bref résumé

 À l'issu de nos études au Baccalauréat en Arts Visuels et Médiatiques, nous organisons une exposition qui sera présentée en mai 2017. Pour plusieurs, il s'agit d'une première expérience d'organisation et de présentation publique de nos démarches. 

Nous espérons récolter un montant de 5000$ qui permettra de défrayer les coûts reliés à l'organisation de l'évènement, notamment la location d'un lieu d'exposition. 

Tous les dons sont grandement appréciés! N'hésitez pas à partager!

story:
What is WITP?

WITP was founded in 2013 as a one-time group show of 17 contemporary artists in London. The premise was to bring individual artists together and have them all answer the same question — 'What is the point?". After two successful years, in 2015 WITP seized an opportunity to exhibit at the Mall Galleries in London, and the show doubled in size to include 35 international artists. The energy from that show resulted in an expansion from an annual show to an artists' community and communication network, with several shows per year, and in early 2016 we launched as a full-fledged corporation limited by guarantee, with an application in process to become a not-for-profit.

What sets us apart from other arts organisations?

  • 100% of a sale at a WITP exhibition goes straight back to the artist. We do not take a commission.
  • More than sales, our mission is to foster relationships among artists, galleries, buyers and industry professionals. 
  • Our international focus provides opportunities on a global platform. 

Not unlike other organisations, we are dedicated to nurturing and promoting excellent art!

Where this money goes

We've operated on a shoestring budget until this point, as many fledgling organsations do! We're ready to spread our wings, but we need your help! Here's what our goal of £8,000 can do in 2017:

  • Pay deposits on gallery space in Poznan, Poland; Berlin, Germany; and two spaces in London, UK
  • Cover cost of printing posters, flyers, and programmes for all five shows in 2017
  • Cover basic administrative fees such as our website, applications, occasional interns, and marketing costs

Prizes and Thank Yous

Every donation helps! If you can support us with any amount during our IndieGoGo fundraiser, you can expect a handwritten thank you card from our Founder Kate Enters and our Marketing Director Ellen Schwartze. Further prizes include (each level includes the prizes from the level before)

  • £20 — WITP Pencil
  • £30 — Private drawing session with WITP Artist Daphne Bampanioti
    OR
    An advice session for art students, new artists, or emerging artists with Daphne
  • £40 — WITP Artist Postcard
  • £100 — WITP Artist Limited Edition Print (100 available)
  • £200 — Visit a WITP artist's studio (10 available)
  • £400.00 — Original art work from a WITP artist (10 available)
    OR
    A 1-to-1 acrylic painting session with Laura Fishman using Golden Paints (1 available)
  • £500.00 — Personal tour of a WITP exhibition with Founder Kate Enters (4 available)

Other Ways You Can Help

We're all too familiar with the term 'starving artist'. If a monetary donation isn't an option, we'd still love your support to:

  • Share this fundraiser far and wide! We are posting frequently and feverishly so that we hit our goal! Find us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.
  • Get involved as a volunteer. Can you lend us your time or talent? Get in touch!
  • Apply to be a WITP artist. Your art and your ideas are valuable to the international artist community. 

From the bottom of our canvas...

THANK YOU!

story:
PROJECT

Seeking Serenity 

A Coloring Book with Meaning

 ~~ You contribute to the creation of this book! ~~

WHAT: Your loved one’s image (person or pet) and their interests incorporated into the pages of an attractive coloring book for adults and youth. The book will be available on Amazon and distributed world wide. Each elegant image carefully hand drawn in a classic, highly detailed style by an award-winning artist. Make your beloved pet famous or memorialize someone who matters in your life.

Adult coloring books are gaining in popularity. Colorists of all ages are discovering the pleasure, and serenity, of creative activity. A relaxing stress reliever and a collectable.

WHO: Dedicate a full page (8” x 10”) or a half page to a loved one:

-  A beloved pet.

-  Memorialize a loved one who has passed on

-  A friend or family member

-  Couples celebrating their commitment

~~Click on the "Perks" to reserve your coloring book page (half page or full). Our contact information will be provided and you can email or text pictures of your pet or person. Rebecca will work with you to get the best results possible.


HOW: Our artist, Rebecca, works with photos of your loved one along with a brief description of their personality and favorite things. This information is used to customize an overall design, which will be a pleasure for anyone to color in. The individual’s name will be on the page as well as in the dedication section in the back of the book.

WHY: To provide a means to show our loved ones we care and remember. A coloring book for all ages is great for relaxing and getting in touch with your creative side. Rebecca has authored and published three books and is currently undergoing treatment for breast cancer. Because she knows what it's like to face the pain and disruption of a serious illness, she donates her books and works to raise funds for those who are fighting serious illnesses: i.e., cancer patients enduring a six hour chemotherapy treatment and people stuck in hospital rooms. Reading or coloring and drawing helps uplift the spirits and alleviates boredom.

Not only will you enjoy your seeing loved ones forever memorialized in a published work, but you will be contributing to Rebecca’s efforts to cover publishing costs and donate copies of this new coloring book, as well as art supplies, to children and adults with cancer and other serious illnesses. You will be making a real difference.

WHERE:  While you actually get something in return- your loved one's image in my book, or just a completed book- you are also contributing to our cause.

Money raised from this project goes to: Printing costs, formatting services, shipping and packaging, keeping our artist fed, and the fundraising site's modest fees. The rest of our earnings are used to help us donate books and coloring supplies to those in most need. (We will be donating boxes of the newly published coloring book to children and adults alike who are facing serious illnesses.)

We will be posting our progress on the website, www.RiseOfCourage.com

SEEKING SERENITY

A Coloring Book with Meaning


FEATURES:

- Quality Hand Drawn artwork, not digital

- Images are one sided (most preferable for coloring books)

- Convenient dashed lines for cutting out and framing an image

- Number of pages: our goal is to have at least forty pages

- Cost to buy in store: retail price depends on number of pages (from $8.99 to $12.99)

- Will be available on Amazon and through various online outlets and distributed to book stores.

Artist brief bio: Rebecca is a lifelong artist with formal training in graphic design, illustration, and art therapy. She holds degrees in mechanical design and communications. Her paintings are collected worldwide and she has done illustrations for numerous books and magazines. As an author, Rebecca has published three books in the nonfiction and fiction genres. She is currently enduring treatment for an aggressive form of breast cancer.

Examples of Rebecca's artwork:
story_txt:
PROJECT
Seeking Serenity A Coloring Book with Meaning
 ~~ You
contribute to the creation of this book! ~~WHAT: Your loved one’s image (person or pet) and their
interests incorporated into the pages of an attractive coloring book for adults
and youth. The book will be available on Amazon and distributed world wide.
Each elegant image carefully hand drawn
in a classic, highly detailed style by an award-winning artist. Make your
beloved pet famous or memorialize someone who matters in your life.
Adult coloring books are gaining in popularity. Colorists of
all ages are discovering the pleasure, and serenity, of creative activity. A
relaxing stress reliever and a collectable.
WHO: Dedicate a full page (8” x 10”) or a half page to a
loved one:
- 
A beloved pet.
- 
Memorialize a loved one who has passed on
- 
A friend or family member
- 
Couples celebrating their commitment~~Click on the "Perks" to reserve your coloring book page (half page or full). Our contact information will be provided and you can email or text pictures of your pet or person. Rebecca will work with you to get the best results possible.HOW: Our artist, Rebecca, works with photos of your loved
one along with a brief description of their personality and favorite things.
This information is used to customize an overall design, which will be a
pleasure for anyone to color in. The individual’s name will be on the page as
well as in the dedication section in the back of the book.
WHY: To provide a means to show our loved ones we care and
remember. A coloring book for all ages is great for relaxing and getting in
touch with your creative side. Rebecca has authored and published three books and is currently undergoing treatment for
breast cancer. Because she knows what it's like to face the pain and disruption of a serious illness, she donates her books and works to raise funds for those who are fighting serious illnesses: i.e., cancer patients enduring a six hour chemotherapy treatment and
people stuck in hospital rooms. Reading
or coloring and drawing helps uplift the spirits and alleviates boredom.
Not only will you enjoy your seeing loved ones forever memorialized
in a published work, but you will be contributing to Rebecca’s efforts to cover publishing costs and donate copies of this new
coloring book, as well as art supplies, to children and adults with cancer and
other serious illnesses. You will be making a real difference.
WHERE:  While you actually get something in return- your loved one's image in my book, or just a completed book- you are also contributing to our cause.Money raised from this project goes to: Printing costs, formatting services, shipping and packaging, keeping our artist fed, and the fundraising site's modest fees. The rest of our earnings are used to help us donate books and coloring supplies to those in most need. (We will be donating boxes of the newly published coloring book to children and adults alike who are facing serious illnesses.)We will be posting our progress on the website, www.RiseOfCourage.com

SEEKING SERENITY
A Coloring Book with Meaning
FEATURES:
- Quality Hand Drawn artwork, not digital
- Images are one sided (most preferable for coloring books)
- Convenient dashed lines for cutting out and framing an
image
- Number of pages: our goal is to have at least forty pages
- Cost to buy in store: retail price depends on number of
pages (from $8.99 to $12.99)
- Will be available on Amazon and through various online
outlets and distributed to book stores.
Artist brief bio: Rebecca is a lifelong artist with formal
training in graphic design, illustration, and art therapy. She holds degrees in
mechanical design and communications. Her paintings are collected worldwide and
she has done illustrations for numerous books and magazines. As an author,
Rebecca has published three books in the nonfiction and fiction genres. She is
currently enduring treatment for an aggressive form of breast cancer.Examples of Rebecca's artwork:

story:
dear Friends,

From the south of Costa Rica on less than a hectare of a quasi wild land is produced some of the most unique, fragrant and flavourful peppercorns. Cultivated amongst a citrus grove  and on land where only natural farming methods have been used for more than a quarter century, pepper vines provide habitat for birds and a variety of wildlife.

   

The orchard that gives this exceptional peppercorns, coffee and cocoa, is about to become a supermarket, or the parking that will accommodate its customers.
Worse, it is also bringing to its knees work done decades by men who chose the long road of agreement with the land rather than an illusory and unhealthy control. In this period of great ecological disorder, we must consider that each land taken at the expense of nature is itself a disaster.

   

  

We need your help in order to acquire this land and save its biodiversity.

  We have prepared for you great perks : by participating to this crowdfunding, you will get the finest pepper as you already know it, but also become the virtual owner of a piper negrum vine, so you can be sure to enjoy its benefits for many more years.

We produced in 2016 only 410 kilos of Peppercorns and because of El Nino we could not make people's favorite white lemon mandarina peppercorns.  

All what's left from the golden spice will be delivered with the perks.

 


"1000 years ago ... peppercorns were worth 10 times their weight in gold"


 

today it is about the same with these very rare peppercorns from Costa Rica
 


Costa Rica: Agroforestry landscape


Your action :

--- planting a seed for the next generations ---


Your support will allow Original NY ltd. the acquisition of the land where its farmers will continue enjoying the fruits of the orchard and thousands of plants and trees will be planted on the planet .


--- by participating in this crow funding, with 8 $  ---

 

you are involved in the preservation of a piece of nature where plants, trees, men, insects, animals

and earth live in harmony and produce the best peppercorns and coffee in the world.


Our immediate action will be to send you our very rare peppercorns and plant a tree, a plant 

or a seed to your name in the orchard 


and in Costa Rica where we have many friends in the need of planting.

   

 

 

We do not claim for a fair trade, just an organic, sustainable, intelligent and simply human agriculture which we consider as a normal trade. 

 100% pure is an insurance to eat food produced with much love, zero inputs whatsoever, zero pesticides. as pure as it can get.


100% pure, single estate Original Denis 

warranty the pure origin .

  

 



 



La familia... For 25 years, the farm has been using ecological and ethical agricultural practices to produce a pepper with exceptional aromas. It incorporates the use of compost, mulches of leaves and plants, with the addition of dolomite, to achieve a natural balance of calcium and magnesium cropland, and that's it.
Harvesting is done manually at full ripeness, which gives a fresh flavor and very fruity for each selected cluster.

 

 

Drying pepper is alternately sun and shelter for about two weeks,
100% pure Lemon Mandarina White Peppercorns is unique. "Like a great wine" white pepper is aged in the native lemon juice of this same soil.

 

The unique and natural citrus flavour permeates the mature peppercorns and imparts a golden hue to the corns themselves. Today, 100% pure peppercorns is recognized worldwide for its freshness, taste and nutritional qualities.

 

It has the reputation of being the best peppers in the world.


Save the orchard and its biodiversity...

650 to 700 pepper plants, the 40 or 50 orange trees, 8 to 10 cacao trees, mango trees and banana trees.


 

  ,

Since 2012, Original Denis  sponsors this uncommon farm .

 

 

Original Denis is an entrepreneur, artist and ecologist. 

Note du porteur de projet - FairWind :

"La première fois que j'arrive chez Original Denis, je me dis : ok.. Je viens de rencontrer Mick Jagger reconverti en dealer."

Il m’a accueilli avec un large sourire plein de bienveillance, le guérisseur venait de rencontrer son malade. Cela faisait longtemps que ma quête de guérison au travers de la nourriture était en stagnation, le moment était tout choisi.
Un appart jonché de sachets hermétiques de grande qualité, remplis de je ne sais quelles denrées venues d’ailleurs et conservées tel un trésor. Le tout bien gardé par une légion de dragons de papier, sous le regard bienveillant des anges, de tatie marguerite.
Après une succincte présentation réciproque, on passe aux choses sérieuses.
Étant grand amateur de café, c’est par lui que je vais découvrir ces produits 100% Pure (concept auquel j’ai du mal à adhérer à ce moment précis). 
Jusqu'à ce que, première claque... J’ai oublié mon expresso préparé dans les règles de l’art, je suis en train de consommer du café : une nourriture vivante est en train de me raconter son histoire, 

je voyage en pleine jungle amazonienne, et pour pas si cher finalement. 
Car oui, quand Denis m’annonce les tarifs de ses produits, je me dis qu’on est vraiment dans un luxe délirant venu tout droit des desiderata malsains de quelques richissimes clients.

Bref… Wassai sauvage, bananes séchées, banane-wassai,

 et enfin le poivre… Le roi.

A la fin de cette entrevue, deux sensations s’immiscent dans tout mon être :
• Mon petit corps dis hmmm, c’est bon, mais tu y est allé fort...
• Ma petite tête va utiliser toute son énergie et sa créativité pour aider ce personnage à sauver sa production, son poivre, et comme il appelle affectueusement ses fermiers : "la familia".


Ensuite j’ai acheté ma première tablette de chocolat à $100, le doigt dans l'engrenage...

 uhmf… J’ai eu droit à un petit discount… Un cadeau pour un chirurgien qui a sauvé ma vie : 60g de pure cacao

 avec lequel un quart d’ongle suffit à remplir une matinée de douceur et volupté buccales. 

Un quart d'ongle j'ai dit...! Enfin cela en vaut chaque cent. 

Ça y est j’ai compris, ça y est je l’ai fait, et je ne pourrais plus revenir en arrière.

Bref depuis ce jour, je me surprends à suçoter un petit grain de poivre, qui vient réveiller et désinfecter ma bouche,

déguster un petit morceau de wassai sauvage, unique et incroyable,

me régaler de bananes séchées, 

d’envisager ma nourriture différemment,
et ça je le dois à Original Denis.

FairWind
100% Pure

Original Denis


 
On a trip to  french Guyana, designed to benefit research about superfoods that can effectively fight the cancer that ate his friends one by one. 

It's during these three years of total immersion in another agriculture that he was enriched with experience leading him to better understanding of our relationship to nature, to the food.

 

His peppercorns quality is not to be proven amongst chef from around the world.

 

  

  

   



His magazine, "Regard sur l'agriculture", militates since 2015 for a new agricultural era, and with the help of his fellow activists, helps to raise awareness on the emergency of the environmental situation of our planet.

 



If you've read until here, first we thank you for your time and hope we could make it clear that we really need help in order to preserve this land, and your participating will make you enjoy a very rare product of the finest quality.

If you had any further questions, feel welcome to leave a note to one of our crew member.


Much love,
FairWind

story:
Incredible Light Painting Portraits 

Help my friends and I make the ultimate traveling studio for creating stunning Light Painting portraits. 

Have your portrait taken! 
Have your portrait created with me, Julian, at the Percona Live MySQL convention in the Expo Hall in Santa Clara on April 19th or April 20th, 2016.

I've been creating Light Painting Portraits far wide for decades.   My crew and I Light Painted on America’s Got Talent, to rave reviews.  With my friends, I created and crowd funded the portrait photo book The People of Burning Man.  Here are photos I took at the Percona MySQL contention in 2013 and 2015.
Light Painting Portraits are a rare and incredible art form.  I’ve been pioneering and expanding this art form.  This campaign will help me to take Light Painting portraits in places where it would otherwise be impossible.  With your help, the studio will be equipped with the best technology imaginable, which will make for countless magical and fantastical images.  This can only happen with your help.

How you can help

Funding: Your support is vital!  If you can help financially, you'll be bringing this project to life.
Help spread the word:  Sharing the video on Facebook or elsewhere helps the project tremendously.

What We Need

The video spells out most of the items that are needed.  But if you have specific questions about any of the equipment or anything else, feel free to ask.  We've done research into the plans, the equipment, and have already started much of the work.
Here are a few links that are cool.  The Olympus cameras with LiveBulb.  The light painting tools the pixelstick and PixelWhip.  And here are some fun xbox Kinect hacks.  

This is historic!

Picasso was one of the light painting trailblazers.   We are  continuing to trailblaze with this art form... technically, creatively, and socially.  Very often I will light paint somebody and it will be their very first introduction to the craft.  Light painting makes people happy.  :-)   This is a chance to bring this art-form to far more people.

There are many great portrait photographers.  There are a good number of folks experimenting with light painting.  But very few humans on earth can make a fast quality custom Light Painting portrait.  Creating such portraits is profoundly rewarding for me.

The risk and the glory

Why this will work out perfectly
Julian has light painted with countless people over many years at many events.   When Julian and his friend set a goal, they  tend to meet it.

Why this is risky
Much of this has never been done before.  We will inevitably run into hurdles and will be adjusting course as we go.  Also, the timing is very tight.   In other words, things may not turn out exactly as we think at this point, but one way or another, we will make this stupendous.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR HELP!  :-)

story:
Seeking the Invisible is a documentary project that seeks to tell the story of those who suffer from invisible illnesses and disabilities and who feel ignored, over looked and judged.  I have been thanked by countless people-those who suffer from invisible illnesses, as well as those who don't, but even with the importance of this project, I am unable to continue in my current state. My Prius, which I use to drive throughout central Illinois (driving up to 1.5 hours just in one direction) to photograph this project, now suffers from a dead battery (which costs approximately $3,000 to replace).  This fund will be used to purchase a new battery, and any funds beyond will be put towards publishing this series in book form.

Thank you for taking the time to consider helping not only me, but those who are invisible as well.
-Lexie Bragg

Artist Statement:
Seeking the Invisible
The dirty looks, the unkind words, these things I have experienced myself, and seen done to others. This is a story that needs to be told. It all comes down to this simple statement: “but you don’t look sick.” this prevailing attitude is one of the key obstacles faced by individuals with what is frequently called an invisible illness. This project attempts to look at the human face of those who suffer from invisible illnesses and invisible disabilities. Through this work, I hope to tell the stories of those who “don’t look sick,” and to examine the fragility of the human body and how our society looks upon people with invisible illnesses.
I started this project because of my own invisible illness and that of my family. However, I still found myself passing judgment on those whose illness I could not see – as well as seeing judgment passed by others about me. This led me to question what it means to be sick, and how this idea shapes the world of those with invisible illnesses, and those who are outside of it.
The human body is something that many of us take for granted. When the body works perfectly, it is something that goes unnoticed. The fact that our heart pumps our blood correctly, that the chemical levels in our brain are equal, or that we are not in constant pain is something that is usually ignored by those who are unaffected by it. The idea that such things could go wrong with our body, and that they eventually will, is something that we choose not to think about. In this project, I attempt to portray some of the unimaginable things that can go wrong with the human body and often with no physical outward signs.
Photographing people with invisible illnesses is not a new idea. Hugh Welch Diamond thought that photographing the mentally ill would aid in curing them, assuming that one could see the illness somehow on the outside. Today, many photographers work to photograph individuals with invisible illness, and to promote the idea that such things are normal and that the people who suffer from them are not different than you or I. However, it is my attempt to investigate the inside world of invisible illness’s that sets my work apart. There is so much more that needs to be explored than a simple labeling of individuals with invisible illnesses. In this work, I attempt to humanize a reality that goes so much deeper than looks.
Finding my models on craigslist and facebook, I arrange to visit with them in their homes and talk with them about their past, their present difficulties and how they cope with their illness. Through two sessions, i develop a portrait of the person and try to capture a glimpse into their life and their illness. By photographing them in their personal surroundings, I try to define the individual person beyond the illness. To photograph a glimpse into their life, we recreate a scene or an action that shows the pain and difficulty of their illness in an attempt to make the invisible visible. These glimpses range from completely structured recreation to straight documentary, depending on the decision made by the model and myself.
A statement is requested from each model, giving them the chance to discuss key elements of their daily lives. Through the camera, I try to document their daily life through an outside perspective. With the addition of a personal statement, this project becomes multi-dimensional, a collaboration between what the world sees and what the person experiences. This is important to help humanize the individuals in the photographs, taking them from simple faces to fleshed out individuals with real-life stories.
These statements, though a crucial part of the project, are set apart from the photographs to lessen the desire to try matching each statement with an individual. This is further done by not including every statement on the wall display. As the project focuses on invisible illnesses, I do not want to give the answer to what is “wrong” with each individual, but instead leave it as much of a mystery as to what one would experience upon seeing them in the real world. When in book form, every statement would be included, though still separated from each correlating photograph. For the act of showing these on the wall display, the statements have been edited to create a more palatable experience. Enough information is given to provide the viewer an inside look, but short enough to allow the viewer to digest the information in a short amount of time.
By working in collaboration with my model through portrait, a personal statement and a glimpse into their daily life, I hope to create a more immersive and truthful body of work. Before we meet, several e- mails or phone calls are exchanged to discuss who I am, what I intend to do, and why. When entering their home, I set aside an hour to talk with them before we begin shooting. This is intended to put the model at ease, as well as to find details that may be important to me as an artist, but are perhaps over looked by the model. Although I normally have a plan of action in mind based on our previous discussions, I allow the session to be very fluid. I am not working to make the photograph say what I want it to say, but to create an image that both the model and myself feel work to answer the search for the invisible.
A very important aspect of this project is the reaction I have received from my models. Every one of them thanked me for doing this project – for taking the time to look at them as people, to see not only beyond their illness, but perhaps to see into the illness as well. It is their praise that reminds me of this project’s importance and relevance.
The human body is incredibly fragile, and it is a fact that we often forget. The core question of this project is the idea of what it means to be “sick,” and how the world reacts to it. Does one need to prove to the world that they are sick in order to receive the respect and care they deserve? How do we want others to react to our invisible illness, and how do we cope in a world where we live with the invisible, and finally, how does one tell the story of the fragility of humanity?
story_txt: Seeking the Invisible is a documentary project that seeks to tell the story of those who suffer from invisible illnesses and disabilities and who feel ignored, over looked and judged.  I have been thanked by countless people-those who suffer from invisible illnesses, as well as those who don't, but even with the importance of this project, I am unable to continue in my current state. My Prius, which I use to drive throughout central Illinois (driving up to 1.5 hours just in one direction) to photograph this project, now suffers from a dead battery (which costs approximately $3,000 to replace).  This fund will be used to purchase a new battery, and any funds beyond will be put towards publishing this series in book form.Thank you for taking the time to consider helping not only me, but those who are invisible as well.-Lexie BraggArtist Statement:Seeking the InvisibleThe dirty looks, the unkind words, these things I have experienced myself, and seen done to others. This is a story that needs to be told. It all comes down to this simple statement: “but you don’t look sick.” this prevailing attitude is one of the key obstacles faced by individuals with what is frequently called an invisible illness. This project attempts to look at the human face of those who suffer from invisible illnesses and invisible disabilities. Through this work, I hope to tell the stories of those who “don’t look sick,” and to examine the fragility of the human body and how our society looks upon people with invisible illnesses.I started this project because of my own invisible illness and that of my family. However, I still found myself passing judgment on those whose illness I could not see – as well as seeing judgment passed by others about me. This led me to question what it means to be sick, and how this idea shapes the world of those with invisible illnesses, and those who are outside of it.The human body is something that many of us take for granted. When the body works perfectly, it is something that goes unnoticed. The fact that our heart pumps our blood correctly, that the chemical levels in our brain are equal, or that we are not in constant pain is something that is usually ignored by those who are unaffected by it. The idea that such things could go wrong with our body, and that they eventually will, is something that we choose not to think about. In this project, I attempt to portray some of the unimaginable things that can go wrong with the human body and often with no physical outward signs.Photographing people with invisible illnesses is not a new idea. Hugh Welch Diamond thought that photographing the mentally ill would aid in curing them, assuming that one could see the illness somehow on the outside. Today, many photographers work to photograph individuals with invisible illness, and to promote the idea that such things are normal and that the people who suffer from them are not different than you or I. However, it is my attempt to investigate the inside world of invisible illness’s that sets my work apart. There is so much more that needs to be explored than a simple labeling of individuals with invisible illnesses. In this work, I attempt to humanize a reality that goes so much deeper than looks.Finding my models on craigslist and facebook, I arrange to visit with them in their homes and talk with them about their past, their present difficulties and how they cope with their illness. Through two sessions, i develop a portrait of the person and try to capture a glimpse into their life and their illness. By photographing them in their personal surroundings, I try to define the individual person beyond the illness. To photograph a glimpse into their life, we recreate a scene or an action that shows the pain and difficulty of their illness in an attempt to make the invisible visible. These glimpses range from completely structured recreation to straight documentary, depending on the decision made by the model and myself.A statement is requested from each model, giving them the chance to discuss key elements of their daily lives. Through the camera, I try to document their daily life through an outside perspective. With the addition of a personal statement, this project becomes multi-dimensional, a collaboration between what the world sees and what the person experiences. This is important to help humanize the individuals in the photographs, taking them from simple faces to fleshed out individuals with real-life stories.These statements, though a crucial part of the project, are set apart from the photographs to lessen the desire to try matching each statement with an individual. This is further done by not including every statement on the wall display. As the project focuses on invisible illnesses, I do not want to give the answer to what is “wrong” with each individual, but instead leave it as much of a mystery as to what one would experience upon seeing them in the real world. When in book form, every statement would be included, though still separated from each correlating photograph. For the act of showing these on the wall display, the statements have been edited to create a more palatable experience. Enough information is given to provide the viewer an inside look, but short enough to allow the viewer to digest the information in a short amount of time.By working in collaboration with my model through portrait, a personal statement and a glimpse into their daily life, I hope to create a more immersive and truthful body of work. Before we meet, several e- mails or phone calls are exchanged to discuss who I am, what I intend to do, and why. When entering their home, I set aside an hour to talk with them before we begin shooting. This is intended to put the model at ease, as well as to find details that may be important to me as an artist, but are perhaps over looked by the model. Although I normally have a plan of action in mind based on our previous discussions, I allow the session to be very fluid. I am not working to make the photograph say what I want it to say, but to create an image that both the model and myself feel work to answer the search for the invisible.A very important aspect of this project is the reaction I have received from my models. Every one of them thanked me for doing this project – for taking the time to look at them as people, to see not only beyond their illness, but perhaps to see into the illness as well. It is their praise that reminds me of this project’s importance and relevance.The human body is incredibly fragile, and it is a fact that we often forget. The core question of this project is the idea of what it means to be “sick,” and how the world reacts to it. Does one need to prove to the world that they are sick in order to receive the respect and care they deserve? How do we want others to react to our invisible illness, and how do we cope in a world where we live with the invisible, and finally, how does one tell the story of the fragility of humanity?

story:
The Doughy Sattva

The theme of this year's burn is Radical Ritual, and we've been selected to build a shrine at the base of the man. Our vision is a sculpture of a pillsbury doughboy buddha, which says, "Woohoo!" when you rub its belly. We will hold rituals at this shrine, including serving cinnamon rolls daily as a sacrament for anyone nearby, as well as interactive experiences around the playa and our camp.

Concept Art

3D Model

We need your help!

Our plan is to construct our sculpture out of Baltic Birch plywood cut by CNC. The wood alone will cost nearly $2,000. We'll also need to transport it to Black Rock City, purchase fabric to sew costumes, and supplies for props and for cinnamon rolls which we'll be serving daily at the shrine in a cult-like ritual. If we fall short of our fundraising goal, we'll be making up the difference out-of-pocket.

About the artists

This will be Chris and Andrew's fourth burn, and second major Burning Man art project. We are dedicated to making this sculpture a reality and have the know-how to get it done--we just need some help with financing. Along with Andrew and Chris, we've got a solid build/interactive team including Jennifer Johnson, Adalyn Naka, Jonathan Schoonhoven, and Caroline Whittinghill.

And More

Check out a preview of our dough rituals here on YouTube (may be NSFW for some)
