story:
Kim jesteśmy? / Who are we?

Cześć, nazywam się Grażyna. / Hi, I'm Grażyna.

 

Jestem założycielką Fresh From Poland - platformy promującej współczesną Polską fotografię - oraz kuratorką projektu UFO Visual Lab: www.ufovisuallab.tumblr.com.

I'm the founder of Fresh From Poland - platform for contemporary Polish art photography and the curator of the UFO Visual Lab project  www.ufovisuallab.tumblr.com.

Nasza organizacja - Fresh From Poland - zaprosiła do współpracy FotoBzik - najbardziej aktywne stowarzyszenie fotografów w Krakowie, oraz Paper Beats Rock - fundację i wydawcę - do wspólnego projektu. Wspólnie tworzymy wystawę i publikację, które zostaną pokazane w galerii Kamienica Szara w Krakowie, 19.05-02.06.2017.

Our organization - Fresh From Poland - teamed up with FotoBzik - the most active photographers' association in Krakow and Paper Beats Rock - foundation and publishing house to create the exhibition and publication that will be shown in Galeria Kamienica Szara in Kraków, Poland, 19.05-02.06.2017. We are planning to continue our project after May and show it in London, UK and Lviv, Ukraine.

Mamy wsparcie patronów medialnych: prism photo magazine oraz doc! photo magazine.

We are supported by our media partners: prism photo magazine oraz doc! photo magazine.

 

Czemu UFO? / Why UFO?

Niezidentyfikowane Obiekty Latające [NOL-e] oraz życie pozaziemskie są motywem który regularnie pojawia się w kulturze, mediach i naukowych dyskusjach od wielu lat.

Unidentified Flying Objects and extraterrestrials have been the themes appearing in the mainstream media and science discussions regularly since many years.

Wydaje nam się niezwykle ciekawym pytaniem: czemu ludzie chcą wierzyć? Jak to możliwe, że tak wielu z nas 'wie' jak wygląda coś, czego istnienie nigdy nie zostało udowodnione? Czemu idea UFO bez przerwy inspiruje artystów do tworzenia powieści, filmów, dzieł sztuki?

We find it extremely interesting: why people want to believe? How come so many of us 'know', how the flying saucers or aliens look like, although no one has ever proved they exist? Why the idea of UFO continuously inspires continuously inspire artists to produce stories, movies, artworks?

Budujemy bibliotekę oraz linię czasu pokazującą niezwykły rozwój mitu UFO na przestrzeni dziesięcioleci.

We are creating a library and a timeline to show detailed evolution of the UFO myth.

Zaprosiliśmy dziesięciu niezwykłych polskich artystów do stworzenia prac na ten temat. Oto oni: Franek Ammer (instalacja i publikacja), Gosia Ćwiech (instalacja fotograficzna), Artur Gołębiowski (ilustracje), Grupa TBX (Paweł Bagiński, Miłosz Cirocki, Wojtek Skrzypczyński - instalacja wideo), Kamil #2 (CGI), Anna Kieblesz (fotografie), Karol Liver (fotografie), Michał Matejko (fotografie i publikacja), Kaja Rata (fotografie), Katarzyna Zolich (wideo footage).

We invited 10 artists to create artworks on this topic: Franek Ammer (art installation and publication), Gosia Ćwiech (photo installation), Artur Gołębiowski (illustrations), Grupa TBX (Paweł Bagiński, Miłosz Cirocki, Wojtek Skrzypczyński - video installation), Kamil #2 (CGI), Anna Kieblesz (photographs), Karol Liver (photographs), Michał Matejko (photographs and publication), Kaja Rata (photographs), Katarzyna Zolich (video footage).

(zdjęcie: Kaja Rata, z serii 'Neujmina i Sekuntala'  / photo: Kaja Rata, from the 'Neujmina i Sekuntala' series)

 

(zdjęcie: Anna Kieblesz / photo: Anna Kieblesz)

 

(zdjęcie: Karol Liver, z serii "Wizitacja" / photo: Karol Liver, from the 'Visitation' series)

Szukamy nowych prac i materiałów poprzez międzynarodowy nabór #showmeyourufo (showmeyourufo.tumblr.com):

We are seeking more works through the international #showmeyourufo open call (showmeyourufo.tumblr.com):

(zdjęcie: Patryk Klimowicz / photo: Patryk Klimkowicz) 

(zdjęcie: Małgorzata Sajur  / photo: Małgorzata Sajur)

(zdjęcie: Pablo Charnas / photo: Pablo Charnas)

 

Zaprosiliśmy kuratorkę Izę Zdziebko oraz fotografów ze stowarzyszenia FotoBzik do zbudowania własnej kolekcji zdjęć związanych z UFO. Projekt ten, 'Wall of Evidence', bada związek między światłem a tym, co i jak widzimy i jak to interpretujemy: 

We invited photographers from FotoBzik association and curator Iza Zdziebko to create their own selection of UFO-related photographs. This project, called 'Wall of Evidence', seeks for connection between the light and what and how we see and how we interpret it:

(zdjęcie: Aleksandra Iwańczak, FotoBzik / photo: Aleksandra Iwańczak, FotoBzik)

(zdjęcie: Tomasz Chowaniec, FotoBzik / photo: Tomasz Chowaniec, FotoBzik)

 

Zaprosiliśmy Karola Livera z 'prism photo magazine' do pokazania na naszej wystawie swojego kuratorskiego projektu 'Disclosure':

We invited Karol Liver from 'prism photo magazine' to show with us his curatorial project 'Disclosure':

 

Kasia Zolich i Katarzyna Legendź z Paper Beats Rock przygotowują zin 'Alternative Facts' - publikację towarzyszącą wystawie.

Kasia Zolich and Katarzyna Legendź from Paper Beats Rock are producing the publication 'Alterative Facts', accompanying the show.

To żywe laboratorium - odkrywamy kolejne połączenia, inspiracje, wyobraźnię ludzką oraz historię tematu UFO w naszej kulturze.

It's a living laboratory - we are discovering the connections, inspirations, limits of human imagination and the history of UFO in our culture.

Szukamy odpowiedzi, i zapraszamy Was do szukania ich razem z nami!

We are looking for answers and we invite you to look for them with us!

 

Czego potrzebujemy i co oferujemy 

What We Need & What You Get 

Potrzebujemy co najmniej 900$ na wyprodukowanie prac, publikacji oraz zorganizowanie przestrzeni galerii, jak również na promocję projektu.

We need at least 900$ for the production of artworks, publication and for organizing the gallery space, as well as for the promotion of the project.

- 220 $ - produkcja 45 kopii publikacji 'Alternative Facts / production of 45 copies of the "Alternative Facts" zine;

- 330 $ -produkcja prac 10 zaproszonych artystów (wydruki, montaż, sprzęt elektroniczny) / producing the artworks of our 10 invited artists (prints, frames, tv screens, computers);

- 100 $ - przygotowanie przestrzeni, produkcja linii czasu oraz labu (meble, książki, materiały, papiery, narzędzia, śrubki, gwoździe, taśmy; kredki, długopisy, nożyczki i druki przeznaczone dla gości do tworzenia własnych prac); / preparing our space, timeline and lab area: furniture, books, materials, papers, tools, all the screws, nails, tapes; pens, crayons, scissors and prints for our guests to make their own works; 

- 100 $ - wyprodukowanie prac artystów zaproszonych do udziału w projektach kuratorskich 'Wall of Evidence'  oraz 'Disclosure' / producing artworks for 'Wall Of Evidence' and 'Disclosure' curatorial projects;

- 150 $ - promocja: reklama w social media, druk plakatów, ulotek, mapek, gadżetów / promotion: social media ads, posters, handouts, postcards, gadgets.

Jeśli nie uda nam się zebrać całej kwoty, będziemy musieli zmniejszyć ilość prac, publikacji lub materiałów promocyjnych. Jeśli uzbieramy więcej niż 900$, przeznaczymy te środki na zabranie UFO Visual Lab do Londynu i na Ukrainę!

If we can't reach our total financial goal, we have to cut down on the amount of works, publications or promo materials. If we raise more than needed, all extra money will be used for taking UFO Visual Lab project to London and Ukraine!

 

Nagrody

Our perks

Aby podziękować Wam za Waszą pomoc, przygotowaliśmy dla Was unikalne prezenty, niektóre z nich nie są dostępne nigdzie indziej:

To thank you for your help, we prepared amazing and unique perks for you, some of them not available anywhere else:

Nasza publikacja - zin 'Alternative Facts' - limitowana edycja, tylko 50 kopii: warto ją zdobyć!

Our zine publication - 'Alternative Facts' - limited edition of 50 copies so it's worthy of getting it!

Mamy również dwie książki fotograficzne przygotowywane jako część wystawy. Specjalnie dla Was produkujemy kilka dodatkowych kopii, można je dostać wyłącznie tu i teraz! To zin w formie gazety autorstwa Michała Matejki - 'Obcy' - oraz publikacja 'Unphotographable Flying Object' Franka Ammera.

​We are also really excited about two photobooks that are produced especially for the exhibition and made in just few copies by Franek Ammer and Michał Matejko - only few copies of each will be available for sale! 

Wiele prezentów zostało przygotowanych specjalnie na potrzeby tej akcji. Są nimi piękne przedmioty zaprojektowane przez wyjątkowego brytyjskiego artystę grafika R.a.Szy. Zamawiajcie, zanim znikną! :-)

Selected artworks and gadgets are tailored especially for the crowdfunding campaign. We have some beautiful objects designed for us by the British graphic designer R.a.Szy. Hurry up before they disappear! :)

Nazwiska wszystkich wspierających nas osób zostaną opublikowane w specjalnej zakładce na stronie naszego projektu: showmeyourufo.tumblr.com.

We will publish the names of all our supporters on project's page showmeyourufo.tumblr.com. We really appreciate your help!

 

ZIN ALTERNATIVE FACTS

Publikacja towarzysząca wystawie UFO Visual Lab

ALTERNATIVE FACTS ZINE

The publication accompanying the UFO Visual Lab exhibition​

Alternative Facts to dowód w sprawie, która toczy się od wielu lat, na wszystkich kontynentach. Sprawa istnienia UFO nie została rozstrzygnięta, mimo że nieustannie ujawniają się nowi naoczni świadkowie. Popularne przedstawienia istot pozaziemskich zdają się zaciemniać obraz sytuacji. Zwróciliśmy się do tych, którzy widzieli, by przedstawili dowody tutaj, na Ziemi. Oto efekt naszych poszukiwań. Nielinearna historia śladów, znaków, paradoksów fizyki, świateł z nieznanego źródła – na pierwszy rzut oka znajome. Im dłużej jednak patrzysz, im wnikliwiej badasz przykładając do siebie majaczące na horyzoncie rozpikselowane grupy atomów, tym pewniejsze jest zdaje się być tylko to, że jesteś obcy w miejscu, gdzie „wszyscy jesteśmy ludźmi, a Ziemia to nasza planeta”.

Alternative Facts - Skoroszyt hakowy, Zin A4 – 60 stron, Zin A6 – 24 strony, odbitka srebrowa; Nakład: 50 egzemplarzy; Wydawca: Paper Beats Rock; Projekt: Katarzyna Ewa Legendź, Katarzyna Zolich; Partnerzy: Fresh From Poland, Fotobzik

Publikacja towarzysząca wystawie UFO Visual Lab prezentowanej w Galerii Szara Kamienica w dniach 21.05.2017 – 03.06.2017 r. 

Alternative facts is an evidence in the case that has been going on for a long time now, on all continents. The UFO case is far from being resolved, although eyewitnesses are constantly being revealed. The pop-representations of all things extraterrestrial seem to obscure the true picture of the situation. We turned to those who saw things and made them show us the evidence here, on Earth. Here you have it – the effect of our research. A non-linear narrative of traces, signs, physical paradoxes, lights coming from the unknown sources – all looking pretty familiar, at the first glance. But the longer you look, the more closely you investigate and juxtapose the pixelated atoms on the horizon, the clearer it gets - it is likely that you’re not at home in your own home, that you’re a mere alien to the „place where we are all human, and Earth is our planet”.

Alternative Facts- Hook folder, A4 Zine – 60 p., A6 Zine – 24 p., silver gelatin print; Edition: 50 copies; Publisher: Paper Beats Rock; Design: Katarzyna Ewa Legendź, Katarzyna Zolich; Partners: Fresh From Poland, Fotobzik.

The publication accompanying the UFO Visual Lab exhibition, Gray House Gallery, Cracow, May 21st – June 3rd 2017

 

Zestaw 4 przypinek

Set of 4 badges

 

 

 

Lniana torba 'FotoBzik' - jasna i ciemna

'FotoBzik' linen bag - ecru & black

Piękne lniane torby 'FotoBzik' zaprojektowane przez Doli Design.

Beautiful linen bags 'FotoBzik' designed by Doli Design.

 

Zin STRING PHOTOGRAPHY - eightsweetlimbs (Grażyna Siedlecka & Nicko Straniero)

Zine STRING PHOTOGRAPHY by eightsweetlimbs (Grażyna Siedlecka & Nicko Straniero)

'String Photography' to pierwszy wspólny projekt Grażyny Siedleckiej i Nicko Straniero w duecie zwanym eightsweetlimbs. Do tego projektu użyliśmy dwóch jednorazowych aparatów fotograficznych związanych sznureczkiem i robiliśmy sobie nawzajem zdjęcia w tym samym momencie, pokazując zupełnie różne perspektywy wybranej dzielnicy Londynu w letnie popołudnie 2014 roku. (Laserowy druk na papierze ksero)

'String Photography' is the first of an ongoing series of collaborations between Grażyna Siedlecka and Nicko Straniero as eightsweetlimbs. For this project we used two disposable cameras, tied them together with a string and took simultaneous photos of each other so to reveal diametrically opposed backgrounds of an area in London we were exploring during a summer afternoon in 2014. (Laser colour photocopied on normal paper)

 

#SHOWMEYOURUFO - jasna bawełniana torba

#SHOWMEYOURUFO ecru cotton bag

zaprojektowana przez naszego ulubionego londyńskiego designera R.a.Szy.

designed by our favorite London-based graphic designer R.a.Szy.

 

UFO VISUAL LAB - jasna bawełniana torba

UFO VISUAL LAB cotton bag

zaprojektowana przez naszego ulubionego londyńskiego designera R.a.Szy.

designed by our favorite London-based graphic designer R.a.Szy.

Nicko Straniero: zin MY SCARY FRIENDS

Nicko Straniero: MY SCARY FRIENDS zine

Seria 40 portretów które badają emocjonalność i psychologię ciemniejszej strony ludzkiej natury. Autorstwa Nicko Straniero, włoskiego artysty mieszkającego w Londynie / nickostraniero.tumblr.com

A series of 40 portraits which explore emotional and psychological notions of our darker human nature. Made by Nicko Straniero, Italian artist based in London. / nickostraniero.tumblr.com

Published 2014
40 pages - size 14x19 cm
edition of 120
Laser color printed on 120g paper

 

 

 

Martyna Rudnicka: zin PRANIE 

Martyna Rudnicka: PRANIE zine

Czy, a jeżeli tak to gdzie, istnieje granica wykluczająca 
zwykłe zdarzenia poza nawias sztuki? Czasem 
najbanalniejsze historie są najciekawsze.

Whether there is – and if so, where – a border that 
pushes everyday events beyond the limits of art. 
Sometimes the most trivial stories are the most 
interesting ones.

Paper Beats Rock

20 pages/ A5 
G-Print 170 g/m² 
Limited edition of 100 copies.

ISBN 978-83-934171-2-4

 

Maciej Przemyk: zin BROMANCE

Maciej Przemyk: BROMANCE zine

Opowieść o współlokatorach, mężczyznach, kolegach, 
muskułach i mimowolnej, surowej i szorstkiej bliskości.

A tale about flatmates, males, friends. 
About thews and involuntary, raw and rough proximity.

Paper Beats Rock

36 pages/ A5 
Amber Graphic 110 g/m² 
Cardboard Sleeve + DIY Cup 
Limited edition of 100 copies.

ISBN 978-83-934171-0-0

 

Fresh From Poland: zin DISTORTION

Fresh From Poland: DISTORTION zine

Pierwsza publikacja powstała dzięki współpracy pomiędzy Fresh From Poland oraz Moniką Proniewską i Pauliną Oknińską z Hekla Studio, odpowiedzialnymi za projekt książeczki. Zin prezentuje  wyselekcjonowane prace polskich artystów, które nawiązują do motywu zniekształcenia rzeczywistości w fotografii.

Ostatnie kopie!

The first publication emerged out of the collaboration between Fresh From Poland and Monika Proniewska and Paulina Oknińska from Studio Hekla, who were responsible for the design of the project. The zine includes selected photographs of contemporary Polish artists, that are related to the theme of distortion of the reality in photography.

Printed in limited edition of 100; 48 pages, soft cover; April 2016.

FEATURED ARTISTS:

Kamil I, Piotr Bekas, Filip Berendt, Magda Biernat, Jan Brykczyński, Grzegorz Czaplicki, Alicja Dobrucka, Anna Kieblesz, Kasia Klimpel, Wawrzyniec Kolbusz, Paulina Korobkiewicz, Gabriel Orłowski, Jerzy Piątek, Natalia Podgórska, Monika Proniewska, Ernest Protasiewicz, Ernest Wińczyk, Martyna Wyrzykowska, Karolina Zajączkowska  / DWA ZETA

Last copies!

 

R.a. Szy: grafika #SHOWMEYOURUFO​​, rozmiar A4

R.a. Szy: #SHOWMEYOURUFO print​, A4 size

#SHOWMEYOURUFO cotton backpack

'KALWARIA' is a photo album by Wojciech Wilczek, remarkable Polish documentary photographer. Portraits of deeply religious Poles celebrating Holy Week, captured by artist - atheist. 128 pages. Language of publication: Polish, English.

You can also become our partner or General Sponsor. Check out our perks on the right side!

Jeśli chciałbyś odebrać prezenty osobiście w Krakowie, napisz do nas: contact[at]freshfrompoland.com. Otworzymy dla Ciebie specjalną opcję zakupu tak, byś nie musiał / musiała płacić za przesyłkę.

If you wish to collect your perks personally in Kraków, Poland, let us know: contact[at]freshfrompoland.com. We will create a special option for you so you don't need to pay for the shipping.

 

Dołącz do projektu: wyślij swoje prace w ramach naboru #SHOWMEYOURUFO!

Join the exhibition: submit your work to #SHOWMEYOURUFO!

Czy zdarzyło Ci się zobaczyć UFO? Czy udało Ci się je sfotografować? A może stworzyłeś prace związane z tematem UFO? A może ten temat nigdy Cię nie interesował - ale spróbujemy Cię zainspirować do włączenia się w nasz projekt mimo to!

Have you ever seen #UFO? Have you captured or drawn it? Or maybe you just tried to imagine it and made an artwork about it? On the other hand perhaps you have never been interested in this topic but we can try to inspire you to join our project anyway!

Aby zgłosić swoją pracę, wystarczy przesłać ją na adres showmeyourufo@gmail.com. Projekt nie ma ograniczeń co do wieku, narodowości czy liczby zgłoszeń na osobę. Prosimy o pliki w niskiej rozdzielczości (72 dpi), opisane imieniem, nazwiskiem, danymi kontaktowymi oraz adresem strony internetowej. Każda praca musi być autorstwa osoby, która ją przesyła.

To apply, all you need to do is submit your pieces to the showmeyourufo@gmail.com email address. There are no age, picture per person or nationality restrictions. Artworks in low resolution (72 dpi) should be accompanied by the participants’ name, surname, website and contact details. Work must be created by the submitting artist. 

Możesz przesłać do nas wszystko, co budzi skojarzenia z tematem UFO. Mogą to być: latające spodki, dziwne rośliny lub obiekty, charakterystyczna architektura, fragmenty map z Google Earth, modele statków kosmicznych, a także (lub przede wszystkim) dokumentacja rzeczywistych zdarzeń z udziałem UFO. Zachęcamy także do nadsyłania zdjęć, historii, kolaży, grafik, rysunków, krótkich filmów wideo, dźwięków… Czyli wszystkiego, co może przyjść ci do głowy na dźwięk słowa „UFO”!

You can send us anything that fits within the UFO topic or visual language: it can be saucers in the sky, weird plants, objects or architecture, Google Earth print screens, or even documentation of sightings or portraits of abductees / witnesses. Regarding the media - we accept photographs, stories, collages, graphics, drawings, clippings, short videos or sounds… Sky is the limit!

Prace prosimy przesyłać do 15 maja 2017.

Deadline for submission: 15 May 2017.

story_txt:
Kim jesteśmy? / Who are we?

Cześć, nazywam się Grażyna. / Hi, I'm Grażyna.

 
Jestem założycielką Fresh From Poland - platformy promującej współczesną Polską fotografię - oraz kuratorką projektu UFO Visual Lab: www.ufovisuallab.tumblr.com.
I'm the founder of Fresh From Poland - platform for contemporary Polish art photography and the curator of the UFO Visual Lab project  www.ufovisuallab.tumblr.com.
Nasza organizacja - Fresh From Poland - zaprosiła do współpracy FotoBzik - najbardziej aktywne stowarzyszenie fotografów w Krakowie, oraz Paper Beats Rock - fundację i wydawcę - do wspólnego projektu. Wspólnie tworzymy wystawę i publikację, które zostaną pokazane w galerii Kamienica Szara w Krakowie, 19.05-02.06.2017.
Our organization - Fresh From Poland - teamed up with FotoBzik - the most active photographers' association in Krakow and Paper Beats Rock - foundation and publishing house to create the exhibition and publication that will be shown in Galeria Kamienica Szara in Kraków, Poland, 19.05-02.06.2017. We are planning to continue our project after May and show it in London, UK and Lviv, Ukraine.
Mamy wsparcie patronów medialnych: prism photo magazine oraz doc! photo magazine.
We are supported by our media partners: prism photo magazine oraz doc! photo magazine.
 
Czemu UFO? / Why UFO?

Niezidentyfikowane Obiekty Latające [NOL-e] oraz życie pozaziemskie są motywem który regularnie pojawia się w kulturze, mediach i naukowych dyskusjach od wielu lat.
Unidentified Flying Objects and extraterrestrials have been the themes appearing in the mainstream media and science discussions regularly since many years.
Wydaje nam się niezwykle ciekawym pytaniem: czemu ludzie chcą wierzyć? Jak to możliwe, że tak wielu z nas 'wie' jak wygląda coś, czego istnienie nigdy nie zostało udowodnione? Czemu idea UFO bez przerwy inspiruje artystów do tworzenia powieści, filmów, dzieł sztuki?
We find it extremely interesting: why people want to believe? How come so many of us 'know', how the flying saucers or aliens look like, although no one has ever proved they exist? Why the idea of UFO continuously inspires continuously inspire artists to produce stories, movies, artworks?
Budujemy bibliotekę oraz linię czasu pokazującą niezwykły rozwój mitu UFO na przestrzeni dziesięcioleci.
We are creating a library and a timeline to show detailed evolution of the UFO myth.
Zaprosiliśmy dziesięciu niezwykłych polskich artystów do stworzenia prac na ten temat. Oto oni: Franek Ammer (instalacja i publikacja), Gosia Ćwiech (instalacja fotograficzna), Artur Gołębiowski (ilustracje), Grupa TBX (Paweł Bagiński, Miłosz Cirocki, Wojtek Skrzypczyński - instalacja wideo), Kamil #2 (CGI), Anna Kieblesz (fotografie), Karol Liver (fotografie), Michał Matejko (fotografie i publikacja), Kaja Rata (fotografie), Katarzyna Zolich (wideo footage).
We invited 10 artists to create artworks on this topic: Franek Ammer (art installation and publication), Gosia Ćwiech (photo installation), Artur Gołębiowski (illustrations), Grupa TBX (Paweł Bagiński, Miłosz Cirocki, Wojtek Skrzypczyński - video installation), Kamil #2 (CGI), Anna Kieblesz (photographs), Karol Liver (photographs), Michał Matejko (photographs and publication), Kaja Rata (photographs), Katarzyna Zolich (video footage).

(zdjęcie: Kaja Rata, z serii 'Neujmina i Sekuntala'  / photo: Kaja Rata, from the 'Neujmina i Sekuntala' series)
 

(zdjęcie: Anna Kieblesz / photo: Anna Kieblesz)
 

(zdjęcie: Karol Liver, z serii "Wizitacja" / photo: Karol Liver, from the 'Visitation' series)
Szukamy nowych prac i materiałów poprzez międzynarodowy nabór #showmeyourufo (showmeyourufo.tumblr.com):
We are seeking more works through the international #showmeyourufo open call (showmeyourufo.tumblr.com):

(zdjęcie: Patryk Klimowicz / photo: Patryk Klimkowicz) 

(zdjęcie: Małgorzata Sajur  / photo: Małgorzata Sajur)

(zdjęcie: Pablo Charnas / photo: Pablo Charnas)
 
Zaprosiliśmy kuratorkę Izę Zdziebko oraz fotografów ze stowarzyszenia FotoBzik do zbudowania własnej kolekcji zdjęć związanych z UFO. Projekt ten, 'Wall of Evidence', bada związek między światłem a tym, co i jak widzimy i jak to interpretujemy: 
We invited photographers from FotoBzik association and curator Iza Zdziebko to create their own selection of UFO-related photographs. This project, called 'Wall of Evidence', seeks for connection between the light and what and how we see and how we interpret it:

(zdjęcie: Aleksandra Iwańczak, FotoBzik / photo: Aleksandra Iwańczak, FotoBzik)

(zdjęcie: Tomasz Chowaniec, FotoBzik / photo: Tomasz Chowaniec, FotoBzik)
 
Zaprosiliśmy Karola Livera z 'prism photo magazine' do pokazania na naszej wystawie swojego kuratorskiego projektu 'Disclosure':
We invited Karol Liver from 'prism photo magazine' to show with us his curatorial project 'Disclosure':

 
Kasia Zolich i Katarzyna Legendź z Paper Beats Rock przygotowują zin 'Alternative Facts' - publikację towarzyszącą wystawie.
Kasia Zolich and Katarzyna Legendź from Paper Beats Rock are producing the publication 'Alterative Facts', accompanying the show.
To żywe laboratorium - odkrywamy kolejne połączenia, inspiracje, wyobraźnię ludzką oraz historię tematu UFO w naszej kulturze.
It's a living laboratory - we are discovering the connections, inspirations, limits of human imagination and the history of UFO in our culture.
Szukamy odpowiedzi, i zapraszamy Was do szukania ich razem z nami!
We are looking for answers and we invite you to look for them with us!
 

Czego potrzebujemy i co oferujemy 
What We Need & What You Get 
Potrzebujemy co najmniej 900$ na wyprodukowanie prac, publikacji oraz zorganizowanie przestrzeni galerii, jak również na promocję projektu.
We need at least 900$ for the production of artworks, publication and for organizing the gallery space, as well as for the promotion of the project.
- 220 $ - produkcja 45 kopii publikacji 'Alternative Facts / production of 45 copies of the "Alternative Facts" zine;
- 330 $ -produkcja prac 10 zaproszonych artystów (wydruki, montaż, sprzęt elektroniczny) / producing the artworks of our 10 invited artists (prints, frames, tv screens, computers);
- 100 $ - przygotowanie przestrzeni, produkcja linii czasu oraz labu (meble, książki, materiały, papiery, narzędzia, śrubki, gwoździe, taśmy; kredki, długopisy, nożyczki i druki przeznaczone dla gości do tworzenia własnych prac); / preparing our space, timeline and lab area: furniture, books, materials, papers, tools, all the screws, nails, tapes; pens, crayons, scissors and prints for our guests to make their own works; 
- 100 $ - wyprodukowanie prac artystów zaproszonych do udziału w projektach kuratorskich 'Wall of Evidence'  oraz 'Disclosure' / producing artworks for 'Wall Of Evidence' and 'Disclosure' curatorial projects;
- 150 $ - promocja: reklama w social media, druk plakatów, ulotek, mapek, gadżetów / promotion: social media ads, posters, handouts, postcards, gadgets.
Jeśli nie uda nam się zebrać całej kwoty, będziemy musieli zmniejszyć ilość prac, publikacji lub materiałów promocyjnych. Jeśli uzbieramy więcej niż 900$, przeznaczymy te środki na zabranie UFO Visual Lab do Londynu i na Ukrainę!
If we can't reach our total financial goal, we have to cut down on the amount of works, publications or promo materials. If we raise more than needed, all extra money will be used for taking UFO Visual Lab project to London and Ukraine!
 
Nagrody
Our perks
Aby podziękować Wam za Waszą pomoc, przygotowaliśmy dla Was unikalne prezenty, niektóre z nich nie są dostępne nigdzie indziej:
To thank you for your help, we prepared amazing and unique perks for you, some of them not available anywhere else:
Nasza publikacja - zin 'Alternative Facts' - limitowana edycja, tylko 50 kopii: warto ją zdobyć!
Our zine publication - 'Alternative Facts' - limited edition of 50 copies so it's worthy of getting it!
Mamy również dwie książki fotograficzne przygotowywane jako część wystawy. Specjalnie dla Was produkujemy kilka dodatkowych kopii, można je dostać wyłącznie tu i teraz! To zin w formie gazety autorstwa Michała Matejki - 'Obcy' - oraz publikacja 'Unphotographable Flying Object' Franka Ammera.
​We are also really excited about two photobooks that are produced especially for the exhibition and made in just few copies by Franek Ammer and Michał Matejko - only few copies of each will be available for sale! 
Wiele prezentów zostało przygotowanych specjalnie na potrzeby tej akcji. Są nimi piękne przedmioty zaprojektowane przez wyjątkowego brytyjskiego artystę grafika R.a.Szy. Zamawiajcie, zanim znikną! :-)
Selected artworks and gadgets are tailored especially for the crowdfunding campaign. We have some beautiful objects designed for us by the British graphic designer R.a.Szy. Hurry up before they disappear! :)
Nazwiska wszystkich wspierających nas osób zostaną opublikowane w specjalnej zakładce na stronie naszego projektu: showmeyourufo.tumblr.com.
We will publish the names of all our supporters on project's page showmeyourufo.tumblr.com. We really appreciate your help!
 
ZIN ALTERNATIVE FACTS
Publikacja towarzysząca wystawie UFO Visual Lab
ALTERNATIVE FACTS ZINE
The publication accompanying the UFO Visual Lab exhibition​
Alternative Facts to dowód w sprawie, która toczy się od wielu lat, na wszystkich kontynentach. Sprawa istnienia UFO nie została rozstrzygnięta, mimo że nieustannie ujawniają się nowi naoczni świadkowie. Popularne przedstawienia istot pozaziemskich zdają się zaciemniać obraz sytuacji. Zwróciliśmy się do tych, którzy widzieli, by przedstawili dowody tutaj, na Ziemi. Oto efekt naszych poszukiwań. Nielinearna historia śladów, znaków, paradoksów fizyki, świateł z nieznanego źródła – na pierwszy rzut oka znajome. Im dłużej jednak patrzysz, im wnikliwiej badasz przykładając do siebie majaczące na horyzoncie rozpikselowane grupy atomów, tym pewniejsze jest zdaje się być tylko to, że jesteś obcy w miejscu, gdzie „wszyscy jesteśmy ludźmi, a Ziemia to nasza planeta”.
Alternative Facts - Skoroszyt hakowy, Zin A4 – 60 stron, Zin A6 – 24 strony, odbitka srebrowa; Nakład: 50 egzemplarzy; Wydawca: Paper Beats Rock; Projekt: Katarzyna Ewa Legendź, Katarzyna Zolich; Partnerzy: Fresh From Poland, Fotobzik
Publikacja towarzysząca wystawie UFO Visual Lab prezentowanej w Galerii Szara Kamienica w dniach 21.05.2017 – 03.06.2017 r. 
Alternative facts is an evidence in the case that has been going on for a long time now, on all continents. The UFO case is far from being resolved, although eyewitnesses are constantly being revealed. The pop-representations of all things extraterrestrial seem to obscure the true picture of the situation. We turned to those who saw things and made them show us the evidence here, on Earth. Here you have it – the effect of our research. A non-linear narrative of traces, signs, physical paradoxes, lights coming from the unknown sources – all looking pretty familiar, at the first glance. But the longer you look, the more closely you investigate and juxtapose the pixelated atoms on the horizon, the clearer it gets - it is likely that you’re not at home in your own home, that you’re a mere alien to the „place where we are all human, and Earth is our planet”.
Alternative Facts- Hook folder, A4 Zine – 60 p., A6 Zine – 24 p., silver gelatin print; Edition: 50 copies; Publisher: Paper Beats Rock; Design: Katarzyna Ewa Legendź, Katarzyna Zolich; Partners: Fresh From Poland, Fotobzik.
The publication accompanying the UFO Visual Lab exhibition, Gray House Gallery, Cracow, May 21st – June 3rd 2017

Zin STRING PHOTOGRAPHY - eightsweetlimbs (Grażyna Siedlecka & Nicko Straniero)
Zine STRING PHOTOGRAPHY by eightsweetlimbs (Grażyna Siedlecka & Nicko Straniero)
'String Photography' to pierwszy wspólny projekt Grażyny Siedleckiej i Nicko Straniero w duecie zwanym eightsweetlimbs. Do tego projektu użyliśmy dwóch jednorazowych aparatów fotograficznych związanych sznureczkiem i robiliśmy sobie nawzajem zdjęcia w tym samym momencie, pokazując zupełnie różne perspektywy wybranej dzielnicy Londynu w letnie popołudnie 2014 roku. (Laserowy druk na papierze ksero)
'String Photography' is the first of an ongoing series of collaborations between Grażyna Siedlecka and Nicko Straniero as eightsweetlimbs. For this project we used two disposable cameras, tied them together with a string and took simultaneous photos of each other so to reveal diametrically opposed backgrounds of an area in London we were exploring during a summer afternoon in 2014. (Laser colour photocopied on normal paper)

Martyna Rudnicka: zin PRANIE 
Martyna Rudnicka: PRANIE zine
Czy, a jeżeli tak to gdzie, istnieje granica wykluczająca zwykłe zdarzenia poza nawias sztuki? Czasem najbanalniejsze historie są najciekawsze.
Whether there is – and if so, where – a border that pushes everyday events beyond the limits of art. Sometimes the most trivial stories are the most interesting ones.
Paper Beats Rock

A tale about flatmates, males, friends. About thews and involuntary, raw and rough proximity.
Paper Beats Rock

Fresh From Poland: zin DISTORTION
Fresh From Poland: DISTORTION zine
Pierwsza publikacja powstała dzięki współpracy pomiędzy Fresh From Poland oraz Moniką Proniewską i Pauliną Oknińską z Hekla Studio, odpowiedzialnymi za projekt książeczki. Zin prezentuje  wyselekcjonowane prace polskich artystów, które nawiązują do motywu zniekształcenia rzeczywistości w fotografii.
Ostatnie kopie!
The first publication emerged out of the collaboration between Fresh From Poland and Monika Proniewska and Paulina Oknińska from Studio Hekla, who were responsible for the design of the project. The zine includes selected photographs of contemporary Polish artists, that are related to the theme of distortion of the reality in photography.
Printed in limited edition of 100; 48 pages, soft cover; April 2016.
FEATURED ARTISTS:
Kamil I, Piotr Bekas, Filip Berendt, Magda Biernat, Jan Brykczyński, Grzegorz Czaplicki, Alicja Dobrucka, Anna Kieblesz, Kasia Klimpel, Wawrzyniec Kolbusz, Paulina Korobkiewicz, Gabriel Orłowski, Jerzy Piątek, Natalia Podgórska, Monika Proniewska, Ernest Protasiewicz, Ernest Wińczyk, Martyna Wyrzykowska, Karolina Zajączkowska  / DWA ZETA

Dołącz do projektu: wyślij swoje prace w ramach naboru #SHOWMEYOURUFO!

Join the exhibition: submit your work to #SHOWMEYOURUFO!
Czy zdarzyło Ci się zobaczyć UFO? Czy udało Ci się je sfotografować? A może stworzyłeś prace związane z tematem UFO? A może ten temat nigdy Cię nie interesował - ale spróbujemy Cię zainspirować do włączenia się w nasz projekt mimo to!
Have you ever seen #UFO? Have you captured or drawn it? Or maybe you just tried to imagine it and made an artwork about it? On the other hand perhaps you have never been interested in this topic but we can try to inspire you to join our project anyway!
Aby zgłosić swoją pracę, wystarczy przesłać ją na adres showmeyourufo@gmail.com. Projekt nie ma ograniczeń co do wieku, narodowości czy liczby zgłoszeń na osobę. Prosimy o pliki w niskiej rozdzielczości (72 dpi), opisane imieniem, nazwiskiem, danymi kontaktowymi oraz adresem strony internetowej. Każda praca musi być autorstwa osoby, która ją przesyła.
To apply, all you need to do is submit your pieces to the showmeyourufo@gmail.com email address. There are no age, picture per person or nationality restrictions. Artworks in low resolution (72 dpi) should be accompanied by the participants’ name, surname, website and contact details. Work must be created by the submitting artist. 
Możesz przesłać do nas wszystko, co budzi skojarzenia z tematem UFO. Mogą to być: latające spodki, dziwne rośliny lub obiekty, charakterystyczna architektura, fragmenty map z Google Earth, modele statków kosmicznych, a także (lub przede wszystkim) dokumentacja rzeczywistych zdarzeń z udziałem UFO. Zachęcamy także do nadsyłania zdjęć, historii, kolaży, grafik, rysunków, krótkich filmów wideo, dźwięków… Czyli wszystkiego, co może przyjść ci do głowy na dźwięk słowa „UFO”!You can send us anything that fits within the UFO topic or visual language: it can be saucers in the sky, weird plants, objects or architecture, Google Earth print screens, or even documentation of sightings or portraits of abductees / witnesses. Regarding the media - we accept photographs, stories, collages, graphics, drawings, clippings, short videos or sounds… Sky is the limit!
Prace prosimy przesyłać do 15 maja 2017.
Deadline for submission: 15 May 2017.

story:
Short Summary

As inventor entrepreneurs based in toronto, canada, we have always looked for the perfect tool to design the prototypes of inventions that we came up with. We wanted something that was durable, made with quality, and cheap at the same time. We made the perfect tool to design our ideas and decided to share it with the world. It was cheap, however had the premium quality that we were looking for. Whether you’re an architect, an engineer, a graphic designer, a stationery enthusiast… etc, our notebooks provide multipurpose utility for any industry. We have created desktop essentials that are affordable and perform accordingly to the needs of the user. We want our notebooks and other stationery supplies to inspire inventor entrepreneurs worldwide. Blueprint isn’t just a product, it’s a movement. Any support we get  would help us expand our product and message throughout the world to encourage and motivate people to innovate and invent no matter what the restrictions are.

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise as much as we can to get the ball rolling. Even a little support goes a long way for us. We want as many people to know about Blueprint as possible. The more we raise, the better the production of our notebooks will be. We also want to raise funds to be able to bring new product lines into the brands such as essentials like, pens, pencils...etc with added benefits to further encourage our message.

The Impact

The impact you supporters will have will be immense and greatly appreciated not just by us but also by the people we wish to help. We want to raise enough money to be able to send these supplies to countries that are less fortunate to encourage education and innovation. The impact of your support will help us expand our business and message across the world!

Risks & Challenges

Notebooks and stationery supplies aren't the most interesting product. We guarantee that our notebooks are not ordinary and can help anyone no matter what industry they're in and that once people get the word about them, they'll instantly be hooked! We need your guys' support to share our brand and help us expand things from this startup!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even sharing our brand, product, or message would be greatly appreciated! Any support would be great. You can find us at our website: www.blueprintnotebooks.com

Instagram: @blueprintnotebooks

Twitter: @Blueprintnotes

Facebook: @Blueprintnotebooks

story:
The Book

“Pathfinder” will be a high quality, hard cover,  60-75 page book dedicated to my son, Lonan and the community of friends and families that I’ve gained in my travels over the last five years.

The work featured in Pathfinder is a result of a mission to visually represent "authentic cultural aesthetics". I believe that sharing these images as a body of work, helps to fulfill another mission of mine which is to build bridges between people around the globe.

Many of the images in Pathfinder were created during my global travels between 2010-2015. The images portray scenes from 15 countries and over 30 cities.  




I'm personally designing and formatting the book which will contain high definition photos in both black and white and full color. Pathfinder will receive a limited run printing of 200 copies.

This campaign will finance the final printing and distribution of the book.

 The Residency

I have the pleasure of being Artist in Residence at the esteemed Le Porte Piente Art International Institute in Noyers, France.  The residency gives me the opportunity to not only do editing on the book but also studio and darkroom work as well as website design and social media.

A Community Collaboration

I've estimated that I need  $6,000 in order to format, print, and ship the Pathfinder.  This fund will be the only revenue for the creation of Pathfinder...every donation is an important part of the total project. 

-$4,500 for printing & shipping the magazine from the printer

-$400 for design/format

-$600 for the IndieGoGo fees + credit card processing fees

-$500 for perks and shipping of perks


Perks from my Archive:

Postcards:

Notebooks:



Prints: 8 x 10s on Archival Lustre Paper



Risks and challenges

Once funds are raised, I foresee no complications in printing this completed project in book form as editing and design are being finalized. The last phase is printing. October 2016 is target date for printing and mailing of final copies. If I don't reach my fundraising goal, the money raised will go towards releasing the book on a smaller limited run.

story:
Meet Jacques Nkinzingabo

Born 1994 ( One Week before the Genocide against Tutsi in Rwanda ), I lost my father when i was still a baby and my mother left me with my older brother at the age of five to look for a house We could stay in after loosing all we had before the Genocide. For Few Months, I lived the life of an orphan and Street kids at the same time until I met My Mom again. Even so, my mother didn’t have the means to support the family so I went to the streets looking for money and food by myself.

I stumbled upon photography in 2009, seven years into the art and I am glad that accidentally i found my passion, which has now become my career. Whose passion for photography came to me in a class assignment, My school director was looking for a student to help in capturing images around the school for some projects / Events.I found myself volunteering to do the job despite the fact that he knew nothing about the gadget I now held in awe.

I was only 15 at the time. Two years later, I was working for different websites and Newspapers in Kigali as a photojournalist- thanks to the accidental activity.

My motivation comes from telling the Rwandan story away from the stifling images and stories about the 1994 genocide against Tutsi, already in the mainstream media. On completing high school in 2013, I decided to engage fully in photography to change the perspective of Rwanda’s story.

Why Am I doing a Fund Campaign?

In 2014, Jacques equipped with phones and small cameras, he started teaching simple photography techniques to kids with disabilities in an orphanage. Soon after, the government found host families for the kids and the program came to an end.

In 2015, while working on one of my personal photo projects documenting the lives of ‘Marines’, (street kids based around the Nyabugogo bus station who are known for stealing phones at night) I realised they had the potential to document their own lives.

Whenever they could, they would grab my camera and take pictures of each other. They loved being around  me as the photographer and became very interested in the project. I felt the urge to start teaching them skills to give them the opportunity to show the world around them. Most classes were given at night, when the rest of Kigali was asleep.

I need your help to travel to Germany for the Exhibition and to make Learning for change Globally.

In May 2016, I invited by akume E.V (Association of African Arts Based in Ravensburg , Germany ) for presenting photos  from the workshop of the kids in Germany apart of The Night of Art Festival and continue this project with  kids in Germany as and We are looking forward to work with refugees in the future for this Project.

I’ve got money and Support to make our First Exhibition in Kigali on 08th September at Germany Culture Center in Kigali but I need your help to make our second exhibition in Germany.

We are looking for support of 2000 USD for my flight to Germany and other needs including Transport, Photo Printing + Framing for the Exhibition and Catalogues for the Exhibition.

What Is Learning For change?

Learning4change is an ongoing initiative where Jacques do photography-workshops with the street-kids of Kigali. Aims With Learning for Change is to offer activities and workshops for the homeless kids.

A Goal with learning4change is to create education activities, offer opportunities , give them a voice involve in continuous social engagement , improve their lives , to educate , self-sustainable and to empower Street kids and young people without opportunities.

So why such an interest in street kids?

‘Homeless children on the streets of Kigali have very limited chances to improve their lives’. Although I have never been a street kid as such for a longtime, I have my own experience on the streets and spending my time with street kids. Through this program I want to improve the situation of the kids through Photography activities, engagement and workshops because education brings development.

 

Learn more about Learning for Change : https://www.africanexponent.com/post/mentoring-rwandas-street-children-through-photography-2713

* http://trueafrica.co/picture_story/photographer-yakubu-helping-kigalis-street-kids-tell-stories/

story:
Short Summary

Being very passionate about Love Live, i've decided to make a fanzine to give back to the community! Love live school idol festival is something that makes me, and many other fans very happy. It's something that helps me get through days by listening to their amazing music, and it's time to give back!

What We Need & What You Get

Breakdown!

  • The funds are going towards printing the actual zine aswell as printing stickers + keychains for deluxe orders and for backers!
  • No matter if we reach the goal or not, we will try our best to pay for everything through orders. This just means less pay for the artists! Please think of them <3

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Why This Project?

I've been making artist books and prints for over fifteen years. Finally, I'm gathering the tools and equipment I need to have a fully functional home studio. It's been a dream of mine to run a small printing business, and this project is a way for me to come one step closer to making that a reality. 

I like making affordable, functional art. I love to send postcards, make tiny books to send through the mail, and create handmade books that people can fill with their own ideas and creative pursuits. I like adding a little joy and beauty into life wherever I can. Your contributions to this campaign will help me get rolling and create more of the little things that make me happy—and hopefully they'll make you and your friends happy, too!

I'm extremely grateful for your contributions, no matter the size. Your support means you believe in me and believe in art, and believe it has an important place in our lives. 

Pictured above: a model of what the finished calendar will look like. Colors may vary slightly in the final product. 

Your Support + Perks

Your contributions will help me get the tools I need to get this studio running:

  • Metal typefaces ($150 for one typeface to get me going). This is a huge benefit. Without type, I have to have special polymer plates made to print text, and that's a big expense. If I don't intend to use the plates again, it's quite wasteful. But metal type can be reused over and over, for years. Plus, it's at the heart of letterpress printing.
  • Wood type ($150-250). This is hard to come by, and fairly expensive. It's hard to find complete sets that are in good condition, but I've finally found a good source. I use wood type for posters, for books, and sometimes for image making. A good wood face will last a lifetime. 
  • Drying rack for prints ($135-150). Have you ever lived with a printmaker who has no drying rack? I confess, I've had to string up clotheslines in my living room before, just so I could hang an edition of prints to dry. A tower-style rack will be a big improvement–and preserve the integrity of the prints (and save me from those embarrassing moments when I forget the line is strung up).
  • Various tools for the press and bindery ($250-400): A book press, book weights, a roller gauge, a type high gauge, spacing material for typesetting, leading, and registration guides. These are things I've been making do without, but to finally be able to purchase them will make printing much more efficient and allow me to work on a larger scale.
  • Your contributions also cover the cost of this project: materials like cover stock for the calendar, paper for the books, book covers, binder's board, book cloth, cover stock for cards, envelopes, ink, linoleum blocks, the photopolymer plate needed for printing the calendar text, and postage for the mailing of all perks. 

The photos you see on this page are works in progress (check out the image gallery for more). At this stage, I've created a digital proof of the calendar so that I can create that fancy printing plate with the calendar text, and used the two blocks I've proofed to serve as a map of what the finished image might look like. Now that I have printer's proofs, I can go back and carve a little more from the blocks to get them just right for the final image. What you see pictured is an early artist's proof. The final image will be much more refined.  

Note: Any funds that exceed the goal will help me get more printing gadgets on my wish list, allow me to create more work, and help me with the cost of starting a business. And YES there will be stretch goals. First up: when I reach the first goal of $1500, I'll design a bookplate and send every supporter a set of 15. 

Pictured below: the model I've made of the 4.5" x 6" size handmade book. 

 

And now for the best part—the Perks: 

  • The bird lover's 12" x 19" wall calendar for 2017. It's 100% letterpress printed with love, and designed so that at the end of the year, you can trim off the calendar and still have the multi-color print ready to frame and enjoy for years to come. The bird image itself is 8" x 10". Printed on heavy stock from the French Paper Company in Niles, Michigan. Each calendar is signed and numbered.  
  • A handmade book that features a cover made from the bird print. Use it as a journal or a sketchbook. Size is approximately 4.5" x 6", so you can easily take it anywhere when you travel. It's hardbound with book cloth and high quality paper, hand-sewn by me. Approx. 160-180 pages for you to fill. Everybody needs a beautiful book to fill with their thoughts. This one is durable enough to last you a long time. 
  • Set of greeting cards. These will also be letterpress printed, with designs similar to the birds on the calendar. I'll create two designs and send you a set of six cards with matching envelopes that you can share with your friends. 

The best part? I'll ship by December 17, so you can give these items away as gifts! (I can only guarantee Christmas delivery to US addresses.)

 

Risks & Challenges

It takes time and commitment to complete letterpress projects. A calendar can be a tricky thing, but I've been wanting to do one for a long time. I design complex letterpress projects by nature, and I always finish them. You can see some of my artist books on my website and see more of what I do. My artist books are held in a number of special collections libraries here in the states (the Library of Congress, Duke University, Washington University, and Vanderbilt, just to name a few), and I've been fortunate to have my work in some libraries and galleries overseas as well. 

Letterpress printing is a slow, sometimes rigorous process, but the beauty of the printed page makes it its own reward. I've done one other crowd-funded project (in 2011), which allowed me to travel to New Mexico and Texas and create an artist book based on historic places I found that were being salvaged in a way that benefitted the surrounding communities. That project was funded beyond its goal and was completed on time—I'm super grateful to all of its backers, who helped me find some truly inspiring people and places during that time. That book was a ton of fun to make, and I wouldn't have made it if it wasn't for all of my supporters. 

I'm one of those people who likes a good challenge. Plus, I'm an Aries. We never give up.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to contribute in other ways? Sharing this project with your friends helps me more than you know. I'm a little bit of a hermit, and my social circles aren't the widest. You can play a HUGE part by using your powers of social media to tell everyone you know about this project. I'll send you warm happy thoughts as you do this, and will think of you fondly as I'm printing. Happy thoughts bring good printing mojo. 

Thanks for checking out my project! Let's do this.

story:
My Story... 

 

About Private Valentine's Brunch Experience

I am launching my personal chef and catering company with this private brunch experience. This is a great opportunity to display my experience, skills to notable Tallahassee residents (entertainers, civic leaders, professional athletes and etc.). I have worked many of brunch, catering events along with chef tables with top chefs in Florida. Also cooked for all type of people from the Mayors to top athletes. 

This will be my own personal event that I will be hosting for four well-known couples that are looking to enjoy a romantic brunch event experience suit for a king and queen. 

My goal is to amaze each couple from start to finish with amazing drinks, fruits display, phenomenal food and service that leaves everyone marveled for the next event. Most importantly; I will capture every aspect of this event to help market and promote the next event to come. 

 

Why I Need You...

I am hoping that IndieGoGo will be a great way to raise the extra needed to complete the funding needed for this terrific event that I am putting together for guest, who can help take this company to the next level. 

Your contribution will help to fund cooking equipment, purchase food in advance. Funding will also be needed to pay a few experienced and qualified staff members to assist with preparing food, service of brunch event to keep guests happy, which is an important part of this event. 

I have half of the funding needed for the event, and hoping to obtain the remainder from supporters. 

 Private Valentine's Brunch Event Budget - Estimated $1,500.00

  • Food & Drinks for 8 People - $450.00 
  • Food Equipment (Waffle Iron, Outdoor Deep Fryer, Warmers and etc. - $200.00 
  • Valentine Decorations - $150.00
  • Staff (Professional Cooks, Servers) - $250.00
  • Professional Film Production - $200.00 
  • Rental Faculty - $300.00

Those who contribute will be recognized, and kept up-to-date on the event as it happens. Contribute at higher levels, and you'll be able to have your own private and exclusive event hosted by Chef Marcus. 

Anything over my initial goal will go towards the next private dinner and brunch event this year. My goal is to offer private brunches and dinners in major cities around the United States for anyone looking for amazing food and experience. Along with becoming a private chef for athletes, entertainers, lawmakers and/or anyone looking to have daily meals prepared fresh for them, their family or even their guest. 

 

Risk & Challenges 

Above & Beyond faces many of the same challenges as other new small businesses. From developing a marketing plan and a list of loyal clients to keeping up on paperwork ad filing taxes properly, I have learned from others but I'm learning as I go, and while it is a steep learning curve, I already have much experience and the necessary skills. 

Additionally, in comparison to most other small business start-ups this project is low-risk. With a small start-up cost an low monthly overhead, I can take my time growing a loyal client base and learning to do things better. Surely, I will make mistakes, but I'm try to keep them small.

story:
The Order Anisoptera

Resilience, metamorphosis......a talent that lay dormant.....a spanner in the works that causes me to rethink how I live and begin to paint again. 

  • My name is Samantha Rochard, and I live in Trinidad and Tobago. I am attempting to kick-start a second career, using my artistic talent, to allow me to work with health limitations that I have (don't want to get into that much)
  • With the help of this campaign funding, I hope to create a series of Dragonfly Paintings, to hold a second solo exhibition (my first was in 2006).   In addition, these images would be used to create motivational merchandise. This would be step one.
  • Your assistance in funding will go to the purchase of material to create the paintings, and cover minimal expenses while I do so. From the sale of these, I hope to be able to create motivational merchandise to encourage persons to live their dream.

 

Buy me a cup of coffee or more

Not sure where you live, but a cup of fancy shmancy coffee in my country is about US$4. Buy me a cup (not that I drink coffee), but each cup can afford me a new canvas.

  • My target is US$4000, enough for canvas, paints, brushes to create 30 paintings, and handle expenses and marketing that come with an exhibition. It would also go toward some living expenses while I create. You will be able to follow my creative process on Facebook or samantharochard.blogspot.com or Instagram.
  • This will also enable me to continue my Friday Finders Keepers Art Drop (persons hunt for a free 5" x 4" painting), and begin sending "awards" to individuals on the island who make significant community contributions, with little acknowledgement. (a little motivational gift for them to keep focusing on their dream)
  • Even if I do not reach my entire goal, the completion of less paintings, and group shows are always possible. Or I can begin the process of creating merchandise from the images completed. The Friday Finders Keepers will continue as long as I can.
  • Contributors of a certain amount will be sent a gift (a small painting)
  • Your contribution will kickstart a cycle for me to continue showing every year, and to build a moderate art career which will allow me to continue working sustainably.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help:

  • Share this, or my blog on your facebook page.
  • Join Samantha Rochard Art and share with your art loving friends
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

This will also enable me to continue my Friday Finders Keepers Art Drop (persons hunt for a free 5" x 4" painting), and begin sending "awards" to individuals on the island who make significant community contributions, with little acknowledgement. (a little motivational gift for them to keep focusing on their dream)
Even if I do not reach my entire goal, the completion of less paintings, and group shows are always possible. Or I can begin the process of creating merchandise from the images completed. The Friday Finders Keepers will continue as long as I can.
Contributors of a certain amount will be sent a gift (a small painting)
Your contribution will kickstart a cycle for me to continue showing every year, and to build a moderate art career which will allow me to continue working sustainably.

 
Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute, you can still help:

Share this, or my blog on your facebook page.
Join Samantha Rochard Art and share with your art loving friends
Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Painting the Mandala of

the Medicine Buddha

My name is Fred van der Zee and I am a digital thangka painter

A thangka is a Buddhist scroll painting depicting various deities, Buddhist teachers and other figures; they are used in Buddhist teachings and practice.
I base my work on centuries-old measurements and painting techniques, but my thangkas come with a twist: they are entirely done digitally.
My craft is taught to me by Andy Weber, a renowned thangka painter, who has been studying and teaching this art form worldwide for over 40 years.
Since 2008 I have been on a quest to balance tradition with modern artistic insights, while retaining the Buddhist spiritual strengths. And – of course – the end result should be pleasing to the eye.

Since the beginning I have been struggling to squeeze my painting hours into my full-time job and my private life. Last year it became inevitable that I had to make a choice: if I wanted myself and my talent to flourish, I had to sever the ties to my current life and dedicate my life entirely to digital thangka painting.

So, in the upcoming three years I will draw the Mandala of the Medicine Buddha with 53 separate highly detailed figures. Your financial support will not only make this possible, but also help in founding the Digital Thangka Art School and starting the Digital Thangka Art Fund.

By contributing to my campaign you will help me create beautiful digital thangkas, pass my knowledge to others and supply financial support to aspiring digital thangka artists all over the world.
Speaking of which: I will train a little guild of talented and dedicated students to assist me painting the Mandala and associated figures.

On a final note: you also will create good karma by supporting the teachings of the Buddha, both for you as well for many others.

 

 

My needs

I need funding for a three-year period. I will chip in most of my savings but I still need some minimum wage to live from. The lovely people of Tushita, Spain have invited me to become their resident thangka painter. I can stay in their beautiful meditation center, combining painting with volunteering work. I am looking for other centers around the world who can offer me the same refuge, where I can paint and teach.
Still, I will need a fair amount: for day-to-day living, paying insurances and taxes, travel expenses, educational material for the Art School. I also will keep supporting my youngest daughter, who is halfway her university study Biology. Lastly, I will use the money to support my little guild of students, if needed.

Thus, my campaign goal is based on the Dutch lowest state allowance of € 1.026,35 per month. So I am aiming at 3 x 12 x 1.026,35 = € 36.948,60, rounded off at € 36.900.
Keep in mind that indiegogo, banks, credit card companies and of course my printer will also take their cut!

Payment methods other than credit card

Indiegogo currently only supports credit card payments. If you like to support me through another channel, such as a bank transfer or paypal,  please first visit the Alternative Payment Method page on my website.

You can also contact me through info@digitalthangka.com

You donated more money than my goal!

All funds in access of my crowd fund goal will be added to the Digital Thangka Art Fund.
Some examples to get a grant from the Art Fund include: paying rent for a course accommodation, temporary renting of equipment (such as laptops or beamers), expenses for travel and stay, software licenses.

 

Your perks

Now for the happy part! These are the perks your contribution will get you.

I have set the minimum contribution for my campaign at € 5.

Everyone who participates in my campaign will receive a high resolution digital image of the Mandala of the Medicine Buddha and 53 highly detailed images of the mandala figures. I draw the Mandala at a size of 150 x 150 cm, and the associated images on a size of A1 (594 x 841 mm).

A complete list of all the images can be found on my website's crowd funding page.

I will finish an image approximately every month and distribute it to all contributors. The Mandala and the Art Box will be sent after the three-year period.

All other perks involve prints: these are museum quality fine art prints on acid free archival paper, also known as giclée prints.

The following perks will be available:

Everyone from € 5 up, will get all the images in a high-resolution, digital form.

For € 50 you will receive a 353 x 500 mm print of the 7 Medicine Buddhas.
For € 100: a 500 x 707 mm giclée print of the 7 Medicine Buddhas.
For € 150: a 75 x 75 cm giclée print of the Mandala of the Medicine Buddha.
For € 500: a 150 x 150 cm giclée print of the Mandala of the Medicine Buddha.
For € 650 you get the following package: one print of the Mandala of the Medicine Buddha 150 x 150 cm, one 500 x 707 mm print of the 7 Medicine Buddhas in circle formation, one 500 x 707 mm print of the 7 Medicine Buddhas as a tower (on top of each other)

The last one is a very special perk: for € 4,500 you will get a 150 x 150 cm giclée print of the Mandala of the Medicine Buddha plus an Art Box , containing all images on 420 x 594 mm, including the 2 images of 7 Medicine Buddhas.
Every Art Box contains a numbered and signed certificate, and an overview and explanation of the figures.
This is a Limited Collectors Edition: a maximum of 21 boxes will be produced.

As a reminder: everyone gets digital images of the Mandala and the associated figures.

One note about printing the images yourself: yes, you can. You can even sell them if you like, on one condition: you may not change the image. So you may not add text, combine them with other figures, cut off parts of the images et cetera. Adding a reference and maybe a donation to the artist will be appreciated!

 

You make an impact!

Thangka painting is an ancient art, dating back to the 11th century. In contrast, digital thangka painting is a very young discipline, dating back less than a decade. There is still a fair lot of experimentation, not only in painting techniques but also in balancing old views with new possibilities. By contributing to my campaign you will parttake in that development and see it unfold before your eyes.

You will also be helpful in another way: I have 35 years of experience in computer graphics and some 10 years in education. Your contribution will be a valuable help to set up the Digital Thangka Art School, so I can transfer my knowledge and dedication to a new generation of digital thangka painters.

 

Organizing the project

I am setting up a little guild of students not only because I like to have a few people around, but also to make sure work on the Mandala will proceed in a timely matter. Of course I will have the final responsibility for the artistic and iconographic quality of the images, but my most talented students will assist me.

The accumulated funds from my campaign will be put on a bank account, that is monitored by a small ‘board’ to ensure that the money is well spend and that there is a controllable cash flow.
A concise financial report will be aggregated every 6 months.

 

Other ways you can support my campaign

Next to giving donations, there is one other thing you can do: share my campaign!

Share it with friends, on Facebook, tweet about it, like my video on youtube. Don’t forget about the sharing tools on indiegogo itself!

Whatever you do, you will have my gratitude!

story:
What are we?

         This project was created to support a small, veteran owned business, highlighting their custom product, and show off the beauty of a strong, female presence (in the midst of dinosaur attacks and the zombie apocalypse of course!). Each person, including the business owners, models and photographer, have overcome great obstacles in life, and this project is a reflection of that strength and success.

The Impact

          Supporting this campaign, purchasing a calendar or otherwise, isn’t just buying a product…..it’s supporting a dream. It’s supporting the idea that challenges are not the end and overcoming obstacles in life creates resilience.  It’s supporting the belief and hope that something new and great can arise from the ashes.

         This highlighted small business was created almost 2 years ago by a veteran Nathan Wright and his wife Katie Wright with Cystic Fibrosis who had undergone a double lung transplant the year prior. Since then, they have devoted their time and effort to build a business, and more importantly, a life, together. This fun, creative calendar is just one way to engage every avenue possible!

         Funds from this campaign will allow this small business to grow and become increasingly well-know in their field.  One avenue this funding will be utilized for is attending large trade shows in order to develop new business partnerships. These relationships will ultimately pass  many benefits along to customers through increased product availablity and improved custom product.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

          The best thing is that this project is already completed! There is no risk to you; it was an idea that began 9 months ago and many people have worked hard to bring it into reality. As a result, everyone who purchases a calendar will receive one, regardless if 1 or all 1500+ are sold! I repeat, everyone who orders a calendar WILL receive one! This creates a great, guaranteed opportunity to own an original, creative calendar and support small businesses in the process.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

            We are greatly appreciative of any and all help! If you aren’t interested in a calendar and would just like to support this effort, thank you, and please feel free to do so by spreading the word about this awesome campaign or offering a smaller perk listed.

story:
Hello, We are a class of 40 split between Photography in the Arts and Photojournalism at the Swansea College of Art, University of Wales Trinity Saint David.
For our final year in university, we have come together to fundraise for our exhibitions in Swansea and London in 2016.


For these shows to go ahead, we need to raise £8,000 to have a professional quality show. For this, we will be creating a high quality catalog to present at the shows, we also will be hiring venues and printing and mounting at a professional standard. 


It's very important for us to show our work in Swansea and London as it will be our last exhibition within the university. This will give us the opportunity to exhibit work professionally in the art world, this will also help us gain clientele and gain promotion for ourselves and the university. 


We will be hosting local events and selling work to help raise the money but through creating this page it will benefit us greatly. 
Given a chance to create these exhibitions, we will be able to show our talent and hopefully grow connections within the artistic community.


Any donations greatly appreciated

Thank you,
Third year Photography in the Arts and Photojournalism students

story:
As some of our most loyalist clients may know, this has been a long journey at the Petro Truck Stop Tattoo Shop, in Atlanta, GA. The opportunity has finally come for us artists, who have dedicated so much passion and energy into our craft, to take on new ownership of the shop and bring it back into the artistic direction it's capable of. We are asking for donations of any kind, to make this a quick and smooth transition. Every donation of $20.00 and above will automatically be enrolled in a RAFFLE for a FREE TATTOO, of up to $500, by the winners artist of choice, Smoke, Renegade, or Savere!!! We appreciate your loyalty to us through out the years, be it one tattoo or many, illustrations, airbrushing, logos, or henna services, you are the reason we value our shop and look foward to continuing to service you for many more years to come. Thank you for all your help and support. Please feel free to spread the word and share the link.

For more of our work:

Renegade:

www.instagram.com/renegade_sn

www.facebook.com/larenegada

http://m.facebook.com/artista.larenegada

Smoke:

www.instagram.com/thaoneandonlysmokewun

www.facebook.com/smokewunzartz

Savere:

Www.instagram.com/saverizm

 www.facebook.com/saverethaoneandonly

*Raffle drawing will take place on Sat. Dec. 5th, 2015.  Check up and follow us at

www.OfPureSeed.weebly.com

story:
(Se volete leggere il progetto in italiano, seguite questo link: italian)

The project

Hello there! 

I'm Sally Viganò, and I'm an artist based in Milano. I usually employ printmaking and glass sculpture techniques for my works and one of my project has been selected by PILOTENKUECHE, in Leipzig (Germany), to be developed during an artist-in-residence program! During this 4 months, from June to September 2016, I will focus upon addictions, especially on gambling and electronic devices addiction.  I'd like to use especially printmaking in order to build installations made of small duplicate pieces. This experience in Leipzig will be an amazing chance for me to develop my artistic research in a real professional way! PILOTENCKUECHE is offering me a collaborative space in which to work, access to research communities, technical assistance and so on. 

It is a chance to share ideas, to discuss my work with other specialist, testing the soundness of my artistic projects and its results in an international context. But it will also means living in an other country for four months, working in a rented studio, so I need YOUR help and support, in order to make this chance real! 

What I need 

I would like to raise 2000 € in order to cover: 

  • 100% of the cost of the residency (1500 €) 
  • Part of a low-maintenance room in Leipzig for four months, which is not included in the residency fee. 
Funds raised beyond my goal will be used to fund: 
  • 100% of the cost of the room 
  • Part of art materials I need to realize the new pieces, such as paper, ink and plates for engraving
I will be very very happy and extremely grateful!

My artistic research

The brain and its structure is the most important element in my research. Printmaking, glass sculpture and installation are my favourite techniques and I use them in order to make the brittleness of the mind visible and to investigate the thin border between reason and no-reason, ordinary routine and obsession. 

In particular, I’m meditating on the concept of ‘connectome’, as studied by the neuroscientist Sebastian Seung (if you want you can see a TED conference about it on YouTube!). His slogan is ‘I am my connectome!’. Our identity and our way of being are influenced by our connectome, the network created by the synapsis we all have inside our brains...

But what happen if this connectome is broken? What if connections doesn’t work anymore? What when our gestures becomes automatic, detached from our reason?

Well… I try to make all of these questions visible, studying the moment in which our mind isn’t ‘connected’ anymore.

My goals in Leipzig

During my time in Leipzig, I’d like to take my reaserch to the next step: the concept of addiction. I’ll study the effects that an obsession could have inside our brains, if there are any, and the addictions’ expression through gestures. Installations like Tutto perso or Touch introduce these themes, but being involved in a residency program could give me the change to develop them in a stronger way. 

The main goal will be create realistic 'installation-places' in which one could lose himself, made from small engraved pieces combines together.

The first month would be committed to study gambling and devices addictions through their compulsive gestures, both theoretically and visually. I would like to discuss the theme with other artists-in-residence in order to enlarge printmaking at other media and create a complete work.

During the second month I’d like to test my data, taking advantages of PILOTENKUECHE studios. I would like to experience other printmaking methods, trying to use them in a unconventional way, such as installations instead of traditional drawings in order to create links between different languages.

The third month will be devoted to get the real work done.

Eventually, the fourth month will be focused on the final group exhibition. This moment will be the main one, in which all the works will be shown and judged. 

Why at PILOTENKUECHE?

Because this residence will allow me to work on the concept within an international context! As a Pilot working in this vibrant community I will be able to  discuss my research with other specialists, discussing  addictions also from a social point of view! The residence is a real studio project with special focus on groups dynamic and provides the participants in experimenting with new forms of cooperation in order to improve and expand an independent and strong research. 

Risks & Challenges

PILOTENKUECHE has already accepted my project and I have an actual contract with theme. They guarantee to involve me as an artist in many exhibitions during the residence, actively promoting my work. The final event of the residence will be a big group exhibition, with galleries and museums involved in it.

I’ll take this residency as a real work, a sort of “internship”, which is essential to pursue my carrier, so I guarantee for my commitment and for PILOTENKUECHE as well. I feel confident that my project will be successful and don’t foresee any setbacks. I know that there are many risks and challenges for you. All I can do now is to show you my passion and my work as a guarantee, saying again that my purpose is to became a real self-employed artist.

What You Get!

Please know that even the smallest contribution makes a big difference for me! 

Here you can see some perks that I made for your kind donation:

Thank you! 

For donations from 1€ to 9 €: thank you! I will send you by e-mail my sincere gratitude for believing in my project.Your name will be listed on my Leipzig-blog page and you'll receive personally the link-page via email to follow my experience in Leipzig.

Engraving cards

For a donation of 10 €: you'll be rewarded with an awesome personalized engraving card (10X15 cm, 2 cards if your donation will be 20 €, 3 if it will be 30 € and so on.....) On the back there will be my sincerely thanks to your donation and my blog-link page to follow my experience in Leipzig. 

Also, Your name will be listed in the contributors pages on my blog. 

Cards collection + small sculpture

For a donation of 50 €: you’ll get the complete collection of engraving cards and a small plaster sculpture. The latter is a duplicate of an installation that was shown in Merano (Italy) in 2013. You can learn more about it at this link: soap sculptures

Your name will be listed in the contributors page on my blog.

Limited edition engravings

If you are so kind to donate 100 € I'll send you a limited edition engraving I did during my studies (2014). You can choose your favorite one from my portfolio at this link: etching portfolio . Email me with the number of the piece you want (sally.vigano@gmail.com).

Your name will be listed on my website as a collector!

Art pieces

For donations from 300 € and beyond I give you the opportunity to get a unique art pieces. In this case you’re great and I really love you!!! If you donate 300 € you can get "Brains" diptych (picture 1); if your contribution is 400€ you can get "Fette di me" (picture 2); if you donate 500 € I'll send you "Cranio (frontale&laterale)" (picture 3); if you donate 800 € you can get "Testa" (picture 4); lastly, if you donate 1000 € I'll send you "What a Pain in My Brain", a glass work entirely crafted in Murano, Venice (picture 5). 

Your name will appear at the top of the collector's list on my website!!


picture 1

picture 2

picture 3

picture 4

picture 5



Make some noise! 

If you can't donate, please spread the word! Even the smallest help I get from you means a lot. I appreciate your help and support in every kind and shape!

Thank you again and again and again!!
