It is a chance to share ideas, to discuss my work with other specialist, testing the soundness of my artistic projects and its results in an international context. But it will also means living in an other country for four months, working in a rented studio, so I need YOUR help and support, in order to make this chance real! 
What I need 
 

I would like to raise 2000 € in order to cover: 



100% of the cost of the residency (1500 €) 


Part of a low-maintenance room in Leipzig for four months, which is not included in the residency fee. 

Funds raised beyond my goal will be used to fund: 

100% of the cost of the room 
Part of art materials I need to realize the new pieces, such as paper, ink and plates for engraving

I will be very very happy and extremely grateful!

My artistic research
 
The brain and its structure is the most important element in my research. Printmaking, glass sculpture and installation are my favourite techniques and I use them in order to make the brittleness of the mind visible and to investigate the thin border between reason and no-reason, ordinary routine and obsession. 



In particular, I’m meditating on the concept of ‘connectome’, as studied by the neuroscientist Sebastian Seung (if you want you can see a TED conference about it on YouTube!). His slogan is ‘I am my connectome!’. Our identity and our way of being are influenced by our connectome, the network created by the synapsis we all have inside our brains...
But what happen if this connectome is broken? What if connections doesn’t work anymore? What when our gestures becomes automatic, detached from our reason?
Well… I try to make all of these questions visible, studying the moment in which our mind isn’t ‘connected’ anymore.




My goals in Leipzig

During my time in Leipzig, I’d like to take my reaserch to the next step: the concept of addiction. I’ll study the effects that an obsession could have inside our brains, if there are any, and the addictions’ expression through gestures. Installations like Tutto perso or Touch introduce these themes, but being involved in a residency program could give me the change to develop them in a stronger way. 


The main goal will be create realistic 'installation-places' in which one could lose himself, made from small engraved pieces combines together.

The first month would be committed to study gambling and devices addictions through their compulsive gestures, both theoretically and visually. I would like to discuss the theme with other artists-in-residence in order to enlarge printmaking at other media and create a complete work.
During the second month I’d like to test my data, taking advantages of PILOTENKUECHE studios. I would like to experience other printmaking methods, trying to use them in a unconventional way, such as installations instead of traditional drawings in order to create links between different languages.
The third month will be devoted to get the real work done.
Eventually, the fourth month will be focused on the final group exhibition. This moment will be the main one, in which all the works will be shown and judged. 

Why at PILOTENKUECHE?
Because this residence will allow me to work on the concept within an international context! As a Pilot working in this vibrant community I will be able to  discuss my research with other specialists, discussing  addictions also from a social point of view! The residence is a real studio project with special focus on groups dynamic and provides the participants in experimenting with new forms of cooperation in order to improve and expand an independent and strong research. 







Risks & Challenges
  
PILOTENKUECHE has already accepted my project and I have an actual contract with theme. They guarantee to involve me as an artist in many exhibitions during the residence, actively promoting my work. The final event of the residence will be a big group exhibition, with galleries and museums involved in it.
I’ll take this residency as a real work, a sort of “internship”, which is essential to pursue my carrier, so I guarantee for my commitment and for PILOTENKUECHE as well. I feel confident that my project will be successful and don’t foresee any setbacks. I know that there are many risks and challenges for you. All I can do now is to show you my passion and my work as a guarantee, saying again that my purpose is to became a real self-employed artist.   What You Get!
Please know that even the smallest contribution makes a big difference for me! 
Here you can see some perks that I made for your kind donation:

Thank you! 
For donations from 1€ to 9 €: thank you! I will send you by e-mail my sincere gratitude for believing in my project.Your name will be listed on my Leipzig-blog page and you'll receive personally the link-page via email to follow my experience in Leipzig.


Engraving cards
For a donation of 10 €: you'll be rewarded with an awesome personalized engraving card (10X15 cm, 2 cards if your donation will be 20 €, 3 if it will be 30 € and so on.....) On the back there will be my sincerely thanks to your donation and my blog-link page to follow my experience in Leipzig. 
Also, Your name will be listed in the contributors pages on my blog. 



Cards collection + small sculpture
For a donation of 50 €: you’ll get the complete collection of engraving cards and a small plaster sculpture. The latter is a duplicate of an installation that was shown in Merano (Italy) in 2013. You can learn more about it at this link: soap sculptures
Your name will be listed in the contributors page on my blog.


Limited edition engravings
If you are so kind to donate 100 € I'll send you a limited edition engraving I did during my studies (2014). You can choose your favorite one from my portfolio at this link: etching portfolio  . Email me with the number of the piece you want (sally.vigano@gmail.com).
Your name will be listed on my website as a collector!


Art pieces
For donations from 300 € and beyond I give you the opportunity to get a unique art pieces. In this case you’re great and I really love you!!! If you donate 300 € you can get "Brains" diptych (picture 1); if your contribution is 400€ you can get "Fette di me" (picture 2); if you donate 500 € I'll send you "Cranio (frontale&laterale)" (picture 3); if you donate 800 € you can get "Testa" (picture 4); lastly, if you donate 1000 € I'll send you "What a Pain in My Brain", a glass work entirely crafted in Murano, Venice (picture 5). 
Your name will appear at the top of the collector's list on my website!!

picture 1

picture 2

picture 3

picture 4

picture 5


Make some noise! 
If you can't donate, please spread the word! Even the smallest help I get from you means a lot. I appreciate your help and support in every kind and shape!
Thank you again and again and again!!

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Kyle Reynolds. I am a life long dog lover. Dogs have been a part of my life since my childhood. I have been a professional photographer for 10+ years. I found the perfect marriage between my love of dogs and my passion for photography. It started at home watching and photographing my own dogs. We currently have five dogs our own at home three of which we rescued from shelters. We also have fostered rescue dogs at our home through various organizations and we currently have one foster at home with us now.
  • Dogs quickly became one of my most frequent subjects for my photography. Over the last several years I discovered I can use my photography to help dogs in shelters. I started photographing dogs our local shelter in 2011 and has take in over 7000 and photos of dogs since then. I donate my time and photographs to the shelter for them to use in their social media in any other publication or promotions they used to advocate for the dogs that are available for adoption. 
  • I have been reaching out to other shelters nearby to see if I can also work with them to use my photography skills to help the dogs at their shelters as well. For a while now I've been searching for a way use my photography to bring more attention to shelter dogs and help promote adoptions and I think this project is a great step in that direction.
  • This project is the best of both worlds for me and brings together arts and animals. This project demonstrates how our can be much more than just something nice to look at it can be something meaningful that has impact on the lives of other living beings in this case the dogs that resided our local shelter. For this project I will work with our local shelter the Chemung County Humane Society and SPCA to photograph the dogs that reside there and then I will select photographs of 10 different dogs to be made and large 20 x 30 prints which will be framed and hung in partnership with the Chemung County Historical Society and put on display as an art exhibit in their museum. 
  • Visitors to the Chemung County historical Society will be able to see the display and will even be able to contribute to the exhibit because they will have the opportunity to write notes or submit photographs by placing them in drop boxes that will be installed with the photograph displays and then those notes and photographs will be on along with the framed artwork that I provide. 
  • This project is so important to me because while I love dogs of any kind there is nothing like impact you can have on a dog's life by being involved with shelter dogs. Shelter dogs often end up at local shelters for reasons that are completely beyond their control and they don't know why they are there or know what may come next for them. If this project can inspire just one person to take some time to go to the local shelter either in our community or where they're from and take a my their day to interact with the shelter dogs and visit them and give them a few moments of happiness that they might not otherwise have or maybe even meet a shelter dog and adopt and take one home then this project will have exceeded my to hopes and dreams for it. 
  • Contributors to this project will help me achieve something that I believe is truly great. It will help spread the word of shelter dogs to the wider public. The support of everyone out there will help me use my artwork in a way I have been able to before and move beyond only sharing photographs of shelter dogs online to having a display that will be open to the public where people can see it up close and personal and get a real sense of knowing these dogs. Hopefully being eligible interact with these images of dogs in this way will inspire people to become more involved in their of local shelters and help these dogs who need them.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The total cost of this project will be $3200. The costs of the project will go into time spent working with the dogs and photographing them at the shelter, reviewing photography, selecting and editing photographs, making decisions on what photograph will be printed delivering photographs for framing, developing material for promotion of the exhibits, costs of advertising the exhibit, travel, and supplies such as the photograph prints themselves, framing material and services, and construction of drop boxes for the exhibit.
  • There are great perks available for anyone who decides to contribute to this campaign. There will be digital downloads available in various sizes. There will be prints of various sizes available. There will be exclusive photographs that are not used in the exhibit available that only contributors will have access to. The framed 20 x 30 prints will be available for contributors after the exhibit has completed its run. 

  • If the project is only partially funded then expenses for the exhibit will be reduced by cutting back each area of expenditures by the percentage not received to fully fund the exhibit. Cuts will be made in a way to avoid changing the exhibit itself if at all possible. If absolutely necessary the time spent photography dogs will be reduced to reflect the new level of funding, the number of prints produced and framed will also be reduced to reflect the new level of funding.

The Impact

  • I think one goal everybody has their lives is to make an impact on another person in this world. This project gives the contributors a chance to actually accomplish this goal. If you've ever wanted to have an impact on the lives of others this is a great chance to get involved. This exhibit which you will be a part of through your contributions has the potential to change the lives of the people who see it in the way that they view arts and in the way that they view dogs. This exhibit also has the opportunity to change the lives of the animals that exhibit represents. People who view the exhibit and the dogs exhibit is about have a real chance to make a real-world connection that can change the lives of each individual involved and you as a contributor to be the one to make that happen. 
  • I have been professional photographer for over 10 years. I have had pieces published in magazines and newspapers. I have had a gallery exhibits. I have sold individual photography pieces at galleries. I have provided services for individuals taking photographs of their dogs and provide them with prints.

Risks & Challenges

  • Photographing dogs can be challenging especially if you want to get high quality authentic photographs of dogs fortunately I have been a professional photographer for over 10 years and been involved in photography for 16 years and my experience photographing dogs has its roots in the very first photographs I took when I first began exporting photography. It's an even greater challenge and photographing dogs when you are specifically working with shelter dogs. I've been photographing shelter dog since 2011 in partnership with the Chemung County SPCA and that is the organization I also partnering with for this exhibit. 
  • Another big hurdle for this type of project can often be finding a space for the exhibit to be on display. Fortunately for me I have a commitment from Chemung County Historical Society for a space to have this display and they are donating this space to me for the length of the exhibit. The Chemung County historical Society is also partnering meet with me in making this project reality. So for the two biggest challenges that a project like this presents I am fortunate to be partnering with two great local agencies that are experts in their field and are going to support me in bringing this project our community.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • There are other ways you can contribute to this project other than just making a financial contribution. If you want to make an impact you can share this project using the sharing tools available on Indiegogo. If you like what you see please share it anyway you can online, in social media, on whatever platform you have available to you. You can share in your community. You can share it globally you can share it in traditional media in print. You can share with local groups and organizations that you think would be interested in a project like this. Share it with local museums, share it with local shelters, and share with local arts organizations. The power to make this project a success lies with each and every one of you who looks at his campaign and chooses to either contribute financially or through sharing it with other people you know and I appreciate everything you put into making this become reality.

story:
What is it?

The West End Effect is a decade long ‘action research’ project / durational performance, in which artists Darren 'Loki' McGarvey and Becci Wallace will investigate what living in a 'posh' area does to a person.  Among other things they will live in Glasgow's West End for at least a year at some point in the next decade to gain a true understanding of how this hostile environment affects people. 

What do they want to find out?

Darren and Becci will attempt to discover whether writing our own bios in third person is easy to detect.  They also hope to gain a deeper understanding of what exactly goes on in the minds of people who don't have to live under the daily threat of violence or the never-ending strain of economic insecurity.  

They want to find out how this kind of emotional freedom impacts upon child-rearing and whether growing up away from poverty leaves you somewhat detached from its harsh, visceral reality.

Ultimately, they wish to establish whether there is a correlation between being from an affluent area and developing an unintentional aloofness to the reality of poverty.

How will this actually work in reality?

They will present their shared experience/observations and findings throughout the years in the following ways:

A series of tedious books 

A tedious documentary 

A series of inoffensive and tedious musical albums which will be released exclusively as vapour featuring some of Scotland's most tedious artists

A series of educational workshops where Darren and Becci will insert themselves into other people's lives based on the assumption that they are superior and exclude anyone who disagrees through various forms of symbolic violence

A lucrative public speaking tour where we will outline our exclusive vision of a nation where what we say is automatically profound, self-certifying and true.  This will be followed by a tedious Q and A session

What are the outcomes?

By the end of the project we hope to report very little that people did not already know but also to have empowered ourselves on the backs of others.  We want to show any old shite can get funded as long as you are confident filling out complicated applications and maybe have a few pals that know someone on the judging panel (Or Fiona Hyslop's number)

£15,000 will provide us with one fifth of 50 percent of a deposit required to enter the housing market in this kind of exclusive area.  Alternatively we may just use it to pay for overheads such as: a car or a fact-finding mission in the south of France while we create the content.  

Once we find a location our lives will become an art exhibition for all to see.

Every penny you pledge will be re-invested back into the West End by way of small inconsequential purchases such as chai-lattes, cranberry and brie bagels and Buckfast Tonic Wine (which we will purchase ironically)

What you will get in exchange for your support is the satisfaction of knowing you are truly cultured.

story:
Qui je suis

Photographe amateur de 30 ans, je travaille essentiellement à l’argentique et je réalise des projets au gré de mes expériences, en toute indépendance. Mon projet sur les campagnes roumaines, né de différentes rencontres, a été mené entre 2014 et 2015 et se concrétise par la réalisation de cette exposition d’une douzaine de tirages.

Le projet

Issu de plusieurs voyages effectués en Roumanie pendant deux ans, ce projet est une fenêtre sur la vie dans les campagnes Roumaines, plus particulièrement dans la région du Maramures, où persistent les traditions et modes de vie d’une rare authenticité. Les photographies témoignent d’un quotidien qui peut paraître en décalage, voire en anachronisme, comparé aux pays d’Europe de l’ouest, mais la visée du projet est avant tout d’illustrer la beauté d’une région européenne en 2015, par son identité forte et ses traditions bien vivantes.

L’exposition

Aboutissement de deux années de travail, l’exposition sera composée de douze tirages réalisés sur papier fine art à partir de prises de vue noir et blanc argentiques. L’exposition aura lieu à partir du 18 décembre pour une durée de deux mois au centre socio-culturel « La Maison des Ensembles » à Paris (5 rue d’Aligre, 12è arrondissement). L’exposition sera ensuite amenée à circuler dans plusieurs autres lieux au cours de l’année 2016.

Financement

Jusqu’à présent autofinancé, j’ai décidé de faire appel au crowd-fundinng pour le développement de mon projet, afin d’assurer une exposition de qualité grâce à des tirages haut de gamme.

Ce financement vise donc à couvrir les frais de production de l’exposition : tirages, supports de présentation et de communication.

Selon le montant de votre participation, vous pourrez choisir de recevoir en remerciement un tirage signé en petit ou moyen format.

story:
After spending six years in the Navy as a photographer, I left the military skilled, proud and published. I burst on the scene with my portfolio and camera, excited to share my work with the world. What I found was an underground art scene that pulsed with passion but discouraged and fearful of rejection. Many would eventually toss their paint in the trash and settle for corporate America. What I wanted to provide was a playground for any artist, everywhere. Instead of fighting for gallery space, this just might be where the pipe cleaner sculptor from Tallahassee gets discovered!  

The funding I am asking for is for startup studio equipment, studio space, creating an online presence and store, business and accounting fees and photographic equipment.  

Art is everything. Be fearless and color wildly outside the lines.

Be fearless and color wildly outside the lines.

story:
Hello,

Thank you for taking a moment to visit this special campaign. My name is Amanda McLaughlin though my family and close friends call me Storm, a name my Great Grandfather gave me due to my apparent stubborn and head strong nature as a young girl. Today I am more like a gentle spring rain, yet my ambitions are stilI just as loud and rambunctious. I am a visual and performance artist by trade, event coordinator/producer and this year's Programming Producer for a wonderful East Coast Transformational Gathering named Return to Roots. 

A year ago a dear friend and fellow producer ask me to design a sacred temple for her gathering. That day she initiated a secret ambition I had always wished to develop. Due to funding, the design and concept lay sleeping on the pages of my journal until now. Here I am, putting my hopes out there in the great wide open. Here WE are, and I am asking for your participation at bringing this to life and manifesting it into physical form.  
By your generous donation, you are contributing to an intentional transformational sacred experience. My passion has always been providing safe spaces for others to explore their most true authentic selves. Complete support, without judgement, without limitations. I have been developing, volunteering for, and initiating gatherings and events which allow for others to discover for so long. It is time to expand and BUILD A sacred space I can bring to others. Everyone's journey is different. The Temple of Authentic Willful Expression symbolizes that journey and offers permission to discover.

The design is already off to the engineers who are also being inspired to embark on a new artistic endeavor which warms me right up! The magic of the Temple of A.W.E  is already alive and doing it's work! 

Now down to Business:

Your contribution will assist in materials, payment for collaborators and transporting the structure.

In return for your donation, I have some beautifully personalized perks to offer you.

ONE of my favorite PERKS is this structure will easily be able to be transported and shared. Meaning, once it exists YOU  may be able to use it for your own personal events! Gatherings, festivals, weddings, shows the possibilities are endless...I couldn't possibly keep this all to myself. I have designed it for the specific intention of sharing!  

Other Perks include Free Tickets and Discounts to Our Return to Roots Gathering, so that you may have the opportunity to experience your contribution. I am also excited to be offering a PERK of one of a kind, just for you painting specifically channeled with intention, tailored to a kindred prayer that is intimately yours to cherish for always, or as a future gift to a loved one! 

I can't wait to give back in all of these special ways as a means to express my gratitude for your help in making this sacred space come to fruition!

All extra funds will be contributed to experience necessary for bringing the Temple of A.W.E as an offering to next years Burning Man in Black Rock City Nevada, There is SO much to learn! I will be attending this year Producing Tedx Black Rock City's event. I am thrilled and cannot wait to hit the playa and connect with other installation artists! 

 I have high ambitions for developing this into a much, much larger and even more eloquent Art Installation in the future. Please help me take the first step manifesting this dream so that others may experience a sacred space to learn, play, trust and grow within.

 I inherited the name Storm for a reason....I am moving forward in full trust. However, I am also aware that with any dream comes a lesson and not all of those lessons are easy. I am confident I have an amazing team of support along side of me. Together we can do anything! Imagine the possibilities! 

And I cannot do it without you, all of you :)

story:
About Us

Once upon a time is a photography exhibition collaborated by a curator and two talented emerging fashion photographers whose works characterized by its "storytelling".

 

The Motivation

The function of photography is always defined as recording, and most of the audiences seem only notice the aesthetic perception of photography, especially fashion photography. We want to explore the possibility of fashion photography - when the model is no longer the main character, and through the medium of an exhibition, we want every series of the work could become fascinating stories and start to communicate with their viewers.

 

The Exhibition

We would like all our visitors to be able to read the stories inside works and bring meanings to the images by their understanding through the curatorial actives. We want to challenge the traditional photograph exhibiting method of displaying in a "white cube", and explore the new way of exhibiting photographies which can stimulate more interacts. For instance, to combine photography and films, and introduce the visual design run through the exhibition hall with the exhibits. 

 

We Need Your Help!

The image and art books printing are the main task in the preparation of our exhibition. We'd like to appreciate all the contribution you made so that we'll send you unique surroundings of our exhibition(please take a look at the right sight of the page of our rewards) in order to make sure everyone who attends has a memorable experience.

 

The Team

Artists

Chen Chen

Currently study master degree at the University of Art London. Chen use both digital and Polaroid to explore photography within fashion media. As an Image-maker, Chen utilises her abilities as both a photographer and art director. Her BA specialises in visual communication with a strong graphic design background. Her work uses extraordinary sensitivity with colour and composition, focusing on capturing the emotion behind the piece.

Her works: http://havefunchen.com/admin/​

Shu Yu

Shu Yu was born in Sichuan, China. He graduated in Sichuan Normal University BA directing and now is studying at London College of fashion BA Fashion Photography. He established his own photo studio during his four-year university life. His work has published on 1626, photo vogue, CNU. He collaborated with numbers of talented fashion design students in LCF, CSM, and Bunka. He also worked for fashion brands such as MINNANHUI, The autonomous collection. 

His works: http://yushuphotography.com/​

Curator

Carlie Chang

Carlie is studying Culture, Criticism and Curation at Central Saint Martins College. She worked in National Art Museum of China and now she is an independent curator based in London, her projects have been exhibited in venues such as Art Pavilion, Espacio Gallery etc. Exhibitions curated by her have been published in some leading media, including Sina News, Art China, PengPai News etc.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Financial help is not always possible,  but you can still support us by simply sharing this campaign page, your clicks really matters for us. And we welcome everyone who interests in our project to our exhibition, so please also share the exhibition information to your friends, and of course, do come to the exhibition if you would like to enjoy our arts! Many thanks and love.

 

Exhibition Visiting Information

Once Upon a Time

Tuesday 8th November - Saturday 12th November 2016

Opening Night: Tuesday 8th November 6pm - 9pm

Menier Gallery, 51 Southwark Street, London SE1 1RU

Free Adminsion

story:
Earthbound Mind Reaching...

You are invited to join me as I travel through India and begin to see the world through the lessons of the mystic east:

  • What is the earthbound mind
  • What stories are being unfolded in the India of today
  • What poems are springing up from the ancient soil/soul?

My book explores these questions and more through narrative accounts, poems and photography. 

Another theme is a listening and response to the 1910 publication Gitanjali by Rabindranath Tagore.  I purchased a copy on arrival in Varanasi and embarked on a stylistic study and meditation on this Nobel prize winning work.  Some attempts to emulate and honor this work are included in the book.

The book is READY!  (Ready to go to the printhouse)

This is where you come in.  This book will only exist because you want to see it. 

  • Tellwell publishing has offered me a great deal, for a 108 color pages book.  The initial costs for all set-up work and the first 100 copies will be $2000.
  • A copy (signed if you wish) for all those who help me bring this bright beautiful book into being
  • All funds will go towards the production of this book and the printing of more copies should there be funds for it.   Your support is greatly appreciated

story:
My dear family, friends, and fellow travelers… including those of you whom I do not yet know. I would like to share with you my latest creation, a book called FLY, MY LOVE, FLY. It was created with one purpose, which is to inspire you to believe that no matter what you are facing, even if it is difficult or painful, it’s possible to lead your life with joy, meaning, and purpose.

Today I live an inspired life. I love the choices I make and I feel passionate about my path. I have a beautiful sense of purpose and lead a life of meaning, but it wasn’t always this way. For many years, I thought that I had missed my calling. Some experiences broke my heart and turned my life upside down. When I was 29, I experienced a crushing loss. During the birth of my second child, my daughter, Meah, there were complications. I was fortunate to survive, but unfortunately, my daughter did not. I have never experienced such intense grief before or since. I felt every negative emotion imaginable for a very long time. I knew that if I were to survive I would need to learn to navigate the emotional lows and find my calm in the midst of this storm of grief.

The period of my recovery from this loss was when I decided to become mindful in a way I’d never before been: to be present and aware of my thoughts, words, and actions. With practice, I learned how to keep my heart and mind open, to love bigger, to give more, and to find beauty in places I’d never imagined it would be possible to find it. And I healed. Through years of deep inner work, my sadness and pain taught me profound and uplifting lessons.

During my healing adventure, I accidentally (sort of) became a painter. Many people have told me that my paintings hold an energy they find healing for themselves. I find painting a meditative experience. When I paint I aim to imbue my art with prayers and affirmations. My art holds images of angels and creatures from the sea around the island where I live with my family.

It is my hope that my book of paintings and writings will inspire my readers to dream and take action to create a life that feels good. I hope that it reminds you that your dreams matter. They’re precious because they are a part of you.

I would love for all of you to be a part of this creative process with me. There is an African proverb that says, "If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together." I would love to do this together with all of you, my family, my friends, and my tribe around the world I’ve yet to meet! You have all been my support, my inspiration, my reason for doing what I do and you will continue to be all of this for me. I am grateful beyond measure to you.

My team is in the final stages of laying out and producing FLY, MY LOVE, FLY. All that is left is for us in September is to print. We are also in the process of creating a workbook of self-reflective exercises that is a companion to planned workshops based on concepts in FLY, MY LOVE, FLY. Our goal is to have both books available by the end of October 2016. That’s just around the corner.

Funds raised here will be used primarily for the printing of FLY, MY LOVE, FLY and the  companion workbook. If we are so blessed as to receive more than what is necessary for printing, excess funds will be applied to marketing and promoting sales of the books. We expect that the year ahead will be an exciting one with me engaging in lots of travel to various different events to promote books, paintings, and workshops, all geared toward helping people "fly."

I appreciate each and every one of you. In whatever way you are able to help, know that I am grateful. If you are able to give funds through this campaign in return for one of the many rewards  I’m offering, I will be so very grateful. I hope that you love and appreciate these offerings as much as I love and appreciate yours. If you are only able to give by means of positive thoughts and or prayers, please offer those. Anyone who knows me knows that I appreciate these more than anything else. Finally, if you would be so kind as to share this campaign page with as many people as you can, that would be amazing! I thank all of you in advance for taking this next step with me and for being a part of this new chapter in my life. Going forward with you on my side means everything to me. Thank you from the bottom of my heart.

story:
Tattoos. What mental images are conjured up when you hear that word? What feelings? For some it is fear, loathing, judgment; for others the idea of fresh ink causes anticipation, excitement, desire. Without fail, one thing every person can agree on when it comes to tattoos is: story. Every tattoo, for better or worse, has a story attached to it.

Is that not true for each one of us as well? For better or worse, we carry our stories around with us. Stories which are meant to be shared.

They say a picture is worth a thousand words. For me, image is one of the strongest forms of storytelling. Long before we learn a language to verbally express ourselves, we can communicate through the power of an image.

Pictures move us. As with all forms of art, a visceral reaction takes place; like the cry of our hearts stretched out and echoed on a canvas. It can be thrilling (and terrifying) to find someone else who understands the ache in our gut, and has somehow perfectly displayed it outwardly for all to see and experience.

For me, something magical happens in a tattoo parlor as I sink back onto the chair; the hum of the machine, the scent of green soap and alcohol, the music, the shop talk… It feels like coming home.

Part of my story is that it has taken me many years to even acknowledge myself an artist, and years afterwards to be able to screw up enough courage to boldly proclaim what I want.

I want to be a tattooist! This is my version of art therapy. Not only is the act of getting tattooed therapeutic for me, but to actually be the artist who could help others by drawing out their stories, breathing life and blood into them, and then have them heal and scar and become a true part of them—I long to do this.

And you can help me realize this dream.

By donating, and using the indiegogo tools to help share my story, you will become a key player in my narrative.

One day I would like to meet you, and we can get messy making art and sharing our stories. And I’ll give you the opportunity to do just that:

For every $110 you donate, I will give you one tattoo (or custom work of art) in return. And it is your prerogative to decide when you would like to redeem said art.

Thank you for taking the time to read a little piece of my heart! I love meeting new people, connecting and listening to your stories. Follow me on Instagram (nwbexx) or find me on Facebook (N. W. Bexx)

story:
Vallejo Art Walk is the largest monthly event in Vallejo California. Vallejo was hit hard first by the Military closing its base at Mare Island and then the recession. The city was forced into bankruptcy soon after. It fell on rough times as many residents moved and others struggled to stay. Many years later the artists started to move into town and create a new art city. In 2016 Vallejo California is a haven for artists, musicians, and creatives of all types. Vallejo Art Walk has been a big part of this change and we need your help to grow again.

Vallejo Art Walk is a monthly occurrence in the Downtown Vallejo Arts District. Founded in February of 2014 by artist Sean Murdock and a group of artists willing to give it a try. The Vallejo Art Walk soared to a success. It is held on the second Friday of each month rain or shine. It is not officially an event but a group of people that open and set up on the same night to show off their talent. Most locations are in the central core of the downtown and very walkable but a few are spread out a few blocks in each direction.

Vallejo has seen a surge of artists and creatives moving into the area. The art walk is an event to celebrate and encourage the growth of this culture. The event is not affiliated officially with any city group so it is completely independent and dependent on you the art lovers to come support the artists. Without sales of art nobody can build a career in the arts or stay in one area too long. So it is you who will keep this event happening.

We want this to be artists working with artists to create a place they can feel a bond with, and to have a feeling of being a part of the growth. Many so called art areas in America rely to heavily on city money to create their art areas and that leads to only certain acceptable art projects and hand picked favorites getting the spotlight and rising to the top. An art walk is different. The art walk in most cities has been and should be a level playing field for every artist to shine and meet their fans one on one without galleries or cities getting between them for that one night a month. No commissions to pay, no certain image to uphold, no one but the buyer and the artist setting the mood.


What We Need

  • Banners advertising Vallejo Art Walk on the tops of the light poles in downtown Vallejo
  • A frame sign boards to advertise Vallejo Art Walk to traffic in downtown Vallejo as they drive home from San Francisco leaving the ferry plaza. 
  • Any funds over the goal will go to an advertising campaign in local print media and 4"x6" Flyers

The Impact

  • We hope to advertise Vallejo Art Walk to more people from outside the downtown Vallejo area. Vallejo has a great art scene now with many artists but the general population is still hesitant to come downtown. With only a small donation last year and 25 dollars a month in Facebook ads we have kept attendance somewhat steady for 2 years. 

  • This added funding and advertising will boost the event and add to the income of the local artists who truly need it by bringing more customers. Artists need patrons or they cannot continue to make art. It is simple, the artists need to sell to a wider crowd and you can make that happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Tell your friends to attend the Vallejo Art Walk and buy some art from local artists.

And that's all there is to it. We need your help!

The city was forced into bankruptcy soon after. It fell on rough times as many residents moved and others struggled to stay. Many years later the artists started to move into town and create a new art city. In 2016 Vallejo California is a haven for artists, musicians, and creatives of all types. Vallejo Art Walk has been a big part of this change and we need your help to grow again.

Vallejo Art Walk is a monthly occurrence in the Downtown Vallejo Arts District. Founded in February of 2014 by artist Sean Murdock and a group of artists willing to give it a try. The Vallejo Art Walk soared to a success. It is held on the second Friday of each month rain or shine. It is not officially an event but a group of people that open and set up on the same night to show off their talent. Most locations are in the central core of the downtown and very walkable but a few are spread out a few blocks in each direction.
Vallejo has seen a surge of artists and creatives moving into the area. The art walk is an event to celebrate and encourage the growth of this culture. The event is not affiliated officially with any city group so it is completely independent and dependent on you the art lovers to come support the artists. Without sales of art nobody can build a career in the arts or stay in one area too long. So it is you who will keep this event happening.
We want this to be artists working with artists to create a place they can feel a bond with, and to have a feeling of being a part of the growth. Many so called art areas in America rely to heavily on city money to create their art areas and that leads to only certain acceptable art projects and hand picked favorites getting the spotlight and rising to the top. An art walk is different. The art walk in most cities has been and should be a level playing field for every artist to shine and meet their fans one on one without galleries or cities getting between them for that one night a month. No commissions to pay, no certain image to uphold, no one but the buyer and the artist setting the mood.
   
What We Need  Banners advertising Vallejo Art Walk on the tops of the light poles in downtown Vallejo A frame sign boards to advertise Vallejo Art Walk to traffic in downtown Vallejo as they drive home from San Francisco leaving the ferry plaza.  Any funds over the goal will go to an advertising campaign in local print media and 4"x6" Flyers 
   The Impact 
We hope to advertise Vallejo Art Walk to more people from outside the downtown Vallejo area. Vallejo has a great art scene now with many artists but the general population is still hesitant to come downtown. With only a small donation last year and 25 dollars a month in Facebook ads we have kept attendance somewhat steady for 2 years.  This added funding and advertising will boost the event and add to the income of the local artists who truly need it by bringing more customers. Artists need patrons or they cannot continue to make art. It is simple, the artists need to sell to a wider crowd and you can make that happen.


    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools!
Tell your friends to attend the Vallejo Art Walk and buy some art from local artists.   And that's all there is to it. We need your help!

story:
Les buts et objectifs de l'académie!

Tout le monde connait quelqu'un dans son entourage qui pratique des arts martiaux, ou même que vous en apprenez vous aussi. Mais vous êtes-vous déjà demandé si cet apprentissage est complet? Le monde des arts martiaux a énormement évolué au fil de cette dernière décennie, et cette école va être en avant de cette vague!

Le but principal de ce projet est d'avoir un lieu ou chaque individu peut venir apprendre les arts martiaux afin de se découvrir et de devenir la meilleure personne qu'elle puisse être.  Elle va le faire en se démarquant sur 2 points principaux:

  • les cours théoriques (à voir plus bas)
  • l'évolution de l'école décidé par les élèves (à voir plus bas)

 

Les services offerts dans l'académie

Voici les diverses disciplines offertes dans l'académie:

  • Jeet Kune Do: système d'auto-défense crée par le légendaire Bruce Lee. Un système qui regroupe à la base les éléments de Wing Chun, Boxe, et Escrime européenne.
  • Aikido: système d'auto-défense utilisée par la police Japonaise où le pratiquant utilise la force de son adversaire pour le maitriser.
  • Kickboxing: sport de combat où les poings et les pieds tombent comme des pluies torrentielles. Une version sportive du Muay Thai.
  • Systema: art martial russe utilisant la nature du corps humain comme arme de défense contre tout type d'aggression dans tous les environnements possible.
  • Cours d'introduction aux arts martiaux pour enfants: Cours d'introduction pour les enfants de 5 à 12 ans dans le vaste monde des arts martiaux. Ne s'attachant à aucune discipline précise, ce cours aura pour but de développer les valeurs principales des arts martiaux pour les enfants de jeune âge.
  • Cours privés: Vous pourrez avoir une entente avec le professeur de votre choix afin d'augmenter la rapidité de votre apprentissage

Mais voici là où les choses diffèrent des autres académies d'arts martiaux... Notre établissement offrira aussi des cours théoriques afin de combler les entrainements pratiques. Quand on parle de cours théoriques, on parle des cours de:

  • Nutrition
  • Musculation/biologie
  • Massage/thérapies
  • Philosophie et psychologie
  • Cours de permiers soins
  • Médecine sportive
  • etc.

Ces cours seront donnés régulièrement par des experts dans chaque domaine.

 

L'évolution constante vers un empire des arts martiaux!

L'académie sera en évolution constante et voici un autre aspect qui va le différencier des autres écoles. Sa progression ne sera pas décidée par le fondateur ou les professeurs, mais plutôt par les élèves. A travers un simple système de commentaires et suggestions,  l'académie mettra en action la demande des élèves. La progression de toutes les demandes et projets mis en action seront ensuite mis à la vue de tous les membres afin de voir la progression de leur décision.

Ces demandes peuvent toucher n'importe quel domaine de l'école. C'est à dire que les élèves peuvent faire la demande de nouvelles machines d'entrainements, d'une nouvelle configuration d'une salle, de nouvelles disciplines, nouveaux abreuvoirs d'eaux, ou même d'un nouveau type de savon dans les salles de bains! La création et l'évolution de l'académie appartient à ses membres!

 

Les salles d'entrainements

Il y aura des salles pour donner des cours d'arts martiaux, ainsi que une grande salle d'entrainement spécifique à la progression de chaque personne. En plus des instruments de musculation de base, il y aura aussi une panoplie énorme d'outils et machine d'entrainements afin de devenir plus fort, rapide, agile, travailler la stabilité, etc, qui n'existent pas encore sur le marché! Cette salle sera toujours accessible aux élèves.

 

Mais...ca coûte cher tout ca!

Ce projet coûte énormement de sous à ces débuts. Le but est d'avoir un minimum pour pouvoir commencer, et ensuite aller de l'avant avec ce qu'on a! Veuillez donner si possible, mais surtout passez le mot à tous ceux que vous connaissez afin de pouvoir réaliser ce projet pour que nous puissions tous avoir une place pour atteindre et depasser notre potentiel!

 

Merci à tous! N'hésitez pas a contribuer et partager!

story:
WHO AM I?

Welcome everyone!

Thank you so much for dropping by and checking out my campaign!

I am an avid illustrator who simply loves, you guessed it, to draw. I specialise in ink and brush illustration. In 2013 I got my BFA in Visual Arts from Emily Carr University in Vancouver, Canada and since then I've been living in Helsinki, Finland expanding my art practice. I love drawing all my favourite dinosaurs, movie, comic and t.v. characters.

My passion for drawing came from watching my grandad sketching landscapes and portraits. Every time he visited us he showed me how to use watercolours, charcoal and other mediums. From all of them I liked watercolour and pencil drawing the most. I slowly started developing my own techniques using ink. Now, I can't let go of my brush and my ink flask. I carry them everywhere I go. I spend hours and hours, day and night drawing. My hobby for drawing became my passion and now I am so happy to say that it has become my profession.  

The Campaign:

My goal is to raise enough funds to be able to travel to this year's Stan Lee's Comikaze 2016 in Los Angeles, California and have the opportunity to exhibit my work at the Artist's Alley where I will have the opportunity to create and expand my professional network, meet enthusiastic fans as well as to talk people from the industry.

At the Artist's Alley I will be able to promote my ink drawings, sell postcards, posters and sketches featuring my work as well as meeting awesome people who share my passion for ink drawing, art, comics, dinosaurs and entertainment in general.

If you decide to help me out achieve my goal and experience this amazing event I would be forever grateful. Also, depending on how much you decide to contribute to my campaign you will be rewarded with amazing prizes such as signed postcards and A4 posters featuring my work as well as original signed ink drawings and other amazing packages!

WHAT I NEED + WHAT YOU GET:

To make this trip a reality I have estimated a budget of €2,400 to travel and exhibit my work at the Convention from Oct 28th to Oct 30th . This budget includes transport from Helsinki to Los Angeles (roundtrip), the rent for space and table at the exhibition, show program Ad, food + accommodation + transport for the 3 days at the Convention.

Here is the Breakdown:

ROUNDTRIP TICKET HEL-LAX: est. €600-800 (depends when I have the funds to book it)

ARTIST ALLEY TABLE: est. €220 (it's $250 USD, so conversion right now it's about this amount)

SHOW PROGRAM FULL PAGE AD: est. €350 (it's $400 USD for a full page ad on the show's program)

TRANSPORT (in L.A. for 3 days): est. €100

FOOD + ACCOMMODATION (in L.A. for 3 days): est. €400

PRINTING POSTCARDS, POSTERS + BUSINESS CARDS FOR SHOW: est. €300

MAILING YOUR REWARDS: est. €200

TOTAL:  est. €2,370 

If the total amount isn't reached all funds will first go towards covering the plane ticket and artist alley table costs.

REWARDS:

What do you awesome people get if you contribute to my campaign?

For those of you with a limited budget you may prefer my specially designed and signed postcards featuring my work such as: comic book heroes or Star Wars characters. (6x4in). 

Alternatively, you could choose between A4 size signed posters featuring our heroes in different designs. If you really want to get a collection piece, purchase one or more original ink drawings and even commission the drawing of your dreams along with the prints and postcards!

SIGNED POSTCARDS: 

You can choose between Marvel, Dc or Star Wars postcards or all of them! Printed on fine art paper 200gsm.

Marvel Postcards

DC Postcards

Star Wars Postcards

A4 SIGNED POSTERS:

Choose between 4 different exclusive A4 posters: Watchmen, Star Wars, Suicide Squad or Lord of the Rings. Printed on fine art paper 200gsm. You can get one of them or all four!


DINOSAUR PACKAGE NOW AVAILABLE TOO!
This package is done for all the dino lovers! It includes the following:
- 5 Signed Dino Mini-Posters (A4 size)
- 3 signed dino postcards
All of these featuring my dino drawings and printed on fine art paper 200gsm.


ORIGINAL INK DRAWINGS + COMMISSIONED DRAWINGS:

You have the chance to choose between original drawings that I have done to enhance your package or commission a drawing of your choice:

- Comic book character (Bust or Full body character)

- Dinosaur (Bust or Full body character)

-Movie or T.V. character (Bust only)

All of my drawings are done on beautiful Fabriano watercolour paper and are 30x20cm in size.

Original drawings available. Hurry up 'cause there are only a few available:

Frank Underwood, Winter Soldier, Spiderman, King Kong, Batman and Vader.


Thank you so much for your support!!


And remember to follow me:

Instagram: @aguirrefirth

Facebook: Aguirre Firth Illustration

Youtube: SaunaVlogs

Twitter: @aguirrefirth


RISKS AND CHALLENGES

The challenges with this project include printing, drawing production and mailing delays depending how successful the project is. If this happens, I will let you know that your rewards are in progress and might take longer than anticipated.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.

story:
I am a professional photographer from New Jersey.  I am working hard to build a business and support myself.  I love using my art to support causes I believe in by raising money or awareness for them.  

 

Photography is a very powerful tool. It can tell a story without a single word. I have the opportunity to capture the Macy's Fireworks over NYC from above the city.

I have shot both fireworks (from the ground) and NYC from above but not at the same time.  

Anything you can do to help make this possible would be greatly appreciated!!

story:
Short Summary

The mapping lineage project aims to document practitioner experiences of ensemble improvisation practices. The project collected over 60 practitioner lineage maps from artist participants at the Form in Question symposium hosted by the Institute for Creative Research at Tisch School of the Arts/NYU in January 2016.  We now wish to publish these lineage maps in an artist book with commentaries in order to provide a valuable resource to artists, practitioners and researchers in the dance field.
 What We Need & What You Get

  • The cost of publishing the book is £3000 GBP
  • The book uniquely documents the lineage of prominent practitioners in ensemble improvisation since the 1970s. The maps are both artistically engaging and historically significant. 
  • All funds will go to the cost of publishing the book.

The Impact

  • The Form in Question Symposium brought together ensemble improvisation practitioners from across the generations.  It was a unique meeting of artists who have documented the lineage of their work through this project that was part of the symposium.
  • The book is a beautiful artifact and a historical document that will be of use to dance students, scholars, artists and historians.

Risks & Challenges

The book will be printed by the Guildford Street Press, a student run press at the University of Bedfordshire, UK.  The book will be bound with a french fold (subject to testing), with a green cover and black riso print on off-white paper inside.

  • The Guildford Street Press regulary produces book for exhibitions and degree shows.
  • Using the Guildford Street Press will help to keep the publication costs down.
  • A risk is that our timescale will slip.
  • Additional monies raised will be used to print additional copies of the book and to subsidise distribution

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share our campaign with your colleagues and friends!

story:
“Imagination is the only weapon in the war against reality.”
― Lewis Carroll, Alice in Wonderland

I was inspired by the imaginative world created by Lewis Carroll in Alice in Wonderland, and decided I wanted to illustrate the book with a modern twist. Most illustrations represent Alice as the blonde girl with a light blue dress, as depicted in the classic Disney film. I wanted to head in a different direction, and infuse Alice's world with global influences. I believe this to be key when illustrating children's books, as today's audience is a global audience.

My version of Alice in Wonderland includes 5 colorful illustrations. This campaign aims to raise the funds necessary to cover the printing costs of the paperback book (100 copies).

For donations of EUR 30 or higher, you will receive a personally signed bookmark featuring one of the 5 illustrations.

A portion of the sales of the book will be donated to a charitable organization.

story:
What We Need

"Once Upon an Eye" is a work-in-progress Spirit and Kitsch + Little Whale Productions collaboration. The short film, animated by Pamela Tan and produced by Christopher Holmes, highlights the humor and heart in Alice Mulhlback's drawings and features an original score composed by Joshua Handal. In the film, two souls hatch--one flees, one pursues--under the benevolent gaze of a larger presence. It is a simple fable about love, with a bird, a wondering eye, and a giant. 

"Once Upon an Eye" will also be part of a unique art installation slated to open on November 4, 2016, at Eye Gallery (Ithaca, NY). Through the installation's projected animations and interactive artwork, you will step into and be a part of the “Once Upon an Eye” world.

Please help fund the Once Upon an Eye experience, which will include: 

  • The completion of the first Once Upon an Eye animated film, including submission fees to Oscar-qualifying festivals, technical fees, and travel.
  • The creation of an interactive art installation that will first open in Ithaca (NY) at the Eye Gallery (how appropriate!) and travel to other sites in 2017. Funding will assist us with obtaining lighting, film projections, sound equipment, and raw materials to create a theater set where the audience is part of the production. 
  • Future animated projects, including Once Upon an Eye sequels and spin-offs.

What You Get

  • Delightful Once Upon an Eye swag, designed by Spirit and Kitsch artist Alice Muhlback, at all donation levels!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Help us get the word out by sharing this campaign!

The short film, animated by Pamela Tan and produced by Christopher Holmes, highlights the humor and heart in Alice Mulhlback's drawings and features an original score composed by Joshua Handal. In the film, two souls hatch--one flees, one pursues--under the benevolent gaze of a larger presence. It is a simple fable about love, with a bird, a wondering eye, and a giant. "Once Upon an Eye" will also be part of a unique art installation slated to open on November 4, 2016, at Eye Gallery (Ithaca, NY). Through the installation's projected animations and interactive artwork, you will step into and be a part of the “Once Upon an Eye” world.

Please help fund the Once Upon an Eye experience, which will include:   The completion of the first Once Upon an Eye animated film, including submission fees to Oscar-qualifying festivals, technical fees, and travel. 
The creation of an interactive art installation that will first open in Ithaca (NY) at the Eye Gallery (how appropriate!) and travel to other sites in 2017. Funding will assist us with obtaining lighting, film projections, sound equipment, and raw materials to create a theater set where the audience is part of the production. 

Future animated projects, including Once Upon an Eye sequels and spin-offs.
   What You Get  Delightful Once Upon an Eye swag, designed by Spirit and Kitsch artist Alice Muhlback, at all donation levels!


    Other Ways You Can Help  Help us get the word out by sharing this campaign!

story:
Short Summary

Many women in Iran use perfume as a way of freely expressing themselves. After working there and returning to the US, I decided to not only make my own perfume but to link it to my Iranian-American culture. 

The first is creating the private collection perfume, UNRESTRICTED, which bridges the gap between American and Iranian culture. It is 100% American made and emblazoned with the mystical clawed bird, Simorgh, a distinct  symbol from Iranian poet, Ferdowsi . The Simorgh represents wholeness, unity and purity.

While creating Unrestricted, I also created a platform to allow everyone to take pleasure in this experience and to blend their own signature fragrance. You choose your lifestyle, whether it’s choosing the food that you put into your body, your thoughts, going to the gym or the clothes that you wear. Desert35 gives you the opportunity to choose specific scents that bring sensuality, peace, fun and joy into your world to create a signature fragrance.

The customization platform creates an empowering lifestyle for everyone. This can be a signature personal fragrance for yourself or as a gift for someone else. The platform is easy to use. Simply choose your gender, the character and oils that best capture your feeling or mood, or particular scent and we will mix a new fresh fragrance to your doorstep.

A healthy lifestyle, and how you build and maintain it, is essential for uplifting yourself and creating a positive mood that leads to a new life experience or exploration.

What We Need & What You Get

Although blending the scents and expressing your personality is part of this project more funds will be needed to launch it.

We are seeking to raise $45,000 which will be used for the following:

-Packaging

-Inventory : Bottles/ Caps/ Labels/ Presentation Boxes

-Filling/ Mixing/ Blending

-Oils+ Additional Perfume Ingredients

-App development completion for customization platform

-Marketing

The Impact

The world of scents, like life, is a world filled with possibilities, personalities and outcomes. The sense of smell is the fastest working sense of all 5 senses and can change the way that you feel in the blink of an eye. It will inspire you to find the mystery and adventure in life in every unique blend. Your help will springboard this project and be a real unique opportunity for new emotional discoveries.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand you may not have the funds to contribute but you can still help tremendously if you believe in this cool life exploration.

•We are currently on Instagram as Desert35 Fragrances. Follow us there!  Share our posts!  Talk us up in groups you're active in. We are a fashionable   lifestyle brand!

•We are always active on social media posting photos and videos, so we'd love for you to follow along and share what you think is cool!

And don't forget, you can use the Indiegogo share tools to make things easy for friends and family to find out what we're doing!

story:
After a nerve wracking morning, I managed to snag an early bird workshop pass to the Symposium, but...

This year, I made the resolution that my hobbies have to pay for themselves. What does that mean? It means I have to make enough money off my art work to cover the costs of the Symposium registration, supplies, accommodation and travel costs (I'm going to leave out shopping and food, 'cause I'd do that anyway). So how much is that?

Registration: $560

Supplies: ~$75

Accommodation: ~ $500 

Travel costs: ~$200-700  (I'm still figuring out details)

Carbon offsets: ~$20-30 (Depends on travel arrangements)

Total: ~$1865

Thanks for your support!

-----

About the Perks

As most of the perks revolve around my trip to Chicago and the sketches I'll be doing there, if you have suggestions of things you want me to sketch, let me know! (Keep in mind, I'll only be there for four days and I also have lots of workshops to go to.)

Postcards and notecards are 4"x6". I'll share pictures of my sketches and you can help decide which are the favourites.

If you want to chip in a few dollars for shipping, thank you very much!

story:
What is MIGHTY?

MIGHTY will be the first art installation brought to Playa by the People of Color Camp. You can find it at the entrance of our camp at 8:00 and Rod's Road.

This year’s Burning Man theme I, Robot asks us to consider the important positions robots and artificial intelligence have taken in our lives. While doing so, we must not leapfrog over the still unrealized acknowledgement of humanity for people of color in our society. MIGHTY is an exploration of what it would look like for radical inclusion to be applied to people of color. 

Initial ideas for MIGHTY began by reflecting on the 50th anniversary of Martin Luther King Jr's assassination and Afrofuturism.

On April 3rd, 1968 in Memphis, TN, Martin Luther King Jr. delivered his last speech “I've Been to the Mountaintop” in support of the ongoing Sanitation Workers Strike. Eleven days after the deaths of Echol Cole and Robert Walker, 1,300 black sanitation workers and their supporters protested the abusive working conditions, racism, and discrimination by the city. The “I Am a Man” sandwich board posters worn by protesters served as an affirmation against oppression and became the resounding theme of the strike. 

MIGHTY serves as a reminder that we must continue to struggle for the full inclusion for people of color in all spaces. Informed by our history we look to the future and will create a platform to uplift each other towards the brilliance of our individual and collective power. 

We envision a future where all people can participate in their fullest expression both on and off Playa. Our observation platform seeks to be a space for elevating people in general and people of color in particular towards a future that allows us all to show up in our full beauty, humanity, and might. We want this to be a space where you can be as you are without the masks we need to wear for our everyday survival.

Designing & Constructing MIGHTY

MIGHTY will be made of 3 tiers with a footprint of 30' x 20' x 8'.  Each tier invites you to commune with one another and wonder about the might within you. The third tier will have two wicker thrones, a telescope and the entrance to the slide for a quick return to the ground level. At night the MIGHTY will be illuminated from beneath the structure in a warm white light. 

Our San Francisco POC Camp family will host our test build in early August where we will prefabricate all the parts needed to successfully build MIGHTY on Playa.

About POC Camp

 

 

 

 

 

 



Founded in 2013 by Nicholas Powers, People of Color Camp is a Melanin kaleidoscope where all hues, all colors, all nations, all religions, and all gender identities are welcome to express their visions. We invite dreams sprung from every corner of the Earth, especially dreams outside of America and those suppressed within it.

POC Camp is an intentional tribe with an eye on recreating our Playa family in the real world.  A living experiment in creating a family outside America’s socioeconomic defaults. We are a foundation for a peaceful future. Come and build with us!

The MIGHTY Team


Gina Tedesco (BX, NY) is known to wear many hats all in the name of getting $#!t done. She became MIGHTY's lead artist when it was suggested that POC Camp should have an observation platform. Being part of the talented team to help bring to Playa POC Camp's first art piece is beyond anything she imagined when she first arrived at Black Rock City in 2015. Returning to Burning Man for her 3rd time, Gina is thrilled to interact with people and art that continuously push the boundaries of human experiences. 


First-time burner, Adrian Lu (SF,CA) fully embraces the principles of Burning Man and immediately jumped into this project by leading the architectural planning for MIGHTY. Attracted by the endless ways in which humanity can be deeply explored on Playa, Adrian looks forward to engaging with art that calls into question and challenges that which is accepted as normal. Working on MIGHTY has allowed him to explore the art of architecture and engineering and pushes the boundaries of what he can do in his own work. 


Marlon Williams (BK, NY) makes his 7th year Burning Man return to connect with community and the sense of joy, wonder, and ritual the Playa provides. He chose to work on this project because he wants to live in a world of radical inclusion, where all people, particularly people of color, are free to express themselves and achieve their highest potential. This project creates the space to glimpse that future so that we can feel energized to change and resist our present reality.  

Your Donations are MIGHTY

MIGHTY Materials = $4,500
Plywood, 2 x 4's, washers, nuts, bolts, hex bolts, paint, fabric, lighting, wicker thrones, and a telescope are just some of the items MIGHTY needs to be a safe and spectacular structure. 

MIGHTY Transportation = $1000
MIGHTY needs get from San Francisco to Burning Man. That involves renting a van for 2 weeks, gas, and insurance. 

MIGHTY Storage= $500
After materials and transportation are taken care of any remaining funds will go towards MIGHTY's new home. MIGHTY will live in a storage unit in Reno

MIGHTY Impact

For a variety of reasons people of color attend Burning Man in very few numbers. MIGHTY will serve as a beacon to signal our growing presence on Playa. We wish to express to those that have been on the fence about attending Burning Man that there is a community of people that looks just like them available to support them as they take the leap and prepare to journey to Black Rock City. 

Shoutouts!

A HUGE thank you to each and every single person who has backed our campaign. Your support brings us closer to making this project a reality. Special shoutouts to POC Camp for letting three people run freely with the idea of an observation platform, Living Cities for contributing to the thought behind this project, H. Scott Roth and 43.60 Studio for their video production, SilkyBlack for his music, Nathalie Larosiliere for bringing our perks to life, and Justin Shirley for adjusting our images.

story:
About me

My journey started in the end of 1955 near Sofia – the capital of Bulgaria. During the childhood I wanted to paint pictures and play the piano. My parents wanted me to become an engineer. So I became an engineer who plays the computer keyboard and uses the acquired knowledge for incarnating the beauty of mathematics in artworks.

In 1985 I was fascinated by the magic of fractals – the most complex math object. This love affair continues to the present day. That makes more than 3 decades in a study of their endless world. During them I have used various software tools (including written by me) for diving in that abyss.

Somewhere in 90’s I realized that fractal beauty is nothing without third dimension and later that 3D world on a flat display is nothing but a cheap imitation of reality. Three new yet inconceivable technologies had to be born: Software to make bulk from flat; software to convert that bulk into a cloud of points; and a machine to materialize the cloud in a touchable beauty.

The birth has gone a long way. In the meantime, I gained life and professional experience; raised my children; traveled around the world; entered politics and left it with disgust…

Now so many years later I managed to get all elements of the mosaic gathered. The software and 3D printing technology advanced sufficiently for tearing off the fractals from the two-dimensional world of Images and giving them life in the space.

Peter Petrov

 

About my campaign

I knew from the very beginning that whenever my first exhibition happens, I would need a financial support.  This is because 3D printing of single piece of my works could cost anything from several hundred to several thousand dollars. Thus not exhibition, even a limited presentation goes far beyond my capabilities. And here I am, with three things on the table:  a new type of beautiful contemporary art; a great opportunity to expose it; and a lack of funds to make the latter happen.    

What is my idea? I’d like to show at least one or two 3D printed wall art pieces and combine this with a digital presentation of the rest via VR headset. Thus people would be able to see not some imaginary artworks but to enjoy them in the physical world.

If I manage to raise $3000 I’ll be able to meet all travel expenses to World Art Dubai and expose two of my works.  This is my goal. Anything raised above would go for printing of one more wall art piece and then for the next one and so on.

 

What can I offer in return?

You can have my designs. Depending on your contribution you will get various numbers of 3D models from my "Wall Art" collection as well as high resolution fractal abstractions from my "Wrapped Canvas Prints" gallery. And these models will be your choice. You have to know that you will get not just some mesh files. You will get designs, which have passed successfully the manufacturability tests of at least three leading 3D printing services: Sculpteo, Shapeways and Make Printable. Designs that are ready for printing. In addition for a highest contribution you will obtain one of following 3D printed small sculptures (subject to 3D Printing Service ability and available materials): Tongues, Dreamaker, Laurel Tower or Out of Cage.

 

What if I don’t reach my entire goal?

I’m ready to combine the digital presentation with one sample only. If the money is even less and I can’t cover my travel expenses I would spend them for a sample of wall art. In that case my art would be presented by Ajala Project people.

 

What is the difference your contribution makes?

The science and technology of XXI century will expand the territory of the contemporary and digital art. More and more new ideas will be born and their authors will have to make way for them to enforce. It will not be easy for the pioneers but this is the way of development. It has always been that way. I believe my art is such a new territory. You could be its pioneers and this is the difference your contribution makes.

 

Risks & Challenges

Though the tests of three leading 3D printing companies confirm that my artworks have no weak places and are printable without any doubt, theoretically it is possible printing to fail by some reason. Such a hypothetical failure would be used as a feedback. All designs could be tailored to any additional requirements and limits.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes we just can’t contribute though we would like to. No matter if you can and how much you would contribute to my campaign. I would appreciate if you share the news about it among your social and professional contacts. It will also help.
