story:
The Project

My name is Chantel Schultz and I am an emerging visual artist in Edmonton, Alberta. I have recently graduated from the University of Alberta with a Bachelor of Fine Arts and have been invited to Salem Art Works as a Young Artist Intern in Salem, NY from May 30 - July 19. I am inviting you to support my project because this opportunity will provide me with access to studio space, networking with other artists, and the uninterrupted time to propel my studio practice as a young emerging artist.

What I Need & What You Get

As an artist intern at Salem Art Works, I will be responsible for assisting with the daily operations of SAW which include general maintenance of the facilities, assisting with events and exhibitions, and execution of a special project. In exchange for my contributions, I will be provided with room and board, access to studio space, technical support and a complimentary workshop. While at SAW, I have been invited to participate in an outdoor sculpture exhibition at North Bennington Sculpture Park in North Bennington, VT. The sculpture will be on exhibition from June 26 - November 2. 

This internship will provide me with room and board but it will not cover travel or material expenses; so I have launched my campaign for $2,650 to cover travel, material and additional living costs. Contributions to this campaign will also help to support the expenses of materials for an outdoor sculpture. As a contributor to this campaign, you will receive original artworks in the form of sculptures, drawings, prints and artwork packages. 

Contributors will receive:

Virtual High Five in the form of a GIF, postcards, illustrated kombucha starter kits, small cement sculptures, original drawings, silicone sculptures, prints, nylon sculptures or a discounted artist package.

Contributions will fund:

Travel = $1,437

Lodging = $180

Living costs = $500

Materials = $500

The Impact

Your contribution will allow me to travel 4,000 km to this internship! It will also provide me with the materials I need to continue making work to develop my artistic practice.

Residencies and internships provide artists with access to specialized resources, opportunities to exhibit work, offer uninterrupted time and space to develop artistic practice and provide opportunities to connect with other artists in varying stages of their careers.  This internship will provide me with the resources I need to sustain the forward momentum I have cultivated in my final year of the Bachelor of Fine Arts program.

As an emerging artist, it is important that I dedicate myself to establish a routine of working, to expand my connection with other artists, and to build confidence in my practice. As a recent graduate, I have limited assets and resources. I will have to be resourceful with the materials I acquire and seek alternative ways to cover travel and additional living expenses. 

With financial relief, this campaign will provide me with the stability and energy I need to further develop a healthy studio practice in a space that affords me the time to do so. 

Risks & Challenges

I will be driving the 4,000 km trek from Edmonton, AB to Salem, NY in order to bring tools and materials to work. The road trip will take me through Alberta, Saskatchewan, North Dakota, Minnesota, Wisconsin, Illinois, Indiana, Ohio, Pensylvania, and New York with major stops in Minneapolis, Chicago, and Cleveland. My car is 12 years old and has been very reliable but travelling this distance may wear it down resulting in unforeseen vehicle hiccups and travel delays. To remedy this, I will need to budget for an emergency fund in case of repair or maintenance and may need support from friends in the United States to provide a safe stop along the way. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute monetarily at this time, please share my campaign through social media (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter) to help me gain traction! 

Keep an eye out for updates on my campaign, whereabouts, practice and other ways you can help to contribute along the way!
story_txt:
The Project
My name is Chantel Schultz and I am an emerging visual artist in Edmonton, Alberta. I have recently graduated from the University of Alberta with a Bachelor of Fine Arts and have been invited to Salem Art Works as a Young Artist Intern in Salem, NY from May 30 - July 19. I am inviting you to support my project because this opportunity will provide me with access to studio space, networking with other artists, and the uninterrupted time to propel my studio practice as a young emerging artist.


What I Need & What You Get
As an artist intern at Salem Art Works, I will be responsible for assisting with the daily operations of SAW which include general maintenance of the facilities, assisting with events and exhibitions, and execution of a special project. In exchange for my contributions, I will be provided with room and board, access to studio space, technical support and a complimentary workshop. While at SAW, I have been invited to participate in an outdoor sculpture exhibition at North Bennington Sculpture Park in North Bennington, VT. The sculpture will be on exhibition from June 26 - November 2. 
This internship will provide me with room and board but it will not cover travel or material expenses; so I have launched my campaign for $2,650 to cover travel, material and additional living costs. Contributions to this campaign will also help to support the expenses of materials for an outdoor sculpture. As a contributor to this campaign, you will receive original artworks in the form of sculptures, drawings, prints and artwork packages. 
Contributors will receive:
Virtual High Five in the form of a GIF, postcards, illustrated kombucha starter kits, small cement sculptures, original drawings, silicone sculptures, prints, nylon sculptures or a discounted artist package.

Contributions will fund:
Travel = $1,437
Lodging = $180
Living costs = $500
Materials = $500

The Impact
Your contribution will allow me to travel 4,000 km to this internship! It will also provide me with the materials I need to continue making work to develop my artistic practice.
Residencies and internships provide artists with access to specialized resources, opportunities to exhibit work, offer uninterrupted time and space to develop artistic practice and provide opportunities to connect with other artists in varying stages of their careers.  This internship will provide me with the resources I need to sustain the forward momentum I have cultivated in my final year of the Bachelor of Fine Arts program.
As an emerging artist, it is important that I dedicate myself to establish a routine of working, to expand my connection with other artists, and to build confidence in my practice. As a recent graduate, I have limited assets and resources. I will have to be resourceful with the materials I acquire and seek alternative ways to cover travel and additional living expenses. 
With financial relief, this campaign will provide me with the stability and energy I need to further develop a healthy studio practice in a space that affords me the time to do so. 


Risks & Challenges
I will be driving the 4,000 km trek from Edmonton, AB to Salem, NY in order to bring tools and materials to work. The road trip will take me through Alberta, Saskatchewan, North Dakota, Minnesota, Wisconsin, Illinois, Indiana, Ohio, Pensylvania, and New York with major stops in Minneapolis, Chicago, and Cleveland. My car is 12 years old and has been very reliable but travelling this distance may wear it down resulting in unforeseen vehicle hiccups and travel delays. To remedy this, I will need to budget for an emergency fund in case of repair or maintenance and may need support from friends in the United States to provide a safe stop along the way. 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you cannot contribute monetarily at this time, please share my campaign through social media (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter) to help me gain traction! 
Keep an eye out for updates on my campaign, whereabouts, practice and other ways you can help to contribute along the way!

story:
Short Summary

Trude Sojka was born in Berlin, in 1909, from Czech-Jewish parents. She studied at the Academy of Fine Arts in Berlin, with the most prestigious teachers of the avant-garde movements of the 1920-1930's. When the war came, she went through at least 4 concentration camps.

In 1946, after surviving the Holocaust, Trude Sojka emigrated to Ecuador to join her only remaining brother. There, she established herself as an artist, depicting her experience during the war, but also providing a message of peace and hope through her original paintings and sculptures, made out of Portland cement and recycled materials. Eleven years after her death, the Terezin Memorial in the Czech Republic (Sojka's family was deported to the Terezin Ghetto), has invited her family to exhibit her artworks, from March to June 2019. The theme is "Being a Woman and a Holocaust Survivor", or "Holocaust and Maternity", because Sojka gave birth and lost her first child in one of the concentration camps.

Her daughter (Anita Steinitz) and grand-daughter (Gabriela Steinitz), Director and President of the Trude Sojka Cultural House Corporation in Ecuador, a non-profit cultural foundation, as keepers of her legacy, are trying to make this exhibit abroad come true.

Indeed,Trude Sojka never returned back to her beloved Czech Republic, but we know it would have been one of her most desired wishes. Most of all, we think it is very important to promote her life-story as a symbol of hope and resilience, as many Holocaust survivors who emigrated to Ecuador, and of many Jewish artists who depicted something different from the horrors of the war. Furthermore, for us, this exhibit should act as a cultural bridge, to show that a country as small as Ecuador, with a very special cultural background, can achieve international recognition.

 

What We Need & What You Get

As a non-profit organization, with almost no income, we need to collect funds to finance the shipping and insurance of these valuable and very heavy paintings and sculptures from Quito to Terezin, which will cost about 20 000 dollars.

Besides, we need to pay our trip to the Czech Republic and back to Ecuador, as well  as our stay in Europe, amounting to, at least, 4 000 dollars,

The Terezin Memorial will help us with the exhibit hall and the installation, as well as with publicity and refreshments for the opening.

 

We sincerely believe in the power of culture. Artists can transmit a lot more than their feelings, they can radically change prejudices or bring more conscience to other human beings. Transmission involves as well movement, that means the circulation of art through the world. How great it is, for example, to be able to see a Cézanne or to discover a new artist in our own country! How great it is also to know that an artist returns to her country of origin, to her home, even posthumously! How interesting to know that there has been a fusion of cultures (the Ecuadorian and the Czech cultures). What a nice and well deserved act of recognition to a Holocaust survivor!

If we do not reach the goal of 24 000 dollars, the project will fail, and who knows when we will have another opportunity to make this expected exhibit.

The Impact

 

Your help is extremely valuable to us, and perhaps, you too, will be able to appreciate these artworks.

Your generosity will be contributing to universal culture and helping to connect two continents, to keep the memory of the Shoah, in order to prevent other genocides of this type. You will be helping to make the message of peace travel around the world!

We don't want this project to begin and then simply end. We want to open its borderlines, so it can be the first step of a worldwide traveling exhibit, throughout Europe, Israel, United-Stated, and more. Perhaps, with your valuable help, one day it could arrive to your country, city or town!

 

Risks & Challenges

 The artworks need to be packed inside hard-covered wooden boxes, carried by air and land providing the maximal care and security, until they reach the town of Terezin.

Meanwhile, Anita and Gabriela Steinitz need to prepare the printing material, texts, documents, etc. for the exhibit, and plan their trip in order to arrive in Czech Republic beginning March 2019.

If the necessary sum is not collected before January 2019, the whole project will need to be cancelled. We hope that your donation at Indiegogo will help us on time.

Moreover, discrimination, violence and hatred continue to happen in the world every day. The right-wing, white-supremacy politics around the world is very frightening.

Many people believe that Trude Sojka's art can be is part of counter-acting that. So this could the perfect occasion to reminds us about the terror that hate can bring, and transmit the message of survivors like Trude Sojka.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate money,this is what you could do:

  • Give us ideas of people, companies or organizations that could perhaps help financing the project
  • If you live in Quito, Ecuador, you could come to the Trude Sojka Cultural House and volunteer, helping us to promote the cultural house, or with our sales (books, artworks, Czech pastry, postcards), or come to our cultural activities (artistic workshops, conferences, etc.)
  • Make some noise about this campaign around you, and use the Indiegogo share tools!

Make some noise about this campaign around you, and use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Dream Control – The Book

An art project and book, featuring staged photography, miniature film sets, an Oscar-winning actor (and many more), elucidating texts about a possible future: Explore a story of lucid dreamers and sleepwalkers venturing in an amusement park, run by a shady corporation.

  • Produced by Frank Lassak and the team of Efacts Photography,
    in cooperation with Musée de cinéma et miniature, Lyon
  • Contains museum-quality reproductions of 20 large-scale staged photographs, produced on film, showing the simulated world of an amusement park for sleepwalkers. For the pictures, the museum gave exclusive permission to use selected miniatures from its collection
  • With accompanying texts (in English, French and German), such as an essay by Julius Deutschbauer and Sina Klein, a fictional story about the future of tailor-made dreaming, and a detailed description of the project and its scientific and philosophical background
     

The Story

Dream Control describes and visualizes both the fascinating and terrifying aspects of an amusement park for sleepwalkers, which – as closer inspection reveals – is a front for a dubious organization, whose true motives are unknown. As such, the book is an invitation for the readers to scrutinize the value and integrity of allegedly life-enhancing services, whose sole purpose is to jeopardize the clients’ ability to lead a self-determined, sovereign life.

 

What We Need & What You Get

For the first print-run of 150 copies, an investment of approx. 5,000 € is needed

  • 20% of this amount comes from our own budget; the remaining 80% (4,000 €) would be crowdfunded.
  • In return for your support, and depending on the amount you're willing to invest, there are various perks available – from signed copies of the book to limited art prints and more.
  • If this campaign ends short of 100% of the goal, we will use the accumulated total for a smaller print-run. Thus, your investment will serve a great purpose in any case.
  • If more than 100% of the campaign goal are coming in, the print-run will be expanded proportionately.

     

Risks & Challenges

There is virtually no financial risk to this project: the first edition will be printed, regardless of how much money will be gathered in this campaign. The idea is to be able to make a larger print-run, so as to reduce the cost per copy of the book – which makes it more attractive to buy for those who are interested in the subject.

Depending on how much money is gathered in this campaign, the following number of copies will be printed:

  • less than 1,000 €: 30 copies
  • 1,000 € to 2,000 €: 50 copies
  • 2,000 € to 3,000 €: 100 copies
  • more than 3,000 €: 150 copies
     

Sales & Distribution

The book will be distributed through regular book shops, at the Musée de cinéma et miniatures in Lyon/France, and in art and media outlets throughout Europe. Estimated selling price: 70 €

 

Other Ways You Can Help

In case you're unable to support this project financially, we would be very grateful if you spread the word about this campaign and share it with your contacts on social media or wherever.
Thank you so much – and sweet dreams!

story:
The Word Barn Story...

We’re one poet and two music fanatics who created a space to share and build community around our passion for both music and literature.

While our events are blessed with great response, and full audiences from both near and far, it is a passion project with little to no funds left over after the musicians, sound, insurance, etc. are paid.

We are able to cover half of the cost, and are hoping for your support to help get us to the finish line to purchase and install a professional sound system – which will both eliminate expensive rental costs, and free up floor space from temporary, bulky sound gear.

While not affordable in the past, an inhouse sound system will provide an opportunity to use microphones and/or sound for our literary and community events, like our Holiday Family Story Hour, as needed.

It will also allow us to feature a greater variety of music acts moving forward!

By eliminating rental costs, we can help keep ticket costs reasonable, continue to attract high-caliber acts to our space, and ensure high-quality sound to compliment The Word Barn listening room experience.

Best of all, a permanent sound system will be hung in the rafters – freeing up floor space currently occupied by temporary sound gear.

All donors, of any amount, will be recognized on a special thank you wall display in The Word Barn.

Thank you for your support - even if it's just helping to spread the word!

story:
Who We Are

I am a proud member of a  team comprised of individuals who bring their passion for creativity to the conception and realization of unique ideas in the fields of tarot/oracle art and tarot/oracle publishing. Each one of us is an established researcher/professional in their area, and in 2017 we decided to integrate our creative efforts into an enterprise that strives for inventiveness and novelty.  

We started the campaign for the Lenormand-Solitaire Set in order to finally achieve the realization of a great idea - the derivation of a unique Solitaire deck from the images of a traditional Lenormand card set, and the unlocking of the novel possibilities for readings residing in the particular combination.

What Does the Lenormand-Solitaire Set Contain

  • A 36-card Lenormand Deck
  • An 18-card Lenormand-Solitaire Deck
  • A Booklet with reading scenarios for practice purposes
  • A specially designed box

The Lenormand-Solitaire+ Edition additionally includes a beautiful table cloth that can be used for card spreads.

What Makes our Lenormand-Solitaire Set Unique

Our deck is no less exceptional in its attention to detail and the beauty of its illustrations than the most celebrated decks internationally. We strive passionately for artistry and quality, and we are particularly proud of the amazing illustrations of this deck.

What makes this deck truly unique is:

  • The innovative idea to generate an 18-card solitaire deck from the 36 images of its Lenormand counterpart
  • Each of the 18 Lenormand-Solitaire cards is comprised of four parts, and every such part carries a fragment from the images of the Lenormand deck
  • The possibilities arising from this innovative idea are intriguing since the particular layout of the Lenormand-Solitaire cards allows for multiple combination schemes - thus, for additional interpretations (watch the video below)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to let your friends know about this wonderful set!

story:
tête-à-tête

 

Es una revista en línea que publicó su "número 0" en enero del 2017, tras una colecta de tan solo $500, y público su último número en diciembre del año pasado.  Todo fue construido desde la base, y ha sido una tarea tan enriquecedora como demandante. Hemos completado doce ediciones, y, por lo pronto, aún nos esforzamos en lograr que sea un proyecto rentable. 

 

Albergamos centenas de imágenes referentes a distintas formas de arte y obras exclusivas; decenas de videos originales que retratan expresiones contemporáneas; por lo menos dos reseñas de libros locales por número; entrevistas a escritores internacionales; música por ser descubierta; y por lo menos un texto de creación único por cada edición.

 

Lo que puedes hacer tú, donante, es lograr que tête-à-tête deje de ser una quimera, y pueda consolidarse como una referencia sólida de manifestaciones culturales y un centro de difusión para artistas y escritores que buscan una manera más para exhibir sus creaciones.

 

Qué necesitamos y qué consigues

 

Con el dinero recaudado lograríamos costear un año más en circulación en redes sociales y el mantenimiento de nuestra página web. En este punto, gastaríamos alrededor de la mitad de los $4000.

Con una tercera parte esperamos compensar –de una manera mínima– a los artistas, creativos y escritores que hacen que tête-à-tête sea posible por un año más.

Con la quinta parte restante, esperamos costear gastos de producción original, que incluye un video y una portada mensual, con los gastos logísticos y tecnológicos que implica.

Finalmente, lo recaudado es una promesa y, humildemente, un reconocimiento. Esperamos entregar, en este nuevo año, más de lo que hemos ofrecido. Lo que habremos recaudado será una inversión, y no un presupuesto.

En función de lo alcanzado (si no lo es todo), publicaremos las ediciones que correspondan, reservando una parte para organizar una fiesta de cierre invitando a todos quienes han contribuido, de una manera u otra, con tête-à-tête (No los hemos olvidado, madres fundadoras). 

 

El impacto

 

Son pocos los medios locales –no subsidiados de alguna manera– los que logran existir publicando material artístico, literario y producción original; una voz independiente y singular se perdería si tête-à-tête dejara de existir. Ponemos mucho esfuerzo en difundir la creación de la estética local, ya sea pintura, fotografía, escultura, instalación, teatro, danza, escritura, y más. Pensamos que es más importante explorar la creación local que destacar coyunturas efímeras.

tête-à-tête no mide su resonancia por su popularidad; preferimos pensar en un logro personal: creamos una revista, y la sostuvimos por un año gracias a contribuciones económicas mínimas… ¿qué lograríamos con más?  

 

Riesgos y retos

 

Por supuesto, el mayor riesgo es perder lo ganado: una personalidad.  Nos hemos construido gracias a mucha amabilidad creativa, algo que se ha ido expandiendo al punto de agradecer la consideración deferente de artistas, creadores, y personas que nos ayudarían a consolidar el proyecto si tan solo lográramos crecer.

 

La realidad ha superado nuestras intenciones, pero nunca nos detuvo. Si alcanzáramos la sostenibilidad de nuestro proyecto, el futuro es promisorio, y creceríamos acorde al contenido.   

 

El mundo del internet nos impone retos que rebasan nuestra función creadora; sin duda este aspecto es uno de los que debemos atender más de prisa. Pero, tanto como muestra desafíos, también permite soluciones. Nuestra inversión en el mantenimiento de la página web debe pasar por una revisión de nuestra accesibilidad y capacidad de interacción con nuestro público. 

 

Otras maneras de ayudar

 

Difunde la palabra: invita a tus conocidos a ver tête-à-tête y envíanos tus sugerencias.  Si eres escritor, artista o fotógrafo (o simplemente tienes la duda de serlo) envíanos tu obra y permítenos comentártela.

Y si has sido tan amable como para haber leído todo esto, ¡ya no es mucho pedir que lo compartas!

Es una revista en línea que publicó su "número 0" en enero del 2017, tras una colecta de tan solo $500, y público su último número en diciembre del año pasado.  Todo fue construido desde la base, y ha sido una tarea tan enriquecedora como demandante. Hemos completado doce ediciones, y, por lo pronto, aún nos esforzamos en lograr que sea un proyecto rentable. 
 
Albergamos centenas de imágenes referentes a distintas formas de arte y obras exclusivas; decenas de videos originales que retratan expresiones contemporáneas; por lo menos dos reseñas de libros locales por número; entrevistas a escritores internacionales; música por ser descubierta; y por lo menos un texto de creación único por cada edición.
 
Lo que puedes hacer tú, donante, es lograr que tête-à-tête deje de ser una quimera, y pueda consolidarse como una referencia sólida de manifestaciones culturales y un centro de difusión para artistas y escritores que buscan una manera más para exhibir sus creaciones.
 

Qué necesitamos y qué consigues
 
Con el dinero recaudado lograríamos costear un año más en circulación en redes sociales y el mantenimiento de nuestra página web. En este punto, gastaríamos alrededor de la mitad de los $4000.
Con una tercera parte esperamos compensar –de una manera mínima– a los artistas, creativos y escritores que hacen que tête-à-tête sea posible por un año más.
Con la quinta parte restante, esperamos costear gastos de producción original, que incluye un video y una portada mensual, con los gastos logísticos y tecnológicos que implica.
Finalmente, lo recaudado es una promesa y, humildemente, un reconocimiento. Esperamos entregar, en este nuevo año, más de lo que hemos ofrecido. Lo que habremos recaudado será una inversión, y no un presupuesto.
En función de lo alcanzado (si no lo es todo), publicaremos las ediciones que correspondan, reservando una parte para organizar una fiesta de cierre invitando a todos quienes han contribuido, de una manera u otra, con tête-à-tête (No los hemos olvidado, madres fundadoras). 
 

El impacto
 
Son pocos los medios locales –no subsidiados de alguna manera– los que logran existir publicando material artístico, literario y producción original; una voz independiente y singular se perdería si tête-à-tête dejara de existir. Ponemos mucho esfuerzo en difundir la creación de la estética local, ya sea pintura, fotografía, escultura, instalación, teatro, danza, escritura, y más. Pensamos que es más importante explorar la creación local que destacar coyunturas efímeras.
tête-à-tête no mide su resonancia por su popularidad; preferimos pensar en un logro personal: creamos una revista, y la sostuvimos por un año gracias a contribuciones económicas mínimas… ¿qué lograríamos con más?  
 

Riesgos y retos
 
Por supuesto, el mayor riesgo es perder lo ganado: una personalidad.  Nos hemos construido gracias a mucha amabilidad creativa, algo que se ha ido expandiendo al punto de agradecer la consideración deferente de artistas, creadores, y personas que nos ayudarían a consolidar el proyecto si tan solo lográramos crecer.
 

La realidad ha superado nuestras intenciones, pero nunca nos detuvo. Si alcanzáramos la sostenibilidad de nuestro proyecto, el futuro es promisorio, y creceríamos acorde al contenido.   

 
El mundo del internet nos impone retos que rebasan nuestra función creadora; sin duda este aspecto es uno de los que debemos atender más de prisa. Pero, tanto como muestra desafíos, también permite soluciones. Nuestra inversión en el mantenimiento de la página web debe pasar por una revisión de nuestra accesibilidad y capacidad de interacción con nuestro público. 

 
Otras maneras de ayudar
 
Difunde la palabra: invita a tus conocidos a ver  tête-à-tête y envíanos tus sugerencias.  Si eres escritor, artista o fotógrafo (o simplemente tienes la duda de serlo) envíanos tu obra y permítenos comentártela.
Y si has sido tan amable como para haber leído todo esto, ¡ya no es mucho pedir que lo compartas!

story:
Problem

Solution

A deck of 365 ways to form a deeper connection with people!

Mission

To form deeper connections (especially for people who feel disconnected) using the box of 365 conversation starting cards that encourage people share vulnerably

The Product

I've created 365 original, hand illustrated quote cards with conversation starting questions on the back meant to inspire deep conversations. Each card is 4.25 x 2.25 inches printed on card stock and put together in a box.

The Project

The project involves me buying a van and living in it while I travel the entire continental United States for 365 days and visit 200 plus destinations. Every day will be dedicated to a card where I will interview people with the meaningful conversation starting question and I'll record the audio & video of the conversations. 

Marketing

I've created an Instagram account with 12,300 followers and I've connected with over 200 people individually who have committed to buying a deck of cards.

About Audrey & The Story Behind the Project....

I’m Audrey Phillips—a twenty-four year old graduate from Bowdoin College with a degree in Earth & Oceanographic Science and Education. I grew up in Seattle, WA and am an avid doodler, outdoor enthusiast, and aspiring therapist. I’m the youngest of four siblings, which fostered my ability to be an observer and empathetic listener from a young age—I’ve been told time after time that listening to others is my greatest strength and I’ve continued to foster my listening abilities throughout my different job experiences as a guide in the outdoors.

I worked as a wilderness therapy guide in Durango, CO where I took at-risk students ages 13 to 29 years old backpacking for eight days in the Utah desert—and my favorite part of the job was creating emotionally safe spaces for students to share their incredibly powerful stories with such vulnerability and strength. I used these 365 Meaningful Conversation Cards in the field with students was blown away by the conversations I was able to stimulate with students—for example, a group of 18-20 year old men talked about their relationship with their body image and the difficulties around “being a man,” yet wanting to be feminine as well. That’s just one of many vulnerable conversations that was sparked and I learned that humans crave a space to connect deeply, yet the space is very rarely opened up. Overall, my professional experiences allowed me to practice holding space for people sharing vulnerably and listening with an open mind & heart.

I’ve also learned in my personal life the power of sharing vulnerably. The biggest struggle I’ve endured in my life is being sexually assaulted right before heading to college and I didn’t tell anyone about my story for years—instead I sat alone in silence and shame, until my last year of college when I took a leap of vulnerability and wrote about my experience with sexual assault for my college newspaper. I felt exposed, raw and nervous when it was sent all across my campus, but I ended up receiving so many messages from people I’d never even met before telling me that my story was courageous and let others feel less alone. It was a turning point for me—I realized that sharing vulnerably opened me up to connect deeply with others as my authentic self, instead of hiding part of me. After that experience I knew that my calling in the world was to create a way for others to share vulnerably and connect deeply.

story:
** WE HIT $5,600!! -- with the help of some behind-the-scenes, tax-deductible donations.)

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

  • We're bringing VR training and equipment to artists in Oaxaca.
  • This is important for three reasons: (1) this is a ground-breaking new artistic medium; (2) the equipment is pretty damn expensive; and (3) we don't want just rich people making VR...
  • There are some pretty amazing rewards here, so you should check probably check those out.
  • If you would prefer your donation to be tax deductible, please contact me directly: info@flatsitter.com

ABOUT ME / FLATSITTER

  • My name is Kyle and I'm the art director for a collective called FLATSITTER. I'm trying to inject some blood into virtual reality.
  • Backed in 2017, I raised funds to tour a mobile VR gallery across North America. That was wild. I delivered over 30,000 experiences to folks at: Moogfest, Satellite Art Show, Burning Man, Desert Daze Festival, Music Box Village, Ace Hotels in Portland / LA / NYC / Pittsburgh; Electric Eclectics Festival, Silo City, Satellite Art Show in Miami Beach, and about 100 other stops in between. The bus now lives in Landers, California with Aimee and Colin. You can go visit: http://thedreamwanderer.com

MY EXPERIENCES WITH OAXACA

Here's a quick recounting of my sordid love affair with Oaxaca:

  • As part of my North American bus tour, I drove down into Mexico in January 2017 to engage with Mexican audiences and to escape being in the US for the inauguration out of sheer embarrassment.
  • On a whim, I stopped in Oaxaca City and fell in looooove.
  • In fact, I fell so hard that I went back in July 2017 for an artist residency at Obracadobra (http://www.obracadobra.com). During this residency, I created a VR experience called "Las Olas" -- I call it a life cycle fever dream, and it features photography and voice from Lizette Flores (Oax) and music from Cages (Buffalo) and is in both Spanish and English.
  • I then went back to my bus lifestyle and came back to Oaxaca in October 2017 to exhibit "Las Olas" at San Pablo -- a 16th century Dominican convent turned arts space.
  • I'm planning on heading back this June to work with a team of artists to produce a new VR piece that is going to be dark and scary and intense and is giving me nightmares already. I'm hoping to premiere this piece during Dia de los Muertos 2018, and to leave the piece running to generate additional revenue for this new lab.

$$$ STUFF

  • (2) Computer w/ beefed up GPU @ $1500
  • (2) VR Headset @ $400
  • (2) Subpac M2 @ $300
  • (2) Headphones @ $40
  • Travel / Accommodation: $1,200
  • Commercial Lease (3 months trial): $2100

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

  • Maybe you can share this campaign on your social things?
  • Maybe you know someone at Oculus / HTC / Nvidia that can get us a discount on things?

REVIEWS FOR "LAS OLAS" MY SPANISH/ENGLISH VR EXPERIENCE THAT I PRODUCED AND PREMIERED IN OAX

  • (Apologies for the typos from transcribing. You can see original, written reviews here: https://photos.app.goo.gl/DjWlZxQZyopkSsvG2

  • "¡Me gusta mucho! Fue una experiencia diferente pero increíble, hay momentos de relajación, angustia miedo, diferentes sensaciones en un solo momento. Mas dinámicas asi! :)".

    "El viaje, la transportación, subir, penetrar, estremecimiento. Angustia. Estallido en soles planetarios, negro amenaza de muerte, pero la muerte no existe. El naranja siempre vence al sueño del soñador!"

    "Fue algo genial. Me pareció algo de otro mundo, sentí diferentes sensaciones, y un poco de miedo, felicidad, sorpresa y hasta tranquilidad. Pienso que todos deberían vivir esto al menos una vez en su vida. Excelente trabajo, digno de presentar."

    "Una experiencia definitivamente emotiva y propositiva, la música, la fotografía, la poesía un todo increíble que mueve los sentidos y por momentos te transporta a sucesos, detalles, circunstancias en las que el proceso ocurre. Me encantó."

    "Gracias por ponerme en un mundo onírico, visceral, extraterrestre/terrestre -- entering into and emerging from... Me entregué al viaje y los disfruté mucho."

"¡Me gusta mucho! Fue una experiencia diferente pero increíble, hay momentos de relajación, angustia miedo, diferentes sensaciones en un solo momento. Mas dinámicas asi! :)".
"El viaje, la transportación, subir, penetrar, estremecimiento. Angustia. Estallido en soles planetarios, negro amenaza de muerte, pero la muerte no existe. El naranja siempre vence al sueño del soñador!"
"Fue algo genial. Me pareció algo de otro mundo, sentí diferentes sensaciones, y un poco de miedo, felicidad, sorpresa y hasta tranquilidad. Pienso que todos deberían vivir esto al menos una vez en su vida. Excelente trabajo, digno de presentar."
"Una experiencia definitivamente emotiva y propositiva, la música, la fotografía, la poesía un todo increíble que mueve los sentidos y por momentos te transporta a sucesos, detalles, circunstancias en las que el proceso ocurre. Me encantó."
"Gracias por ponerme en un mundo onírico, visceral, extraterrestre/terrestre -- entering into and emerging from... Me entregué al viaje y los disfruté mucho."

story:
Dear Friends

I've created new print editions of five recent drawings and hope with the sale of these prints to raise the funds to cover the production cost of my next body of fibre-based art works.

As many of you know I've spent the last fifteen years working to establish myself within the Canadian and international art communities. I'm grateful for the exhibition opportunities I've had and very excited about the recent direction my art practice has taken. In contributing to this fundraiser your support  will come at a vital time for me as these new textile works represent my most ambitious effort yet in every respect. With your purchase of a print I will be able to achieve my goals for this coming year and to significantly build upon my recent success.

While we've been locked down over the last few months  I've been productively making drawings for this print edition (images of which you can see below) and preparing the drawings, designs and digital files for my textile-works. These works will be an extension of the rugs seen in the attached video and images below. It's my intention however for these new pieces to be wall works rather than rugs this time.


Each of the five prints created for this fundraiser is an edition of twenty, signed and numbered on German etching paper, size 29" x 22" and priced at $475 CDN each ($350 USD)

All funds raised for this project will go directly to production expenses, which I hope to start in fall.

 

 

 

Southbank #1, pigment print on German etching paper 29" x 22" 2020

 

 

Ihoan,  pigment print on German etching paper 29" x 22" 2020

 

 

Brasilia,  pigment print on German etching paper 29" x 22" 2020

 

 

Southbank #5,  pigment print on German etching paper 29" x 22" 2020

 

 

At Night All Cats Are Grey,  pigment print on German etching paper 29" x 22" 2020

 

Portfolio editions of 2-5 works are also available 

2 works - $900 CDN      ($665 USD)
3 works - $1350 CDN   ($995USD)
4 works - $1750 CDN   ($1290 USD)
5 works - $ 2200 CDN   ($1620 USD)


Free shipping within Canada

 

Grands Ensemble 1.1 and 1.2 hand-dyed, hand-tufted and hand-carved 100% New Zealand, for for Urban Fabric, Shanghai.

story:
Short Summary

The "Stations of the Cross" are traditionally a series of art pieces chronicling 14 of the last events leading to Jesus' death. They are meant to help us get a fuller understanding of Jesus' suffering on Good Friday. I've been drawing and animating Christian mandalas, which I've found to be helpful in Christian meditation. I think the Christian Church needs more relevant multi-media to help it compete with the emotional power of secular modern media.

There are a couple of reasons to do this project as an IndieGoGo. As an IndieGoGo I can begin marketing and selling the mandalas before they are all completed, which gives us adequate time to spread awareness by Good Friday 2020. It also makes a good IndieGoGo project because it will help to have donations to fund this project, as I will have to prioritize this over other paying projects. And also because perhaps this is a cause you would want to support!

What You'll get

  • By funding the project at any level you'll be allowing me to make a video to give away for free to any church, group, or individual to watch on Good Friday, 2020. The video would be a little over an hour, and would be meant to deepen our understanding of Jesus' suffering through meditative, rich animation.  
  • You can purchase one, some, or all of the Stations in poster form. They would be printed on 13"x19" thick paper. I will send them to you as posters in a poster tube with hanging instructions.
  • You can buy the rights to print them on your own.
  • Note: these are the Biblical stations of the cross endorsed by Pope John Paul II in 1991, rather than the traditional stations.

story:
Our Launch

 

Eco-friendly Artwork for Your Body!

 

Towels featuring original Aboriginal & Torres Strait Artwork from Far North Qld, based in the tropics of Northern Australia.

 

Deakin Beach Art Australia

10% of all sale proceeds go directly to the artists.
 

Deakin Beach Art is a growing company based in the tropics of northern Australia. Formed in 2015 we produce beach and leisure products that feature artwork by award-winning Australian artists. Our current release which we are seeking funds for is the launch of a new range of environmentally friendly towels featuring stunning original Indigenous artwork that has been signed by the artists.

The featured artists Heather Koowootha and Glen Mackie (Kei Kalak) are renowned Australian artists, making these towels truly ‘Artwork for your Body’®

Made from our exclusive super-soft earth-friendly Envirosuede ™ fabric we think our towels will be one of the most luxurious towels on the market.

Featuring a double-sided print, our towels are 80% made from recycled plastic bottles. They are quick-drying, super absorbent, lightweight, sand-free, super-soft on your skin, and good for the planet.

Perfect for everyday use or the world traveler.

These pieces of art are not just for the beach but look great in the bathroom or as a decorative throw.

Our towels not only look good, but they are practical too. The antimicrobial fabric makes them great for the gym or car and your fur babies will love them too. 

All artworks featured on our products are ethically sourced and licensed through formal licensing agreements.

10% of all sale proceeds go directly to the artists.

Deakin Beach Art Australia is a member of the Indigenous Art Code.

More information on the artists can be viewed at our website www.deakinbeachart.com.au

 

 

What we need
 

Our towels are fully developed and ready for production. We need $68k AUS to purchase our first stock order. Included in this sum is the cost of stock, the 10% royalty on all Perk orders to the artists for their original, authentic artwork, a small contingency for some promotion in multiple mediums and website upgrade, and contribution to postage costs.

If we fall short of our entire fund-raising goal, we will allocate the funds we have raised to our stock, artist commissions, and postage costs. Any shortfall will be covered by our company. All funding participants will receive the towels specified in our Perks.

 


The Impact

 

We have a great range of products but our mission doesn’t end there. With your help we also aim to;

  • Support and promote Australian Indigenous and contemporary artists
  • Be environmentally friendly
  • Work with the Endeavour Foundation of QLD who provide employment for people with disabilities

 

Aboriginal and Torres Strait art is one of the oldest ongoing art traditions in the world. This unique art is expressed in many mediums often encompassing the re-telling of inherited myths and legendary stories.

We believe it is artwork of great breadth and depth and that our exclusive Envirosuede™ fabric provides a great platform to showcase our award-winning artists. Your contribution helps support this important art form as well as getting you a towel that not only looks and feels great but is also practical.

We have worked hard to make our products environmentally friendly. Our luxurious Envirosuede™ towels are 80% made from recycled plastic bottles. They are quick-drying, super absorbent, lightweight, antimicrobial, sand-free, soft on your skin, and good for the planet.

We have also partnered with the Endeavour Foundation QLD for the processing of all our orders. Endeavour has a seventy-year history of providing help and opportunity for people with disabilities and we are proud to be associated with this important organisation. Our towel range is the second release from Deakin Beach Art Australia. We successfully launched our range of Indigenous art flip flops in 2016. We know the whole process from concept, artist liaison, product development, manufacture, promotion, sales, and distribution. You can check-out our flip-flop range on our website www.deakinbeachart.com.au

It takes a lot to get a new product ready for release. We’ve been meticulous in our attention to detail and believe our towels are unique in design and construction. However, we are a small company and your support is invaluable in these expensive final stages of product release. Our goal is to extend our range and work collaboratively with contemporary Australian artists in the future.

 


Risks and Challenges
 

Our towels are fully developed and ready for commercial sale so in that regard, we don’t face the risks associated with a product still in development. Our challenge will be to penetrate the online marketplace, particularly in this post-Covid environment. To help solve this we have assembled an experienced team with wide-ranging skills covering website design, social media use and influencers, still and video production, graphic art design, and of course our uber-talented artists. We believe that between our experienced teams' hard work, our stunning products, and help from people like you that we are well placed to successfully launch the new towel range.

 

Other Ways You Can Help
 

As mentioned above our challenge is to get the word out about our great products. You can help!

Let your friends and social media contacts know of Deakin Beach Art Australia.

Write us a review, post a photo of you and your experience with your new towel on our Instagram page, check out our artists and their stories. Use the Indiegogo share tool too!

 

 

 

What You Get  - THE PERKS

 

We have five  levels of support, Active, Chillin’ Party, Chillin’ x 2 and Party x 2;

 

Active : For $49 AUS you get a ‘Active Towel’ (100cm x 50cm) of your choice from our full range delivered to your door. Valued at $55.

(Postage is free in Aust and $15 AUD anywhere else in the world)

 

Chillin’: For $95 AUS you get a ‘Chillin’ Towel’ (160cm x 80cm) of your choice from our full range PLUS a FREE matching  ‘Active Towel’ all delivered to your door (valued at $150). (Postage is free in Aust and $15 AUD anywhere else in the world)

 

Party: For $155 AUS you get a double size ‘Party Towel’ (160cm x 160cm) of your choice from our full range PLUS a FREE matching ‘Active Towel’ all delivered to your door (valued at $210).  (Postage is free in Aust and $15 AUD anywhere else in the world)

 

Chillin’ x 2: For $167 AUS you  get a  'Chillin’Towel' (160cm x 80cm) of your choice from our full range PLUS a FREE matching  'Active Towel' (100cm x 50cm) PLUS a SECOND 'Chillin’ Towel' of your choice at a 25% DISCOUNT (valued at $245)  (Postage is free in Aust and $30 AUD anywhere else in the world)

 

Party x 2 : For $271 AUS you  get a double-sized 'Party  Towel' (160cm x 160cm) of your choice from our full range PLUS a FREE matching 'Active Towel' (100cm x 50cm) PLUS a SECOND 'Party Towel' of your choice at a 25% DISCOUNT(valued at $365) (Postage is free in Aust and $30AUD anywhere else in the world)

 
 
 
 

Towel Designs

 

Upon choosing the perk you wish to support, you will also need to choose the towel design you would like, sizes shown in the images below are as follows:

  • Party Towel - Extra Large (160cm x 160cm)
  • Chillin' Towel - Towel (160cm x 80cm)
  • Active - Towel Small (100cm x 50cm)
story_txt:
Our Launch Eco-friendly Artwork for Your Body! Towels featuring original Aboriginal & Torres Strait Artwork from Far North Qld, based in the tropics of Northern Australia. Deakin Beach Art Australia10% of all sale proceeds go directly to the artists. Deakin Beach Art is a growing company based in the tropics of northern Australia. Formed in 2015 we produce beach and leisure products that feature artwork by award-winning Australian artists. Our current release which we are seeking funds for is the launch of a new range of environmentally friendly towels featuring stunning original Indigenous artwork that has been signed by the artists.The featured artists Heather Koowootha and Glen Mackie (Kei Kalak) are renowned Australian artists, making these towels truly ‘Artwork for your Body’®Made from our exclusive super-soft earth-friendly Envirosuede ™ fabric we think our towels will be one of the most luxurious towels on the market.Featuring a double-sided print, our towels are 80% made from recycled plastic bottles. They are quick-drying, super absorbent, lightweight, sand-free, super-soft on your skin, and good for the planet.Perfect for everyday use or the world traveler.These pieces of art are not just for the beach but look great in the bathroom or as a decorative throw.Our towels not only look good, but they are practical too. The antimicrobial fabric makes them great for the gym or car and your fur babies will love them too. All artworks featured on our products are ethically sourced and licensed through formal licensing agreements.10% of all sale proceeds go directly to the artists.Deakin Beach Art Australia is a member of the Indigenous Art Code.More information on the artists can be viewed at our website www.deakinbeachart.com.au  What we need Our towels are fully developed and ready for production. We need $68k AUS to purchase our first stock order. Included in this sum is the cost of stock, the 10% royalty on all Perk orders to the artists for their original, authentic artwork, a small contingency for some promotion in multiple mediums and website upgrade, and contribution to postage costs.If we fall short of our entire fund-raising goal, we will allocate the funds we have raised to our stock, artist commissions, and postage costs. Any shortfall will be covered by our company. All funding participants will receive the towels specified in our Perks. 
The Impact We have a great range of products but our mission doesn’t end there. With your help we also aim to;
Support and promote Australian Indigenous and contemporary artists
Be environmentally friendly
Work with the Endeavour Foundation of QLD who provide employment for people with disabilities
 Aboriginal and Torres Strait art is one of the oldest ongoing art traditions in the world. This unique art is expressed in many mediums often encompassing the re-telling of inherited myths and legendary stories.We believe it is artwork of great breadth and depth and that our exclusive Envirosuede™ fabric provides a great platform to showcase our award-winning artists. Your contribution helps support this important art form as well as getting you a towel that not only looks and feels great but is also practical.We have worked hard to make our products environmentally friendly. Our luxurious Envirosuede™ towels are 80% made from recycled plastic bottles. They are quick-drying, super absorbent, lightweight, antimicrobial, sand-free, soft on your skin, and good for the planet.We have also partnered with the Endeavour Foundation QLD for the processing of all our orders. Endeavour has a seventy-year history of providing help and opportunity for people with disabilities and we are proud to be associated with this important organisation. Our towel range is the second release from Deakin Beach Art Australia. We successfully launched our range of Indigenous art flip flops in 2016. We know the whole process from concept, artist liaison, product development, manufacture, promotion, sales, and distribution. You can check-out our flip-flop range on our website www.deakinbeachart.com.auIt takes a lot to get a new product ready for release. We’ve been meticulous in our attention to detail and believe our towels are unique in design and construction. However, we are a small company and your support is invaluable in these expensive final stages of product release. Our goal is to extend our range and work collaboratively with contemporary Australian artists in the future. 
Risks and Challenges Our towels are fully developed and ready for commercial sale so in that regard, we don’t face the risks associated with a product still in development. Our challenge will be to penetrate the online marketplace, particularly in this post-Covid environment. To help solve this we have assembled an experienced team with wide-ranging skills covering website design, social media use and influencers, still and video production, graphic art design, and of course our uber-talented artists. We believe that between our experienced teams' hard work, our stunning products, and help from people like you that we are well placed to successfully launch the new towel range. Other Ways You Can Help As mentioned above our challenge is to get the word out about our great products. You can help!Let your friends and social media contacts know of Deakin Beach Art Australia.Write us a review, post a photo of you and your experience with your new towel on our Instagram page, check out our artists and their stories. Use the Indiegogo share tool too!

Valued at $55.(Postage is free in Aust and $15 AUD anywhere else in the world) Chillin’: For $95 AUS you get a ‘Chillin’ Towel’ (160cm x 80cm) of your choice from our full range PLUS a FREE matching  ‘Active Towel’ all delivered to your door (valued at $150). story:
Who I am 

Hi! My name is Melanie and I'm a German-Filipina visual artist, currently based on Boracay Island in the Philippines. My journey has taken me to many places: I was born in Germany, grew up in Spain, studied in the UK, lived and taught art in Thailand and the US, and just recently moved back to my home base in the Philippines.

Through my art practice, I try to explore local and forgotten histories using overlooked surfaces. I am a painter by training, known for my use of driftwood found on the shores of the Philippine islands. 

Over the past few years, I've been particularly interested in the cultural links and shared history of Mexico and the Philippines via the galleon trade. 

Check out my recent work on this topic on my website: http://www.gritzkadelvillar.com/

 which leads to....

 

The reason for this crowdfunding campaign!

I'm super excited to share with you that I am one of only two artists (out of more than 200 applicants!) who has been one of two artists selected to do an artist-in-residence program at the Leonora Carrington Museum in San Luís Potosí in Mexico this fall! 

This is an amazing and once-in-a-lifetime opportunity for me to spend three months (from mid August to mid November this year) at the Leonora Carrington Museum to develop a research-based art project. 

My time at the museum will culminate with a solo exhibition of my works and findings in one of the museums temporary exhibition spaces. The exhibition will launch in November 2019 and will run until February 2020.

See some images of the museum: 

 

 

as well as the space designated to my exhibition:

 

What the Project is about

Using the museum as base to work from, I will be able to explore some of the old mining towns in and around San Luís Potosí. These mining towns formed part of the old trade routes between Spain, Mexico and the Philippines. I want to visit some of these "ghost towns" and see how the gold and silver mining industry has impacted the remaining local communities. 

What traces remain of the mining industry in the local community? What remains of the indigenous cultures today and in what form? 

It will be interesting to uncover a more local and indigenous voice in contrast to the "official" history.

 

Project goal

The goal of my project is to work together with the local communities to help give visual expression and a voice to some of their personal as well as mythological stories they may have from the past. The final exhibition will most likely be in the form of an art installation, mixed media works, and have a video component.

Moreover, as part of the residency, I will be able to share my findings and process with the public in the form of an artist talk at the museum. 

This is ever so exciting!!

This residency is really a dream come true: it will allow me to work on the ground with local communities, gather important data on my research topic, and develop my own art practice within the beautiful setting of the museum whilst getting inspired by Leonora Carrington's works!

 

The Catch

However: the reality of executing a 3-month long art project involves quite a bit of money. This is because, although the museum offers me accommodation during my stay, I will still need to cover all the other expenses for the time I'm in Mexico as well as all production costs of the final exhibition.

This means, I can only carry out my project with your help :) 

Moreover, time is short!!- August is less than 2 months away - and I have to gather sufficient funds beforehand, so let's make this happen!! We've got 30 days to gather funds :)

 

Expenses I need to cover to make my project happen


Roundtrip airfare from Boracay Island (via Manila) to San Luís Potosí (via Mexico City): ~$2,500

Living expenses for three months (food and basic living costs ):~$3,500

Transportation to and from the mining towns, in and around San Luís Potosí: ~$600

Art materials (paper, brushes, canvas, gesso, paint, etc): ~$1,000

Production of limited edition of lithographs/etchings within the museum: ~$1,500

Further expenses: travel and health insurance, emergency medical expense, potential framing of works, accommodation in Mexico City before and after the residency, translator, video camera, rental of projectors, external hard drives, sound recording and potential postproduction/editing of video footage:  ~$5,500

Total: ~$14,600

This is the ideal target.  (NB: ca 15% of this total will be deducted by Indiegogo as platform, transaction, and bank fees)

I'd like to ask you for contributions in any amount towards the actualization of this dream. Seriously: any and every little support will help!  NO DONATION IS TOO SMALL! 

Also, any amount exceeding my target will be used for further development of the project back in Manila.

 

What you will get in return for your support:

I will send you a personal THANK YOU note via email, whatever the amount of your contribution!

I will be making updates on social media, sharing the process and journey with all my supporters.

To further entice you to contribute, I've got some really amazing perks you can claim as Thank You! 

 

In case I do not reach my target budget:

All funds will nevertheless go to the realisation of the project. I will try and adjust the project to whatever amount of funding I will have at the end of this campaign. I am good at working with what I've got, so I can guarantee the result will be innovative, even if production funding is low.

 

The Impact

Again, the residency program is an incredible opportunity and an absolute honour for me to take part in. Not only will the project allow me to explore the local history, collaborate with the local communities of San Luís Potosí, and create innovative art works on the topic, I also hope that the research will have a much more far-reaching impact further down the line, in developing the cultural ties between Mexico and the Philippines.

 

Risks & Challenges

As with any art project based on community collaboration in a foreign country, much will depend on the kind of input I will be able to get from the peoples of San Luís Potosí. However, given my extensive teaching experience I am confident in my own ability to reach out and work with people from all walks of life. I have experience in conducting art workshops and have successfully completed and executed a community project in India in 2016 (see here: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/grit-in-mumbai/

Moreover, since I will be working with and through the staff of the Leonora Carrington, I am confident that together we will be able to solve any logistical challenges that may arise.

I am also counting on the help of the Philippine Embassy in Mexico City to help with the promotion of the project.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I value and truly appreciate any form of support. If you cannot contribute to the funding scheme, I would be very happy if you could help spread the word of my project initiative via email, social media and of course, the Indiegogo share tools!

 

THANK YOU SO MUCH, 

 

Melanie Gritzka del Villar

----------

story:
JOIN US!

This artbook project originally started as an artzine where I was hoping to team up with a few artists from Germany to create a collection of illustrations and to donate the profit to charity. It ended up growing more internationally than I ever expected and I love to see that people care! There are many things that can be donated such as time and compassion, so along with 38 artists, we put a lot of effort in creating a collection of illustrations to the topic of dream for you.

Help us raise some funds for children's education and get some beautiful art in exchange for your contribution!
 

What We Need & What You Get

Select a bundle of your choice and get one of the respective rewards send to you at the end of the funding/preorder period. Our main goal is to sell the physical artbook and cover the production cost. Our second goal is, of course, to raise as much funding as possible and to have enough profit to donate.

We aim to print 150 copies, along with extra merchandise (amount might be adjusted depending on funding):

 

The Book of Dreams  
Softcover, DIN A4, 48 pages in full color with 35 illustrations from artists around the globe incl. artist comments.

The Digital Zine
Pdf version with additional illustrations and artists (total of 40 illustrations from 38 artists).

Digital Merch 
5 desktop wallpapers + 8 mobile wallpapers by Cirno Avery, Yuuchi Ng, Keizumi and Yuli + 1 Timelapse Video of artwork process by Mayte.

Poster 
DIN A4, doublesided, total of 4 motives from the artbook i.a. from Dinh Diep (see preview pic)

Postcard
DIN A6, pearlescent/nacre embellished, 3 different motives from the artbook i.a. from 360AYA (see preview pic).

Acrylic Charms
Holographic effect, with keychain, 5 motives to the theme of 'FISH'from L.unarT, Raining Color Design, Risu, Ro & Su.

 

***Please note that shipping fees and time varies depending on your bundle choice and country of residence. I will send out everything from Germany.***
 

The Impact

We want to help poor children in the mountainous regions in Vietnam to get an opportunity to receive education. Roughly $100 USD can grant one child a scholarship of 16 months. It may be just one child but for this child their life will change and the more we raise the more children we can help.

For more information about what impact donations to BetoAji Foundation can make please visit the respective website or contact me for a breakdown of the relevant numbers.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

No money to afford a bundle? No problem, spreading the word, sharing this project with your family and friends is also a way to help! You can also follow us on social media (Twitter/FB/Website) to show some support :)

Not interested in the artbook but in the cause? You can also make direct donations to BetoAji Foundation or make a contribution without choosing a bundle. Get more information through our website or contact me through l.unart@yahoo.com


My Story & Motivation :)

I was born and raised as a child to Vietnamese immigrants who came to this foreign country as contract workers decades ago. Starting a new life with almost nothing, they had to earn a living through heavy manual labor. My parents wanted to make sure we children get to live a better life with less hardship than they had had so they always put our education first and I couldn't be more grateful for that. 

Years later, with amazing educational opportunities that were possible thanks to scholarships that I received along the way and great people and mentors that I met, I got to learn about foreign cultures and people, lived in different countries in the world and I now hold university degrees that will ensure me a stable future. 

This project is combining my hobby of creating art with my wish to help other children with less opportunities to receive education, so that they can build a future for themselves. While I lived in Japan, through some friends I joined events of Betoaji where we raised funds for children in Vietnam, the home country of my parents. I chose to donate the profit of this project to this particular organization because it targets intercultural exchange on the one side and provides access to education on the other side. I wanted to be sure that even if we only gather a small amount of funds, our contribution could make an impact and reach the children for sure.

I wanted to be sure that even if we only gather a small amount of funds, our contribution could make an impact and reach the children for sure.

story:
Artastic is an artbook with a cause: it wants to help undiscovered artists shine. 

 

By supporting this project, you'll help more than 90 creators bring their work into the world. 

 

Hi, my name is Hitomi, or Blizz-Mii, founder and organizer of the Artastic Art Books.

Any artist knows that it's a long ride up the popularity ladder. A lot of artists remain pretty much undiscovered, despite being very talented.

Artastic began with a simple mission: to help undiscovered artists get more exposure. It combines popular and lesser known artists into a single production.

The first book was successfully funded on Kickstarter and released last year, in 2016. (Thanks, everyone!!) Artastic: First Love is the second book in the series, and if all goes well, it will continue Artastic's mission to help undiscovered artists shine!

 

Do you remember your first love?

 

First love is something that many people hold dear. It evokes a diversity of strong emotions and memories. In this book, you’ll be able to immerse yourself in the many experiences of first love.

 

Artastic: First Love is an anthology of art, stories, and manga that will tug at your heartstrings. :) 

 

Content

  • 90+ pages
  • 38 full page art pieces
  • 3 short stories (~5 pages each)
  • 3 short manga (~5 to 15 pages each)
  • 4 pages with 4 art pieces
  • 2 pages with 16 art pieces
  • 4 pages of "My First Love” blurbs by artists
  • 90+ artists (expected)

Specs

  • A4 size
  • Softcover, perfect bound
  • Matte cover

Tentative Release Date: April 2018

 

 

 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge will be on the artists and writers completing their works (especially the mangas -- those can take some time). I'm also thinking of using Amazon FBA, which will be a new frontier for me.

I've gone through the actual production of books a couple of times, though, so that should be relatively straightforward. I am working with the same manufacturing company as well.

The previous Artastic book was completed on schedule, so hopefully this book will too!

 

Disclaimers

* Full disclosure: I am a friend of LGBTQ and encourage the artists in this book to draw/write whatever orientation they wish, as long as it remains PG-13. (There will be no explicit adult content in this book.) If this offends you, please navigate away. I really appreciate you for looking anyway!

* That said, the artists aren’t asked to “represent” any orientation. So please don’t take offense if there isn’t enough representation. I don’t want to impose a quota and limit artists' creativity.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by sharing our project on social media!

We're on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. :)

 

Thank you for reading!

story:
Short Summary

Hello old and new friends.  Do you want to get cool stuff while helping an artist out?  My name is Elizabeth Pattie and I am an emerging artist from Kamloops, BC.  My artistic practice uses marionettes and stop frame animation to create video work that explores memory, nostalgia, and relationships.  I am raising funds to purchase a new computer.  I would like to continue the video work I began in my BFA but my current computer cannot support video editing software and, as an emerging artist, I cannot afford to replace it.  I am fundraising to purchase a new computer and the editing equipment needed to make more videos.  This is very important for my artistic practice so I may create more work to exhibit during my emerging years.  Once I have a strong body of work I will activity apply for exhibitions and expand my portfolio. 

You may view my current work at 

www.elizabethwarnerartist.com


What We Need & What You Get

I am looking to raise $2000.  $1600 will go towards a mac desktop computer and $400 will go towards video editing software.

Here's the perks:

  • $25 donation - 5 piece marionette coaster set
  • $50 donation - 5 piece marionette coaster set and a dvd of my BFA video work "Nicholas" (only 5 available)
  • $100 donation - your choice of a small (7 inch) custom marionette or a ~8.5 x 11" original painting (your choice of subject)
  • $150 donation - your choice of a medium (11 inch) custom marionette or a ~12x16" original painting (your choice of subject)
  • $200 donation - your choice of a large (16 inch) custom marionette or a ~20 x 40" original painting (your choice of subject)
  • $300 donation - Extra large custom marionette on a complex 10+ string system

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand some people can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!  If you have the time I would love for you to share my campaign.

story:
About 2nd Floor Rear 2016

Our Shtick:

2nd Floor Rear is an annual multidisciplinary arts festival that celebrates Chicago’s vibrant community of alternative art spaces and DIY creative practices. Each February, 2nd Floor Rear connects artists with new audiences, helps underfunded and under-appreciated alternative spaces get some exposure, and enlivens a dreary winter weekend at the peak of Chicago’s bleakest season.

The festival is made up of multiple events scheduled concurrently and back-to-back, which take place at various locations throughout a cluster of designated neighborhoods. When we say “events,” we mean this in the broadest possible sense—past artworks, events, and happenings ranged from late-night studio square dancing to a guerrilla sculpture garden, a site-specific installation in an underpass, and a nomadic gallery in a handbag.

It’s 2nd Floor Rear’s 5th anniversary. To celebrate, we’re inviting Pilsen to join the party. So while events on  Saturday, February 6, will happen all over Chicago’s North Side off the Blue Line (as with past seasons), events on Sunday, February 7, will be in the South Side off the Pink Line.

Did we mention that the whole thing is free?

Yep. All events are free or pay-what-you-can, and open to the public.


Our Story:

Chicago has a robust, little-known history of showing art in “apartment galleries” and small, seemingly random venues. We started 2nd Floor because we wanted there to be a designated moment to highlight this phenomenon.

We got started in with nothing but an email account, a big idea, and bunch of creative friends—and we don’t intend to stop. Now it’s our fifth anniversary. We still have a bunch of creative friends and even more big ideas. We’re adding new partnerships and expanding our fanbase. We’re also working with Goodcity on a long-term business plan and non-profit incorporation.

Bringing this festival to life is a pretty magical experience. We’re so glad you’re here to help make it happen.


What We Need 

Consider the humble pie chart:

51% of the $ we raise with this campaign will go to one of our contract staffers whose work is crucial to festival operations, like our 2016 Curatorial Fellow, or our rad designer who makes those handy festival guides each year, or the handsome devil that manages our videos and media.

26% of your hard-earned and generously given dollars will pay the people documenting all our events.

23% covers a few months of shared workspace for 2nd Floor's headquarters at Hume Chicago, an artist-run collective project space and storefront gallery in Humboldt Park. (Making this campaign a 2-for-1 deal—you support an art space and an art festival at the same time! FTW.)


What You Get



Any questions?


The Impact

Think about it this way. For the cost of going to a movie at a River North cineplex—single ticket, no soda or snacks—you get 1.5 hours of a movie you'll be able to watch on Netflix in a couple of months. For the same amount, you could make a significant contribution to 20+ hours of unique, locally produced arts programming. 

What's the better value? 

Your contribution goes a long way for us as well. By sharing resources and spending smart, we make every dollar count.

Just $500 covers:

  • Paid gigs for four emerging photographers and professional documentation for 20-60 artists –OR–
  • 1/3 of a competitive fellowship for an emerging curator –OR–
  • 100% of our outreach and development costs

We also care about where the money goes. Each year, over half of our total budget goes to paid creative labor and artists’ support. We buy and rent locally whenever possible, targeting businesses and community organizations that reflect our values. 

We don’t just throw a great art party. We invest in Chicago culture.


PS: Your contribution is also tax-deductible, thanks to Goodcity, our fiscal sponsor.



Other Ways You Can Help

Can't spare the cash? You can still help out by spreading the word and sharing this campaign online. Share, share, and share again. Tell your mom. Tell your friends. Tell your mom's friends. 

Learn more about other ways you can help here.

story:
The EU-ONE is an electronic multi-synthesizer musical instrument. The EU-ONE can be played  similarly to how one can play an acoustic instrument. It also allows you to freely change between its sound and play modes. It utilizes Bluetooth so you can change settings easily from your mobile device. Our partners have developed dedicated app so that the instrument can be used to play music and games which makes learning easier and more fun. Additionally, the EU-ONE is foldable so that it increases portability and convenience. Anytime and anywhere, you can enjoy the experience of playing the EU-ONE.







We love listening to music and playing musical instruments; therefore our goal is to facilitate enjoyment for our customers through music and instruments. However, there is a steep learning curve and many people give up halfway. In recent years, we have observed the trend of open source and apps becoming very popular. This has led to many innovative products and is the inspiration behind the idea of the EU-ONE.

However, the development of the EU-ONE is just the first step. We would like to promote the EU-ONE by opening our design and source codes.   By doing so, everyone can reference, download and modify free of charge. We welcome all music lovers and engineers to assist with designs and create multi-functional musical instruments on this platform together. We hope to attract more app developers to develop a variety of music games and teaching aid apps.

Disclaimer: ‘Delivery of rewards/perks is subject to best efforts and not guaranteed.’

Throughout the development process, we have tried to use better quality woods and structures to increase overall product quality. We are trying hard and have spent a lot of energy and effort in this area. We are looking forward to getting recognition from more music lovers.

By opening our source code, we sincerely invite partners who are willing to take challenges to join us for product development. We look forward to your support.

    Thank you

story:
We have our first member's exhibition at McCune Smith, Glasgow, opening on August 28th and running till September 28th.

In order to make the opening night a success, we would be greatly appreciate any help towards this.

This would limit the costs to our artists greatly. Hanging fixtures, paint and providing refreshments at the opening can all add up! Any extra funds would be used to upgrade our website and print business cards.

The opening night is on from 7-10pm on Friday the 28th of August. Please pop down to enjoy a drink, some nibbles and a chat with us about our work :)

You can see the diverse range of work being produced by our talented artists on the website: www.thelocale.co.uk

For more information you can email us at: thelocale@hotmail.com
