story:
Reseña en español e Inglés

(Review in Spanish and English)

_____________________________________________________________________________

_____________________________________________________________________________


Reseña (Español)

Hola a todos amigos de Indiegogo.

Mi nombre es Manuel López Orozco, tengo 26 Años y vivo en la ciudad de Medellín.



Desde niño comencé mi camino hacia el Arte, siendo la Música la que me ayudó como ruta para formarme primeramente como Persona y segundo poder encontrarme con diferentes escenarios Artísticos y Sociales al rededor de  comunidades cercanas y otras bellas comunidades de Colombia.

Crecí en una comuna fuertemente golpeada por el conflicto armado, la drogadicción y la falta de oportunidades reales para miles de  jóvenes soñadores. 

Fue así como desde temprana edad y con los pocos conocimientos que he ido alcanzando, decidí comenzar mi propio proceso Social Artístico enseñándole a niños, jóvenes y adultos  el cómo soñar haciendo música y Arte,  aportando a su vez la reconstrucción del tejido Social.



Algunos de estos procesos y organizaciones que abalan mi Labor:

  • Guitarras Andantes  y Percutubos.

Haciendo Tubofonos juntos con Abdulla en Colombia


  • Corporación casa mia (organización social y cultural)


  • Colonia de San luis (organización enfocada al trabajo con comunidad desplazada)
  • legión del Afecto (DPS) Departamento para la prosperidad Social
  • Mesa de la cultura de la comuna 6 de Medellín


Soy integrante y a la vez vocalista de una propuesta Musical llamada  KoGgi Kroker, en el que interpretamos Música Inédita y con la que hemos podido traspasar y cortar fronteras para unir la gente en pro a la vida y a la esperanza.


Con mi guitarra he podido llegar a territorios de mi ciudad e incluso del departamento y el país, donde por culpa del temor y las secuelas de la guerra ha mucha gente le ha sido casi imposible llegar.


Mi gran amor por las comunidades, sus tradiciones, culturas y pensamientos; han sido el mayor factor motivante  para recorrer y conocer cada día mas cada territorio.


Soy percusionista y toco batería con las manos en una Banda de musica experimental llamada Kerbveros



     "Bahrein... Un Sueño Posible"

Hace tres años, llegó a mi país y a mi vida un joven viajero llamado Abdulla Faisal,  a quien  hoy por hoy podría decir que es mi hermano, no de sangre pero si de una gran Amistad. 



Al llegar a mi país, pude recorrer con el y enseñarle algunos de nuestros mejores Paisajes Urbanos y Rurales, montañas, fauna y flora y así cumplir poco a poco su gran sueño de conocer Colombia y su verdadera Realidad mas allá de lo que simplemente dicen los medios de comunicación.


Gracias a él, pude saber que existe tambien un País llamado Bahrein, un pequeño País Árabe lleno de cosas hermosas, tradiciones y con una riqueza cultural fenomenal. 



Él también es Músico y posee una Banda llamada Majaz, donde para ambos ha sido un sueño poder tocar juntos allá.

https://www.facebook.com/MajazBH?fref=ts



Desafortunadamente el presupuesto monetario para viajar a un lugar de estos es alto y no he podido reunir suficiente dinero para poder cumplir con este Sueño.


Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Para este viaje a Bahrein, es necesario recaudar al rededor 3000 Dolares para invertirlos de la siguiente manera:


Tiquetes del avión. ($1900)

La visa ($100)

Las Necesidades básicas "Comida, Transporte, comprar regalos" ($1000)

Y el resto, mi amigo Abdulla faisal se hará cargo en su país.


El impacto

Mi viaje a Bahrein, será componiendo una canción de este bello país y poderlo cantar KoGgi Kroker y Majaz juntos, ya sea por video o concierto.

Realizar registros fotográficos y videos de la visita por Bahrein y exponerlo luego en diferentes organizaciones sociales para que el mundo conozca un poco de aquellas riquezas culturales del medio Oriente.

Deseo aprender demasiado de las culturas y tradiciones y mirar la forma de realizar algunas labores sociales con los niños, jóvenes y adultos.

Mejorar mi nivel en el idioma Ingles.

Y no olvidarmos, que será mi primera vez en salir y viajar en toda mi vida.


Riesgos y desafíos

Pienso que el mayor riesgo sería Enamorarme de este país y su cultura, pero vale la pena soñarlo.


_____________________________________________________________________________

_____________________________________________________________________________


Review (English)

Hello to all my friends at Indiegogo,

I’m Manuel Lopez, 26 years old, living in Medellin, Colombia.


My story begins with my relationship with art, it started when I was a young kid. 

Making music has always been my passion, and it had helped me to become the person I am today. 

Music has not only developed me personally, but also opened a door for me to many art communities and social projects in the beautiful neighborhoods of Medellin and Colombia in general

I decided to dedicate myself at a young age to teach children, youngsters and adults to dream by making music and art, so they themselves can heal the scars of some communities in Colombia.



My history and the Organizations I work with:

  • Corporation ‘Casa Mia’ (a social and cultural organization)

  • Guitarras Andantes  y Percutubos

    • Making Tubephones with Abdulla in Colombia


  • Colony of San Luis (focused on working with displaced communities)  
  • Legion of Affection (DPS) Department for Social Prosperity
  • Member of the Cultural Office of ‘Comuna 6’ (a neighborhood in Medellin) 


Alongside this I am a vocalist with the artist name KoGgi Kroker, and I play unpublished music through which we have been able to pass and cut borders, and to unite people in favor of life and hope.


With my guitar I have been able to access places in my city, my state, my country,


The great love I carry for my communities, its traditions, cultures, and thoughts, have been the main motivation to travel and discover more places every day.

I'm also a drummer and I play drums with my hands in an experimental music band called Kerbveros


‘Bahrein… A Possible Dream’

Three years ago, a young traveler named Abdulla Faisal entered into my country and stepped into my life. Today, I can call him my brother, perhaps not by blood but certainly by the strong friendship we share.



At his arrival in Colombia, I was able to travel with him and show him some of our beautiful urban and natural views: mountains, fauna and flora, neighborhoods in Medellin. This way, little by little, he fulfilled his great dream to get to know Colombia and its true reality. A more profound reality of what Colombia is, beyond that what the media reports about it.


Thanks to him, I learned more about Bahrein as well. A small Arab country that not many people heard of it, yet it's filled with beautiful traditions and a phenomenal culture.


Abdulla is also a musician, and part of a band called Majaz. We share the dream to one day play together in Bahrein.

https://www.facebook.com/MajazBH?fref=ts


Unfortunately the monetary budget for such travels is very high but it's what makes me insist on doing it and fulfil my big dream which is traveling outside Colombia for the first time!

What We Need

I'll need around $3000 for the needs below :

- Flight Ticket ($1900)

- Visa ($100)

- Basic Needs "Food, Transportation, Souvenirs" ($1000)

- And the rest will be provided by my friend Abdulla 


The impact

This trip will help me compose a song about this beautiful and infamous country and it will be written by me Koggi Kroker and Majaz together, with a video clip and a concert to perform it.

Make an art gallery and short videos about Bahrain, the arab world, and my visit there, and showcase it in Colombia and introduce them to things they find interesting in the middle east 

I wish to learn a lot from such a distinct culture and traditions, and find my way to introduce something unique and completely new to the arab kids.

Improve my level in English 

And of course, that this will be the very first time for me to travel outside my country in my whole life!

Risks & Challenges

I think that the mayor risk will be me falling in love with this country and their culture, but it's worth dreaming it :)

Mi nombre es Manuel López Orozco, tengo 26 Años y vivo en la ciudad de Medellín.


Desde niño comencé mi camino hacia el Arte, siendo la Música la que me ayudó como ruta para formarme primeramente como Persona y segundo poder encontrarme con diferentes escenarios Artísticos y Sociales al rededor de  comunidades cercanas y otras bellas comunidades de Colombia.
Crecí en una comuna fuertemente golpeada por el conflicto armado, la drogadicción y la falta de oportunidades reales para miles de  jóvenes soñadores. 
Fue así como desde temprana edad y con los pocos conocimientos que he ido alcanzando, decidí comenzar mi propio proceso Social Artístico enseñándole a niños, jóvenes y adultos  el cómo soñar haciendo música y Arte,  aportando a su vez la reconstrucción del tejido Social.





Algunos de estos procesos y organizaciones que abalan mi Labor:

Guitarras Andantes  y Percutubos.


Haciendo Tubofonos juntos con Abdulla en Colombia



Corporación casa mia (organización social y cultural)





Colonia de San luis (organización enfocada al trabajo con comunidad desplazada)
legión del Afecto (DPS) Departamento para la prosperidad Social
Mesa de la cultura de la comuna 6 de Medellín


Soy integrante y a la vez vocalista de una propuesta Musical llamada  KoGgi Kroker, en el que interpretamos Música Inédita y con la que hemos podido traspasar y cortar fronteras para unir la gente en pro a la vida y a la esperanza.





Con mi guitarra he podido llegar a territorios de mi ciudad e incluso del departamento y el país, donde por culpa del temor y las secuelas de la guerra ha mucha gente le ha sido casi imposible llegar.



Mi gran amor por las comunidades, sus tradiciones, culturas y pensamientos; han sido el mayor factor motivante  para recorrer y conocer cada día mas cada territorio.

Soy percusionista y toco batería con las manos en una Banda de musica experimental llamada Kerbveros





     "Bahrein... Un Sueño Posible"
Hace tres años, llegó a mi país y a mi vida un joven viajero llamado Abdulla Faisal,  a quien  hoy por hoy podría decir que es mi hermano, no de sangre pero si de una gran Amistad. 





Al llegar a mi país, pude recorrer con el y enseñarle algunos de nuestros mejores Paisajes Urbanos y Rurales, montañas, fauna y flora y así cumplir poco a poco su gran sueño de conocer Colombia y su verdadera Realidad mas allá de lo que simplemente dicen los medios de comunicación.




Gracias a él, pude saber que existe tambien un País llamado Bahrein, un pequeño País Árabe lleno de cosas hermosas, tradiciones y con una riqueza cultural fenomenal. 





Él también es Músico y posee una Banda llamada Majaz, donde para ambos ha sido un sueño poder tocar juntos allá.
https://www.facebook.com/MajazBH?fref=ts





Desafortunadamente el presupuesto monetario para viajar a un lugar de estos es alto y no he podido reunir suficiente dinero para poder cumplir con este Sueño.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes
Para este viaje a Bahrein, es necesario recaudar al rededor 3000 Dolares para invertirlos de la siguiente manera:

Tiquetes del avión. ($1900)
La visa ($100)
Las Necesidades básicas "Comida, Transporte, comprar regalos" ($1000)
Y el resto, mi amigo Abdulla faisal se hará cargo en su país.

El impacto
Mi viaje a Bahrein, será componiendo una canción de este bello país y poderlo cantar KoGgi Kroker y Majaz juntos, ya sea por video o concierto.
Realizar registros fotográficos y videos de la visita por Bahrein y exponerlo luego en diferentes organizaciones sociales para que el mundo conozca un poco de aquellas riquezas culturales del medio Oriente.
Deseo aprender demasiado de las culturas y tradiciones y mirar la forma de realizar algunas labores sociales con los niños, jóvenes y adultos.
Mejorar mi nivel en el idioma Ingles.
Y no olvidarmos, que será mi primera vez en salir y viajar en toda mi vida.

Riesgos y desafíos
Pienso que el mayor riesgo sería Enamorarme de este país y su cultura, pero vale la pena soñarlo.

_____________________________________________________________________________
_____________________________________________________________________________

Review (English)
Hello to all my friends at Indiegogo,
I’m Manuel Lopez, 26 years old, living in Medellin, Colombia. 

My story begins with my relationship with art, it started when I was a young kid. 
Making music has always been my passion, and it had helped me to become the person I am today. 
Music has not only developed me personally, but also opened a door for me to many art communities and social projects in the beautiful neighborhoods of Medellin and Colombia in general
I decided to dedicate myself at a young age to teach children, youngsters and adults to dream by making music and art, so they themselves can heal the scars of some communities in Colombia.




My history and the Organizations I work with:

Corporation ‘Casa Mia’ (a social and cultural organization) 



Guitarras Andantes  y Percutubos

Making Tubephones with Abdulla in Colombia


Colony of San Luis (focused on working with displaced communities)  
Legion of Affection (DPS) Department for Social Prosperity
Member of the Cultural Office of ‘Comuna 6’ (a neighborhood in Medellin) 


Alongside this I am a vocalist with the artist name KoGgi Kroker, and I play unpublished music through which we have been able to pass and cut borders, and to unite people in favor of life and hope.





With my guitar I have been able to access places in my city, my state, my country,

 
The great love I carry for my communities, its traditions, cultures, and thoughts, have been the main motivation to travel and discover more places every day.
I'm also a drummer and I play drums with my hands in an experimental music band called Kerbveros





‘Bahrein… A Possible Dream’
Three years ago, a young traveler named Abdulla Faisal entered into my country and stepped into my life. Today, I can call him my brother, perhaps not by blood but certainly by the strong friendship we share.





At his arrival in Colombia, I was able to travel with him and show him some of our beautiful urban and natural views: mountains, fauna and flora, neighborhoods in Medellin. This way, little by little, he fulfilled his great dream to get to know Colombia and its true reality. A more profound reality of what Colombia is, beyond that what the media reports about it.




Thanks to him, I learned more about Bahrein as well. A small Arab country that not many people heard of it, yet it's filled with beautiful traditions and a phenomenal culture.




Abdulla is also a musician, and part of a band called Majaz. We share the dream to one day play together in Bahrein.
https://www.facebook.com/MajazBH?fref=ts




Unfortunately the monetary budget for such travels is very high but it's what makes me insist on doing it and fulfil my big dream which is traveling outside Colombia for the first time!


What We Need
I'll need around $3000 for the needs below :
- Flight Ticket ($1900)
- Visa ($100)
- Basic Needs "Food, Transportation, Souvenirs" ($1000)
- And the rest will be provided by my friend Abdulla 


The impact
This trip will help me compose a song about this beautiful and infamous country and it will be written by me Koggi Kroker and Majaz together, with a video clip and a concert to perform it.
Make an art gallery and short videos about Bahrain, the arab world, and my visit there, and showcase it in Colombia and introduce them to things they find interesting in the middle east 
I wish to learn a lot from such a distinct culture and traditions, and find my way to introduce something unique and completely new to the arab kids.
Improve my level in English 
And of course, that this will be the very first time for me to travel outside my country in my whole life!
Risks & Challenges
I think that the mayor risk will be me falling in love with this country and their culture, but it's worth dreaming it :)

story:
Yabous Cultural Centre 

Our mission is to develop and promote arts that enhance and assert cultural, national and human values. Yabous Cultural Centre is a unique cultural non-governmental organization based in East Jerusalem.  Our 19 years of experience, has given our young and dynamic staff a profound understanding of promoting culture in East Jerusalem and how important it is for civic engagement and nation building. We encourage cultural values that enhance innovation, quality, diversity and tolerance to varying cultures and their values, provided this does not compromise our principles. We promote national values that reflect our National Palestinian identity aspirations, ambitions and dreams, grounded on justice and respect to human rights and dignity. All that we do helps instill and revive culture and arts in Jerusalem that meets the needs and rights of the people of all ages, including children, women, irrelevant of gender, color, religion, status and nationality.

Yabous Cultural Centre promotes a new social reality, artistic creativity.  We work towards reviving culture in Jerusalem, which otherwise, was absent.  We work for the most marginalised children and people and we create job opportunities for a large segment of the society.

WHAT WE DO

We carry out the following:

  • The Yearly Jerusalem Summer Music Festival, the Jazz Festival, The Religious music Festival, Piano week ends , Ramadan Nights and Christmas Carols night.
  • Film Festivals, school special educational and entertainment musical screenings  and regular films screenings
  • Literature readings , panel discussions , and book Launching
  • Children’s programs ( fun club, theatre ,visual arts, story-telling, film screenings  and other activities )
  • Dabkeh ( traditional Palestinian dances)  
  • All that remains exhibition, Art exhibitions , First Exhibition for young artists  and art workshops
  • International Cultural Weeks
  • Art Summer Camps

· *  Storytelling Festival

·  Art & Healing "Artful Mondays" at Hospitals.

  • Comics International Festival
  • Palestinian and European Cultural Youth Summit to promote social and cultural realities

The aim of this project is to offer children and youth a variety of activities in order to answer different needs: a safe and non-violent environment at Yabous, enhancing the importance of education and culture, freedom of expression, communicating Yabous’s democratic and equality values and promoting gender equality.

Project Objectives

§Providing a safe and non-violent venue for children and youth

§Enhance national identity and heritage

§Promote freedom of expression, creativity and artistic taste

§Combining entertainment with artistic development

Target Group

§The community of Jerusalem, but the marginalized areas stated above in particular

§Youth & children & females in particular


The Impact

§After witnessing the reality of children and youth through our projects and direct contacts and relying on report on the reality of Palestinian children’s well-being in occupied east Jerusalem made by Birzeit University Centre for Continuing Education published in June 2014, Yabous Cultural Centre has set children and youth in East Jerusalem as their priority. Five main areas of Jerusalem have been analysed and studied in this report: Shufat Refugee Camp, Sur Baher, Silwan, Al Tur and the old city.

§Children are being deprived of their rights, their Palestinian national identity, their childhood and their well-being. The Israeli occupation of East Jerusalem has made Palestinian children and youth our main vulnerable group in Jerusalem.

§The lives of this group are being affected on all different levels: Economic well-being, housing and environmental well-being, social life, leisure, education, health and professional development and most importantly the occupation is affecting transmitting the Palestinian heritage and the sense of belonging to a strong Palestinian identity amongst these generations.

§These factors are causing enormous problems in the society such as poverty, unemployment, violence, lack of safety, drug use, child labour and early marriages.

§Adding to those issues, the reality of weak educational foundations, lack of activities and quasi non-existing playground spaces, children and youth of Jerusalem are left with no positive exists.

§Yabous Cultural Centre aims at bringing as many solutions as possible to children and youth from all the areas mentioned above and to the rest of Jerusalem and its surroundings through its events and activities. 

We need your help and support please  get the word out.....

Visit our site Yabous.org and check our work and activities. 

Thank you for supporting our mission

story:
English

Soline Scutella was born in Montpellier and has Italian roots. From a very young age, she has been devouring the books of the family library and she has been thinking, among other things, of becoming a librarian. Maybe someday, she thought to herself…


  However, being a traveler at heart, she preferred to discover the world and its various cultures : as soon as she turned fifteen years old, she boarded planes and trains as easily as others would get into their cars.

  After backpacking around the world for about twenty years and working for the TV and cartoon industries from 1996 to 2006, Soline Scutella immersed herself into the world of comic strips and illustration in 2009, from her office located in Angoulême, a south-western town in France. She hardly leaves her “headquarters”, except in order to join festivals and meet crowds of curious and enthusiastic readers.

  On her publishing journeys, she often comes across talented writers who are sometimes willing to work some time with her within her own structure she named “Scutella Éditions”.

  Thus, in 2014, she discovered the amazing works by Ciou, a painter dedicated to the lobrow movement. Soline and Ciou met through Arts BD (www.artsbd.fr), an editorial structure specialized in illustration and graphic arts, which has enabled the artist to publish silkscreens and posters since 2012. Both women took up the crazy challenge of revisiting Poucette, also called Thumbelina,



a famous nineteenth-century tale by Hans Christian Andersen, by means of an English-French translation with about thirty illustrations in keeping with the culture of the trash-punk-kawaï movements. Poucette is a little girl born of a seed. After experiencing many adventures, she turns into the Queen of Flowers.

The immersion into the world of this nineteenth-century fairy tale and Ciou’s interpretation of it lead the reader to discover a contemporary acrylic and ink painting reviving the wonder and cruelty of Andersen’s world in a magnificent display of colors, lights and shadows, not to forget unexpected details which are absolutely mesmerizing.

Entering Ciou’s world implies agreeing to be emotionally overwhelmed, accepting disturbing unspoken truths, an order emerging from chaos and an outstanding aestheticism.

This version of Thumbelina turns out to be completely new and original, complex and thrilling : it combines contemporary art with nineteenth-century magical extravaganza in an illustrated, bilingual edition of Andersen’s text, bringing two authors, two worlds and two periods together, although they are separated by almost two centuries.

A daring wager resulting from a fully conscious choice! Will you be part of the adventure?


Ciou Biography 

http://ciou.eu/

Ciou, was  born in Toulouse in 1981, she  actually works and lives in her home town , after living in Bruxelles and Paris.

She succeeded to gain a relevant place in the world of contemporary pop art and lowbrow, at a very young age . The exhibit that gave her international visibility was in 2004 at the Flux Factory gallery  in New York City  with the group show  » Cute and Scary » with confirmed lowbrow artists. From there she went on to show in Amsterdam  at the Kochxbos gallery, Paris, Barcelona, Brussels, California, Portland, Roma  , Tokyo, Berlin,  NYC at the Cotton Candy Machine gallery , also Seattle with her fist solo show  » Mysterious flowers »  in usa at the gallery Roq La Rue in late 2010. She did her fourth solo show at the Kochxbos gallery in January 2015 and  always working in several group show in USA and Europe.

In the media, the art and life of  ciou was on  Dutch national Tv, VPRO  for the international Sarah’s Barbaren documentary. Also she made her first book in 2009  » Chat siamois » with the french editor Venusdea. « Ciou collected art  » is out now, 144 pages, first art book , edited by Kochxbos Publishers 2014. She is actually working on a new  illustrated book,  a new version of Thumbelina by Christian Hans Andersen, edited by Scutella in January 2016


Suspended between dream and nightmare, her paintings consist of a base made of a collage of old papers, taken from old medical books, dictionaries, and nature manuals, where she uses acrylic and ink; creating her own personal mixed media  . Her Influences are diverses :  the american vintage culture from the 30′ to the 70′ , the victorian style and the european barocco   too  , however she is focused on the japanese culture and  japanese traditional  and contemporary art .  Her style is  characterized by a line of great expressive force and a language where the power of color and deformation of shapes combine to make her stroke unmistakable . Ciou creates her  own « necro-kawai » cosmology of characters mainly centered around witch-y nature burlesque girls and their  strange animal companions.  Her new works feature florescent psychedelic colors as a foil for her obsessive black line work. Her darkly charming works are creepy in a very playful way, a little bit of sweet and a little bit of sour in a friendly and dangerous world .


French

Native de Montpellier, et d’origine italienne, Soline Scutella dévore les livres de la bibliothèque familiale très jeune et pense, entre autres, à devenir libraire, un jour peut-être... .

Mais, nomade dans l’âme, elle préfère découvrir le monde et ses cultures dès l’âge de 15 ans et saute dans un avion ou un train comme d’autres prennent leur voiture.

Après avoir promené son sac à dos dans le monde entier pendant une vingtaine d’années et travaillé pour la télévision et le dessin animé entre 1996 et 2006, Soline Scutella plonge dans la bande dessinée et l’illustration en 2009 depuis son QG d’Angoulême, dans le Sud-Ouest de la France dont elle ne sort que très peu, sinon pour courir les festivals et rencontrer un public curieux et passionné !

Dans ses pérégrinations d’éditrice, Soline croise souvent la route d’auteurs talentueux qui, parfois, veulent bien faire un bout de chemin au sein de sa structure éditoriale indépendante, Scutella Editions.

C’est ainsi qu’elle découvre, en 2014, le travail étonnant de l’artiste Ciou, peintre affiliée au mouvement nécro-kawaï.

Par l’intermédiare d’Arts BD (www.artsbd.fr), chez qui Ciou publie des sérigraphies et affiches depuis 2012, l’éditrice et l’artiste se rencontrent et prennent le pari un peu fou de revisiter sur le mode trash-punk-kawaï, en une trentaine d’illustrations inédites et décalées, et en 2 langues (Français et Anglais), le conte du XIXème siècle de Hans Christian Andersen : Poucette ou Thumbelina, cette petite fille née d’une graine et qui, après moult aventures, se transforme en Reine des Fleurs.

La plongée dans l’univers de ce conte féérique du XIXème et l’interprétation qu’en donne Ciou à travers Thumbelina, emmènent le lecteur à la découverte d’une peinture contemporaine, à l’acrylique et l’encre, qui ressuscite l’onirisme et la cruauté du monde d’Andersen dans un feu d’artifice de couleurs, de lumières et d’ombres, de détails inattendus qui vous hypnotisent littéralement : entrer dans l’univers de Ciou, c’est accepter le bouleversement émotionnel, les non-dits qui dérangent, l’ordre qui émerge du chaos, et un esthétisme hors normes.


Notre proposition sur le conte Thumbelina s’avère inédite et originale, complexe et haletante parce qu’elle allie art contemporain et féérie du XIXème, dans une vision illustrée du texte d’Andersen, en 2 langues, le Français et l’Anglais, dans des traductions contemporaines de l’écrivain : ici se rencontrent, échangent et construisent ensemble deux auteurs, deux mondes, deux époques, à plusieurs siècles d’intervalle.

En somme, la réinterprétation aux couleurs du XXIème siècle de l’imaginaire né avant 1900.

Pari audacieux, pari assumé ! En serez-vous ?

Biographie de Ciou

http://ciou.eu/

Ciou a su se faire une place dans le milieu international du Pop art contemporain et du Lowbrow.
Sa première grande exposition collective «  Cute and scary » a eu lieu en 2004, à New york à la galerie Flux Factory. L’international lui ouvre rapidement ses frontières.
Elle expose à Amsterdam à la galerie Kochxbos, puis à Paris, Barcelone, Bruxelles, Californie, Portland, Rome, Melbourne,Tokyo, Berlin, Dublin, Suisse, ainsi qu’à Seattle pour sa première exposition personnelle américaine «  Mysterious Flowers » à la galerie Roque La Rue. Elle est représentée par la galerie Kochxbos à Amsterdam et ses oeuvres sont exposées à la galerie Cotton Candy Machine à New york. 


Son premier livre illustré est édité en 2009 sous le titre « Chat Siamois », écrit par Guillaume Bianco. En 2014 elle est sélectionnée pour créer un carnet de 12 timbres «  Féérie astrologique » par La Poste. Les originaux du carnet font partie de la collection permanente du musées de la Poste de Paris. Le Premier Artbook est édité en 2014 par la galerie néerlandaise Kochxbos. Il retrace dix ans d’expositions et de création.
Ciou popose une adaptation de Poucette de Christian Hans Andersen, édité par Scutella en 2016.
Ces influences sont nombreuses, on y trouve aussi bien le vintage américain des années 30 aux années 70 que le baroque européen et le style victorien du 19ème. Ciou est avant tout passionnée par l’art contemporain et traditionnel japonais.
Ciou crée sa propre cosmologie «  nécro kawaï » autour d’ensorcelantes danseuses burlesques et de leurs étranges compagnons. Ces travaux récents sont remplis d’arborescences aux couleurs psychédéliques.
Les oeuvres de Ciou mêlent subtilement onirisme et cauchemar, un univers merveilleusement acide.


Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Rémunération de l’artiste / Artist Fees : 5000 EUR + % sur chaque vente de livre / % on each book sold

Maquettage du livre/ Book layout : 1300 EUR

Impression du livre/ Printing of book : 8700 EUR

Exposition avec parcours conté en anglais et en français, lors du Festival International de la Bande Dessinée d’Angoulême 2016 : 1500 EUR

Exhibition with storyboards printed in English and French, at the 2016 International Cartoon Festival in Angoulême: 1500 EUR


    Les contreparties proposées vous permettent de recevoir dès 20 EUR d’investissement le livre chez vous à sa parution, de le recevoir dédicacé et numéroté par Ciou elle-même pour 100 EUR de mise, voire même de recevoir une œuvre sérigraphiée, numérotée et signée à 200 EUR de mise ! Et à compter de 700 EUR d’investissement, c’est une œuvre originale que vous avez entre les mains ! Et pour le super bonus, recevez un chèque de 500 EUR pour assister en VIP à un événement Ciou à travers le monde !

    The deal is, for an investment of only 20 EUR you will receive the book on the date of its publication, or for 100 EUR you will receive a numbered first edition autographed by Ciou herself, or for just 200 EUR, a screen-printed first edition both numbered and autographed!  For an investment of 700 EUR you will own an original work!  And as an extra bonus you will receive a voucher worth 500 EUR to attend a Ciou event anywhere in the world as a VIP!

    Si l’objectif n’est pas atteint, les financements récoltés grâce à vous permettront à la maison d’édition de payer intégralement l’auteur et de contribuer de toute façon à la publication du livre.

    L’éditeur s’engage à publier le livre pour le 29 janvier 2016, lors du FIBD 2016.


    Should our objective not be achieved, the funds raised by you will enable the publisher to pay the author in full and also contribute to the book's publication.

    The editor is committed to publishing the book on the 29 January 2016, ready for the 2016 FIBD.


L'impact

  • Ciou, bien que française, est peu connue du public en France, et le livre Thumbelina a pour objectif de faire découvrir aux lecteurs français mais aussi internationaux, sa magnifique réinterprétation d’un conte de notre enfance, Poucette ou Thumbelina (ou Tomelise pour les premières traductions).

    De plus, la présentation de son exposition contée lors du FIBD 2016 permettra aux enfants de se familiariser avec Andersen d’une part, et le monde de Ciou, très étonnant, d’autre part. Le rôle d’un éditeur consiste aussi à faire partager et à donner accès à la culture à tous, petits et grands.

  • Even though she is French, Ciou is little known to the French public and the aim of her book Thumbelina is to introduce her wonderful re-interpretation of this classic childhood tale, Poucette or Thumbelina (or Tomelise in the first translations) to the French and wider international public.

    Furthermore, the presentation of her storyboard display during the 2016 FIBD will enable children to become familiar on the one hand with Andersen, and on the other with the surprising world of Ciou. Sharing and allowing everyone, both young and old, to have access to culture is also the rôle of the editor.

  • C’est la première fois que Scutella lance un tel projet, et en plus sur une plate-forme internationale, c’est donc une toute nouvelle expérience, surtout pour une petite maison d’édition et son artiste, toutes deux françaises ! Donc, pardon pour mon anglais probablement un peu scolaire, et merci de nous soutenir dans cette aventure un peu folle !

  • This is the first time that Scutella has launched such a project, particularly on an international site. So, it is a whole new experience, especially for a small publishing house and its author, who are both French! Therefore, please excuse my ‘school’ English and thank you for supporting us in this slightly crazy adventure!

  • Les livres Scutella sont reconnus en France pour être de grande qualité et proposer la découverte d’artistes atypiques, aussi bien en bande dessinée, en jeunesse qu’en illustration et art, et les chanceux du côté de Los Angeles peuvent trouver certains des titres du catalogue Scutella chez Stuart NG Booking, le libraire qui aiment les livres des Frenchies !

    Les galeries d’art qui exposent régulièrement le travail de Ciou ont d’ores et déjà fait part de leur intérêt pour Thumbelina et vous retrouverez le livre en vente du côté des Etats-Unis, du japon, de l’Australie, etc… On vous en dit plus dès qu’on a les bons de commande entre les mains !

  • Scutella books are recognized in France as being of high quality and for offering the opportunity to discover atypical artists, in both cartoons and children’s books as well as illustrations and art,.  Those people fortunate enough to live near Los Angeles will find a number of titles from the Scutella catalogue at Stuart NG Booking, the bookstore that loves ‘Frenchie’ books!

    The art galleries that regularly exhibit Ciou’s work have already expressed interest in Thumbelina and the book is already on sale in the USA, Japan and Australia, etc ... We can let you know more once we have orders in hand!

Risques et défis


  • Proposer Thumbelina par Ciou, c’est oser l’alliance du conte féérique du XIXème siècle et la vision trash-punk-kawaï d’une artiste contemporaine : c’est donc un vrai défi artistique à relever pour l’éditrice et l’auteure afin de faire partager au plus grand nombre un esthétisme et une technique graphique hors normes.

    C’est aussi notre rôle que de sensibiliser le public aux différentes formes d’art.

    Et Scutella Editions est peu à peu reconnue pour son catalogue de livres étonnants, graphiquement surprenants et toujours de belle fabrication : les ouvrages sont en majorité des livres cartonnés, reliés et toilés, et utilisent un papier haut de gamme, dans le respect des normes de protection de l’environnement, le tout donnant une très belle tenue au livre, qui durera dans le temps et fera le bonheur de votre bibliothèque !


  • Ciou’s version of Thumbelina dares to combine a nineteenth century fairytale with the trash-punk-kawaii vision of a contemporary artist. Thus from an artistic perspective it represents a very real challenge for both the editor and the author to share with as many people as possible this very unconventional aestheticism and graphic technique.

    Our role is also to raise public awareness of different forms of art…

    … and Scutella Editions is gradually becoming recognised for its catalogue of amazing books, graphically surprising and always beautifully produced. The books are invariably hardbacked, bound with canvas finish and printed on high-quality paper, in compliance with environmental protection standards, All of which gives the books a beautiful, long-lasting finish, and guarantees lifelong pleasure on your library bookshelves!

  • Le plus gros problème à l’heure actuelle pour publier de beaux livres, c’est le mode de financement : le système bancaire classique ne répond pas à la demande de financement de fabrication du stock, et c’est notamment la raison pour laquelle ma structure modeste se tourne vers les internautes : vous êtes les meilleurs juges sur un tel projet, et votre degré d’implication permet de mesurer la cohérence dudit projet immédiatement.

    De plus, pour un artiste, voir les gens se mobiliser autour de la création de son œuvre, constitue une véritable reconnaissance de son travail et je suis toujours étonnée de voir à quel point les auteurs sont sensibles au retour des internautes et plus qu’émus du soutien généré par le financement participatif.

    Les contributeurs sont tout simplement de formidables mécènes, et vont aider à la naissance et la vie de l’œuvre.

  • Today the biggest constraint in publishing beautiful books is the method of funding. The traditional banking system does not support the need for funding to produce stock, and that is why my modest structure is looking to the Internet for support.  You are the best judges of such a project, and your level of involvement will enable us to assess immediately the conherence of the project.

    Furthermore, when an artist sees people rallying around and taking an interest in the creation of his work, it is a true recognition of that work. I am always surprised to see how sensitive authors are to the participation of Internet contributors, and how emotional they become when receiving support generated by crowdfunding.

    Contributors are quite simply incredible patrons, and they contribute to the birth and life of an artist’s work.

D'autres façons d'aider

  • Que vous soyez contributeur ou pas, vous pouvez nous aider grandement en faisant passer le mot à vos amis, connaissances, bref à votre réseau, et cela nous est très précieux pour faire connaître notre travail ! Alors partagez, relayez, utilisez les outils Indiegogo et autres à votre disposition pour nous soutenir, et soyez-en grandement remerciés ici !

  • Whether you are a contributor or not, you can help enormously by spreading the word to your network of friends, acquaintances and contacts. For you to publicise our work in this way would be invaluable! Please therefore share, pass on, use Indiegogo and any other tools at your disposal to support us.  We would be extremely grateful and would like you to accept our heart-felt thanks!
story_txt:
English


Soline
Scutella was born in Montpellier and has Italian roots. From a very young age,
she has been devouring the books of the family library and she has been
thinking, among other things, of becoming a librarian. Maybe someday, she
thought to herself…



  However, being a traveler at heart,
she preferred to discover the world and its various cultures : as soon as she
turned fifteen years old, she boarded planes and trains as easily as others
would get into their cars.
  After backpacking around the world
for about twenty years and working for the TV and cartoon industries from 1996 to 2006, Soline
Scutella immersed herself into the world of comic strips and illustration in
2009, from her office located in Angoulême, a south-western town in France. She
hardly leaves her “headquarters”, except in order to join festivals and meet crowds
of curious and enthusiastic readers. 
  On her publishing journeys, she
often comes across talented writers who are sometimes willing to work some time
with her within her own structure she named “Scutella Éditions”.
  Thus, in 2014, she discovered the
amazing works by Ciou, a painter dedicated to the lobrow movement. Soline and
Ciou met through Arts BD (www.artsbd.fr),
an editorial structure specialized in illustration and graphic arts, which has
enabled the artist to publish silkscreens and posters since 2012. Both women
took up the crazy challenge of revisiting Poucette,
also called Thumbelina, 





a famous
nineteenth-century tale by Hans Christian Andersen, by means of an
English-French translation with about thirty illustrations in keeping with the
culture of the trash-punk-kawaï movements. Poucette is a little girl born of a
seed. After experiencing many adventures, she turns into the Queen of Flowers.


The immersion into the world of this
nineteenth-century fairy tale and Ciou’s interpretation of it lead the reader to
discover a contemporary acrylic and ink painting reviving the wonder and
cruelty of Andersen’s world in a magnificent display of colors, lights and
shadows, not to forget unexpected details which are absolutely mesmerizing. 
Entering Ciou’s world implies agreeing to be
emotionally overwhelmed, accepting disturbing unspoken truths, an order
emerging from chaos and an outstanding aestheticism.
This version of Thumbelina
turns out to be completely new and original, complex and thrilling : it
combines contemporary art with nineteenth-century magical extravaganza in an
illustrated, bilingual edition of Andersen’s text, bringing two authors, two
worlds and two periods together, although they are separated by almost two centuries. 
A daring wager resulting from a fully conscious choice!
Will you be part of the adventure?



Ciou Biography  
http://ciou.eu/
Ciou, was  born in Toulouse in 1981, she  actually works and lives in her home town , after living in Bruxelles and Paris.
She succeeded to gain a relevant place in the world of contemporary 
pop art and lowbrow, at a very young age . The exhibit that gave her 
international visibility was in 2004 at the Flux Factory gallery  in New
 York City  with the group show  » Cute and Scary » with confirmed 
lowbrow artists. From there she went on to show in Amsterdam  at the 
Kochxbos gallery, Paris, Barcelona, Brussels, California, Portland, Roma
  , Tokyo, Berlin,  NYC at the Cotton Candy Machine gallery , also 
Seattle with her fist solo show  » Mysterious flowers »  in usa at the 
gallery Roq La Rue in late 2010. She did her fourth solo show at the 
Kochxbos gallery in January 2015 and  always working in several group 
show in USA and Europe.
In the media, the art and life of  ciou was on  Dutch national Tv, 
VPRO  for the international Sarah’s Barbaren documentary. Also she made 
her first book in 2009  » Chat siamois » with the french editor 
Venusdea. « Ciou collected art  » is out now, 144 pages, first art book ,
 edited by Kochxbos Publishers 2014. She is actually working on a new 
 illustrated book,  a new version of Thumbelina by Christian Hans 
Andersen, edited by Scutella in January 2016



Suspended between dream and nightmare, her paintings consist of a 
base made of a collage of old papers, taken from old medical books, 
dictionaries, and nature manuals, where she uses acrylic and ink; 
creating her own personal mixed media  . Her Influences are diverses :  
the american vintage culture from the 30′ to the 70′ , the victorian 
style and the european barocco   too  , however she is focused on the 
japanese culture and  japanese traditional  and contemporary art .  Her 
style is  characterized by a line of great expressive force and a 
language where the power of color and deformation of shapes combine to 
make her stroke unmistakable . Ciou creates her  own « necro-kawai » 
cosmology of characters mainly centered around witch-y nature burlesque 
girls and their  strange animal companions.  Her new works feature 
florescent psychedelic colors as a foil for her obsessive black line 
work. Her darkly charming works are creepy in a very playful way, a 
little bit of sweet and a little bit of sour in a friendly and dangerous
 world .

French
Native de
Montpellier, et d’origine italienne, Soline Scutella dévore les livres de la bibliothèque
familiale très jeune et pense, entre autres, à devenir libraire, un jour
peut-être... .

Mais, nomade
dans l’âme, elle préfère découvrir le monde et ses cultures dès l’âge de 15 ans
et saute dans un avion ou un train comme d’autres prennent leur voiture. 

Après avoir
promené son sac à dos dans le monde entier pendant une vingtaine d’années et travaillé
pour la télévision et le dessin animé entre 1996 et 2006, Soline Scutella
plonge dans la bande dessinée et l’illustration en 2009 depuis son QG
d’Angoulême, dans le Sud-Ouest de la France dont elle ne sort que très peu,
sinon pour courir les festivals et rencontrer un public curieux et passionné ! 

Dans ses
pérégrinations d’éditrice, Soline croise souvent la route d’auteurs talentueux
qui, parfois, veulent bien faire un bout de chemin au sein de sa structure
éditoriale indépendante, Scutella Editions.

C’est ainsi qu’elle découvre, en 2014, le travail
étonnant de l’artiste Ciou, peintre affiliée au mouvement nécro-kawaï. 

Par l’intermédiare d’Arts BD (www.artsbd.fr), chez qui
Ciou publie des sérigraphies et affiches depuis 2012, l’éditrice et l’artiste
se rencontrent et prennent le pari un peu fou de revisiter sur le mode
trash-punk-kawaï, en une trentaine d’illustrations inédites et décalées, et en
2 langues (Français et Anglais), le conte du XIXème siècle de Hans Christian
Andersen : Poucette ou Thumbelina, cette petite fille née d’une graine et qui, après moult aventures, se
transforme en Reine des Fleurs.

La plongée dans l’univers de ce conte féérique du
XIXème et l’interprétation qu’en donne Ciou à travers Thumbelina, emmènent le
lecteur à la découverte d’une peinture contemporaine, à l’acrylique et l’encre,
qui ressuscite l’onirisme et la cruauté du monde d’Andersen dans un feu
d’artifice de couleurs, de lumières et d’ombres, de détails inattendus qui vous
hypnotisent littéralement : entrer dans l’univers de Ciou, c’est accepter le
bouleversement émotionnel, les non-dits qui dérangent, l’ordre qui émerge du
chaos, et un esthétisme hors normes.



Notre proposition sur le conte Thumbelina
s’avère inédite et originale, complexe et haletante parce qu’elle allie art
contemporain et féérie du XIXème, dans une vision illustrée du texte d’Andersen,
en 2 langues, le Français et l’Anglais, dans des traductions contemporaines de
l’écrivain : ici se rencontrent, échangent et construisent ensemble deux
auteurs, deux mondes, deux époques, à plusieurs siècles d’intervalle.

En somme, la réinterprétation aux couleurs du
XXIème siècle de l’imaginaire né avant 1900.

Pari audacieux, pari assumé ! En
serez-vous ?

Biographie de Ciou
http://ciou.eu/




Ciou a su se faire une place dans le milieu international du
Pop art contemporain et du Lowbrow.
Sa première grande exposition collective «  Cute and scary » a eu
lieu en 2004, à New york à la galerie Flux Factory. L’international lui ouvre
rapidement ses frontières. 
Elle expose à Amsterdam à la galerie Kochxbos, puis à Paris, Barcelone,
Bruxelles, Californie, Portland, Rome, Melbourne,Tokyo, Berlin, Dublin, Suisse,
ainsi qu’à Seattle pour sa première exposition personnelle américaine « 
Mysterious Flowers » à la galerie Roque La Rue. Elle est représentée par
la galerie Kochxbos à Amsterdam et ses oeuvres sont exposées à la galerie
Cotton Candy Machine à New york. 



Son premier livre illustré est édité en 2009 sous le titre « Chat
Siamois », écrit par Guillaume Bianco. En 2014 elle est sélectionnée pour
créer un carnet de 12 timbres «  Féérie astrologique » par La Poste.
Les originaux du carnet font partie de la collection permanente du musées de la
Poste de Paris. Le Premier Artbook est édité en 2014 par la galerie
néerlandaise Kochxbos. Il retrace dix ans d’expositions et de création. 
Ciou popose une adaptation de Poucette de Christian Hans Andersen, édité par
Scutella en 2016.
Ces influences sont nombreuses, on y trouve aussi bien le vintage américain des
années 30 aux années 70 que le baroque européen et le style victorien du 19ème.
Ciou est avant tout passionnée par l’art contemporain et traditionnel japonais.
Ciou crée sa propre cosmologie «  nécro kawaï » autour
d’ensorcelantes danseuses burlesques et de leurs étranges compagnons. Ces
travaux récents sont remplis d’arborescences aux couleurs psychédéliques. 
Les oeuvres de Ciou mêlent subtilement onirisme et cauchemar, un univers
merveilleusement acide.



Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Rémunération de l’artiste / Artist Fees :
5000 EUR + % sur chaque vente de livre / % on each book sold
Maquettage du livre/ Book layout : 1300 EUR
Impression du livre/ Printing of book : 8700 EUR
Exposition avec parcours conté en
anglais et en français, lors du Festival International de la Bande Dessinée
d’Angoulême 2016 : 1500 EUR
Exhibition with storyboards printed in English and
French, at the 2016 International Cartoon Festival in Angoulême: 1500 EUR 

Les contreparties proposées vous
permettent de recevoir dès 20 EUR d’investissement le livre chez vous à sa
parution, de le recevoir dédicacé et numéroté par Ciou elle-même pour 100 EUR
de mise, voire même de recevoir une œuvre sérigraphiée, numérotée et signée à
200 EUR de mise ! Et à compter de 700 EUR d’investissement, c’est une
œuvre originale que vous avez entre les mains ! Et pour le super bonus,
recevez un chèque de 500 EUR pour assister en VIP à un événement Ciou à travers
le monde !


The deal is, for an investment of only 20 EUR you will
receive the book on the date of its publication, or for 100 EUR you will
receive a numbered first edition autographed by Ciou herself, or for just 200 EUR, a screen-printed first edition
both numbered and autographed!  For an
investment of 700 EUR you will own an original work!  And as an extra bonus you will receive a
voucher worth 500 EUR to attend a Ciou event anywhere in the world as a VIP!
Si l’objectif n’est pas atteint, les
financements récoltés grâce à vous permettront à la maison d’édition de payer
intégralement l’auteur et de contribuer de toute façon à la publication du
livre.
L’éditeur s’engage à publier le
livre pour le 29 janvier 2016, lors du FIBD 2016.





Should our objective not be achieved, the funds raised
by you will enable the publisher to pay the author in full and also contribute
to the book's publication.
The editor is committed to publishing the book on the
29 January 2016, ready for the 2016 FIBD.



L'impact


Ciou, bien que française, est peu connue du public en
France, et le livre Thumbelina a pour objectif de faire découvrir aux lecteurs
français mais aussi internationaux, sa magnifique réinterprétation d’un conte
de notre enfance, Poucette ou Thumbelina (ou Tomelise pour les premières
traductions).
De plus, la présentation de son exposition contée lors
du FIBD 2016 permettra aux enfants de se familiariser avec Andersen d’une part,
et le monde de Ciou, très étonnant, d’autre part. Le rôle d’un éditeur consiste
aussi à faire partager et à donner accès à la culture à tous, petits et grands.


Even though she is French, Ciou is little known to the
French public and the aim of her book Thumbelina is to introduce her wonderful
re-interpretation of this classic childhood tale, Poucette or Thumbelina (or
Tomelise in the first translations)
to the French and wider international public. 

Furthermore, the presentation of her storyboard display during the 2016
FIBD will enable children to become familiar on the one hand with Andersen, and
on the other with the surprising world of Ciou. Sharing and allowing everyone, both young and
old, to have access to culture is also the rôle of the editor.









C’est la première fois que Scutella
lance un tel projet, et en plus sur une plate-forme internationale, c’est donc
une toute nouvelle expérience, surtout pour une petite maison d’édition et son
artiste, toutes deux françaises ! Donc, pardon pour mon anglais probablement
un peu scolaire, et merci de nous soutenir dans cette aventure un peu
folle !


This is the first time that Scutella has launched such
a project, particularly on an international site. So, it is a whole new
experience, especially for a small publishing house and its author, who are both
French! Therefore, please excuse my ‘school’ English and thank you for
supporting us in this slightly crazy adventure!






Les livres Scutella sont reconnus en
France pour être de grande qualité et proposer la découverte d’artistes
atypiques, aussi bien en bande dessinée, en jeunesse qu’en illustration et art,
et les chanceux du côté de Los Angeles peuvent trouver certains des titres du
catalogue Scutella chez Stuart NG Booking, le libraire qui aiment les livres
des Frenchies !
Les galeries d’art qui exposent
régulièrement le travail de Ciou ont d’ores et déjà fait part de leur intérêt
pour Thumbelina et vous retrouverez le livre en vente du côté des Etats-Unis,
du japon, de l’Australie, etc… On vous en dit plus dès qu’on a les bons de
commande entre les mains ! 


Scutella books are recognized in France as being of high
quality and for offering the opportunity to discover atypical artists, in both cartoons
and children’s books as well as illustrations and art,.  Those people fortunate enough to live near
Los Angeles will find a number of titles from the Scutella catalogue at Stuart
NG Booking, the bookstore that loves ‘Frenchie’ books!
The art galleries that regularly exhibit Ciou’s work
have already expressed interest in Thumbelina and the book is already on sale
in the USA, Japan and Australia, etc ... We can let you know more once we have orders
in hand!



Risques et défis


Proposer Thumbelina par Ciou, c’est
oser l’alliance du conte féérique du XIXème siècle et la vision
trash-punk-kawaï d’une artiste contemporaine : c’est donc un vrai défi artistique
à relever pour l’éditrice et l’auteure afin de faire partager au plus grand
nombre un esthétisme et une technique graphique hors normes.
C’est aussi notre rôle que de
sensibiliser le public aux différentes formes d’art.
Et Scutella Editions est peu à peu
reconnue pour son catalogue de livres étonnants, graphiquement surprenants et
toujours de belle fabrication : les ouvrages sont en majorité des livres
cartonnés, reliés et toilés, et utilisent un papier haut de gamme, dans le
respect des normes de protection de l’environnement, le tout donnant une très
belle tenue au livre, qui durera dans le temps et fera le bonheur de votre
bibliothèque !




Ciou’s version of Thumbelina dares to combine a
nineteenth century fairytale with the trash-punk-kawaii vision of a
contemporary artist. Thus from an artistic perspective it represents a very
real challenge for both the editor and the author to share with as many people
as possible this very unconventional aestheticism and graphic technique.

Our role is also to raise public awareness of
different forms of art…
… and Scutella Editions is gradually becoming
recognised for its catalogue of amazing books, graphically surprising and
always beautifully produced. The books are invariably hardbacked, bound with
canvas finish and printed on high-quality paper, in compliance with
environmental protection standards, All of which gives the books a beautiful,
long-lasting finish, and guarantees lifelong pleasure on your library bookshelves!


Le plus gros problème à l’heure
actuelle pour publier de beaux livres, c’est le mode de financement : le
système bancaire classique ne répond pas à la demande de financement de
fabrication du stock, et c’est notamment la raison pour laquelle ma structure
modeste se tourne vers les internautes : vous êtes les meilleurs juges sur
un tel projet, et votre degré d’implication permet de mesurer la cohérence dudit
projet immédiatement.
De plus, pour un artiste, voir les
gens se mobiliser autour de la création de son œuvre, constitue une véritable
reconnaissance de son travail et je suis toujours étonnée de voir à quel point
les auteurs sont sensibles au retour des internautes et plus qu’émus du soutien
généré par le financement participatif.
Les contributeurs sont tout
simplement de formidables mécènes, et vont aider à la naissance et la vie de
l’œuvre.


Today the biggest constraint in publishing beautiful
books is the method of funding. The traditional banking system does not support
the need for funding to produce stock, and that is why my modest structure is
looking to the Internet for support.  You
are the best judges of such a project, and your level of involvement will
enable us to assess immediately the conherence of the project.
Furthermore, when an artist sees people rallying
around and taking an interest in the creation of his work, it is a true recognition
of that work. I am always surprised to
see how sensitive authors are to the participation of Internet contributors,
and how emotional they become when receiving support generated by crowdfunding.
Contributors are quite simply incredible patrons, and they
contribute to the birth and life of an artist’s work.



D'autres façons d'aider


Que vous soyez contributeur ou pas, vous pouvez nous
aider grandement en faisant passer le mot à vos amis, connaissances, bref à
votre réseau, et cela nous est très précieux pour faire connaître notre
travail ! Alors partagez, relayez, utilisez les outils Indiegogo et autres
à votre disposition pour nous soutenir, et soyez-en grandement remerciés
ici !


Whether you are a contributor or not, you can help
enormously by spreading the word to your network of friends, acquaintances and
contacts. For you to publicise our work in this way would be invaluable! Please
therefore share, pass on, use Indiegogo and any other tools at your disposal to
support us.  We would be extremely
grateful and would like you to accept our heart-felt thanks!

story:
The idea of the international street art project Urban Myths is to create a new vision of modern cities through the eyes of their citizens. In summer 2016, prominent street artists from different counties will gather in the heart of Eastern Europe, in Belarus, to create a series of murals based on the dialogue with locals.

Who we are

We are a group of activists who seek to bring the street-art to a new level. We see the street-art as not only a change of urban image, but also as a way to create new meaning. That is why we promote ambigous art that evokes spectator’s emotions and makes him/her see numerous phenomenon and problems in a different way.

Urban Myths is not a boring municipal project for decorating dull buildings, but a good provoking with elements of slight and positive hooliganism. For the real street-art is a game and claiming for discussion!

We would love to see our artworks not just decorating a city, but inspiring its citizens!

Background

In autumn 2015, we organized the first international project Urban Myths. During three months  street artists from different countries painted Minsk buildings based on their talks with local activists and modern history. Two of the Minsk murals –Man without Identity and Girl in Embroidered Shirt – for the first time in Belarus history were rated within the top 10 best graffiti of the month in the world.

You can watch this TV-report to see the result:


Photo gallery here->

Urban Myths-2016  is a chance to rise and shine in a different way, it’s a chance for collaboration between artists and it’s a chance to improve ourselves and our environment.

The unique part of the festival is in the idea of exploration of local modern history and urban legends by street artists. We hope this is the way to make artworks be contextual and assist locals to develop their own urban identity.

Dates of the festival Urban Myths 2016: May 2016 - June 2016

The money raised will be expensed for 5 huge murals by world-renowed street artists! Calculation is the simplest ever: 5 murals = 5 artists = 5 countries = $12 500

The budget considers only the most essential points:

  • artrists’ travel and visa costs

  • artists’ accomodation

  • paint and painting tools

  • lifting equipment rent costs

The more money we raise - the more amazing street-art will be performed!

We already have:

  • a group of inspired volunteers experienced in organizing similar projects; 

  • a support from local municipalities; 

  • an interest in participation of well-known street artists (here are some examples of their works):

(Deih, Spain)

(QBic, Russia)

(T-Radya, Russia)

(Predok, Belarus)

(Hyuro, Spain)

(Mutus, Belarus)

…we are negotiating with various remarkable artists! News will be published in our blog.

Your support can make a real difference, can inspire hundreds of people and organize a really great Festival!

___________________________

p.s. Other Ways You Can Help

  • Your brand as an official sponsor of the event (for further communication please contact us by email or Facebook)

  • Share the project page and information with journalists and your friend in social media

Thank you!

In summer 2016, prominent street artists from different counties will gather in the heart of Eastern Europe, in Belarus, to create a series of murals based on the dialogue with locals.Who we areWe are a group of activists who seek to bring the street-art to a new level. Two of the Minsk murals –Man without Identity and Girl in Embroidered Shirt – for the first time in Belarus history were rated within the top 10 best graffiti of the month in the world.You can watch this TV-report to see the result:
Photo gallery here->

Urban Myths-2016  is a chance to rise and shine in a different way, it’s a chance for collaboration between artists and it’s a chance to improve ourselves and our environment.
The unique part of the festival is in the idea of exploration of local modern history and urban legends by street artists. We hope this is the way to make artworks be contextual and assist locals to develop their own urban identity.

Dates of the festival Urban Myths 2016: May 2016 - June 2016

The money raised will be expensed for 5 huge murals by world-renowed street artists! Calculation is the simplest ever: 5 murals = 5 artists = 5 countries = $12 500 
The budget considers only the most essential points:

artrists’ travel and visa costs
artists’ accomodation
paint and painting tools
lifting equipment rent costs

The more money we raise - the more amazing street-art will be performed!

We already have:

a group of inspired volunteers experienced in organizing similar projects;  
a support from local municipalities;  
an interest in participation of well-known street artists (here are some examples of their works):


 (Deih, Spain)
 (QBic, Russia)



(T-Radya, Russia)

 (Predok, Belarus)

(Hyuro, Spain)

(Mutus, Belarus)
…we are negotiating with various remarkable artists! News will be published in our blog.Your support can make a real difference, can inspire hundreds of people and organize a really great Festival!___________________________p.s. Other Ways You Can Help
Your brand as an official sponsor of the event (for further communication please contact us by email or Facebook)
Share the project page and information with journalists and your friend in social media
Thank you!

story:
Who are we?

  • We are two performers from Rhode Island. The idea to write Pickles was Laura's, simply because she was sick of seeing women portrayed as "pretty things" or "damsels". We both wrote what we knew and it quickly became apparent that it was really a reflection of our relationship and how we see the world. Similar to the main characters we both have opposing views, but seeing different sides of the coin makes us a better team because we get a wider view. 
  • Pickles was officially selected by The New York International Fringe Festival. We were also the only show selected from Rhode Island. Being selected means the absolute world to us. We have very big plans and can't wait to represent Rhode Island theater with grace, professionalism, and intensity.
  • Every donation gets us one step closer to making this play stand as tall as it can. We can't express enough how important this show is to us. Pickles is our life and we are passionately in love with this show. Contributions mean that the dreams we've had can finally be realized and come to life under the beautiful lights of a New York City stage!

What We Need & What You Get!

  • We have calculated that we will need at least $6,000 to get us to the festival. The funds will be split between our set, costumes, props, travel, insurance, media, marketing, and tipping the venue.
  • We certainly couldn't do this without support, and because we rely so heavily on you we have perks to show you we appreciate every contribution. Depending on your donation amount you will receive a playbill from the New York City run of the show signed by every member of the cast, your name prominently placed in the playbill of our Rhode Island run before we head to the Festival, an exclusive customized T-shirt, or a meet and greet with us for an exclusive look into the show and what goes on backstage!
  • Reaching our entire goal means that we don't have to cut any corners, and that we can see our show fully realized. This could lead to Pickles being picked up by the Festival for more shows and a longer run in New York City.

The Impact

  • We can't really describe what contributions will mean to this project. It's like directly funding someones dreams. Everything becomes easier and all of our efforts over the years will mean something because of your support. Everyone who believes in what we do is remembered and never forgotten. We have always been about team work, and believe there's no other way to get something done.
  • Every show that we have been a part of has become the most important thing in our lives. Everything dulls in comparison because we love what we do so very much. Pickles is poured directly from our hearts and souls and we are determined to put up the best version possible.
  • This is more than just a play for us, this is what we dream of at night. We have spent years working hard and hoping to get an opportunity like the one that lies ahead of us with Pickles. We know that this is possibly the greatest thing that's ever happen to us. We may not change the world with Pickles, but if someone watching can sit back and have as much fun as we're having then it'll all be worth it. If one young girl watches the show and feels more powerful and capable, no words will be able to describe the impact.

Our Risks & Challenges

  • It is a huge risk for the both of us to take this show to New York and put ourselves out there. Pickles is the first play that we have written and while that has no bearing on our success, there are many challenges that we will face. Limited funding for travel and lodging means that our cast and crew won't have a place to stay during our run. No expenses for the set, costumes, or props means that our show won't give people that feeling that we had when we saw it in our minds. Even something that seems simple like making sure we have a place to park our rental truck, which will carry our show inside, requires funds. Without help our show will never make it to the Festival.
  • We are not quitters, and we will never give up on Pickles. This show is us, it is our lives, and it is about what and who we love. We are prepared to do everything we can to put this show up. We know that once people see it and fall in love, like we have, that there'll be no question as to why it needs to be experienced.

Other Ways You Can Help Us

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! Every person that helps, even a little, makes us stronger and more capable!
  • Also, don't forget that you can use the Indiegogo share tools to help us out!
Thank you so much and we hope to see you all at the show!

Our Amazing Cast

        Laura Minadeo  -  Annie
        Alexander Rotella  -  Everyman
        Erin Archer  -  Professor Tellas/The Decafinator
        Zach Searle  -  Yeta
        Jeff Ararat  -  Zack/Yeta's Crew
        Caitlin Arcand  -  Samantha/News Anchor/Zombie
        Mark Carter  -  Frank/Henchmen
        Michael Dubuc  -  Petey/Ryan/Jeff/Zombie
        Lauren Ferreira  -  Citizen/Shuffler/Zombie
        Amy Hammond  -  Model Type Actress/Yeta's Crew
        Sam Ojih  -  Willie/Henchmen
        Matthew Parker  -  Business Man/Todd/Yeta's Crew
        Ana Proulx  -  Becky/Zombie
        Jennifer Robbins  -  Business Woman/Alicia/Yeta's Crew

story:
This an art project designed to boost creativity and restore my belief that humans can be kind and compassionate. Our world needs more empathy and understanding.

I will be placing at least 100 hundred water-proof baggies around the city of Seattle and the surrounding suburbs. In those bags will be bits of my life. The bits will be things I've collected: postcards from all over the world, pieces of created jewelry, beautiful minerals and crystals, found objects, scraps of unique paper, beads, string and more. 

Please use the items in the bag as you wish, but if you make something creative from them, please share a picture on our Facebook page:  https://www.facebook.com/bomlsea

In each bag will be an explanation of the project and a link to this campaign, The hope is that some will contribute so that the project can continue and costs are covered. 

My goal is to distribute the first 20 bags by April 1st,

If you found one of the bags and ended up here, please considering contributing, if you can afford it.

story:
Bref résumé de mon projet

Du 15 février au 15 mars, je serai en résidence de création littéraire à la Maison Félix-Leclerc de Vaudreuil-Dorion. Je prendrai des photographies à partir desquelles je composerai des poèmes. Les meilleures créations feront l'objet d'un recueil. En parallèle à ce projet de création, j’offrirai un atelier ouvert au public. Les participants auront la possibilité d'expérimenter ma méthode durant une fin de semaine complète. À la fin de l'année 2016, une enchère poétique aura lieu à la Maison Félix-Leclerc. 

Project summary

From February 15 through March 15, I will be at Felix Leclerc House of Vaudreuil-Dorion for a creative writing workshop. My project is about poetry and photography. I will take pictures, modify them on computer and write poems inspired by ambiance and emotions I feel during this writing retreat as well as my impressions while I work on those pictures. Best of those poetry artworks will become a poetry book. I also pledged to offer two public events : one week-end of creative writing in autunm 2015 and one poetry auction of the best artwrok (canvas transferred) in winter 2016. Both events are planned at Felix Leclerc residence.

Ce dont j'ai besoin

Votre aide me permettra de subsister pendant ce mois et d’assurer la réalisation technique de ce projet.

  • 550$ iront à la subsistance sur place (nourriture, transport, savons).
  • 1553$ iront aux frais de subsistance à distance (ma part de l'hypothèque, ma part de comptes courants, ma part de contribution pour mes enfants à charge).
  • 200$ aux frais d'impression de manuscrit en couleur et de démarchage d'éditeurs.
  • 750$ en frais de déplacements globaux pour les trois activités organisées entre 2015 et 2016 à la Maison Félix-Leclerc.
  • 1000$ Frais de traiteur lors du lancement/exposition de 2016 et de l'enchère poétique à la fin de l'année 2016.
  • 1000$ cachet de l'encanteur poète (incluant son transport et son hébergement).
  • 3300$ Création d'un site Web qui permettra aux intéressés d'enchérir en temps réel et à distance lors de l'enchère poétique.
  • 2200$ Frais de transferts sur toile, encadrement et laminage des œuvres présentées au lancement du recueil et vendues à l'enchère poétique.

Needs

You donnation will help me to pay for my bills, travelling and food during the workshop and all the events.
  • 550$ CAD for food, transports during workshop.
  • 1553$ CAD for bills at my home (mortgage, loans, heat and electricity).
  • 200$ CAD printing fees.
  • 750$ CAD travelling fees and other transportations (events of 2015-2016).
  • 1000$ CAD poet auctionneer's fees and contract.
  • 3300$ CAD Website and online auction platform.
  • 2200$ Canvas transfers fees.

Ce que vous obtiendrez

  • Plusieurs beaux cadeaux pour des dons d'aussi peu que 1$ (regardez le menu à droite).
  • Des remerciements vous seront adressés personnellement à la fin de mon recueil.
  • Si vous êtes une entreprise, votre logo figurera sur mon journal de création en ligne, les communiqués de presse, au lancement du recueil ainsi qu'aux enchères.
  • Vos noms seront mentionnés lors de la conférence de presse du 16 février 2015, ainsi qu'à la rencontre avec le public du 14 mars 2015.
Si vous regardez les détails de la section "contrepartie" dans le menu de droite, vous trouverez toutes les informations pour chaque type de contribution.

What you will get

  • Many nice gifts for donation as low as 1$ CAD (see right menu).
  • You name will appearat the end of my poetry book.
  • If you are a company, your logo wil be published on my online workshop dary, on press releases, during the poetry book launch and exposition as well as during the poetry auction.
  • Your name will be listed during the Feb. 16 press conference and the March 14 public meeting.
More details on right menu.

D'autres façons d'aider

Si vous ne pouvez pas faire de dons, vous pouvez m'aider comme ceci : 

  • Proposer des services pro bono.
  • Offrir le transport lors des diverses activités prévues.
  • Offrir votre aide (montage et démontage de salles, etc.)
  • Partager ce projet à tous vos contacts.

Merci de votre participation!

Other ways to contribute

If you cannot make a donation, you still can help!
  • Offer your services for free.
  • Propose your transportation help for activities.
  • Help during events.
  • Share this project to all your contacts.
Thank you from all my heart!

story:
Short Summary

DAYTRIP is a Toronto-based collective comprised of Erich DeLeeuw, Matthew Volpe and Andrew Savery-Whiteway. Their latest endeavour After Frank is a documentation of their pilgrimage from Toronto to Mabou, Nova Scotia to New York City, in search of the iconic photographer Robert Frank. Adopting the canon of the great American road trip, with a specific focus on Canadian ephemera, this project is in part an homage to Robert Frank’s seminal series The Americans, a road map for DAYTRIP’s exploration of Canada. The DAYTRIP collective observes and documents subtle elements of discarded Canadiana, while defining a new precedent for the social landscape of a changing country. Returning to fundamental camera systems, small format Black and White 35mm film, the images are especially immersive and draw the viewer into the captured scenarios as a close voyeur. The exhibition of photographs will feature the launch of Issue No.2 of DAYTRIP’s book series, alongside a short documentary film shot on the journey.


What We Need & What You Get

This project's eventual realization is made up of a few parts and with your help we plan to execute a finished product that exceeds expectations and features a special series of images about one of the greatest photographers of all time.

We need to: 

- Print 300 self-published special edition copies of Issue No.2 (approx $3,500)

- Make 20+ custom hardwood picture frames (approx $750)

- Print large scale photographs for the exhibition (approx $2000)

- Produce wall and window vinyl decals for the promotional purposes at the venue (approx $600)

- Develop and invest in marketing and promotional material (approx $200)

You get:

- Assorted perks depending on how much you are willing to spend including, but not limited to, preorders of Issue No.2, custom DAYTRIP shirts, limited edition posters, framed fine art prints and more!


The Impact

After spending our very small, collective savings to make our two week trip to Mabou, Nova Scotia with hopes of finding Robert Frank we were pretty devastated when we arrived at his summer home to learn we had missed him by three weeks. His neighbour informed us that Robert and his wife June had drove to New York where they would spend the upcoming winter and we realized what our only option was. Returning home to Toronto we spent a few weeks saving up enough to buy bus tickets to New York City, and the rest is history. 

Your support will help us tell this story to the best of our ability, we pursued a very unique path and were able to meet and interview the iconic and elusive Robert Frank. We want to do this rare opportunity justice and create an exhibition, book and documentary that will serve as a vehicle for this incredible story. The fact that we have been selected as a featured exhibition for Scotiabank's Contact Photography Festival is a testament to the art communities faith in our work and the remarkable story we are telling. 

Your support has made our dream of creating a photographic book a reality and moving ahead we believe your support will be the catalyst that takes our second edition above and beyond. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to assist us in a financial capacity there are other ways you can help us achieve our goal. By simply sharing our campaign with your connections on social media or by email, using the Indiegogo sharing tools or by word of mouth, anything helps and everything is appreciated.
