story:
A Little About Us...

Hello, we are the Alvarez family. I have been an artist since I could hold a pencil and it has always been my passion. My wife, Monique and I work together at Derek Alvarez Art. We have two little boys, Sam and Grant (Irish Twins) and I wanted to be able to spend as much time with them as possible while still working to provide all they need. Painting on the iPad allows me to continue making art with my boys around me in a non-toxic environment.

We adopted our dog, Charlie Parker, from a shelter in Colorado almost seven years ago and he's like a child to us. My older son Sam adores dogs, ours included, and I thought painting a series of dogs would be fun. Monique had the idea to turn it into a contest where proud pet lovers could submit their dog and story. We received over 50 submissions at last count through our Facebook event.

Congratulations to:

Susan Tiss and Ruairi
Leah Cox and Pony Boy
Colette Nicole and Thor & Happy
Cher Heath and Miracle
Nicole Gregory and Roxy
Kelly Laurich and Oliver & Oscar
Lily Carrizosa and Adonis
Frederick Calabrese and Chipper
Jo Martinez and Louie and Alfie
Brock Cruzan and Boo
Kara McMillian and Mr. Gatsby
Adrennia Gates and Brody & Red
Pauline Haas-Vaughn and Pixel
Karyn Garvin and Luke

We will donate 10% of the proceeds to Pima Animal Care Center located in Tucson, Arizona, where we call home.

Having a successful campaign will allow us to print the calendars (locally through AlphaGraphics), ship them and get them in at least 1,000 homes by the new year.

What We Need & What's In It For You...

We have set our goal to raise $5,000 because this will ensure that we can pay to have 1,000 Pop Dogs 2016 Calendars printed and ready to ship. If we don't reach our goal we'll use the funds to order as many calendars as the funds allow. We will also use a portion of funds for marketing and advertising costs.

As small business owners we are really excited about getting the entire community involved in this project. We have some pretty special perks for businesses and individuals who love and support us here. For example, businesses can sponsor the calendar and have their logo on each one or even retail them during calendar season. Individual supporters can get signed calendars, prints and even the chance to have a custom portrait of their pet painted.

Making A Difference...

Our project is important to us because we believe the world needs more art and that it's important to give back. Art provides us with a way to connect to our true selves, beauty and the divine. Art helps us gain a greater understanding of our emotions. Art is a reason to slow down in a fast-paced world, time greatly needed to heal, grow and improve ourselves. We want our sons to be exposed to art and to know there is a way to express themselves -- be it painting, music, dance, gardening, or cooking. Creating is key to living and loving. We want to be examples of thriving artists.

We also always want to remember the importance of sharing and giving back. Pima Animal Care Center is committed to providing timely service to residents and compassionate care to animals, while working to support public safety, find homes for homeless animals and educate the community about responsible pet ownership. We know firsthand how much joy a dog can bring to a family and we want to help make this happen for families and pets in our community.

Please Share...

We are aware that you may have found our campaign but are not in a position to contribute monetarily. We know the best way to ensure success is to get the word out to as many people as possible. Please share our campaign with friends and family through email and social media. Thank you for supporting a small family business and a big dream! http://DerekAlvarezArt.com
story_txt:
A Little About Us...Hello, we are the Alvarez family. I have been an artist since I could hold a pencil and it has always been my passion. My wife, Monique and I work together at Derek Alvarez Art. We have two little boys, Sam and Grant (Irish Twins) and I wanted to be able to spend as much time with them as possible while still working to provide all they need. Painting on the iPad allows me to continue making art with my boys around me in a non-toxic environment. 
We adopted our dog, Charlie Parker, from a shelter in Colorado almost seven years ago and he's like a child to us. My older son Sam adores dogs, ours included, and I thought painting a series of dogs would be fun. Monique had the idea to turn it into a contest where proud pet lovers could submit their dog and story. We received over 50 submissions at last count through our Facebook event.
Congratulations to:Susan Tiss and RuairiLeah Cox and Pony BoyColette Nicole and Thor & HappyCher Heath and MiracleNicole Gregory and RoxyKelly Laurich and Oliver & OscarLily Carrizosa and AdonisFrederick Calabrese and ChipperJo Martinez and Louie and AlfieBrock Cruzan and BooKara McMillian and Mr. GatsbyAdrennia Gates and Brody & RedPauline Haas-Vaughn and PixelKaryn Garvin and LukeWe will donate 10% of the proceeds to Pima Animal Care Center located in Tucson, Arizona, where we call home.

story:
COLLIDE

Theatre. Performance. Design. Art.

Collide is a London-based theatre company specializing in the blending of theatre with different creative visual techniques, and in exploring theatre as an experience for all senses. 

Who We Are

Collide is a company made of a diverse group of people, all coming from different fields and trainings. Starting from all around the world and the UK, we are meeting in London in an attempt to join our clashing passions and make what we consider bold, visually striking, and powerful theatre.

We are fueled by our diverse backgrounds and supported by our need to create theatre for an audience who is willing to think differently. The way we work and the material we produce reflect our striving to bring all of theatre’s elements together, while creating pieces which challenge the expectations of what theatre should be.

Testing the limits of both our audience’s and our own imaginations, we unite our forces in an attempt to speak through words, images, and sound.

Collide’s debut production will be a site-specific promenade performance of Sarah Kane’s 4.48 Psychosis in the Crypt under St Pancras Church in July 2015.


In order to realise this performance though we need your help!


We need your support in order to:
  • Cover the costs for our venue.
  • Buy all the necessary materials for our installations. 
  • Get the show running. 
  • Promote it.
  • Create the piece we dream to make!


A few words about the play:


Kane’s final play is a raw and sincere landscape of the psychotic mind. It is a story about someone who desperately wanted to communicate, to be understood; to be seen a person and not as an illness. She allows us to observe the struggle of the self to remain intact and its inevitable fall.

Kane’s final play is a raw and sincere landscape of the psychotic mind. It is a story about someone who desperately wanted to communicate, to be understood; to be seen a person and not as an illness. She allows us to observe the struggle of the self to remain intact and its inevitable fall.

Collide is recreating an internal visual depiction of the human mind in turmoil. A barren space, or a mind which is full of potentiality at the same time. Exploring the fragmentation of self, the losing of borders that the psychotic mind experiences, the performance asks the audience to enter a subterranean labyrinth and encounter the complexity of the human memory, imagination and perception in all of its terror and beauty.

They have created a world open to its audience, a theatre of deconstruction which invites the audience to enter a region of the mind most of us would hope never to see.

Enter the labyrinth, but remember: you will be able to exit but someone else will stay in there, trapped forever. 

 

Drop us a line if you need more information! We would love to hear from you: 

contact.collide@gmail.com


Your support would be hugely appreciated!

story:
Summary

"Everyone Can Paint" is an art instruction program that teaches beginner and intermediate students everything they need to know to start making beautiful painting in oil or acrylic. 

This streaming video course will take the student from blank canvas to a completed painting, covering every aspect of the process in detail.  Remember, this series is especially designed for those with LITTLE OR NO PRIOR EXPERIENCE!

Chappy Valente is known in the southeast and California for his landscapes, portraits and large format mural work.  His training came through his time at Art Students League of New York and the International School of Painting, Drawing and Sculpture in Umbria, Italy.

He has spent the past twenty years developing this unique teaching method that has resulted in amazing results for hundreds of students.  In his words, "The secret is in the simplifying". 

What We Need & What You Get

To get things up and running we need to raise the money to produce videos, launch our website and our initial marketing campaign. By being an early supporter of what we believe will become the "go to" art instruction videos we are offering early access to the videos, and the ability to own an original commissioned painting at a fraction of the cost. 

The Impact

The goal of "Everyone Can Paint" is to break down the mental barriers that cause people to think they can't when, in fact, they can.  In Chappy's words, "Everyone can paint once they're shown four fundamental steps in the process". 

Student Work

story:
Greetings!

My name is Angie Schuyler. I am a spiritual, visionary artist, who's every creation is designed to bring healing to the people who keep them, and the environment in which they reside. I am the designer of Mystical Moment Healing Jewelry; the creator of OrgoneART and Vitality Icons, which are orgonite creations that are used as meditation tools and protection against electromagnetic frequencies (EMF's). I am also the visionary behind the Recipro City, experimental gifting economy, idea. My newest inspiration is PRmia and this campaign is largely aimed at helping me launch this new line of healing art.


For all the information you may want, about all my different artistic creations, my passions, and my projects, please go to my Mystical Moment website, and follow all the different links across the top of the page. Each project, or creation, has it's own page.

www.mystical-moment.com

There is also a series of videos to be found HERE that will give deeper explanations, of each project and healing and creative element of the things I plan to do while traveling with my mobile art show.

In February of 2015, I was gifted with the greatest inspiration of my life. The PRmia Trance Art inspiration came, as an answer to a prayer. I asked for an inspiration that could provide an early retirement, and the opportunity to travel.

It has long been my dream to travel, in a motor home, and make my living off my creative talents. So, I requested that this new inspiration be something that I could do anywhere, anytime and with minimal supplies. The PRmia art, requires only a Sharpie, a piece of paper, and a laptop!!! How perfect! The idea came instantly and has turned my whole world around! I have already risked a lot to bring it to where it is now and am willing to risk even more because I don't think it wise, to waste an answered prayer. I am stepping out in faith, risking everything, and going for it! I pray you see the value in assisting me and thank you, in advance, for whatever way you feel led to do so.

This fund-raising campaign is important to me because I am wanting an opportunity to live authentically, and purely, as the artist, and healer that I am, and to share the healing tools, talents and visions I've been given.

Although my jewelry, and orgonite creations, are wonderful and fulfilling to create, the PRmia trance art drawings are beyond amazing, in their ability to heal and create peace. The PRmia project is worthy of my best efforts, my commitment, and my dedication. I have seen the calming and clarifying effect it has on people. I have seen its healing and stress-relieving qualities at work. I have watched the way it delivers messages from Spirit, to those open and wanting to receive. I want to put the PRmia, as well as my other healing arts, in front of as many people as possible. I am intent on sharing it, far and wide, as a way to bless many and provide for my personal needs at the same time.

That would be one dream come true, and I am certain that from that dream, I will be led into the fulfillment of another.

I am in search of an eventual place to settle where I can contribute my talents and abilities to a self-sustainable eco-community that runs on a gifting economy, such as or similar to, my Recipro City vision. Being out on the road, meeting many different people, will increase my chances of finding such a place.

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~

TESTIMONIALS

This is a PRmia review by Kathy Jennings, managing editor of Second Wave Media

"Saturday nights I often find myself with my pens and PRMia book. I am working my way through the book and have found ...it to be a very good way to unwind from the week. I often work lots of hours. This creative play provides a meditative state that I find often eludes me otherwise. It also makes for some very cool dreams. I have been particularly fascinated with the activation part of the PRMia equation and do feel it is part of the work I am doing to raise my vibration and that of those around me."

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~

This is a PRmia review by Nicole Milcarek

"PRima coloring books have helped me get in touch with my basic self and makes me feel like a kid again. If I am stuck... on a project or I'm having a particularly stressful day, I can just pull out my colored pencils and get lost in the intricate designs of Angie Schulyer. It is amazing to me that by the time I am finished with coloring one of the PRima illustrations I have forgotten what I was bothered by when I started. Great for meditation! Great for creativity! Get yours today!"

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~

Grace Sky Says:

"PRmia from my perspective: I love coloring -- I can remember loving it from 2 years old. Within the last few years, I began to see the therapeutic effects of meditative coloring. For me, meditative coloring connects me with my inner child, and that is healing. … Each page has one or more primary image(s). It might appear to you to be an animal, person, some sort of combination, or other entity. (I saw a fairy in a few pages.) While coloring or meditating, you will notice shapes connecting together to form smaller images.In one drawing I found leaves, seeds, ripples of water, and even veins or tributaries. The images and symbols you find assist you in your conscious and subconscious life. I suggest keeping a list of what appears in order to research the meanings and notice synchronicity.

Thank you, Angie for your amazing work and loving spirit. I wish you the best with your magnificent venture!”

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~

Review from Kevin Schuyler

"Angie is always creating new art, and these are not only interesting to look at, but even more fun to color, bringing out the things that you see in the image. I see something different each time I look at them, and can choose colors based on how I feel to best express what I'm seeing. It's very helpful if you have a creative block, to inspire movement in creativity. I can testify to it. I will be talking more about this later, because it works in many ways. This art is special, and so is the artist. I know, Angie is my wife, and this is just the latest of her mind's creativity. Enjoy! -Kevin"

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~

*REVIEW* by Coloring Isn't Just for Kids

PRmia ART FOR COLORING By-Angie Schuyler. PRmia Art is a 22 page coloring book. Pages are all one sided. The paper is normal thickness so you may need to add a piece of paper between the pages for bleed through. The pictures in this coloring book are very different and unique. I have never seen another coloring book like this one. I cant wait to be able to sit down and color one of these pages. A lot of coloring books look alike and or have a lot of the same designs. If you want something different to color than this coloring book is for you. Angie started drawing the art for these coloring books on Feb 12th,2015. She has already created 2 coloring books, PRmia Art for Coloring and PRmia Art for Coloring Book #2. She is starting on book 3 and 4 but isn't going to bring those out until the first 2 coloring books get up and going well but she says she is prepared for that. Angie has been married to her husband Kevin for 5 years. Between the two of them they have 6 grown children and (almost) 7 grand kids(one on the way). Angie has 2 pets, One is a Chinchilla named Ziggy and the other is a male Beta Fish named Rainbow. Angie is a Holistic Healer and she says she has people who buy her coloring books just to contemplate the art and seek out different shapes within it. Some simply like to trace the lines with their fingers and they say it has a peaceful effect on them. The healing aspect of the art is very important to Angie.

You can find Angie on Facebook here: https://www.Facebook.com/perceptionsandreflections

You can purchase Angie's coloring books on Etsy here: https://www.Etsy.com/shop/PRmia

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~

What I Need.....

By choosing to support my project, you would allow me to purchase the things I need, to launch this and to do business, on the road. This is my wish list, in order of priority. If I raise less than the full amount, I will gratefully make do with what I am gifted and adjust according to necessity and priority.

This is a list with approximate amounts and photographic representations of the items I am looking to purchase.

*Art show display, with (weatherproof) tent - $1000.

*Matting and framing, for several of my original drawings so I can do some gallery shows- $500


*Inventory (coloring books, cards, t-shirts, bags, shoes, posters, phone covers, etc.; all with my art on it and all for coloring on. - $2000

*Art Show booth fees, for a year - $1000


*Transportation and Lodging - this could take one of several different forms.

$1,000.00 if all I do is fix my car to make it safe and reliable, and I live in a tent or hotel rooms.

$4,500.00 if I fix the car and pay it off and still have my lodging be a tent or hotel rooms.

$20,000 would purchase a hauling vehicle and a tent trailer.

$24,500.00 would get me a high mileage motor home and fix and pay off my car to tow behind.


$34,500.00 will fix and pay off my car, and purchase a low mileage motor home, in excellent condition.(this would be my ultimate wish)

A motor home or trailer is very important to me.

I like to have my own space. Kind of like a turtle, I like to carry my home with me, wherever I go. :-) This is an essential for me. I really need, for my own well-being, to not have to stay in hotels. I need a space to call my very own.

Should this project be over funded:

Should this project be over-funded, I will immediately hire a financial professional, to handle bookkeeping and taxes. Then I'll put the extra funds in a trust and start a not-for-profit for the Recipro City project, which supports organic gardens and sustainable living projects, as well as the creation of an economy that runs on the law of reciprocity. Should it be over funded, by a million dollars or more, I just might buy a particular property I am aware of that would be the perfect location for my Recipro City style eco-village / healing center / hermitage.

What You Get for Offering Your Support.....

I am offering samples of my art, and products made with my art.

You can find all the incentives in boxes along the right side of this page, near the top.

The Impact my Vision Can Make

I am only one person, yet I have much, in the way of healing tools, inspiration, advice and vision, to offer the people, who's paths I'll cross, along my ensuing journey.

I want to teach people, about energy work and the power of Love and reciprocity, to heal and bring positive change. I want to share about my experiences with Recipro City, so far. I also want to share my ideas, for changing our economy into a kinder and gentler system that cares for the needs of all, and does so in ways that help our natural environment to heal and flourish.

I want to work, with the people I meet along my way, to continue my Recipro City experiment, by encouraging them to start Recipro Stations, install neighborhood Share Sheds, and organize Share Fairs and Gifting Markets.


I also want to encourage people to join the "I Love You!" movement.

I don't have any fancy education credentials to share with you. Everything I have learned, and have to offer has been gifts of Spirit or gained from personal experience and expressed through natural talents. I have spent the past 15 years developing my intuition and my various artistic expressions. Now, I am embarking on a journey that will allow me to test my faith, in the way I was inspired by my hero, Peace Pilgrim.

Peace Pilgrim was a woman who walked all over the US, for 28 years, going only on faith to provide for her, while she traveled around talking to people about peace. My mission is different but I know I have the faith to take me down the road!

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~

TESTIMONIALS

"That art is transformative is certainly not new. Religious artifacts and architecture in every culture are a testament to this. But these are brand new times!........This strikes me as art that’s meant to be used. Each image should be grasped and manipulated with dexterity and vigor; they should be wrung out to see what more might be squeezed from pulp and pits, even as our eternal thirst seems momentarily quenched. It is the consumer of this art who paradoxically comes to it as the unmolded clay… " ~ Author ~ Niels Kunze from his article about the Prmia art "Where Art Thou"

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~

I have found that coloring these awesome trance art pieces has the ability to help me calm myself. I was feeling anxious, my mind jumping from one "must do" thought to another. I looked through the pages, searching for the image that appealed to me most. I turned them this way and that. Suddenly, there it was! Once I started to color the image, I found myself relaxing, my breathing slowed and became deep and regular. My mind focused on choosing the colors and finding the patterns, hidden within the picture, that spoke to my subconscious mind. This is a wonderful tool to use to help you wake up your imagination and journey deep into your inner self.~ Tish Sanders

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~

"I took some of Angie's wonderful drawings and I colored them in with marker. I cannot tell you how relaxing and connected they help me feel .. they relieve stress and they allowed my imagination to soar . I love them....try it .. it is wonderful .. coloring releases any stress I may be having .. I cannot say enough about them !! " ~ Carolyn L'Hommedieu

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~

"Meditate… breathe… and then go grab your crayons! This is artwork that begs to be defaced. Coloring is the consummation of this marriage. The doodle-art progeny created are novelty expressions, akin to your own DNA in their uniqueness. And when you’re finished, it’s not so much that you’ve really altered the original– it’s still there, underneath– but it’s more that you put something of yourself into it, a giving of self-expression… for the opportunity of claiming that expression AS Self, tangibly… demonstrably." ~ Author ~ Niels Kunze, from his article "Where Art Thou"

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~

Risks & Challenges

I have been preparing for this journey, mentally and emotionally, for a very long time. As far as going out on the road, the challenges will depend on the level of funding support I am starting off with. I am making this journey, regardless of the funding received from this campaign. It is my hope that I am able to do it in the comfort and security that comes with having a reliable motor home and a car to tow behind. If that doesn't happen, I still know that I will be fine. I am very resilient and no stranger to roughing it, or going without. I look forward to traveling with abundance, ease and grace. Should challenges arise I will meet them with faith. Which always gives me great stories to tell about how Spirit works miracles to take care of me.

My biggest personal challenge, is in dealing with the bureaucracy but I have people who will take over that job for me, so I am not worried about that part.

I am no stranger to RVing. My two boys raced moto-cross for several years so I spent every weekend RVing. I also worked several years, in the 80s, on the production line, in RV plants. I have a well rounded working knowledge of how the systems within the RV function.

I am no stranger to selling my art, either. I provided for myself and my kids, while raising them as a single mom, by selling my jewelry in a wide variety of venues, between 1997 and 2006. Since then I have continued to, periodically, do arts and craft shows. I have also maintained a cleaning business, for the past 8 years, in which I implemented my energy healing abilities, with physical cleaning and organizing work. You can find out more, about that and look at some of my references, by clicking the Good Vibes tab on my Mystical Moment website www.mystical-moment.com/

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone is able to help with $s , but that doesn't mean you can't be a huge help to me.

You can still help, by getting the word out and making some noise about my campaign The Indiegogo share tools are easy and convenient to use!


Thank You! Thank You! Thank You! I appreciate, very much, you taking the time to read and to consider giving your support!


I reserve the right to go with the flow and shift directions, as the path unfolds before me.

I Love You ALL!


I expect a miracle now!                                       

Angie

artistic creations, my passions, and my projects, please go to my
Mystical Moment website, and follow all the different links across
the top of the page. Each project, or creation, has it's own page.
www.mystical-moment.com
There is also a series of videos to be found HERE
that will give deeper explanations, of each project and healing and
creative element of the things I plan to do while traveling with my
mobile art show. 

In February of 2015, I was gifted with the greatest inspiration of
my life. The PRmia Trance Art inspiration came, as an answer to a
prayer. I asked for an inspiration that could provide an early
retirement, and the opportunity to travel. 

It has long been my dream to travel, in a motor home, and make my
living off my creative talents. So, I requested that this new
inspiration be something that I could do anywhere, anytime and with
minimal supplies. The PRmia art, requires only a Sharpie, a piece of
paper, and a laptop!!! How perfect! The idea came instantly and has
turned my whole world around! I have already risked a lot to bring it
to where it is now and am willing to risk even more because I don't
think it wise, to waste an answered prayer. I am stepping out in
faith, risking everything, and going for it! I pray you see the value
in assisting me and thank you, in advance, for whatever way you feel
led to do so.
This fund-raising campaign is important to me because I am wanting
an opportunity to live authentically, and purely, as the artist, and
healer that I am, and to share the healing tools,
talents and visions I've been given.
Although my jewelry, and orgonite creations, are wonderful and
fulfilling to create, the PRmia  trance art drawings are beyond
amazing, in their ability to heal and create peace. The PRmia project
is worthy of my best efforts, my commitment, and my dedication. I
have seen the calming and clarifying effect it has on people. I have
seen its healing and stress-relieving qualities at work. I have
watched the way it delivers messages from Spirit, to those open and
wanting to receive. I want to put the PRmia, as well as my other
healing arts, in front of as many people as possible. I am intent on
sharing it, far and wide, as a way to bless many and provide for my
personal needs at the same time.
That would be one dream come true, and I am certain that from that
dream, I will be led into the fulfillment of another. 

I am in search of an eventual place to settle where I can
contribute my talents and abilities to a self-sustainable
eco-community that runs on a gifting economy, such as or similar to,
my Recipro City vision. Being out on the road, meeting many different
people, will increase my chances of finding such a place.
~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~
TESTIMONIALS
This is a PRmia review by Kathy Jennings, managing editor
of Second Wave Media
"Saturday nights I often find myself with my pens and
PRMia book. I am working my way through the book and have found ...it
to be a very good way to unwind from the week. I often work lots of
hours. This creative play provides a meditative state that I find
often eludes me otherwise. It also makes for some very cool dreams. I
have been particularly fascinated with the activation part of the
PRMia equation and do feel it is part of the work I am doing to raise
my vibration and that of those around me."
~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~
This is a PRmia review by Nicole Milcarek
"PRima coloring books have helped me get in touch
with my basic self and makes me feel like a kid again. If I am
stuck... on a project or I'm having a particularly stressful day, I
can just pull out my colored pencils and get lost in the intricate
designs of Angie Schulyer. It is amazing to me that by the time I am
finished with coloring one of the PRima illustrations I have
forgotten what I was bothered by when I started. Great for
meditation! Great for creativity! Get yours today!"

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~Grace
Sky Says:
"PRmia from my perspective: I love coloring -- I can
remember loving it from 2 years old. Within the last few years, I
began to see the therapeutic effects of meditative coloring.         
     For me, meditative coloring connects me with my inner child, and
that is healing. …               Each page has one or more primary
image(s).                                                            
                         It might appear to you to be an animal,
person, some sort of combination, or other entity.            (I saw
a fairy in a few pages.)                                             
                                                              While
coloring or meditating, you will notice shapes connecting together to
form smaller images.In one drawing I found leaves, seeds, ripples of
water, and even veins or tributaries.      The images and symbols you
find assist you in your conscious and subconscious life.             
         I suggest keeping a list of what appears in order to
research the meanings and notice synchronicity.
Thank you, Angie for your amazing work and loving spirit. 
                                                              I wish
you the best with your magnificent venture!”
~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~
Review from Kevin Schuyler
"Angie is always creating new art, and these are not
only interesting to look at, but even more fun to color, bringing out
the things that you see in the image. I see something different each
time I look at them, and can choose colors based on how I feel to
best express what I'm seeing. It's very helpful if you have a
creative block, to inspire movement in creativity. I can testify to
it. I will be talking more about this later, because it works in many
ways. This art is special, and so is the artist. I know, Angie is my
wife, and this is just the latest of her mind's creativity. Enjoy!
-Kevin"
~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~
*REVIEW* by Coloring Isn't Just for Kids
PRmia ART FOR COLORING By-Angie Schuyler. PRmia Art is a
22 page coloring book. Pages are all one sided. The paper is normal
thickness so you may need to add a piece of paper between the pages
for bleed through. The pictures in this coloring book are very
different and unique. I have never seen another coloring book like
this one. I cant wait to be able to sit down and color one of these
pages. A lot of coloring books look alike and or have a lot of the
same designs. If you want something different to color than this
coloring book is for you. Angie started drawing the art for these
coloring books on Feb 12th,2015. She has already created 2 coloring
books, PRmia Art for Coloring and PRmia Art for Coloring Book #2. She
is starting on book 3 and 4 but isn't going to bring those out until
the first 2 coloring books get up and going well but she says she is
prepared for that. Angie has been married to her husband Kevin for 5
years. Between the two of them they have 6 grown children and
(almost) 7 grand kids(one on the way). Angie has 2 pets, One is a
Chinchilla named Ziggy and the other is a male Beta Fish named
Rainbow. Angie is a Holistic Healer and she says she has people who
buy her coloring books just to contemplate the art and seek out
different shapes within it. Some simply like to trace the lines with
their fingers and they say it has a peaceful effect on them. The
healing aspect of the art is very important to Angie.
You can find Angie on Facebook here:
https://www.Facebook.com/perceptionsandreflections
You can purchase Angie's coloring books on Etsy here:
https://www.Etsy.com/shop/PRmia

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~
What I Need..... 

By choosing to support my project, you would allow me to purchase
the things I need, to launch this  and to do business, on the road.
This is my wish list, in order of priority. If I raise less than the
full amount, I will gratefully make do with what I am gifted and
adjust according to necessity and priority.
This is a list with approximate amounts and photographic
representations of the items I am looking to purchase.
*Art show display, with (weatherproof) tent  - $1000.
*Matting and framing, for several of my original drawings so I can
do some gallery shows- $500

*Inventory (coloring books, cards, t-shirts, bags, shoes, posters,
phone covers, etc.; all with my art on it and all for coloring on. -
$2000
*Art Show booth fees, for a year  - $1000

*Transportation and Lodging - this could take one of several different forms.
$1,000.00 if all I do is fix my car to make it safe and reliable,
and I live in a tent or hotel rooms.$4,500.00 if I fix the car and pay it off and still have my lodging be a tent or hotel rooms.
$20,000 would purchase a hauling vehicle and a tent trailer.
$24,500.00 would get me a high mileage motor home and fix and pay
off my car to tow behind.

$34,500.00 will fix and pay off my car, and purchase a low mileage
motor home, in excellent condition.(this would be my ultimate wish)
A motor home or trailer is very important to me.
I like to have my own space. Kind of like a turtle, I like to
carry my home with me, wherever I go. :-) This is an essential for
me. I really need, for my own well-being, to not have to stay in
hotels. I need a space to call my very own.
Should this project be over funded:

Should this project be over-funded, I will immediately hire a
financial professional, to handle bookkeeping and taxes. Then I'll
put the extra funds in a trust and start a not-for-profit for the
Recipro City project, which supports organic gardens and sustainable
living projects, as well as the creation of an economy that runs on
the law of reciprocity. Should it be over funded, by a million
dollars or more, I just might buy a particular property I am aware of
that would be the perfect location for my Recipro City style
eco-village / healing center / hermitage.
What You Get for Offering Your
Support..... 

 I am offering samples of my art, and products made with my art.
You can find all the incentives in boxes along the right side of
this page, near the top.
The Impact my Vision Can Make
I am only one person, yet I have much, in the way of healing
tools, inspiration, advice and vision, to offer the people, who's
paths I'll cross, along my ensuing journey.
I want to teach people, about energy work and the power of Love
and reciprocity, to heal and bring positive change. I want to share
about my experiences with Recipro City, so far. I also want to share
my ideas, for changing our economy into a kinder and gentler system
that cares for the needs of all, and does so in ways that help our
natural environment to heal and flourish.
I want to work, with the people I meet along my way, to continue
my Recipro City
experiment, by encouraging them to start Recipro
Stations, install neighborhood Share Sheds, and organize Share Fairs
and Gifting Markets.

I also want to encourage people to join the  "I
Love You!" movement.
I don't have any fancy education credentials to share with you.
Everything I have learned, and have to offer has been gifts of Spirit
or gained from personal experience and expressed through natural
talents. I have spent the past 15 years developing my intuition and
my various artistic expressions. Now, I am embarking on a journey
that will allow me to test my faith, in the way I was inspired by my
hero, Peace Pilgrim.
Peace Pilgrim was a woman who walked all over the US, for 28
years, going only on faith to provide for her, while she traveled
around talking to people about peace. My mission is different but I
know I have the faith to take me down the road!
~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~ 

TESTIMONIALS
"That art is transformative is certainly not new.
Religious artifacts and architecture in every culture are a testament
to this. But these are brand new times!........This strikes me as art
that’s meant to be used. Each image should be grasped and
manipulated with dexterity and vigor; they should be wrung out to see
what more might be squeezed from pulp and pits, even as our eternal
thirst seems momentarily quenched. It is the consumer of this art who
paradoxically comes to it as the unmolded clay… " ~ Author ~
Niels Kunze from his article about the Prmia art "Where Art
Thou"
~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~
I have found that coloring these awesome trance art pieces
has the ability to help me calm myself. I was feeling anxious, my
mind jumping from one "must do" thought to another. I
looked through the pages, searching for the image that appealed to me
most. I turned them this way and that. Suddenly, there it was! Once I
started to color the image, I found myself relaxing, my breathing
slowed and became deep and regular. My mind focused on choosing the
colors and finding the patterns, hidden within the picture, that
spoke to my subconscious mind. This is a wonderful tool to use to
help you wake up your imagination and journey deep into your inner
self.~ Tish Sanders
~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~
"I took some of Angie's wonderful drawings and I
colored them in with marker. I cannot tell you how relaxing and
connected they help me feel .. they relieve stress and they allowed
my imagination to soar . I love them....try it .. it is wonderful ..
coloring releases any stress I may be having .. I cannot say enough
about them !! " ~ Carolyn L'Hommedieu
~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~
"Meditate… breathe… and then go grab your
crayons! This is artwork that begs to be defaced. Coloring is the
consummation of this marriage. The doodle-art progeny created are
novelty expressions, akin to your own DNA in their uniqueness. And
when you’re finished, it’s not so much that you’ve really
altered the original– it’s still there, underneath– but it’s
more that you put something of yourself into it, a giving of
self-expression… for the opportunity of claiming that expression AS
Self, tangibly… demonstrably." ~ Author ~ Niels Kunze, from
his article "Where Art Thou"
~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~
Risks & Challenges
I have been preparing for this journey, mentally and emotionally,
for a very long time. As far as going out on the road, the challenges
will depend on the level of funding support I am starting off with. I
am making this journey, regardless of the funding received from this
campaign. It is my hope that I am able to do it in the comfort and
security that comes with having a reliable motor home and a car to
tow behind. If that doesn't happen, I still know that I will be fine.
I am very resilient and no stranger to roughing it, or going without.
I look forward to traveling with abundance, ease and grace. Should
challenges arise I will meet them with faith. Which always gives me
great stories to tell about how Spirit works miracles to take care of
me.
My biggest personal challenge, is in dealing with the bureaucracy
but I have people who will take over that job for me, so I am not
worried about that part.
I am no stranger to RVing. My two boys  raced moto-cross for
several years so I spent every weekend RVing. I also worked several
years, in the 80s, on the production line, in RV plants. I have a
well rounded working knowledge of how the systems within the RV
function. 

I am no stranger to selling my art, either. I provided for myself
and my kids, while raising them as a single mom, by selling my
jewelry in a wide variety of venues, between 1997 and 2006. Since
then I have continued to, periodically, do arts and craft shows.  I
have also maintained a cleaning business, for the past 8 years, in
which I implemented my energy healing abilities, with physical
cleaning and organizing work. You can find out more, about that and
look at some of my references, by clicking the Good
Vibes tab on my Mystical Moment website www.mystical-moment.com/
Other Ways You Can Help
I understand that not everyone is able to help with $s , but that
doesn't mean you can't be a huge help to me.
You can still help, by getting the word out and making some noise
about my campaign The Indiegogo share tools are easy and convenient
to use!

Thank You! Thank You! Thank You! I appreciate, very much, you
taking the time to read and to consider giving your support!




I reserve the right to go
		with the flow and shift directions, as the path unfolds before me.


I Love You ALL!I expect a miracle now!                                        
Angie

story:
Mi nombre es Lucas Belmonte Amenta, en unos días cumplo 17 años, me encuentro cursando el  4 año de educación secundaria del colegio san José en Rafaela, Santa Fe, Argentina. A los tres años fui diagnosticado con TGD (Trastorno Generalizado del Desarrollo) no especificado. Me apasiona el origami desde los 9 años.

Mi proyecto consiste en hacer 193 origamis (estrella de 12 puntas) en papel reciclado con la palabra paz impresa en diferentes idiomas; y después enviarlos por correo a las representaciones de los países del mundo en las oficinas de la ONU, en Nueva York.  

Con este proyecto busco:

  •  Dar un mensaje de superación para todas las personas con capacidades especiales como TGD, síndrome de asperger o u otro trastorno, mostrando que pueden superarse si se lo proponen. Pues todos tenemos la capacidad de hacer cosas grandes en el interior.
  • Contribuir en dar a conocer el arte del origami.
  •  Dar un mensaje de paz para el mundo con mis origamis. Cada uno de los que envié tendrá escrito por todas partes la palabra paz en diferentes idiomas, para que mi mensaje se entienda en todos los idiomas.

Con dinero que recaude pagare:

  •  El papel reciclado.
  •  Las cajas.
  •  La impresión con la palabra paz en todos los idiomas en el papel.
  •  Mientras que la embajada Argentina permanente en Naciones Unidas, a quien agradezco profundamente,  colaborará con el envío por correo de los origamis a las oficinas de la ONU en Nueva York, por lo que no tendré gastos de correo.
Los invito a ver el vídeo, donde doy detalles del proyecto. 

Cualquier opinión, sugerencia o comentario sera bienvenido: 

lucasbelmonteamenta2.0@gmail.com

story:
We did it!   Thanks to you, we made it to the Playa for Burning Man 2014!!!

It was truly an amazing journey one that the entire team will never forget!

It was a definitely intense and now that XUZA is built we are now ready to take her to a whole new level.  

As soon as we arrived home from the Playa last year we looked over all of our notes.  What worked, what didn't and these are the things we were focused on for 2015.

The items that caused us the most headaches were:

  1. Transportation / Trailer
    The rig was too big for the trailer that was rented to us, which delayed us 3.5 days. A good friend and fellow burner and Art Car builder reached out with a professional hauler who hooked us up and helped us get to the Playa.  It cost us a mint, but we were determined to get her there even though it cost us in the wallet and five days late.
  2. The Mask
    This was just too bulky and heavy.  It took a team of us to get her positioned and mounted. 
  3. The Driver controls
    The Driver had very limited visibility which was a major safety concern.

I met with my good friend and amazing Artist Gear Duran over the Christmas Holiday and he expressed 100% interest in creating a whole new look for XUZA!
XUZA is being hand sculpted out of foam core material and will be airbrushed in UV reactive colors,  this will truly be an ART car!

We are now looking for you to be a part of this amazing Project!   When XUZA appears out of the dust in front of you, I want you to have the satisfaction of knowing that you helped build this masterpiece!   Wave us down, and jump on board, we have a full size Refrigerator / Freezer on board stocked full of refreshing cold beverages and frozen treats to help cool you down from the heat of the day.  Then Party with us as our DJ's lay down some sic beats which will be the soundtrack to our journey together!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help: Please share this campaign through your social networks, email lists, etc. 

You can use the Indiegogo share tools! 

Every Dollar counts... if all 60,000 residents of Black Rock City contributed just $0.20 we would easily hit our goal!!!


Your contribution will go to the following key expenses:
  • Building Materials: 
    Foam Blocks:
    Ten 8' x 4' Foam blocks which will be hand carved by Gear Duran.  everything needed to successfully create this foam core masterpiece

  • Mechanical:
    We are moving the driver controls to the front of the rig, suspended from the top deck... Much safer, more visibility for the driver and it looks absolutely BAD ASS!

  • Steel: 
    To build the skeleton structure to support the foam core

  • Lighting:
    UV reactive Lighting to enhance the UV reactive paint scheme
    Full Spectrum LED's  to complete the 8' x 26' LED ceiling

  • Transportation Costs
    We are looking to have our own Trailer and Hauler so we don't have to rely on outside companies anymore.   Fuel, both transporting her and while on the playa. 
  • Bells and Buzzers:
    This we can't disclose, I know, I know... but there are some many amazing features that were adding to XUZA this year that we want you to be surprised when you get to experience her in person!

In Hindu Numerology, XUZA :

TEACHER, will expand healing qualities and to serve as a reflection of cosmic truth to all.

 

 Amazing Perks!!!!
This year our T-shirts, Tanks and Leggings are
XUZA Inspired designs by Gear Duran. 
 
XUZA Limited Edition T-Shirts!The shirts are printed using a dye sublimation process which allows all over printing.


XUZA Limited Edition Leggings:
you know you want a pair ;-)


Your Own Custom Burn Barrels!
We offered the Custom Burn Barrels last year with much success!!!  
Just send us your camp logo or whatever name you would like and we will customize the barrel and bring it to the Playa with us where you can pick it up from our camp or you can pick it up locally in Las Vegas!

 


My Dear Friends Sammi and Chandra are getting Married at the Playa this year.  They were on the Journey with me in 2013 when I had "the Vision".  They wanted to contribute to the funding video and help with this campaign.  After watching the clips they sent, I needed to edit it and make their own Video segment.  This is the LOVE from my Burner Family..... enjoy lol...

story:
I want to develop 3D anaglyph in painting drawing and sculpture and give the world the new art direction. At the same time this art form gives me ability to say that I’m improving the main historical principal of paintings: exposing three dimensions in two dimensions, this is exactly word by word explaining what I do, in my art.

I’m working on 3D art, 2 years already and I want to make huge jump this year in this direction, to start painting huge figures in different dimensions and create huge paintings. I think that this should be the art of the XXI century, we all want to see something new and my soul needs to create something that will encourage people to be better than they are thinking of themselves. I think that art should make world the better place and for me it is very important to show the idea and concept of painting. 

By Kanye 3D  portraits I want to make some kind of iconography of new age, to mention that this person Kaney West made huge difference. When I made my first 3D anaglyph painting, which my friends and relatives thought was impossible to do, I started to believe in myself too. Now my aim is to create a massive painting using both figurative arts and my 3D anaglyph technics. That is the reason of why I need a detailed knowledge of figurative arts to make the most impressive illusion of the real-sized figures in 3D, which I am sure I am going to get at the New-York Academy of art.

5 month ago New York Academy of Art accepted me for full time student master two year program of figurative arts. I was chosen with 50 student from all over the world. Everything was great until I failed finding a financing for my study.

People I need your help, I need to collect $70000  for annual cost tuition to become professional and develop new form of art.

მოგმართავთ თქვენც ჩემო ქართველო მეგობრებო, იმის გამო რომ განათლების საერთაშორისო ცენტრის პრიორიტეტულ მიმართულებაში არ ჩამთვალეს, ვცდილობ შევაგროვო პირველი წლის გადასახადი, დარწმუნებული ვარ 5$ არავის დააზარალებს , ვისაც კი ამის საშუალება გაქვთ გთხოვთ 5000 კაცმა რომ ჩამირიცხოს ხუთ-ხუთი დოლარი უკვე შემიგროვდება თანხის ნახევარი რაც უკვე საკმარისი იქნება ჩემი სწავლების დაწყებისთვის, ძალიან გთხოვთ დამეხმაროთ მსოფლიოს მაშტაბით, ახალი მიმდინარეობის დამკვიდრება საქართველოს თანამედროვე ხელოვნების სახელით. 
თითოეული ადამიანის დოლარიც კი მე მომიმატებს რეიტინგს! გთხოვთ გაიზიაროთ და გააკეთოთ დონაცია.
ზოგიერთი ადამიანი ვერ გაერკვია  როორ უნდა ჩარიცხონ და ამ შემთხევაში მთხოვეს საბანკო ანგარიშის ნომერიც.
ჩემი ანგარიშის ნომერია: GE50BG0000000317536200
story_txt:
I want to develop 3D anaglyph in painting drawing and sculpture and give the world the new art direction. At the same time this art form gives me ability to say that I’m improving the main historical principal of paintings: exposing three dimensions in two dimensions, this is exactly word by word explaining what I do, in my art.I’m working on 3D art, 2 years already and I want to make huge jump this year in this direction, to start painting huge figures in different dimensions and create huge paintings. I think that this should be the art of the XXI century, we all want to see something new and my soul needs to create something that will encourage people to be better than they are thinking of themselves. I think that art should make world the better place and for me it is very important to show the idea and concept of painting. By Kanye 3D  portraits I want to make some kind of iconography of new age, to mention that this person Kaney West made huge difference. When I made my first 3D anaglyph painting, which my friends and relatives thought was impossible to do, I started to believe in myself too. Now my aim is to create a massive painting using both figurative arts and my 3D anaglyph technics. That is the reason of why I need a detailed knowledge of figurative arts to make the most impressive illusion of the real-sized figures in 3D, which I am sure I am going to get at the New-York Academy of art.
5 month ago New York Academy of Art accepted me for full time student master two year program of figurative arts. I was chosen with 50 student from all over the world. Everything was great until I failed finding a financing for my study.

story:
***All funds raised after $5,000 will go towards production!***

Short Summary

 The TTRG began with Isaac Facio and Heather Mackenzie building interest and collaboration around the nature of craft, research, and invention that strives to create a collective of expertise across the arts and sciences through mentorship, curatorial and technical collaborations, exhibitions, and outreach within the areas of textiles and fiber-based media. The TTRG also includes collaborators Joyce Lee Safe and Erika Rae.

This project has been a year in the making through multiple grant applications, public presentations, symposiums, culminating in an exhibition. With the support of an EAGER Grant from SAIC’s Earl and Brenda Shapiro Center for Research and Collaboration, we were able to fund the initial applications to the TextielLab. The Fiber and Material Studies department has also generously sponsored our accommodations while in Tilburg. 

Responding to her cultural heritage, Melissa Leandro experiments with the interlacements between off-the-grid embroidery and jacquard weaving in Una Parte de la Multitud,  A Part of the Multitude. Through the abstract depiction of landscapes, she maps relationships between elements in space, like objects, landmasses, and cultural identities. As she invents a unique and technical language of symbols and fractured objects, she aims to develop physical translations between weaving, embroidery, and drawing.

Sasha de Koninck studies self-awareness with responsive knitted architecture in textiles for clothing in Garments for Uncomfortable Social Situations. Investigating textile structures, she uses a waffle knit structure to build a three dimensional textile that responds as a pressure sensor. She creates a multisensory experience, through the research and development of smart textile material for the body that is intimate, sensitive and loud.

Melissa and Sasha have been accepted to produce their projects at the TextielLab in Tilburg, the Netherlands. We are the first US students to be accepted to the TextielLab.

"The TextielLab at the TextielMuseum is a unique knowledge centre, combining a specialised workshop for the manufacture of unique fabrics and an open studio where innovation is central. National and international designers, architects, artists and promising students are guided by product developers and technical experts, and so discover the endless possibilities of yarn, computer-controlled techniques and craftsmanship." http://www.textiellab.nl/en/page/lab-intro


What We Need & What You Get

We have received grants and donations to cover initial flight and accommodations in Tilburg, as well as initial development fees and some materials. These include: The Shapiro Center Eager Grant, the Dimensions of an Artist Grant, the Idea Generation Grant, and individual funding request through SAIC Student Government.

The remaining expenses we need to fund include:

Travel:

  • Field research in Amsterdam, Brussels, and Tournai. Total: $350

  • Local transportation in all locations

Accomodations:

  • Hostel, room and board in Amsterdam, Brussels, and Tournai. Total: $466.77

Development:

  • Remaining 70 % of development cost for Melissa and Sasha projects, Total: $4,572.00

  • Development entails sampling, testing and prototyping with the machines to make final aesthetic decisions about each project.

Production:

  • Any funds exceeding original goal of $10,000, will be allocated towards productions costs

  • Once we have completed the development stage of our projects, the Textile Lab will notify us of the final production costs

  • Production entails the production and finishing of textiles

Materials:

Melissa:

  • 8 cones of (Lurex) Metallic Yarn 8/2

  • 35 cones Perle (mercerized) Cotton$

  • 45 spools Embroidery Floss- Melrose

Sasha:

  • 11 Cones Conductive Yarn

  • 35 Cones

  • 7 LilyPad MP3

  • 7 LiPo Batteries

  • 7 MicroSD cards


Shipping and peripherals

  • 6 Boxes at dimensions (24x24x12, 50lbs) traveling one way for both artists

  • Return shipping of finished work

  • Baggage Fee 2nd Bag (one way)

  • Total: $1,000

Perks

$5  -Thank you on our website: We are starting a Tumblr to document our experience at the TextielLab, donors will get a shot out on the news feed.

$25 - Postcard from one of our travel locations: Receive a specialized thank you postcard from Tilburg, Brussels, or Amsterdam.

$50 - Jacquard woven patch and Shout out on Website. Receive a jacquard patch woven with holographic Lurex featuring a TTRG logo design by Bea Pomasanoff. 


$75- Print: Receive a print of a jacquard weave graphic score by Sasha de Koninck. Choose from 5 designs, 17"x48", Satin Luster. 

 

        1              2                3                4                5

$100 - Button set of artist works: A set of five buttons featuring images of Melissa and Sasha’s work. And a TTRG button!


$150 - Heat press weaving coaster set. (4 included) Hand woven plastic materials, fused into textile coasters. Water Resistant. 4” Square.

$200- T-Shirt: You can choose from four shirt designs by Sasha de Koninck featuring patterns generated in MaxMSP. Shirts are unisex. Sizes available: XXS-4XL. (Shirts printed through Print All Over Me)

A                                                                                  B

C                                                                                        D

$250 - Original Sun Print or Drawing: 1 8.5x11 Sun Print collage or drawing by Melissa Leandro. Plus woven jacquard patch.  

  

  

$500 - Original Jacquard weaving (donor chooses from selection) by Melissa Leandro and Sasha de Koninck. Plus Button set.

Sasha de Koninck, Flight Patterns. Textile is made up of 15 images generated in MaxMSP. Choose one image per $500.

Sasha de Koninck, Flight Patterns. Textile is made up of 15 images generated in MaxMSP. Choose one image per $500.

  

Melissa Leandro. Package no.1-4. Textile is one of a series of 4 sun prints. Choose one per $500.

Melissa Leandro. Pocket keepsake. Textile is made of 3 sun print images, choose one per $500.

$1000 - Dinner Party: If you are local, we will host a dinner party for you and a guest at Sasha’s apartment where we will talk about our time at the TextielLab over a delicious home cooked meal. Plus postcard, woven patch, and button set.

The Impact

The TextielLab offers a rare blend of old and new technology through access to cutting edge equipment and collection of textiles. We are the only students from the US to ever be accepted to produce projects at this facility. This opportunity is incredibly exciting because there are only a handful of places in the world offering access to computerized textile production equipment to independent artists. For a period of 8 production days, we will each be working with our own dedicated technician and machine. This period is known as development stage, after which point the facility with produce the final body of work.

Without this funding our projects will not be possible without a large financial burden put on the group. Even if we hit the $10,000 goal, we will not personally be compensated. Every dollar raised will go directly to seeing these projects succeed from start to finish. More broadly, we see this as an opportunity to pursue our largest projects to date.

We hope that with your help we can make this a reality.

Risks & Challenges

As members of the Textile Technology Research group, we have met on a weekly basis for the last year to continue to move our projects forward, fundraise, organize outside events, and bring notoriety to the group. We are deeply invested in completing these projects, and securing funds for development and production is the final hurdle.

Once we are at the TextielLab, we will have to tackle language barriers, technical difficulties, time and material constraints. The TextielLab has only quoted us for development costs. Once we determine scale, materiality and finishing, the TextielLab will give us a quote for Production costs. This is a complete unknown. Making this a highly risky endeavor.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot make a monetary contribution, please help us by sharing our campaign. Every little bit helps!

story:
Mike Covell, Jason Fritts, and Macey Mott are setting out on a long-held dream to create a flexible rehearsal, performance and events space to serve the Jackson Hole community.  That dream is taking shape as Convergence.

Mike (a musician and sound designer), Jason (a musician, teacher, and band leader), and Macey (a theater and artistic director, producer, designer, and actor) all have long histories in Jackson's performing arts community and more than 60 years of combined experience creating and managing performance art.

As Jackson continues to grow, existing venues are bursting at the seams.  Small theater, music, and dance groups in our area can't afford to rent the space.  We hope to provide an affordable alternative for rehearsal, performance, and event space the artistic community can take advantage of.

Convergence will make its home on North Cache Street in Jackson.  The large open space will provide flexible options for a wide variety of needs. Retractable walls can be closed to create smaller rehearsal or classroom spaces or open up to a large performance or event space.   A portable riser system will create risers or stages anywhere in the space.  While a durable floor will be perfect from everything from a dance floor, performance seating, or concert.

Convergence will give musicians and theater groups a place to rehearse, bands to perform, artists to offer classes, and the public to host events of all kinds. The possibilities are endless.

Funds generated through this campaign will go towards start-up costs. We are currently working with the Town of Jackson & Teton County to do a change of use for the space and once that process is complete, there will be some limited construction to get the space ready for you to use.  Funds will also be used for rental costs during the construction phase, as well as equipment including retractable walls, chairs, computer equipment and software, and electronics.

We hope to be running in the black within three years of opening.  We plan on charging hourly rates for rehearsal spaces, for events and performances in the space, and also sell tickets for Convergence sponsored events such as concerts, dance hall nights, and holiday events.

Michael, Jason, and Macey are excited to offer an alternative space for artists in Jackson and hope you find this a worthy cause to support. 

Thank you!

story:
Hello!  My name is Adam Benson.  I'm a visual effects artist, musician, writer and digital paint artist.  I am putting together a calendar based on a series of Pinup Girl drawings that I have done specifically for this reason.  These drawings are the culmination of a years worth of work. The idea to make a calendar came to me when I finished a drawing that I had been working on for several weeks.  I really liked the outcome and I decided to go ahead and make a total of 12 drawings for a 2016 Calendar.  That was in October of 2014.  At the time I knew it would be too difficult to get 12 drawings done in time for 2015, so I've spent most of the rest of the year working on each of these drawings for a pre-2016 release.




Now I need your help in getting them published.  I'm very excited about finishing this collection and getting them out there for people to enjoy.  I need funds for printing, marketing, shipping and licensing (for fonts and other incedentals).   Once they are printed they will go on sale in various market places, like Etsy and Amazon.  A portion of all of the sales will go to charities, including Breast Cancer and Alzheimer's research.  


The printing costs are by far the largest expense, but there are other expenses that I will need to cover as well.  

  • Printing cost (Estimates): $3500 / 1000 copies
  • Marketing: $600
  • Font Licensing and incidentals: 5%
  • IndieGoGo: 5%

Here are my deadlines and what you can expect as far as delivery and updates
  • This campaign will run for 30 days.
  • At the end of the campaign Calendars and Prints will be ordered.  Some drawings are still currently being finished, but everything will be going to print before the end of October for an early November delivery.
  • If you would like delayed, or gift shipping please let me know so I can make arrangements for you.



  1. For $5 get one of the Stickers and a big thanks for your support!


  2. $5 can also get you one of the Refrigerator Magnets


  3. $10 buck will get you ANY of the Signed Prints!


  4. For $20 you can get your own copy of the 2016 Pinup Calendar


  5. Get a mug with 2 of my favorite pinups for $20!


  6. For a $30 donation you can get a copy of the Calendar and a print of your choice.


  7. $45 Donation will get you an Official, first run, signed and numbered copy of the Calendar!


  8. Get Six of your favorite prints signed for a $60 Donation


  9. Get 2 copies of the Calendar and Two Signed Prints of your choice for a $60 Donation!


  10. The Pick Six Plus package gets you six signed prints of your choice plus a Calendar!


  11. The Basic Collection contains all 12 Prints and a Copy of the Calendar, a mug, a sticker and a fridge magnet.  Get it for $100 Donation!

Find More Perks To the Right!



Once I have the calendars printed and the marketing and sales begin, I will be donating 25% of all proceeds to Breast Cancer and Alzheimer's Disease research.  In the grand scheme of things this could mean several thousand dollars of donations to causes that really need the research support that they deserve.  To be clear, the money raised here is only for printing and marketing costs, the charitable donations will be part of the eventual sale of the printed materials.  Fortunately, the cost of printing should be a drop in the bucket in eventual money raised for these important contributions.  Your donation to this campaign will be a pre-sale of the eventual completed calendar, and thus cover the cost of publishing these globally.  

                            

                               

This campaign should be very low risk, because copies will be printed no matter how much money is raised here.  I may not get the full 1000 copies printed, but any and all money raised here will be going toward the printing of these calendars.  One of the drawbacks to printing is that the numbers get exponentially smaller the more copies that you get printed, so even if partial funds are raised, the printing costs will still be substantial.  That doesn't mean that they won't get printed, it just means that fewer copies would be printed, and thus less money will be going to charities that need our support.  On the plus side, selling 1000 copies globally should be a non-issue.  The market for pinup girl calendars already exists, and if this campaign is successful, then future copies will be easy enough to procure using money raised from calendar sales.



Even if you don't have the funds to contribute, please spread the word.  I would really like to get these printed for people to enjoy and to raise money for Breast Cancer Research and Alzheimer's Disease Research.  Whether you contribute or not I would greatly appreciate you passing this on to anyone else that you think might be interested!

Thank you very much for your support!
story_txt:
Hello!  My name is Adam Benson.  I'm a visual effects artist, musician, writer and digital paint artist.  I am putting together a calendar based on a series of Pinup Girl drawings that I have done specifically for this reason.  These drawings are the culmination of a years worth of work. The idea to make a calendar came to me when I finished a drawing that I had been working on for several weeks.  I really liked the outcome and I decided to go ahead and make a total of 12 drawings for a 2016 Calendar.  That was in October of 2014.  At the time I knew it would be too difficult to get 12 drawings done in time for 2015, so I've spent most of the rest of the year working on each of these drawings for a pre-2016 release.



Now I need your help in getting them published.  I'm very excited about finishing this collection and getting them out there for people to enjoy.  I need funds for printing, marketing, shipping and licensing (for fonts and other incedentals).   Once they are printed they will go on sale in various market places, like Etsy and Amazon.  A portion of all of the sales will go to charities, including Breast Cancer and Alzheimer's research.  
 


 
The printing costs are by far the largest expense, but there are other expenses that I will need to cover as well.  


Printing cost (Estimates): $3500 / 1000 copies
Marketing: $600
Font Licensing and incidentals: 5%
IndieGoGo: 5%


Here are my deadlines and what you can expect as far as delivery and updates


This campaign will run for 30 days.

At the end of the campaign Calendars and Prints will be ordered.  Some drawings are still currently being finished, but everything will be going to print before the end of October for an early November delivery.
If you would like delayed, or gift shipping please let me know so I can make arrangements for you.










For $5 get one of the Stickers and a big thanks for your support!



$5 can also get you one of the Refrigerator Magnets



$10 buck will get you ANY of the Signed Prints!



For $20 you can get your own copy of the 2016 Pinup Calendar



Get a mug with 2 of my favorite pinups for $20!




For a $30 donation you can get a copy of the Calendar and a print of your choice.



$45 Donation will get you an Official, first run, signed and numbered copy of the Calendar!



Get Six of your favorite prints signed for a $60 Donation



Get 2 copies of the Calendar and Two Signed Prints of your choice for a $60 Donation!



The Pick Six Plus package gets you six signed prints of your choice plus a Calendar!



The Basic Collection contains all 12 Prints and a Copy of the Calendar, a mug, a sticker and a fridge magnet.  Get it for $100 Donation!


Find More Perks To the Right!







 Once I have the calendars printed and the marketing and sales begin, I will be donating 25% of all proceeds to Breast Cancer and Alzheimer's Disease research.  In the grand scheme of things this could mean several thousand dollars of donations to causes that really need the research support that they deserve.  To be clear, the money raised here is only for printing and marketing costs, the charitable donations will be part of the eventual sale of the printed materials.  Fortunately, the cost of printing should be a drop in the bucket in eventual money raised for these important contributions.  Your donation to this campaign will be a pre-sale of the eventual completed calendar, and thus cover the cost of publishing these globally.  
                                                               This campaign should be very low risk, because copies will be printed no matter how much money is raised here.  I may not get the full 1000 copies printed, but any and all money raised here will be going toward the printing of these calendars.  One of the drawbacks to printing is that the numbers get exponentially smaller the more copies that you get printed, so even if partial funds are raised, the printing costs will still be substantial.  That doesn't mean that they won't get printed, it just means that fewer copies would be printed, and thus less money will be going to charities that need our support.  On the plus side, selling 1000 copies globally should be a non-issue.  The market for pinup girl calendars already exists, and if this campaign is successful, then future copies will be easy enough to procure using money raised from calendar sales.
    


 Even if you don't have the funds to contribute, please spread the word.  I would really like to get these printed for people to enjoy and to raise money for Breast Cancer Research and Alzheimer's Disease Research.  Whether you contribute or not I would greatly appreciate you passing this on to anyone else that you think might be interested!
Thank you very much for your support!

story:
Hi! My name is Jessica, a.k.a. Lady J, and I am an artist! My husband and I have been incredibly blessed with an opportunity to move into a shop space. This location is a commercial space where there will be room for me to do all of my art and jewelry making as well as having an area to display and sell my wonderful creations! We are raising money to make creating this amazing space possible! It might not look like much yet, but it's going to be amazing! ;)


Up until now, I've been using my living room at home as my creative space, which has been great, but I have just about maxed out what is possible with that limited of an area to work in. I have big dreams and lots of new ideas for my jewelry creations as well as a deep desire to get back to oil painting and I am so very excited to have the opportunity to pursue my dreams!

Here is my first ever oil painting.... I had such a great time creating this piece, I truly can't wait to work on some new paintings in the new studio space!

I will continue to refine my color pencil drawing techniques, always striving for perfection.... I have a ton of reference photos that are just waiting to be spread out in the new space and have artwork based on them!

As I continue to heal from the auto accident, my hands are getting steadier all of the time. I look forward to getting back to playing with pigment and continuing to explore all of the possibilities that watercolor paints have to offer!

I have loved every minute of these last couple of years of experimenting with wire and rocks. Making jewelry has really brought my art to a whole new level! Here are a few of the many many pieces I've made!

All contributions $25 and higher get 3 bookmarks with Jessica's stunning art, a sterling silver chain, a framed and signed 5x7 print of your choice AND MORE, including an ABSOLUTELY AMAZING DISCOUNT CARD!  Contributions of $50 and above add a 2nd discount card for a friend AND a custom wire-wrapped ring (or 3 additional 5x7 prints)! 

******
Business/sponsors for the discount card and also some details are still pending.  Here's what we have so far:

Jessica herself will offer you 10% off Lady J Arts purchases until the card expires!

https://www.facebook.com/marijahsboutique Amazing and Beautiful Hair Accesories and more!

http://www.kimbrask9crunchies.com/ Home baked dog treats! All-natural, no preservatives and according to our dogs they are delicious! 

http://www.theherbalgerbil.com/ Dan Prince and Kat Prince offer a splendid variety of high quality, handcrafted organic herbal skin care products and more! Kat is a certified Clinical Herbalist and offers free consults!

Gary Kroll - First Guitar, Violin or Viola lesson free! Call (541) 890-3423 . This amazing musician has a Master's in Music and is currently the Orchestra conductor for Rogue Community College.

Mercy's Manna https://www.facebook.com/pages/Mercys-Manna/155623547827054 Home grown, organic delicious Herbal Tea and more!

FREE essential oil with consult! Contact Grace at (541)821-2801 ...www.mydoterra.com/graceandrews

www.kinnatone.com Kinnatone offers Guitar & Bass effect pedals and modifications. Brian is EXTREMELY talented and an incredible guitar player! He has been a musician for over 20 years!

http://theteapotonwheels.com/ Incredible, gourmet tea of all sorts. They serve dishes with a British flair, as well as traditional (but better) American dishes.

A friend of ours is an AMAZING (and licensed) Massage Therapist and will have a discount for her services on the card. We are also working on finalizing a discount with a couple of Coffee Shops, Burger Places and more!
