story:
THE ATLANTIS PROJECT

"The Psychedelic Project”

"We say thanks to all kind of investors, artists, art lovers, life lovers and dreamers, to support this project.

We have the opportunity to synchronize art, spirituality and teamwork.

We want to introduce a kindness point of view about the process of creativity in working groups.

We say thanks to you for your important support".

Sebastian Troncoso & Angel Nicolas

www.sebastiantroncoso.com

GENERAL INTRODUCTION

This is an artistic, psychological, magic and experimental project that aims to study the effects of magic truffles, called PSILOCYBE ATLANTIS, within a group of people devoted to art.

The production team will ingest the truffles and live a psychedelic experience, with the purpose of finding artistic inspiration.

Before the session every participant will have already read the manual 'The Psychedelic experience' by Timothy Leary, Ralph Metzner and Ram Dass.

The session will also be led by a psychologist specialized in Transpersonal Therapy.

OBJECTIVES

The project attempts to bring to light a new perspective of teamwork by means of transpersonal therapy and the use of magic truffles and psychedelic experience as a valid tool for creative inspiration.

The team will produce a fashion movie and two editorials for Supplementaire Magazine inspired in the experience.

Also a documentary film based on all the creative process of production, from the psychedelic experience until materialize the inspiration.

TRANSPERSONAL  PSYCHOLOGY

Transpersonal psychology  

Is a sub-field of psychology that integrates the spiritual and transcendent aspects of the human experience with the framework of modern psychology. The transpersonal is defined as "experiences in which the sense of identity or self extends beyond (trans) the individual or personal”; experiences or events that allow you to live a bigger and more meaningful reality.

Researchers of Transpersonal Psychology are concerned with the study of humanity's highest potential, and with the recognition, understanding, and realization of unifying, spiritual, and transcendent states of consciousness. Due to its methodology and contents, Transpersonal Psychology is considered to be within the framework of Humanistic Psychology and Self-development. It gives us a different understanding of the psychic, health, illness and self and social development.

MAGIC TRUFFLES

Magic truffles are edible mushrooms with hallucinogenic properties that contain the psychedelic compounds psilocybin and psilocin.

Dr. Timothy Leary, Ralph Mentzner, Ram Dass: “The Psychedelic experience, a manual based on the Tibetan Book of the Dead.”

This manual gives you clear steps on how to plan a psychedelic session, and helps you prepare yourself for a mystical, personal and group experience based on the tibetan model.

There are four main points you can achieve with the intake of magic truffles:

  •  A bigger sense of personal power and intellectual comprehension; sharper intuition of the self and culture; bigger professional efficiency and fast learning.

  •  A sense of obligation and empathy towards others as well as the will to help your fellow mates during their process of rebirth.

  •  Recreational use, aesthetic and sensual pleasure, interpersonal approach and pure experience.

  •  Transcendence, letting go of  the ego and the space-time limit and mystical union.

In this project we will focus on the 1st, 3rd and 4th points.

THE TEAM

Transpersonal Psychologist

Art Director

Video Director

Photographer

Model

Stylist

Make-up artist

Producer

METHODOLOGY

Day 1 The Psychedelic experience and integration

On July, the team will meet up at 4pm. Upon the arrival at the countryhouse there will be a 1 hour transpersonal therapy session before the psychedelic experience begins.

Each person, depending on their weight and previous experience with psychedelic substances, will take between 8 to 30 grams of Psylocibe Atlantis Magic Truffles

The session will last 6 hours and there will later be a 1-2 hour session  to integrate the experience together.

Day 2 Brain Storming and Moodboard

The team will have 2 weeks to work on the production. They will meet up at the office to brainstorm and to create a mood board.

Day 3 Production

Fashion editorial

Fashion video

Documentary

Final Product

Video:

-The Atlantis Project Documentary Film

A documentary about all the process

- The Atlantis Art Video

A fashion film based in the psychedelic experience and two editorials.

- The print magazine:

All the issue theme of Supplementaire Magazine London

“The Psychedelic Issue”

Including the cover

100 pages

Including

40 pages of Psychedelics, Art and Spirituality 

40 pages of fashion photography Histories.

------------------

Links related to psychedelic studies and creativity

•  Psychedelic agents in creative problem-solving experiment:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychedelics_in_problemsolving_experiment

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KtL5fafpRKc

•  Jim Fadiman's speech about his study:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KtL5fafpRKc

•  Article written in the 60s:

http://www.hofmann.org/papers/creative/psychreports.html

•  LSD, Spirituality and the Creative Process, Marlene Dobkin De Rios.  Research with LSD:

https://www.maps.org/news-letters/v14n1/v14n1_38-39.pdf

http://www.collective-evolution.com/2015/01/11/8-famous-people-whosecreativity-innovation-was-inspired-by-lsd/

story:
Summary

ARC is an educational foundation...

that provides outreach to disenfranchised groups throughout the city, helping to facilitate the expression of creative voice.

ARC is a gallery...
which subsidizes individual and group shows for artists, making the viewing and representation of art more accessible.

ARC is a group of artists...

who want to expand the gallery's offerings to the artists and communities we serve.

YOU can help expand the reach of ARC.


What We Need

We are starting our 42nd year with a fresh image and a new website. We would also like to re-introduce a Media Center into our space to support the exhibition of artists working in video and sound.

We need $3500 for the purchase of the Media Center equipment which will include: 40”monitor, LCD projector, DVR player, tablets, amplifier, speakers, microphones, earphones, and a cabinet to safely secure our new items. 

All funds received will go toward this goal. Any funds raised over this goal will be used to subsidize media based exhibitions.


What You Get

Our featured perk is a listing on ARC's Artist Registry Page. Your $50 contribution will entitle you to become an ARTIST FRIEND of ARC for one year. This listing – for you or a friend – includes an image on the Registry page and a link to your personal website.


The Impact

For 41 years, ARC Gallery has been engaged in bringing both contemporary work and creative perspectives which are pertinent not only to individual experiences, but also to the practice of art.

Your donation will help ARC – the educational foundation, the gallery, and the group of artists – stay relevant in our continued mission of expanding the reach and representation of the creative voices which shape both the city of Chicago and our world.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if you are not able to contribute financially at this time, you can still help to make this campaign a success by sharing our goal on your Facebook page and through Twitter.

story:
martatrotsiuk.com

I love traveling as much as photography. Last half a year I spent in Southeast Asia, now my favorite region. I was traveling, doing photos and trying to understand life there. 

When I came back to my native Ukraine I realized that people  are lacking something here.

I often meet people who want to travel but can't because of certain circumstances. They smile to me and tell me that they are envy.

But instead of it I want them to be inspired, I want them to see and to feel what I feel and get their motivation.

 In the Internet you can see lots of travel pictures, but most of them don't have any soul, they are empty. My photos don't look like usual travel photos. I do my best to see through my soul, through my eyes and then, I try to frame what I saw  into my pictures. 

My desire to share everything what I get from traveling and to make people travel, was the reason I started the project.

What I Need 

The funds from this campaign will go to organize an exhibition in the cultural capital of Ukraine, my native city Lviv.

So what I need to make this exhibition happened:

·  120$ for Venue hire (Museum of Ideas - Lviv, Ukraine)
idem.org.ua
http://www.river-cities.net/pages/show/Museum_of_Ideas

·  200$ for printing, framing photos and design

·  80$ for marketing (advertising to invite people, invitations)

·  100$ for opening evening costs (food and drinks)

TOTAL: 500$


Risks & Challenges

If the campaign will not be succeed, I will search more  funds but I believe I will make this exhibition.

If you have any other questions, feel free to give me a call in skype or send me an email at:
Email: marta@martatrotsiuk.com

Skype: photonoa

Risks & Challenges

  
If the campaign
will not be succeed, I will search more 
funds but I believe I will make this exhibition.
If you have any
other questions, feel free to give me a call in skype or send me an email at:
Email: marta@martatrotsiuk.com
Skype: photonoa

story:
As a daughter, an athlete, and a poor college student trying to make it in a world where a 4 year degree just isn't good enough anymore. Going into my senior year of college has made me realize that it is time to grow up and enter the real world.

Drawing has always been something that I would do whenever I had free time, it was a relaxing time when I could just be myself and enter my own little world. Then people would start telling me that my designs were really good, and they would buy them. I never thought of selling my designs, just because it was something that I would do for fun, and I wanted to keep it that way.

Starting this fundraiser would allow me to pursue my passion for drawing, while completing my degree in accounting and marketing. Helping me with the funds to finish my schooling, and also finishing school with my masters degree.

I hope this coloring book allows you to feel the way I do when I sit down to draw. Use it as a time to relax and take your mind off the real world around you.

story:
Help us rebuild the Disco Jelly!

The Disco Jelly needs some love! This year we really need YOUR help to get to Burning Man. The Disco Jelly suffered some major damage during the winter and will need several repairs before it can sail across the Playa. We have poured a lot of time, energy and money into this project, and now with these repairs and upgrades, we have gone over our personal budgets. We are working hard and putting any money we can to the project, but with your help, we can actually make this happen. Please help the Disco Jelly get home.

The Disco Jelly art car is a collaborative Burning Man project between Bunny LaValliere, Matt Stocklmeir and Sara Ritter. The Disco Jelly was crafted in Cupertino, CA from a variety of new and recycled materials and stands 15 feet high.


What We Need & What You Get

Despite carefully covering and securing the Disco Jelly, the rain got the better of us. Most of the fabric is destroyed beyond fixing and the metal in parts of the car is rusting and needs to be replaced. We want to get better quality materials and fabrics that can withstand the elements. The front of the car must be redone altogether and we want to add extra seating so we can carry more passengers across the Playa.

So what EXACTLY would your money go to? Here is a detailed list of what your donation would pay for and our perks. 

  • Disco balls in various sizes for the front of the car.
  • Yards of new fabric to create the Jelly brain and to wrap around the interior frame of the car.
  • Fabric to create a less moopy chandelier.
  • New foam to line the entire vehicle. We need a much sturdier/thicker foam this time.
  • Adding a third bench to the back and two tray tables to hold drinks.
  • Adding a fourth support beam to make the car studier during dust storms.
  • Replace the tires on the trailer.
  • Rewire the trailer.
  • Adding a stereo that plays off of our generator.
  • Replace lights damaged
PERKS
  • If you donate $5, you will be our best friend forever, get the biggest high five and a mention on our website.
  • If you donate $15, you get a Disco Jelly sticker.
  • If you donate $25, you get a Disco Jelly sticker and sexy picture of the Jelly at Burning Man.
  •  If you donate $50, you get a Disco Jelly sticker, a sexy picture of the Jelly at Burning Man and a picture of YOU photoshopped so it looks like you were there with us!
  • If you donate $100,  you get a Disco Jelly sticker, a sexy picture of the Jelly at Burning Man, a picture of YOU photoshopped so it looks like you were there with us AND Disco Jelly poster.
  • If you donate $750, you get a night with the Disco Jelly. We will drive you wherever you want, it's all about YOU! You also get a Disco Jelly sticker, a sexy picture of the Jelly at Burning Man, a picture of YOU photoshopped so it looks like you were there with us AND Disco Jelly poster.
FUNDS
If we don't reach our goal, anything raised will go directly to the repairs mentioned above. If we reach a surplus, that would allow us to upgrade the Disco Jelly, adding more lights and better fabrics that would hold up better over time. Our trailer is also broken. We plan to get new tires, but it would be best to replace it altogether. 

The Impact

By supporting the Disco Jelly, you are supporting the hopes and dreams of four awesome people who wanted to spread some fun and magic on the Playa. We provide rides to whoever needs them and have participated in weddings and other art car events.

The Disco Jelly passed the day and night license inspections their first year at Burning Man and had little to no problems the entire stay. We are an extremely hardworking team and accomplish whatever we set our minds to. Plus we are really sexy ;)


Other Ways You Can Help

We are grateful for any form of help you can offer the Disco Jelly! Here are some additional ways you can help us!

  • If you have any extra fabric in purple or various shades of white, we are interested! We need a lot, so the pieces/amounts would need to be at least a few yards.
  • Can you sew? The tentacles take hours up hour to sew and perfect. If you can help out with sewing that is a huge help.
  • Good old fashion elbow grease. If you don't mind getting your hands dirty, you can help us with repairs and installations. 
  • Fundraiser...We will have one fundraising event. If you could donate time or supplies, that would be spectacular!
Thank you guys so much. We truly appreciate any help you can give. All we have to say is... I DON'T THINK YOU'RE READY FOR THIS JELLY!

story:
For the last five years, we've been taking care of your travels, spreading love, joy, unity and magic all over the globe. 

We have installed a family feeling and friendship vibe throughout our current locations.
We're proud to say that we have built a strong community and consolidated people of many different backgrounds.
It's safe to say Magic Bus Hostels loves to make our guests feel special and welcome, whether it be through sharing meals, helping you in times of need or getting you to where you need/want to be.
We've been fortunate enough to keep expanding and through that see many different countries.
Through exploration, we have developed some great ideas on new locations in safer yet exciting new neighbourhoods.
Nonetheless, we want you to get involved as well to let us know where you might think a great location for Magic BUS would be to set up shop and continue to put smile's on many of our customer faces.


So...Where Do You Want to Go Next?

- Latin or South America?

- Asia? Africa?

- Or maybe Korea?

Just point your finger on the map and we'll be there!


You may be asking youself, Why should I Contribute?
It's a UNIQUE opportunity - choose your dream destination, give us a hand and get your next vacation spot created, just for you! Most importantly, personalized to you!

The contribution time is limited as we're ready to make that move. Let's make this summer a moment of MAGIC and one to REMEMEBER!


Through increased investment, we'll have that ability to make your venue a once in a lifetime experience.

* Please share your idea and help spread the magic.


 whereisthenextmagicbus@gmail.com

story:
Hello friends! My name is Anna Davidson. I am a visual artist and scientist from the University of California Davis. This spring I will complete my M.F.A. in Art Studio after previously receiving my Ph.D. in plant science in 2014.

I am honored and thrilled to have been accepted to the upcoming Arctic Circle Residency for June of 2016. The Arctic Circle Program is an expeditionary residency program that brings together international artists, scientists, innovators and educators of all disciplines who collectively explore remote destinations in the Arctic aboard an ice-class sailing vessel.

The mission of The Arctic Circle Residency: “The Arctic Circle is a nexus where art intersects science, architecture, education, and activism, -an incubator for thought and experimentation for artists and innovators who seek out and foster areas of collaboration to engage in the central issues of our time.”

About my work and my intentions for the residency program:

Over the last six months I have been researching and exploring the notion of the sublime while attempting to understand and share it through visual art. On a quest to experience the sublime I have found myself on the ice fields and glaciers of Alaska and in the depths of the Pacific Ocean.  My experiences in extreme remote environments provides the inspiration and the material for my artwork, and conducting work in the Arctic Circle will be the ultimate landscape to work from.

Not only will I make work surrounding the sublime, I will also make work that is central to threatening environmental issues of our time including global climate change (more specifically, the rapid melting of glaciers), and the disappearance of ecosystems that are home to a diversity of plants and animals. My most recent piece exhibited in Singapore, focused on rising sea levels as a result of melting glaciers and its effects on small-populated tropical islands like Singapore.  

My time in the arctic will be spent collecting material using video, photography, sculpture, and writing which I will transform into works of art that will be exhibited and published. While I plan on creating a video installation and a number of sculptures, I will go with an open mind to avoid limiting myself. I plan to publish writings about my work and experiences in the Leonardo Journal of Art, Science and Technology. I will also participate in collaborations aboard the ship.

Concurrently, as a plant ecophysiologist, I am interested in studying the flora of the area and observing how these harsh environmental conditions have shaped the morphology and physiology of these plants.

Finally, as an educator at the intersection of art and science, I look forward to collaborating with others to develop ideas for a unique curriculum to share with future students.

Bringing awareness and appreciation of the richness, fragility, and the sublime of our planet to others is my mission and right now it is absolutely critical. This is not only vital for human kind, but for all species, for all of  planet Earth. By helping me, you will play a vital role in this mission.


What I Need & What You Get

I am trying to raise $7500.

The cost of this prestigious residency is $13,000. I'm trying to raise $7,500. Of this amount, $6,500  will go towards paying the residency fees and $1000 goes to the flight to Svalbard. Anything extra I manage to raise will go towards air travel, video equipment, materials and exhibition costs. If I do not reach my goal, then the money I raised will still go towards this mission.

What will you get if you donate?

$5 A huge thank you email detailed with a story of my journey.

$25 A post card from Svalbard, and an invitation to my exhibition.

$50 A fine art print of an Arctic iceberg named after you.

$100-A large, fine art photographic print of the Arctic Circle.

$200–$1000 An original art piece made by me, inspired by the Arctic Circle.


As humans it is our responsibility to respond to our environment, and right now, it’s in great danger. People must be aware of our impact we have on the natural world and work together to protect what we have left. By contributing to this campaign, you are directly participating in the delivery of environmental awareness via an influential medium: art.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help me get the word out about my campaign. Post it on your Facebook, email your friends, parents, work buddies etc. You can also use the indiegogo share tools!

story:
Who is Natalie Field?

I am a creative image-maker based in Johannesburg, South Africa,  where I work as a conceptual portraiture and fashion photographer. I am passionate about travel, yoga, the art of storytelling, and unraveling the "Ultimate Question of Life, the Universe, and Everything". And I have my doubts that the answer is 42.

You can read more about me HERE.

What is the Arteles Artist Residency?

An artist residency is a creative space in which artists can focus on producing a new body of work. The Arteles Creative Center in Finland offers 1-2 month stays at their small holding set in the extraordinary nature of the Hämeenkyrö region, which offers a peaceful environment for inspired thinking. Approximately one hundred artists, writers and researchers from around the world are invited to attend annually. I am very excited to have been selected as one of them!

You can read more about Arteles HERE.

My Project: "Human. Nature."

During this residency I want to further my studies into human nature, the evolution of mankind and our natural place in the eco-system vs the current detachment that has become a world-wide epidemic.

I first started exploring organic morphology and transformation in the series “Breathe in… Breathe out… Let the human in…” (2015), adding natural elements from the ocean to point towards evolution and the ever-evolving state of the human existence. When you look at the veins in your hand, to those in a leaf, to the cracks in the dessert floor, there is an underlying pattern that connects us all. But it goes even deeper than this.

Consider the human being as a part of the Universe. We are star dust. All matter made up of the very same protons, neutrons and electrons. In fact, you can even picture the atom as a miniature Solar System, with the nucleus playing the role of a Sun orbited by electrons as planets. The pattern of these atoms are repeated within and without the human form, stretching through the very fabric of space-time.

The intention of the proposed work is to make the viewer reconsider his every day existence and place in the natural world.

To this cause I applied to the Arteles residency, as it offers a natural landscape for me to work with. I intend to explore the surroundings, photographing both myself and aspects of the environment fused together to portray our connection. My love for hiking will take me deep into the forests for theses creative sessions. By mounting my camera on a tripod and using the intervalometer setting, I will be able to move around in the landscape to capture myself in the scene. I will also be crafting accessories from the natural materials to introduce into the images.

My visit is during the Autumn, better known in Finland as the “Ruska”. I am hoping for rich colour palettes of reds and golds for this series. Other perks of this season include misty mornings, and the harvesting of wild berries and mushrooms… all which I intend to feature. 

Over the last year I have been studying the effects of Automatism, a technique developed during the Surrealist movement that shifted creation from conscious control to chance. This has led to an interest in the spontaneity of in-camera effects, like multiple exposure and motion blur. These techniques will be combined with photo-manipulation in post-production, to create dream-like images illustrating the key concepts from my studies.

What I Need

Naturally I am over the moon to have been given this opportunity, especially considering that the institution has granted me 50% funding on the residency fee valued at 970 Euros! However, there are many additional costs to consider, and the South African the Rand to Euro exchange rate is incredibly steep at over R16 to €1. As such I would greatly appreciate your support towards the following budget:

Visa Application €60
International Travel €925
Domestic Travel €100
Residency Fee (50%) €970
Food for 32 days €600
Materials for project €500
Thermal Clothing €250
Microscope Camera €1200

Total   €4605

Please note that to enable Credit Card Payments on this campaign costs and perks have been calculated in US Dollar.

Total $5100

I intend to follow through with the residency regardless of the outcome of the campaign.

Should the total budget not be reached, your financial support will go towards key expenses like the residency fee and flights. The cost of the products have also been factored into their individual costing, so you are sure to receive your reward!

What You Get

I look forward to sharing the journey and art with you through the following…

Follow My Journey

For as little as R10 ($0.75) per day, you can join me on my great adventure. I will share my thoughts, experiences and artistic process with you through behind the scenes footage and short video blogs delivered to your inbox daily for the duration of the residency. This option is perfect for fellow photographers and artists who would like insight into the process of applying to and attending a residency, and are interested in learning new creative skills. 

Postcard from Finland

When last did you receive something fun in the post? To thank you for your support I will send you a postcard from Finland! Finnish stamp and all! 
This option also includes Follow My Journey

Customised Thank You

This option is great for businesses who would like to sponsor, as it includes a feature on my social media and daily deliveries. You will receive a personalized shout-out on social media during the residency, as well as a customized Thank You card with a fun photo from my trip upon my return.
This option also includes Follow My Journey | Postcard from Finland

Brag Book

This option features a small 75x75mm accordion style Brag Book in a sleeve featuring a collection of images I will be taking of the landscape, fauna and flora of Western Finland.
This option also includes Follow My Journey | Postcard from Finland | Customized Thank You

Photo Book

Once the residency has been completed, I will compile an A4 hard cover book featuring the artworks along with my notes on consciousness, metamorphosis and the transmigration of the soul. The book will also talk about the process of creating the work and showcase photographs of the Finnish landscape, fauna and flora.  
This option also includes Follow My Journey | Postcard from Finland | Customized Thank You

Folio Box

A limited edition box set of 10 mounted and signed small photo prints. This special edition run of 25 engraved boxes holding the full series of images created during the residency will only be on offer through this campaign. This option is for the serious art collector, or those wishing to display the artworks on the coffee table or frame the images for their walls.
This option also includes Follow My Journey | Postcard from Finland | Customized Thank You

First Option

All supporters of the campaign will have first option on purchasing large-format prints. A print run of 10 prints per artwork from the series will be made available on A2 Fine Art Paper. Postage fees will be determined at the time of purchase.  

The Impact

The Arteles residency will provide me with an opportunity to step away from the city noise into a calm and peaceful environment ideal for reflection and creation. I believe that the concepts I intend to study and illustrate through my work are pertinent to us all, not only on an individual level, but also in light of our shared consciousness.  

Risks & Challenges

Although I have not previously attended a residency, I hope that this will be the first of many to come. I have built a successful photographic business over the last seven years. My work has received several awards, and I have been published both nationally and internationally. I am also brand ambassador for Photon studio equipment and Vanguard tripods and bags. 

I do not foresee many challenges to the project. That said, it is very rainy in Finland in the month of October, but I intend to include the weather into the work come rain or shine. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I am currently looking for an exhibition space to show the work upon my return.

I appreciate your interest and support, and understand that not everyone can contribute financially. If you find the topics around human nature and consciousness as intriguing as I do, I invite you to connect with me on social media. And should you feel so inclined, share the love by sharing this campaign through your own networks!

My love for hiking will take me deep into the forests for theses creative sessions. By mounting my camera on a tripod and using the intervalometer setting, I will be able to move around in the landscape to capture myself in the scene. I will also be crafting accessories from the natural materials to introduce into the images.
My visit is during the Autumn, better known in Finland as the “Ruska”. I am hoping for rich colour palettes of reds and golds for this series. Other perks of this season include misty mornings, and the harvesting of wild berries and mushrooms… all which I intend to feature. 
Over the last year I have been studying the effects of Automatism, a technique developed during the Surrealist movement that shifted creation from conscious control to chance. This has led to an interest in the spontaneity of in-camera effects, like multiple exposure and motion blur. These techniques will be combined with photo-manipulation in post-production, to create dream-like images illustrating the key concepts from my studies.


What I Need
Naturally I am over the moon to have been given this opportunity, especially considering that the institution has granted me 50% funding on the residency fee valued at 970 Euros! However, there are many additional costs to consider, and the South African the Rand to Euro exchange rate is incredibly steep at over R16 to €1. As such I would greatly appreciate your support towards the following budget:
Visa Application €60International Travel €925Domestic Travel €100Residency Fee (50%) €970Food for 32 days €600Materials for project €500Thermal Clothing €250Microscope Camera €1200
Total   €4605
Please note that to enable Credit Card Payments on this campaign costs and perks have been calculated in US Dollar.
Total $5100
I intend to follow through with the residency regardless of the outcome of the campaign.
Should the total budget not be reached, your financial support will go towards key expenses like the residency fee and flights. The cost of the products have also been factored into their individual costing, so you are sure to receive your reward!
What You Get
I look forward to sharing the journey and art with you through the following…
Follow My Journey
For as little as R10 ($0.75) per day, you can join me on my great adventure. I will share my thoughts, experiences and artistic process with you through behind the scenes footage and short video blogs delivered to your inbox daily for the duration of the residency. This option is perfect for fellow photographers and artists who would like insight into the process of applying to and attending a residency, and are interested in learning new creative skills. 
Postcard from Finland
When last did you receive something fun in the post? To thank you for your support I will send you a postcard from Finland! Finnish stamp and all! This option also includes Follow My Journey
Customised Thank You

This option is great for businesses who would like to sponsor, as it includes a feature on my social media and daily deliveries. You will receive a personalized shout-out on social media during the residency, as well as a customized Thank You card with a fun photo from my trip upon my return.This option also includes Follow My Journey | Postcard from Finland
Brag Book

This option features a small 75x75mm accordion style Brag Book in a sleeve featuring a collection of images I will be taking of the landscape, fauna and flora of Western Finland.This option also includes Follow My Journey | Postcard from Finland | Customized Thank You
Photo Book

Once the residency has been completed, I will compile an A4 hard cover book featuring the artworks along with my notes on consciousness, metamorphosis and the transmigration of the soul. The book will also talk about the process of creating the work and showcase photographs of the Finnish landscape, fauna and flora.  This option also includes Follow My Journey | Postcard from Finland | Customized Thank You
Folio Box

A limited edition box set of 10 mounted and signed small photo prints. This special edition run of 25 engraved boxes holding the full series of images created during the residency will only be on offer through this campaign. This option is for the serious art collector, or those wishing to display the artworks on the coffee table or frame the images for their walls.This option also includes Follow My Journey | Postcard from Finland | Customized Thank You
First Option
All supporters of the campaign will have first option on purchasing large-format prints. A print run of 10 prints per artwork from the series will be made available on A2 Fine Art Paper. Postage fees will be determined at the time of purchase.  

The Impact
The Arteles residency will provide me with an opportunity to step away from the city noise into a calm and peaceful environment ideal for reflection and creation. I believe that the concepts I intend to study and illustrate through my work are pertinent to us all, not only on an individual level, but also in light of our shared consciousness.  

Risks & Challenges
Although I have not previously attended a residency, I hope that this will be the first of many to come. I have built a successful photographic business over the last seven years. My work has received several awards, and I have been published both nationally and internationally. I am also brand ambassador for Photon studio equipment and Vanguard tripods and bags. 
I do not foresee many challenges to the project. That said, it is very rainy in Finland in the month of October, but I intend to include the weather into the work come rain or shine. 

Other Ways You Can Help
I am currently looking for an exhibition space to show the work upon my return.
I appreciate your interest and support, and understand that not everyone can contribute financially. If you find the topics around human nature and consciousness as intriguing as I do, I invite you to connect with me on social media. And should you feel so inclined, share the love by sharing this campaign through your own networks!

story:
Updates September 1st 2016:

Hi! We've come to the end of the crowdfunding and although I didn't manage to raise the full funds, we raised some funds!!!!! So I consider this to be a success!

 It was a really good experience and I'm glad I did it! For those who contributed I will be in touch with you directly and your Dream Quest Coloring Books will be shipped out at in October once I have finished printing and publishing them, so they should arrive some time in November/December, in time for the holidays! 

If you would like to follow me art journey on instagram, do add me at @aisthmus for my art, and @aidadaism for my personal life and vlogs that I do on youtube.

Thank you again for the support! I look forward to hearing what you think about the books once you recieve them this winter!!


________________________________________________________________________


UPDATES: Check the Picture Gallery above for new images!! I have added Segment #2 - The Dive!!!


About the Book:

_________________________________________________________________________
The Dream Quest was a book that started as a whimsical inking while I was day dreaming on the job. A girl mysteriously making what looked to be the beginning of a great journey through a thick jungle, heading towards a distant mountain. 


Immediately friends and colleagues began to comment on the illustration, and after a wonderful party at a friend's place where I took out my sketch book to show a new friend the progress of what at the time I had envisioned as a graphic novel, it dawned on me that this whimsical fantasy had a lot more to it than just one detailed page of wonder. 


Thus after months of dedicating many hours of inking, thinking and dreaming, the story of the little girl on a quest finally has come full circle, and I am eager to turn what is currently several pages of inkings a several more digital pages of inking into a beautiful paperback book that you can have to colour, read and enjoy!


The story is completely wordless as I feel that to for every person who receives this book the dream quest will be different for them, based on their interpretation, and I want to preserve that place of peace where you can travel with the girl, define for yourself what the nature of each out come is, and find yourself, as she finally does, in full circle after completing the book, and perhaps find out something unique about yourself, as the girl does in the process of the journey. 
Here are a few sample pages from Segment #2 of the Book - The Dive:


Here are some of the rewards you will get when you support this campaign:


_________________________________________________________________________

A Little Bit About Me:

_________________________________________________________________________


I'm Ai, I graduated from Nanyang Academy of Fine Arts a couple of years ago with a Diploma in Fine Arts and I have been pursuing my art ever since. Working odd jobs and temping quite a bit, I am forever grateful to the kind and supporting support system that I have in my life, because without my girlfriend, best friend and family, I wouldn't have anywhere to live and I wouldn't be able to draw! Drawing is my life, and creating things is what I do and probably will continue to do until I meet my Maker, which is why I am so proud to finally be able to present my very first coloring book! It has taken time and effort, but every sleepless night and inbetween hour has been worth it!
_________________________________________________________________________
So How Do We Make The Magic Happen?
_________________________________________________________________________


I am going to need $2500 to be able to make this campaign really come to life. Here is the breakdown of the funding:

$1200 - For the Printing, packaging and shipping of the 200 limited edition coloring books that I am so excited to have printed for your pleasure~!

$600 - for all the prints, posters, buttons and stickers that I will be making + shipping costs for all of these items!

$450 - Speciality Hardcover Limited Edition copies that I will personally have locally printed with additional pages included. + Shipping. This is limited to only 10 hardcover books.

$250 - Indigogo Fee

If we exceed the goal I will use all additional funds to create more Speciality Hardcover Limited Edition Copies~!!!! I will choose at random lucky lucky contributors to win the extra Hard Copies if we exceed the number of people claiming for the Hardcover Limited Edition Copies, or if there are excess Hardcover Copies~!!

If we do not reach the entire goal you will still recieve your rewards because I am so excited to make them~ Which is why I'm going with the flexible option so that those who have already commited their heart and soul to this Dream Quest, will be able to recieve it nevertheless!!!

_________________________________________________________________________

The Impact

_________________________________________________________________________

By helping me to back this campaign, you will not only be helping to bring this book to life in physical form, but you will also be helping me to complete the final vision I have for this project, which is to be able to print 200 limited edition books, which will each have a personally written and illustrated foreword, just for you. 


This book is a dream, and fantasy, and bringing it into the physical realm would be like bringing a piece of magic into this life, and damn, that would be amazing. I can only do this if you would like a piece of that magic too.


_________________________________________________________________________ 

Risks & Challenges

_________________________________________________________________________

I am basically a classic example of a temp-ing, no-future artist who barely can make ends meet, so trying to find money to publish this book not just for quantity sake but also quality is impossible for me as I don't even make $1200 a month, and that is just for the basic cost of the books alone. However I have temp-ed at a graphic design firm, worked briefly as an illustrator and temp-ed at a childcare so I am well versed with packing, shipping, printing, cutting and all the manual labour that it takes to create a beautiful book with care, love and kindness that a book deserves. I cannot guarantee 'Louis Vutton' Level of branding, but I can guarantee good workmanship from a pair of weathered hands that know what they are doing. 

Shipping out orders:

  • One Month Minimum per batch order
I will still need a couple of months to prepare each and every edition that I will be sending out to you, so I expect that if we start work by the end of July/ mid August, be should have everything printed by the end of September / mid October, shipped by November and they should arrive in time for Christmas, making it a wonderful gift for the holidays! If not it should arrive by January / February.
  • Notification Via Batches and Batch Emails

I will send out notification in batches to all of you lovely contributors to keep you in the loop when you item has be sent out, which will take a couple of weeks as well to make sure I'm sending the right thing to the right soul, so you needn't worry that I've forgotten because I won't! 

 All of this takes time, and money, so is this campaign is successful You will literally see me jumping up and down and rolling around and laughing and crying because this is such a big thing for me, and I want to share it with you so badly it hurts! 

_________________________________________________________________________


Other Ways You Can Help

_________________________________________________________________________

If you can't help because you are a 'starving artist' like me or you just don't have the means, I would be so grateful if you wanted to share it on social media or show it to your friends~ Every little bit of exposure helps and maybe who knows, your friend might need a dream quest and they've been waiting all there lives for this to happen, so let them know about it~!! 

Indiegogo has a lot of cool share tools so remember to use them to bring this campaigne to the people who matter to you the most! 

Thanks again so much for choosing to read, be inspired and to support the Dream Quest! This Quest a journey for every soul, of every kind, or every nation, so share away!

story:
It all began with a sketch of an old house…and a question:

“What do you do with an 1857 house that can’t be saved?”

...you make art.

 

 

 

What is The Crooked House?

It’s about home.

It’s about people.

It’s about community.

It asks the visitor, “What is your home?”

The Crooked House is a sculpture that examines the essence of home.  

The concept of home is so personal and at the same time so universal.  We all have places we call home, but our home is more than a roof over our heads and somewhere to shelter from the weather.  Homes contain our history and our memories, they give meaning to our days.  We sell and buy houses—we move our home with us wherever we go. 

With only a façade that gives the image of a house at its most basic—a door, windows, the angle of the roof and a fireplace—The Crooked House in many ways resembles a child’s drawing.  When you enter The Crooked House, there is a space for you to be at home.  While you sit in front of the fireplace, you can see the history of this house and this town captured in the handprints on the back of the façade.  You can trace your own handprint onto the wall with a piece of chalk, adding your history to this opened house. 

When you make yourself at home in this house with no walls and no roof—you are surrounded by memories of the people and places who have created your home.   

 

The sculpture

The Crooked House is a life-size (16.5 ft. x 22.5 ft.) concrete sculpture of a historic house.  It is only five feet from the sidewalk on a main street in a small Pennsylvania town—bringing a piece of contemporary art to the everyday life of the 1,123 residents.  The front preserves the details of the house and the back incorporates handprints and mementoes from the 1850s and today.  

 

THE ARTISTS "SHORT" STORY

I bought this house at auction intending to restore it.  As I removed layers of wallpaper, the house started to lose its internal support and began to lean—eventually taking on enough of a tilt to be dubbed “The Crooked House.” It only took me 6 weeks of work to realize that it just couldn’t be salvaged. I didn’t want to bulldoze this piece of Milesburg history—this house belonged to Abigail Miles, cousin of the town founder—but I couldn’t save it as a house. After much worrying, dreaming, and drawing, the idea to preserve the façade in concrete was born. That plan has grown to include donating property for Homecoming Park and salvaging a stone fireplace that was hidden in the walls. 

~ Benjamin Fehl

 

the journey...

This community art project grew out of my graduate studies in both architecture and art.  In both programs I spent a great deal of time exploring the concept of what home means to us; The Crooked House project developed from this.   The real story takes place over a decade of research, planning and hard work. The project involves not only creating a concrete casting of the front of the historic house and repointing the stone fireplace to be a freestanding hearth, but also dedicating the property around where the house stood as a public park—Homecoming Park.  

I started on this journey back in 2004 as an artist with an idea. Over the years I’ve had the good fortune of gathering a team of volunteers and supporters, known as Friends of The Crooked House.

These friends have joined me in 1,000s of hours of work—dismantling the house, preserving the façade, repointing a 160 year-old fireplace and excavating the foundation. They’ve donated their expertise, money, materials, the use of heavy machinery, and time to bring The Crooked House to this point

We have a hard deadline of March 2017 to finish the project. Since 2011, the project has been funded with several small grants, donations, and discounts, as well as using my savings to pay for skilled labor and essential materials.  Slow and cheap has meant the best use of project resources…up to now. 

We need your help to purchase the materials to cast the sculpture.

 

We’re ready to cast it and install.   

The finish line is in sight.  To meet the borough deadline of March 2017, we must raise $40,000 for materials to mold, cast and install the sculpture. It sounds like a lot of cash. But thanks to ongoing grants (since 2011) from the Pennsylvania Council on the Arts, plus a grant from the Puffin Foundation, and generous donations of labor, materials and funds by Friends of The Crooked House, 2/3 of this $120,000 project is already complete. The last hurdle to clear is the purchase of materials to create and install the sculpture.  You can be a patron of the arts, receive a tax deduction for your donation, and support arts access for rural communities by funding some of the materials to cast The Crooked House in concrete. 

 

 

What’s the $40k for?

 

What happens if we exceed our goal?

Any funds raised beyond the cost of completing and installing The Crooked House sculpture will be used for Homecoming Park to purchase materials to landscape and secure the park (fencing, brick pavers, trees and plants, park benches…).

 

What happens if we don’t meet our goal?

All funds donated will be used for the project.

Benjamin says "I don’t really want to think about that too much—we have a deadline and must meet it. If we don’t raise the money, I start applying for loans and continue to apply for grants. (Can you recommend an art-friendly banker?)"


 

Project History

  • 2004—The property at 204 Market Street is purchased at auction.
  • 2005—The house begins to lean as layers of wallpaper are removed.  A massive stone fireplace is discovered behind a living room wall.  Insurmountable structural issues are revealed and restoration is halted.
  • 2006–2009—While dreaming, designing and drawing new ideas for the old house, Benjamin begins working on a new house to live in at the back of the property.  
  • 2009–2011— The Crooked House is accepted as Benjamin’s Masters of Fine Arts thesis project. The advisory committee is formed.  Project is presented to Milesburg Borough Council and a 3-year building permit issued.  PA Council on the Arts (PCA) grant awarded, (first of 6 annual grants) and the project wins 1st place in the Penn State Graduate Student project exhibit.
  • 2012—Workshop studio is opened Studies and modeling experiments for the casting process get underway.  Fireplace restoration studies begin. Community open house visitors contribute their handprints and memories of home. 
  • 2012–2014—Interior scaffolding is built to hold up the structure and dismantling begins.  Interior walls are removed, fireplace is made sound.  Friends of the Crooked House donate materials, heavy machinery rentals, and skilled labor.  Building Permit Extension #1 is issued.
  • 2015—The house is dismantled with the façade preserved for casting. Fireplace is underpinned for new foundation. Building Permit Extension #2 is issued. 
  • 2016—FINAL Building Permit Extension issued – project must be complete in March 2017. Fireplace is righted and new foundation added, engineering design approved and the site is prepped. Factory space secured to house façade for molding and casting of sculpture. Fundraising for sculpture materials and installation is underway.
  • Latest—Engineer certified structural drawings are complete and submitted to the inspector. We've taken the internal steel components that will attach the sculpture to the foundation to Johnstown be galvanized.
  • Next—We're sourcing materials to build the footer.  Donations welcome!

 

 

the donor recognition gifts

Words are not enough to express our gratitude for your generosity. Please let us thank you with a gift of art or artifacts from The Crooked House’s development.  Details in the charts below:

 

Friends of the Crooked House SWAG

Your name listed by category on thecrookedhouse.net website, and:

 

Groundbreaker Leadership Circle

You will be recognized for your generous support and groundbreaking leadership with a permanent tile featuring the handprints, mementos, and names of you and your loved-ones) on The Crooked House Tribute Wall (Left side of sculpture, visible from the street. Tile sizes 6"x12" to 24"x12").  Your name and your generous gift will be listed on the thecrookedhouse.net website, you also recive the exclusive thank-you gifts detailed in the chart below:

 

Gift details:

Personal Thank You from the artist—"I'd rather draw than write...so I can't promise very many words. I'll do my best to let you know how wonderful you are!"

Crooked House Stickers—put the Crooked House on your laptop, car or anywhere.  

Milesburg History Tin (Exclusive link for Friends of the Crooked House members,  local pickup or delivery only)—your own tin full of remnants of human-made objects discovered during the project, such as pottery fragments and hand-forged nails from 1857.

Crooked House Notecards—a set of six blank notecards featuring key process drawings and photos.

Signed Crooked House Prints—a set of six signed prints of key process drawings, suitable for framing.

Crooked House T-shirt—wear your patron of the arts status with pride. Shirts will feature the logo and you will have the option of a shirt with the logo on the front or the back.

Original Crooked House Art—choose* your favorite drawing and we’ll professionally mat or frame it for you.

Tile on the Crooked House Tribute Wall,  includes an Artist Led Design Session—make your mark with your personal tile featured on the Tribute Wall; you can add the names, handprints and impressions of significant mementos of yourself and your loved ones. Benjamin will assist you to design your tile. 

VIP Opening Reception—Groundbreakers will be recognized for their contributions at a private, pre-opening reception. 

Dedicate Homecoming Park—as a thank you for your significant project support, you can name Homecoming Park after yourself, your family, or your loved ones .  Please call us at (814)933-5204, or email us at info@thecrookedhouse.net, to discuss this naming opportunity.

 *Choice of drawings organized on a first-come first-served basis, by donor level

 

Testimonials

Graeme Sullivan | Director,  Penn State School of Visual Arts
"great place for nibblies." 

Jay Robinson | Editor,  State College, PA
"I've watched The Crooked House development since it's inception and I am fully confident that it will be a success. I am proud to support this project." 

JoJo Tibbetts | Child,  Bellefonte, PA
"Where is Lucky dog?" 

 

FAQ

Q.  Ben, what motivates you? 
A.  Coffee from Fonté Coffee Roasters. Come visit the project and I'll make you the best darn cup of coffee east of Seattle. 

Q. How much have you spent on the project? 
A.  About $80,000--between grants, donations, volunteer time, and my own money.  

Q. Whose house was it? 
A. 204 Market Street was built for Abigail Miles, a cousin of the town founder. 

Q. What is wattle & daub? 
A. A technique combining sticks, reeds or other materials (wattle) with clay or mud (daub) to form or insulate walls. 

Q. Why don't you build it out of stone? 
A. I like concrete...formal qualities etc.

Q. When are you going to get this done?!?! 
A. Soon! Very soon!

Q. Who issues my tax receipt?
A. Fractured Atlas sponsors The Crooked House's non-profit status. They will email you a receipt for your tax-deductible donation to use for your taxes. Details below:

Tax-Deductible Gift Information 

The Crooked House is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of The Crooked House must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

about community.It asks the visitor, “What is your home?”The Crooked House is a sculpture that examines the essence of home.  The concept of home is so personal and at the same time so universal.  We all have places we call home, but our home is more than a roof over our heads and somewhere to shelter from the weather.  Homes contain our history and our memories, they give meaning to our days.  We sell and buy houses—we move our home with us wherever we go. With only a façade that gives the image of a house at its most basic—a door, windows, the angle of the roof and a fireplace—The Crooked House in many ways resembles a child’s drawing.  When you enter The Crooked House, there is a space for you to be at home.  While you sit in front of the fireplace, you can see the history of this house and this town captured in the handprints on the back of the façade.  You can trace your own handprint onto the wall with a piece of chalk, adding your history to this opened house. When you make yourself at home in this house with no walls and no roof—you are surrounded by memories of the people and places who have created your home.    The sculptureThe Crooked House is a life-size (16.5 ft. x 22.5 ft.) concrete sculpture of a historic house.  It is only five feet from the sidewalk on a main street in a small Pennsylvania town—bringing a piece of contemporary art to the everyday life of the 1,123 residents.  The front preserves the details of the house and the back incorporates handprints and mementoes from the 1850s and today.   THE ARTISTS "SHORT" STORYI bought this house at auction intending to restore it.  As I removed layers of wallpaper, the house started to lose its internal support and began to lean—eventually taking on enough of a tilt to be dubbed “The Crooked House.” It only took me 6 weeks of work to realize that it just couldn’t be salvaged. I didn’t want to bulldoze this piece of Milesburg history—this house belonged to Abigail Miles, cousin of the town founder—but I couldn’t save it as a house. After much worrying, dreaming, and drawing, the idea to preserve the façade in concrete was born. That plan has grown to include donating property for Homecoming Park and salvaging a stone fireplace that was hidden in the walls. ~ Benjamin Fehl the journey...This community art project grew out of my graduate studies in both architecture and art.  In both programs I spent a great deal of time exploring the concept of what home means to us; The Crooked House project developed from this.   The real story takes place over a decade of research, planning and hard work. The project involves not only creating a concrete casting of the front of the historic house and repointing the stone fireplace to be a freestanding hearth, but also dedicating the property around where the house stood as a public park—Homecoming Park.  I started on this journey back in 2004 as an artist with an idea. Over the years I’ve had the good fortune of gathering a team of volunteers and supporters, known as Friends of The Crooked House.These friends have joined me in 1,000s of hours of work—dismantling the house, preserving the façade, repointing a 160 year-old fireplace and excavating the foundation. They’ve donated their expertise, money, materials, the use of heavy machinery, and time to bring The Crooked House to this pointWe have a hard deadline of March 2017 to finish the project. Since 2011, the project has been funded with several small grants, donations, and discounts, as well as using my savings to pay for skilled labor and essential materials.  Slow and cheap has meant the best use of project resources…up to now. We need your help to purchase the materials to cast the sculpture. We’re ready to cast it and install.   The finish line is in sight.  To meet the borough deadline of March 2017, we must raise $40,000 for materials to mold, cast and install the sculpture. It sounds like a lot of cash. But thanks to ongoing grants (since 2011) from the Pennsylvania Council on the Arts, plus a grant from the Puffin Foundation, and generous donations of labor, materials and funds by Friends of The Crooked House, 2/3 of this $120,000 project is already complete. The last hurdle to clear is the purchase of materials to create and install the sculpture.  You can be a patron of the arts, receive a tax deduction for your donation, and support arts access for rural communities by funding some of the materials to cast The Crooked House in concrete.   What’s the $40k for? What happens if we exceed our goal?Any funds raised beyond the cost of completing and installing The Crooked House sculpture will be used for Homecoming Park to purchase materials to landscape and secure the park (fencing, brick pavers, trees and plants, park benches…). What happens if we don’t meet our goal?All funds donated will be used for the project.Benjamin says "I don’t really want to think about that too much—we have a deadline and must meet it. If we don’t raise the money, I start applying for loans and continue to apply for grants. (Can you recommend an art-friendly banker?)" Project History

2004—The property at 204 Market Street is purchased at auction.

2005—The house begins to lean as layers of wallpaper are removed.  A massive stone fireplace is discovered behind a living room wall.  Insurmountable structural issues are revealed and restoration is halted.

2006–2009—While dreaming, designing and drawing new ideas for the old house, Benjamin begins working on a new house to live in at the back of the property.  

2009–2011— The Crooked House is accepted as Benjamin’s Masters of Fine Arts thesis project. The advisory committee is formed.  Project is presented to Milesburg Borough Council and a 3-year building permit issued.  PA Council on the Arts (PCA) grant awarded, (first of 6 annual grants) and the project wins 1st place in the Penn State Graduate Student project exhibit.

2012—Workshop studio is opened Studies and modeling experiments for the casting process get underway.  Fireplace restoration studies begin. Community open house visitors contribute their handprints and memories of home. 

2012–2014—Interior scaffolding is built to hold up the structure and dismantling begins.  Interior walls are removed, fireplace is made sound.  Friends of the Crooked House donate materials, heavy machinery rentals, and skilled labor.  Building Permit Extension #1 is issued.


2015—The house is dismantled with the façade preserved for casting. Fireplace is underpinned for new foundation. Building Permit Extension #2 is issued. 

2016—FINAL Building Permit Extension issued – project must be complete in March 2017. Fireplace is righted and new foundation added, engineering design approved and the site is prepped. Factory space secured to house façade for molding and casting of sculpture. Fundraising for sculpture materials and installation is underway.

Latest—Engineer certified structural drawings are complete and submitted to the inspector. We've taken the internal steel components that will attach the sculpture to the foundation to Johnstown be galvanized.

Next—We're sourcing materials to build the footer.  Donations welcome!
  the donor recognition giftsWords are not enough to express our gratitude for your generosity. Please let us thank you with a gift of art or artifacts from The Crooked House’s development.  Details in the charts below: Friends of the Crooked House SWAGYour name listed by category on thecrookedhouse.net website, and: Groundbreaker Leadership CircleYou will be recognized for your generous support and groundbreaking leadership with a permanent tile featuring the handprints, mementos, and names of you and your loved-ones) on The Crooked House Tribute Wall (Left side of sculpture, visible from the street. Tile sizes 6"x12" to 24"x12").  Your name and your generous gift will be listed on the thecrookedhouse.net website, you also recive the exclusive thank-you gifts detailed in the chart below: Gift details:Personal Thank You from the artist—"I'd rather draw than write...so I can't promise very many words. I'll do my best to let you know how wonderful you are!"Crooked House Stickers—put the Crooked House on your laptop, car or anywhere.  Milesburg History Tin (Exclusive link for Friends of the Crooked House members,  local pickup or delivery only)—your own tin full of remnants of human-made objects discovered during the project, such as pottery fragments and hand-forged nails from 1857.Crooked House Notecards—a set of six blank notecards featuring key process drawings and photos.Signed Crooked House Prints—a set of six signed prints of key process drawings, suitable for framing.Crooked House T-shirt—wear your patron of the arts status with pride. Shirts will feature the logo and you will have the option of a shirt with the logo on the front or the back.Original Crooked House Art—choose* your favorite drawing and we’ll professionally mat or frame it for you.Tile on the Crooked House Tribute Wall,  includes an Artist Led Design Session—make your mark with your personal tile featured on the Tribute Wall; you can add the names, handprints and impressions of significant mementos of yourself and your loved ones. Benjamin will assist you to design your tile. VIP Opening Reception—Groundbreakers will be recognized for their contributions at a private, pre-opening reception. Dedicate Homecoming Park—as a thank you for your significant project support, you can name Homecoming Park after yourself, your family, or your loved ones .  Please call us at (814)933-5204, or email us at info@thecrookedhouse.net, to discuss this naming opportunity. *Choice of drawings organized on a first-come first-served basis, by donor level TestimonialsGraeme Sullivan | Director,  Penn State School of Visual Arts"great place for nibblies." Jay Robinson | Editor,  State College, PA"I've watched The Crooked House development since it's inception and I am fully confident that it will be a success. I am proud to support this project." JoJo Tibbetts | Child,  Bellefonte, PA"Where is Lucky dog?"  FAQQ.  Ben, what motivates you? A.  Coffee from Fonté Coffee Roasters. Come visit the project and I'll make you the best darn cup of coffee east of Seattle. Q. How much have you spent on the project? A.  About $80,000--between grants, donations, volunteer time, and my own money.  Q. Whose house was it? A. 204 Market Street was built for Abigail Miles, a cousin of the town founder. Q. What is wattle & daub? A. A technique combining sticks, reeds or other materials (wattle) with clay or mud (daub) to form or insulate walls. Q. Why don't you build it out of stone? A. I like concrete...formal qualities etc.Q. When are you going to get this done?!?! A. Soon! Very soon!Q. Who issues my tax receipt?A. Fractured Atlas sponsors The Crooked House's non-profit status. They will email you a receipt for your tax-deductible donation to use for your taxes. Details below:Tax-Deductible Gift Information The Crooked House is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of The Crooked House must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
The Freetographer

I want to continue to shoot outstanding images like this

I want to make images like this for everyday regular people free for the rest of my life, and I want to help give back + improve the culture while doing it! This generation deserves something amazing.  Help me make this happen! I know its very possible! So Let's birth an idea!

Hello everyone!

Thank you for checking out this crowdfunding campaign!
It makes me very happy to start this campaign today 
Which happens to be my birthday! (12/21)
I really appreciate you checking this out

To get a visual understanding of this Crowdfunding Campaign Click Here =)

Onto the campaign!
-------------------------------------------
There are 2 goals that I want to accomplish in this campaign!

The first Goal is to get a photography studio so I can lower\eliminate a pricing structure for EVERYONE!

The second Goal is to open up a fun filled interactive museum for the entire world to partake in, filled with work from visual artist!

I want give myself to America!

The reason why I am in front of you today is because I want to combine time and self esteem and give it to the world!  I have a dream of owning a photography center and meeting a new face and story every single day. Teaching and also inspiring others, all while doing this at no expense to the people participating.  

--------------------------------------------

The Hall Of Photos Museum

The 2nd goal that I want to achieve is creating something that I had a dream about.  I want to create "The Hall of Photo's" Museum.  10,000+ Photo's in one place from photographers that love their camera.

This is the goal that requires a lot of money! 
 

I want to recreate that dream that I had.  It's very dear to me.  Just image walking into this national landmark and being overwhelmed by all of the beauty that came from eyes all around the world.

Every photographer from around the world can submit only their BEST PHOTO EVER.  This will be the biggest collection of artistic photography in the entire world. There will not be any "collections", or any "featured photographers", just an awesome photo after another awesome photo, after ANOTHER awesome photo. These photos will never get taken down unless photographer wants to replace it with an even better photo.  

If we reach our goal, we can officially put my dream into fruition.  We need this as a culture.  This can be our time stamp that represents our greatness as a civilization.

This can be our Roman Colosseum!!!  

----------------------------------------------

If you think this is a good idea, be sure to donate and encourage your friends to contribute and share as well!

To view the websites of my works Click Here

To get a better understanding of this Crowdfunding Campaign Click Here
